Title: General open position
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About Juno Journey:Our mission is to Connect employees' ambitions with the company's goals through one journey of personal development.Our ValuesBe Product Obsessed - We love making our product the best in the world. Every feature, every screen, every word is thought through. It’s like magic, smooth, easy, fantastic.Grow every day - We make big bets and we believe in the power of feedback and encourage a mindset of continuous learning and growth.Have Internal-Drive- We’re a company of builders who are internally driven to do good work. We understand that we can get to about the 90th percentile in our field by working either smart or hard, which is still a great accomplishment. But getting to the 99th percentile requires both.Collaborate- We know that many of our biggest advances grow out of work done across multiple teams. We communicate and love working in teams.Be Accountable- We own challenges, problems, solutions, and outcomes. We don’t blame our team, circumstances, or luck. We take ownership, find issues, and execute quickly to improve.If you want to be part of the journey but you didn't find your right role, send us your cv and we will try to find for you something/

Title: Business Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: QualificationsUndergraduate degree or master’s degree or 1+ years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degree; Requirements may vary by country or practiceAbility to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organizationCapability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team projectComfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situationsAbility to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language(s) What You'll DoYou'll work in teams of typically 3 - 5 consultants to identify, and oftentimes implement, potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge. Together, you will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important goals.Over the course of each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate, and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations. You'll also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. In some cases, you will be asked to travel to your client site.When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world. As a business analyst, you will receive training and coaching on how to betterStructure ambiguous problems and take action to solve themSynthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methodsWork effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to actEstablish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured mannerDevelop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal valuesMcKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you’ll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals. Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams.We view the business analyst position as the start of a rewarding, challenging, and highly flexible career with McKinsey. During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a business analyst on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of industry and functional areas.We encourage you to explore different content areas or geographies through a year-long rotation with one of our practices (e.g., corporate finance, social sector, healthcare, operations) or global offices; many do this after two years as a generalist business analyst. You will likely intersect with many elements of our firm’s work including digital, implementation, and tech and analytics capabilities – either by collaborating on teams or working with colleagues from these group.Following your business analyst tenure, assuming good performance, you will move into a post-graduate school role. Some business analysts will take advantage of the opportunity to get outside experience through a secondment (externship) with a private sector or social sector client with the firm’s support. Others may choose to pursue graduate school with support from the firm.Who You'll Work WithYou will join one of our offices around the world to work in teams and directly with our clients. In addition to these locations, this job opportunity is also available in Ho Chi Minh City.In this role you will help our clients in the private, public, and social sectors solve some their most pressing problems. You will also work with a range of experts in the firm, from data scientists to researchers to software and app designers.
Requirements: ['Undergraduate degree or master’s degree or 1+ years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degree; Requirements may vary by country or practice', 'Ability to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization', 'Capability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team project', 'Comfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situations', 'Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis', 'Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language(s)', 'Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them', 'Synthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods', 'Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act', 'Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations', 'Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner', 'Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values']

Title: HRBP
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are seeking an experienced and results-driven HR business partner to join a company with the vision to simplify and streamline the work of Managed Service Providers and IT professionals, and to align the company's HR initiatives and functions with business objectives and business needs. Duties for the HR business partner will include aligning staff to business objectives, recruiting the right talent, enhancing staff performance, supporting employee development, enhancing recruitment efforts, planning strategic HR initiatives, managing HR consultants, running orientation and onboarding processes, communicating role expectations, designing succession plans, maintaining staff relations, managing internships, updating policies and practices, and overseeing wellness and health initiatives. Your experience in human resources management will aid the organization in adding value to overall business objectives, providing HR solutions, resolving personnel grievances, retaining a talented workforce, and ensuring compliance with regulations.The ideal candidate for this role should have a good understanding of business functions, good communication skills, good interpersonal skills, strategic thinking, and good organizational skills. The noteworthy HR business partner should improve HR initiatives, enhance staff morale, enhance relations between staff and employers, contribute to attaining business goals, promote good HR practices, and attract talented recruits.HR Business Partner ResponsibilitiesDeveloping the HR agenda.Developing HR strategies, policies, and practices.Improving and monitoring employee productivity.Structuring compensation and benefit packages.Managing staff wellness initiatives.Improving relations between staff and employers.Evaluating staffing needs.Overseeing recruitment efforts.Managing and allocating HR funds.Engaging with heads of department.HR Business Partner RequirementsDegree in human resources management.Strong leadership skills.Excellent communication skills.Analytical skills.Problem-solving skills.Proactive nature.Excellent interpersonal skills.Meticulous attention to details.Highly organized.Good people skills.

Title: VP Operations
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Mixtiles is on a mission to create homes people love. We started by creating the easiest way to get photos out of your smartphone and onto your walls. Mixtiles is one of the biggest B2C startups in Israel, selling hundreds of millions of dollars a year, manufactures and delivers over a million framed photos every month to happy customers in over a hundred countries. If you ask the average American about us, they would probably know us.Our Operation team manages 6 factories in the US and Europe, with hundreds of workers and millions of shipments every month. Our culture of operational excellence has been one of the key drivers to the company's growth and profitability.Today, we're close to becoming the largest global company in photos on walls. Within three years, we want to be by far the largest global player ($400M). To do that we need to roll out new products at high speed. We also want to dramatically make photos on walls more accessible, which means ambitious cost reductions, including deploying entirely new product architectures.All of this, with super professional management of scale, quality, manufacturing processes, and more.We're looking for an exceptional VP Operations to lead and manage the supply chain and operation engineering teams.Who do we need?Experienced operations manager, comfortable with supply chain logistics and operations engineeringSystems thinker who can analyze and improve processes at high detailInnovative thinker who can bring a fresh approach to the field and move at startup speedsAbility to set operations strategy and drive processes' improvementExperience in establishing a new factory - nice to haveB2C experience - great advantageOn top of this, you should be super smart, dynamic, a great communicator, care about what you do and how it moves the needle.
Requirements: ['Experienced operations manager, comfortable with supply chain logistics and operations engineering', 'Systems thinker who can analyze and improve processes at high detail', 'Innovative thinker who can bring a fresh approach to the field and move at startup speeds', "Ability to set operations strategy and drive processes' improvement", 'Experience in establishing a new factory - nice to have', 'B2C experience - great advantage']

Title: Controller
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Do you want to join a group that is developing a ‘wow’ product?Multinarity is an early-stage startup in the AR field working on an exciting new consumer product that brings tangible value to users.We are looking for a Controller to join our Finance department.In this role you will report to the VP Finance and be accountable for the accounting operations of the company. This includes the production of periodic financial reports, maintenance of an adequate system of accounting records, and a comprehensive set of controls and budgets designed to mitigate risk.The controller will also be responsible for enhancing the accuracy of the company’s reported financial results and ensuring that these comply with generally accepted accounting principles or international financial reporting standards.ResponsibilitiesMaintains and enforces a documented system of accounting policies and proceduresPlanning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functionsManaging the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of consolidated business resultsCoordinating and preparing internal and external financial statementsOversee the accounting operations of subsidiary corporationsCoordinating activities of external auditorsAssessing current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processesEvaluating accounting and internal control systemsEvaluating the effectiveness of accounting software and supporting database, as neededDeveloping and monitoring business performance metricsOverseeing regulatory reporting, frequently including tax planning and complianceManaging the company’s bookkeeping processes and dutiesRequirements:Bachelor’s degree in accounting or financeCPA – A must (Big 4 preferred)2-4 years’ experience as controller in high tech companyStrong knowledge of US GAAP, vast accounting knowledge in areas such as: revenue recognition, business combination, inventory, tax accounting etc.Experience in HW and inventoryExperience in bookkeepingProven record in building finance departmentsFluent English (writing and speaking)Strong communication and teamwork skills

Title: Product Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.Experience building and shipping technical products.Experience in people management, with technical leadership.Preferred qualifications:Experience in a business function or role (e.g., strategic marketing, business operations, consulting).Experience in a role preparing and delivering technical presentations to executive leadership.Experience in software development or engineering.About The JobAt Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development.One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.The US base salary range for this full-time position is $194,000-$292,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits.ResponsibilitiesManage cross-functional programs driving Growth and Trust with our users.Lead a team of product managers. Lead a team through defining, identifying, collecting, and tracking appropriate product or business metrics.  Create product requirements, co-lead product design and development, and own product roadmaps.  Lead collaboration with Engineering, Marketing, Legal, UX, and other teams on cutting-edge technologies. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Assistant Controller
Location: Givatayim, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: WSC Sports develops an AI-based automation solution for real-time sports content creation and distribution and is the fastest-growing sports-tech company in the world.Why WSC Sports:You’ll work in an awesome environment alongside some of the most innovative people around, using cutting-edge technologies and tools (video editing, AI, data, etc.), and have the opportunity to directly influence the products and tools used by our clients who include sports giants such as the NBA, Bundesliga, FIBA, ESPN and more. Title: Warehouse Employee

Title: Office & Experience Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Who is Eleos Health?Today, more people than ever are speaking publicly about their mental health. Whether it's ourselves, our friends and family or even public figures, taking care of your behavioral health is no longer a taboo, it's vital, and it's only human. Eleos is on a mission to help deliver the world's most effective behavioral care through data, measurement, and personalization. Or simply put,We want to give clinicians the support they need to do the important work only they can do.What is this opportunity?This is an exciting opportunity to make an enormous impact on the lives and experiences of our people, as you will play a critical role in shaping the culture and day2day experience of our superb team in our TLV office. In this role, you will plan and execute initiatives that are designed to make our people feel part of a community that values them, cares about them and will go above and beyond to celebrate who they are, both as individuals and as a group. As part of the global HR Team in an early stage start up, you’ll be highly instrumental in laying the foundation of our team’s identity, processes and culture. You’ll be reporting to the VP of People, and will be working with our Talent Acquisition Partners and US Office & Event Manager, with the intention of building a stellar employee experience worldwide!Who are you?You are the very definition of a people’s person, and take great joy when at service to others. You care deeply and authentically about the well being of the people who surround you, and you will go above and beyond to support their needs. You're a wizard when it comes to operations and can easily build and execute on operational processes so you can work smarter and faster and focus on what truly matters. You are creative, organized and manage your time effectively. You are a full owner of your domain, and are constantly looking to make an impact. You have a sharp eye for details and superb project management skills.How will you contribute?You’ll have End2End responsibility for the office aesthetics, facilities and day to day environment Plan and execute our experience approach, annual plan and all employee life cycle initiativesPlay a big part in preparing for and supporting our new joiners in their first daysManage the office budgetBe responsible for all travel and expenses arrangementsAct as the main focal point for vendors and service providersOrganize office operations and proceduresWhat qualifications and skills will help you to be successful?2+ years of experience in a similar role at a fast-paced, dynamic environmentStrong passion for creating memorable experiences for our team, visitors and candidates Strong project management skillsService oriented, friendly and approachable with a can do attitude Excellent communicator who is able to work effectively across the organizationAlways willing to 'roll up your sleeves' and do what it takes to get the job doneStrong attention to details and follow-up; with you, no detail gets lost.Advanced proficiency in written and spoken EnglishExperienced in Google suite Some nice to haves areExperience with vendor and budget management This is a unique opportunity to join a startup that is having a meaningful impact on the well-being and mental health of thousands. We haveA product that positively impacts peoples' lives every single day.A team of amazing people with a shared vision and the infinite drive to make it happenWe offer significant equity.Opportunity to build, grow and become highly instrumental in shaping how technology can increase the effectiveness of therapy.Hybrid work opportunities. Mental health days off you can take any given moment simply because you need them.

Title: Banking Analyst - Expert Graduate Programme - 2023
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Join the world of bankingEvery day, corporations worldwide come to Barclays for our banking expertise. We help drive global commerce by providing comprehensive financial, advisory and capital-raising services. Our bankers advise on everything from mergers and acquisitions and privatisations to debt and equity financings and restructuring. Want in? Join us as an analyst.The chance to make an impactYou May Work OnAfter several weeks of intensive training to start, you’ll join one of our industry, product or geographic groups and start working on live deals and business development projects right away. Within small deal teams, you’ll quickly play an important role on a variety of demanding assignments.financial analysis and modelingvaluationindustry researchbusiness evaluation and strategic assessmentbusiness and idea generationexternal and internal stakeholder communication.A place where you can thrive At Barclays, you’ll be surrounded by people who will help you achieve your ambitions. Our collaborative, supportive environment gives you the chance to build solid relationships with senior leaders, peers and clients alike. What’s more, dedicated programme managers will support and advocate for you throughout the first several years of your career at Barclays, ensuring you develop the skills you need to succeed.During Your Analyst Years, You’ll Alsoparticipate in formal and informal training designed to give you the knowledge you need when you need it receive detailed performance coaching and feedbackhave opportunities to expand your network and develop leadership skills.Your role as a Banking analyst will provide you with the skills and experience needed for a successful career in the world of finance. We’ll also provide you a visible path to the necessary steps for promotion to associate and the tools to get you there.To Be Considered For This Programme, You Mustbe motivated with a strong degree or expected degree – in any area.Ideally You Would Havea strong interest in business and finance, though no specific subject degree is required a candidate with course experience in accounting (strongly recommended) someone who shows resourcefulness, team-orientation, enthusiasm and an entrepreneurial spirit, demonstrated through participation in extracurricular activities.It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.
Requirements: ['financial analysis and modeling', 'valuation', 'industry research', 'business evaluation and strategic assessment', 'business and idea generation', 'external and internal stakeholder communication.', 'participate in formal and informal training designed to give you the knowledge you need when you need it', 'receive detailed performance coaching and feedback', 'have opportunities to expand your network and develop leadership skills.', 'be motivated with a strong degree or expected degree – in any area.', 'a strong interest in business and finance, though no specific subject degree is required', 'a candidate with course experience in accounting (strongly recommended)', 'someone who shows resourcefulness, team-orientation, enthusiasm and an entrepreneurial spirit, demonstrated through participation in extracurricular activities.']

Title: Creative Strategist
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are Papaya Gaming mobile games startup …As a Creative Strategy, you will join our Creative Marketing team to focus on driving UA’s creative strategy based on creative performance analysis and results for the live games in our portfolio.The individual who fills this role would be responsible for delivering creative strategy, planning and building the UA’s creative GANTT and creative AB tests (for video, static and playable ads), and researching and analyzing creative industry trends.The ideal candidate is highly analytical yet creative, can work independently, manage multiple projects concurrently, as well as engage and collaborate with other teams & team members from across multiple disciplines and functions: Creative Marketing TL, User Acquisition & Retargeting managers, ASO, and Art Leads.Requirements:3+ years of experience in a Creative Strategist roleUnderstanding UA terminology and its different platforms is a plusExperience working in metrics-based teams/companiesExcellent organizational & communication skills – both written and verbalExperience working in fast-paced environments, preferably in mobile gamingStrong analytical skillsMust have good judgment and ability to work independently with minimal supervisionSolid Understanding of UA & ASO strategy and tacticsA genuine interest in social, gaming, analytics, and advertising is a mustPassion for problem-solving: You must be able to tackle new, unfamiliar, and possibly daunting problems—to break them down into manageable bits and solve themResponsibilities:Deliver creative matrix strategy based on creatives performanceComing up with new, fresh creative approaches and experiments aDrive creative testing backed up with hypotheses to gain insights, identify opportunities and apply them in creative strategyOngoing creative performance monitor, analysis, and optimizationDay-to-day work with Creative Marketing Lead to execute the creative strategy, review concepts and adsCollaborate closely with UA & ASO to ensure the creative strategy is on par with UA & ASO plans and tactics to maximize share of voice and channel mixPartner with Product Managers to ensure that product features will be reflected in the creative strategyVendor selection and relationship maintaining

Title: Service Manager, Israel
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: What To ExpectOur Service Managers are the leaders of our field Service operations. As Tesla expands its service in Israel, you will be responsible for delivering an exceptional service experience to our customers, developing your team members and organization, managing day-to-day operations, and ensuring Tesla Service meets the needs of our customers as well as the expectations of our employees.As Service Manager you will be responsible for our service locations and lead your Management team and organization to consistently deliver excellent results. To succeed at Tesla, you must be energetic, highly organized, and smart working as well as having a passion for true leadership and the Tesla brand.What You’ll Do Direct and focus the resources with service to ensure service teams are as effective as they possibly can be Develop and drive strategic decisions for the service organization in order to meet current and future business demands Select and coach a leadership team, giving them tools and clear objectives so they can help the local Service Center be successful and meet its targets Effectively communicate and motivate teams, as well as adapting to the changing needs of the company Regularly review Service Center KPIs, identifying trends and reviewing in more detail with managers if required to quickly address any negative trends or issues Proactively lead a team of managers, being present in the field and ensuring managers are empowered to make the right decisions to drive the business forward Connect and work closely with other service managers across EMEA, discussing daily operations, field operations service, to optimize best practice throughout the region Carry out quarterly performance and development reviews with managers, understanding what is needed for them to develop their role, setting clear goals, expectations and follow ups Constantly assess potential service improvements Manage financials from a service perspective for the center, maintaining an overview of cost savings, employee expenses, operational costs, profit and loss and revenue Lead the region to expand and grow, including mobile service and new service locations Present and pitch to senior leadership and your teams on strategic initiatives to be implemented within the Service area for your center Liaise closely with broader business areas including, but not limited to, Sales, Delivery, EHS, HR, Recruitment, ensuring a strong network of peers As part of this role you will be required to travel to different centers within your regionWhat You’ll Bring Ministry of Transport certifications for professional manager are required: Mechanics, Electricity, Air conditioning and HV EV maintenance A proven background of leading an organization or region to meet operational and strategic targets Experience within the automotive industry is required Ability to find, organize and manipulate data for decision making and action taking purposes A background of interrogating numbers and identifying correlations An understanding of local employment law is highly desirable Excellent organization skills, with experience of high-level reporting Experience of working in an agile environment, where you have responded quickly to changing business needs An open and approachable leadership style, with experience of leading, motivating and coaching managers Proven experience of successful delegation to achieve results Excellent command of the English language Ability to move between a high-level, holistic business approach and communicating with employees on a grass-roots level Strong analytical IT skills, including use of Excel

Title: Personal Assistant to the CEO
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: First, let's talk about you! You will: Work with amazing people!!!Play a critical role in ensuring a smooth day-to-day flow and aspire for efficiencyHandle complex scheduling for the CEO - you’ll need to always be one step ahead of our CEO’s busy scheduleCollaborate with multiple interfaces including executives, management level, and highly senior industry professionalsCompose, collect & distribute presentations & documents on behalf of the CEOAssist with the preparation of presentationsSupport special cross-company projectsSupport and coordinate company eventsAct as a vital member of the people operations team and support the office management effortsSo if you have:3+ years of work experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant, or similar roleFull professional fluency in EnglishProven experience supporting executives, preferably in global and/or tech companiesExceptional operational skills and impeccable attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skills in English and HebrewOutstanding priorization and time management skillsGreat interpersonal skillsHigh sense of responsibility and accountabilityAbility to multitask while remaining detail-orientedTo be a problem solver with the ability to see potential problems before they occurExperience in startups - a big advantage!Now, what is Dazz? At Dazz, we're changing cloud security for the better. In an industry where virtually all of the innovation has been in finding security issues in the software development pipeline, we're focused on fixing them and reducing risk within the cloud. The Dazz Remediation Cloud takes aim at the single biggest problem in cloud security with a three-step process: We discover and visualize our customers’ code-to-production environment, reduce noise and find root causes and owners, and tee up a super dev-friendly fix that massively improves efficiency and builds trust between security and engineering teams. No small feat!But we also realize it’s not just about what you can do for Dazz. We see your employment here as very much a two-way street. We want you to feel like you’re doing your best work, stretching yourself, learning new things, receiving relevant, timely feedback, and being given growth opportunities. We want Dazz to be a great place to be and a great place to be from, and that means making your experience here a transformative one.
Requirements: ['Work with amazing people!!!', 'Play a critical role in ensuring a smooth day-to-day flow and aspire for efficiency', 'Handle complex scheduling for the CEO - you’ll need to always be one step ahead of our CEO’s busy schedule', 'Collaborate with multiple interfaces including executives, management level, and highly senior industry professionals', 'Compose, collect & distribute presentations & documents on behalf of the CEO', 'Assist with the preparation of presentations', 'Support special cross-company projects', 'Support and coordinate company events', 'Act as a vital member of the people operations team and support the office management efforts', '3+ years of work experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant, or similar role', 'Full professional fluency in English', 'Proven experience supporting executives, preferably in global and/or tech companies', 'Exceptional operational skills and impeccable attention to detail', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Hebrew', 'Outstanding priorization and time management skills', 'Great interpersonal skills', 'High sense of responsibility and accountability', 'Ability to multitask while remaining detail-oriented', 'To be a problem solver with the ability to see potential problems before they occur', 'Experience in startups - a big advantage!']

Title: Content Creator
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Artlist is a fast-growing creative technology company providing video creators with high-quality music, sound effects, footage and digital assets for video, as well as powerful video and image editing software. With our revolutionary license and cutting-edge creative tools, we’re on the fast track to becoming the ultimate 360 degree solution for video creators.Today, Artlist is the go-to licensing provider for creators in over 160 countries. Among our 16M clients are Google, Apple, Nike, Coca-Cola, Ikea, Mercedes, Samsung, Wix, Netflix, Dior and many more.Artlist consists of 4 products:Artlist.io, a royalty-free music and SFX platformArtgrid.io, a curated stock footage platformMotionArray.com, an all-in-one marketplace for creators that offers video templates, presets, music, SFX, stock footage, motion graphics and stock photosFXhome, a cutting-edge video, VFX and image editing softwareWe’re looking for a full-time Content Creator to join our vibrant Creative team in Tel Aviv.Wake up for this:Create and publish compelling and engaging daily video content from A to Z, across multiple social media platformsBe the face of Artlist and its products and appear regularly on our social media channelsActively engage with our audiences on various social media platformsLead initiatives and campaigns to promote Artlist’s products through social media.Research the latest social media trends, competitors and audiences and come up with creative content ideas to further Artlist’s growth, retention & brand awarenessRequirements:Native English speaker - a mustAt least 2 years of experience as a Content Creator, Social Content Specialist, Social Media Manager or in a similar roleMultitasker with the ability to handle multiple priorities/projects simultaneously and tight deadlinesExperience with video and image editing software (Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop) - a big advantagePortfolio is a must

Title: Professor
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: PositionPositions are open at five distinct ranks: Postdoctoral Fellow,Assistant Professor, Associate Professor, Full Professor, and Chair Professor.Responsibilities and DutiesApplicants will have extensive teaching experience, have published high quality papers in their area of expertise, have been successful in obtaining research grants, and have substantial experience in the supervision of research students. The successful candidate, in addition to teaching typically two modules/courses per year (i.e. one per semester), will provide leadership in curriculum development and enhancing our research profile at the international level. They are expected to assume administrative responsibilities based on their experience.Personal AttributesSelf-motivated and being able to motivate others;Strong leadership and interpersonal skills;Strong team player;Proactive and flexible but with good respect for deadlines;Able to work in an environment where diversity and inclusiveness is appreciated.Essential Qualifications/ExperiencesA PhD in a closely aligned area and PG Cert HE or equivalent;Ideally few years of teaching/research experience at a university or equivalent after completion of PhD degree;PhD supervision capacity;Strong publications record in an area of expertise;Evidence of success in obtaining research grants;Fluency in English.Desirable Qualifications And ExperienceProfessional memberships such as BCS, IET, ACM, IEE and HEA;Strong knowledge / experience in international higher education.Compensation PackageRange Of Annual Base PayLecturer: 280k-320k RMBAssistant Professor: 360k-400k RMBAssociate Professor: 450k-490k RMBSenior Associate Professor: 540k-580k RMBProfessor: Above 620k RMB, negotiableMembers of Academic Staff are entitled to subsidies for accommodation, travel, and children's educational, medical insurance, and a one-time relocation allowance is provided. Overseas staff may receive a tax "holiday", depending on nationality and personal circumstances.

Title: Office Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Rewire is looking for a superstar Office Manager to join our incredible HR Team at our Tel Aviv office!If you are a positive, highly motivated, get-things-done and love being the super glue that holds everything together type person- then we are looking for you!As Rewire's Office Manger you are first and foremost a people's person. You love engaging with people and working in a diverse, fast paced, dynamic environment. You don't shy away from responsibility and you use your wild creativity to think outside the box and push initiatives to the next level.You are exceptionally organized, detail oriented and thrive under pressure. You are passionate about creating a friendly and inviting office environment. You are a team player but also know how to take charge and lead projects to deliver fast and effective results.Most importantly, you want to be a part of an incredible, social-good-centered and growing company working to change the world!Job ResponsibilitiesManage and execute day-to-day office operationsResponsible for office maintenance, facilities, vendors, logistics and supplies (Kitchen, office equipment, etc.)Take active part in executing company welfare activities together with HR team.Manage day-to-day office operations, including food and other supply orders, managing cleaning services, deliveries, office supplies, mail, parking and more.Preparing facilities for scheduled events and arranging refreshments, if required.Ordering office supplies and replacements, as well as managing mail and courier services tracking of the company’s bank account - incoming & outcoming payments, conducting bank transfers to suppliers, money exchange etc.Manage meeting room schedules and support management meeting needsMonthly arrangement of material and invoices for bookkeeping.Positive attitude, detail and customer-oriented with good multitasking and organizational ability.Supporting the HR team with recruitment and employee’s welfare including event planning.Requirements:Previous experience as an office admin / administrative experience in a startup environmentExceptional organizational, planning and time management capabilitiesStrong multitasking and prioritization skillsFast thinker, problem solver and result drivenPositive and friendly attitude with a love for team work!Ability to maintain professionalism always under pressureFluency (both written and spoken) in Hebrew and English- native English speaker - advantage!Proficient in MS Office, Outlook, Excel

Title: Videographer & Video Editor
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: (Social media team) MarketingWho Connecteam is:Connecteam is a TLV-based startup that's on a mission to change the work experience for 80% of the world's global workforce - the frontline employees.Our business management platform helps thousands of businesses thrive by taking away the daily hustle and complexities of managing teams, so they can have the peace of mind to grow and run their business.We see the Social media channel as one of our most significant strategic ends for the coming years! We are looking for an experienced videographer and editor to take ownership of our video production activity, including unique content, field interviews, educational videos, testimonials, documentaries, podcasts, etc., and to be an integral part of our Social Networks team.What's the job?As Connecteam's Videographer and Video Editor, you will be a part of our growing Social Networks team.You will be an important part of our content production and execution and will be responsible for shooting and directing our activity in the field and in-house, including a variety of content types and editing the footage and content that will fit its designated social channel, while working closely with our professional in-house studio and our Social Networks team executing branding strategy on social outlets, and creating meaningful content to our target audience.What you'll be doing: Pre-production - Planning and setting our productions Production - Video-shooting and directing Sound and lighting setupPost-production -Video editing in various formatsWorking closely with social media managers, graphic designers etc. Joining our team abroad for field content productionManage our footage storageWhich qualifications you'll need:Native written and spoken English - MUST3+ years of experience in social media videography - MUST3+ years of experience in video editing - MUSTHigh-performance execution Autodidact and a can-do mentality Excellent interpersonal and organizational skillsAbility to work under pressure and meet tight deadlinesExperience in SaaS B2B - an advantageBackground working with SMB audiences - an advantageHiring process with us: At Connecteam, we aim to complete our hiring processes at lightning speed, keeping the time between when we receive your CV until you (hopefully) sign with us super short, communicative and transparent.Joining Connecteam Is The Smart Move:We build our people up. Every team member is treated as a long-term investment and we recognize the value in always nurturing and training them so they can go above and beyond in their skills and job duties. We make an impact on our customer's business. We are on a mission to provide managers of all business types and sizes with the tools they need to communicate, operate, engage, and run their deskless workforce. Our product offers them an effective and affordable solution to run their business. We get the job done. Connecteam employees are passionate in executing their job duties so they can drive the company forward and provide real value to our customers. We have fun! From weekly happy hours to holiday parties, we always enjoy each other's company (and good food, of course). Connecteam is like one big, happy family!Everyone is welcome. Connecteam is committed to building an encouraging, caring, and supportive environment. We share a responsibility to support our team and enrich their lives. Title: HR Coordinator
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Established in 2000, eTeacher Group created and operates leading virtual schools throughout the world. Our company specializes in large scale operation of online teacher-led classes. We work with leading professionals every step of the way, from recruiting and developing content, to marketing, sales and operations.We are looking for a talented Global Human Resources Coordinator to join our leading HR team and support its entire activity. You’ll be in charge of assisting all daily operations and activities of the HR department providing operational support to successfully implement local initiatives and execute regional and corporate programs. Among rest: employee onboarding/offboarding, lifecycle, welfare, HRIS administration and much more.You can imagine what a key role you’ll be playing!Responsibilities:Assist with recruitment and interview process: coordinate communication with candidates, schedule interviews, track the status of candidates in ATS and respond with follow-up offers at the end of the recruiting processSupport the orientation and onboarding programsMaintain and operate the company’s HRIS: create new employee files, remove terminated ones, change status of employees, etc.Coordinate HR projects (recruitment, training, surveys, welfare, etc.)Perform customer service function by answering employee requests and questionsProcess and produce reports on HR activity (staffing, recruitment, training, grievances, performance evaluations, etc.)This is a remote full time position.Requirements:Proven experience as an HR Assistant, HR Administrator or HR CoordinatorDegree in Human Resources or related field - an advantageFull proficiency in both Hebrew and English - a mustHands-on experience with an HRIS – Bob preferredStrong interpersonal and communication skillsExcellent organizational skills and attention to detailExcellent time management skills with a proven ability to multitask, prioritize and meet deadlinesGood analytic skillsSelf-starter with strong problem-solving skillsHigh proficiency in Microsoft Office and general computer skillsGood home office working environment (quiet space, , high speed internet connection 100MB, ability to activate webcam at all times, headset)
Requirements: ['Assist with recruitment and interview process: coordinate communication with candidates, schedule interviews, track the status of candidates in ATS and respond with follow-up offers at the end of the recruiting process', 'Support the orientation and onboarding programs', 'Maintain and operate the company’s HRIS: create new employee files, remove terminated ones, change status of employees, etc.', 'Coordinate HR projects (recruitment, training, surveys, welfare, etc.)', 'Perform customer service function by answering employee requests and questions', 'Process and produce reports on HR activity (staffing, recruitment, training, grievances, performance evaluations, etc.)', 'Proven experience as an HR Assistant, HR Administrator or HR Coordinator', 'Degree in Human Resources or related field - an advantage', 'Full proficiency in both Hebrew and English - a must', 'Hands-on experience with an HRIS – Bob preferred', 'Strong interpersonal and communication skills', 'Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail', 'Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to multitask, prioritize and meet deadlines', 'Good analytic skills', 'Self-starter with strong problem-solving skills', 'High proficiency in Microsoft Office and general computer skills', 'Good home office working environment (quiet space, , high speed internet connection 100MB, ability to activate webcam at all times, headset)']

Title: VP Finance
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: As Faye's VP of finance, you will have the opportunity to oversee all financial aspects of the business and drive the company’s financial strategy and planning. You will be responsible for assessing the financial performance of the company as well as possible risks and investments. You will lead the finance department, making sure we move in the right direction and have the best infrastructure and tools to do so.Responsibilities:Oversight of all Finance, Accounting, and Tax functions across the company and its subsidiariesServe as a business partner to the CEO and a key member of the leadership team, taking part in strategic business decisions, providing insights into the financial & operational implications of the company performanceLead FP&A functions, building business plans and models to achieve company objectivesEnsure the timely and accurate preparation and filing of the Company’s financial reportsDevelop and track business & insurance metrics and performance KPIsDevelop and improve company work processes, policies and compliance to support company objectives and growthEnhance and implement financial and accounting system processes, tools, and controlsSupport company fundraising and investor relationshipsQualifications:Proven experience as the CFO/VP Finance or otherwise the leading finance professional in a high growth company At least 10+ years of accounting experienceExperience in successfully leading fundraising rounds from international VCsExperience navigating the financial, tax, regulatory and compliance frameworks in the United StatesEfficient and creative problem-solving skillsExcellent English – writing and verbal skillsExperience in B2C, Travel or insurance - an advantage
Requirements: ['Oversight of all Finance, Accounting, and Tax functions across the company and its subsidiaries', 'Serve as a business partner to the CEO and a key member of the leadership team, taking part in strategic business decisions, providing insights into the financial & operational implications of the company performance', 'Lead FP&A functions, building business plans and models to achieve company objectives', 'Ensure the timely and accurate preparation and filing of the Company’s financial reports', 'Develop and track business & insurance metrics and performance KPIs', 'Develop and improve company work processes, policies and compliance to support company objectives and growth', 'Enhance and implement financial and accounting system processes, tools, and controls', 'Support company fundraising and investor relationships', 'Proven experience as the CFO/VP Finance or otherwise the leading finance professional in a high growth company', 'At least 10+ years of accounting experience', 'Experience in successfully leading fundraising rounds from international VCs', 'Experience navigating the financial, tax, regulatory and compliance frameworks in the United States', 'Efficient and creative problem-solving skills', 'Excellent English – writing and verbal skills', 'Experience in B2C, Travel or insurance - an advantage']

Title: Office & Employee Experience Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Who are we?Zencity is re-inventing the way governments listen to, understand, and interact with their residents. Our community insights & analytics platform and community survey solution use advanced NLP and ML algorithms to help government organizations be more data-driven. Our global team of urban enthusiasts and data geeks works with 300 cities and counties - from Los Angeles, to Chicago, to Tel Aviv. If you’re passionate about joining a growing and dynamic company focused on leveraging data and tech to work on real-world challenges and radically improve life in cities – your place is with us!﻿We are looking for an energetic and organized office and employee experience manager to join Zencity’s People team.Who are you?You are most of all a people person, and care about the well being of the people who surround you, doing your best to support their needs. With a range of responsibilities, you are a great all-round team player and an expert multi-tasker.We’re looking for someone who can easily build and execute operational processes so you can work smarter and faster to focus on what truly matters - our people! You’ll own your domain from start to finish, and are constantly looking to make an impact.How will you contribute?You will take the lead and provide excellent customer service to our employees and will be in charge of all office related tasks and welfare initiatives. Above all, you will be responsible for the day-to-day experience of Zencity’s most valued asset – its people.ResponsibilitiesYou’ll have End2End responsibility for the office aesthetics, facilities and day to day environment as well as managing welfare initiatives:Plan and execute a creative and global employee experience strategy across the employee life cycle, connecting employees to our brand, our values, our culture, and offices (in Tel Aviv, the US, and Canada)Plan and produce events from proposal to delivery. Set targets, maintain timelines and priorities for every event and manage the branding and communicationsPlay a big part in preparing for and supporting our new joiners in their first daysManage the office and welfare budgetAct as the main point of contact for vendors and service providersOrganize office operations and proceduresDevelop the office “Look and Feel”Requirements:RequirementsAt least 2 years of experience in an administrative position in high-tech (preferably startup) environment.Social spirit, service oriented, and great interpersonal skills - MustPassion for multi-tasking - MustFluent English in speaking, reading, and writing - MustStrong project management skillsExcellent communicator who is able to work effectively across the organizationStrong attention to detail and follow-up; with you, no detail gets lost.Always willing to 'roll up the sleeves and do what it takes to get the job done
Requirements: ['Plan and execute a creative and global employee experience strategy across the employee life cycle, connecting employees to our brand, our values, our culture, and offices (in Tel Aviv, the US, and Canada)', 'Plan and produce events from proposal to delivery. Set targets, maintain timelines and priorities for every event and manage the branding and communications', 'Play a big part in preparing for and supporting our new joiners in their first days', 'Manage the office and welfare budget', 'Act as the main point of contact for vendors and service providers', 'Organize office operations and procedures', 'Develop the office “Look and Feel”', 'At least 2 years of experience in an administrative position in high-tech (preferably startup) environment.', 'Social spirit, service oriented, and great interpersonal skills - Must', 'Passion for multi-tasking - Must', 'Fluent English in speaking, reading, and writing - Must', 'Strong project management skills', 'Excellent communicator who is able to work effectively across the organization', 'Strong attention to detail and follow-up; with you, no detail gets lost.', "Always willing to 'roll up the sleeves and do what it takes to get the job done"]

Title: מנהל/ת תפ"י
Location: Petah Tikva, Center District, Israel
Text: לחברת בטחונית העוסקת בפיתוח וייצור מערכות אלקטרו-אופטיות דרוש/ה מנהל/ת תפ"י.התפקיד הינו תפקיד ניהולי הכולל הובלת תחומים ופעילויות לוגיסטיות ברמה חוצת ארגון. ריכוז וניתוח דיווחי הביצוע מול התוכנית. תכנון ובקרת יצור- הכנת תוכניות עבודה למחלקות המפעל ובקרת ביצוע ריכוז מידע והכנת דוחות תפעול תקופתיים. הפקת תוכניות עבודה על בסיס יומי וחודשי. תכנון והפקה של הזמנות רכש מול ספקים בארץ ובחו"ל. בקרה שוטפת של עמידה בתוכניות היצור, ואספקת רכש. עדכון שוטף של תוכניות היצור בהתאם לשינויים ותכנון משאבים. אחריות על כל ההזמנות- הזמנות בחו"ל ובארץ. מעקב אחר ביצוע ההזמנות.Requirements:ניסיון בתפקיד דומה/ זהה- חובההכרות עם מערכת ניהול priority- חובההשכלה בתחום תעשייה וניהול/ לוגיסטיקה- יתרוןתקשורת בין אישית טובהשליטה ב- office- חובהאנגלית ברמה טובה- יתרון
Requirements: ['ריכוז וניתוח דיווחי הביצוע מול התוכנית.', 'תכנון ובקרת יצור- הכנת תוכניות עבודה למחלקות המפעל ובקרת ביצוע', 'ריכוז מידע והכנת דוחות תפעול תקופתיים.', 'הפקת תוכניות עבודה על בסיס יומי וחודשי.', 'תכנון והפקה של הזמנות רכש מול ספקים בארץ ובחו"ל.', 'בקרה שוטפת של עמידה בתוכניות היצור, ואספקת רכש.', 'עדכון שוטף של תוכניות היצור בהתאם לשינויים ותכנון משאבים.', 'אחריות על כל ההזמנות- הזמנות בחו"ל ובארץ. מעקב אחר ביצוע ההזמנות.']

Title: IT Support Specialist
Location: Givatayim, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: WSC Sports develops an AI-based automation solution for real-time sports content creation and distribution and is the fastest-growing sports-tech company in the world. Why WSC Sports:You’ll work in an awesome environment alongside some of the most innovative people around, using cutting-edge technologies and tools (video editing, AI, data, etc.), and have the opportunity to directly influence the products and tools used by our clients who include sports giants such as the NBA, Bundesliga, FIBA, ESPN and more. And that’s just the beginning of what WSC Sports has to offer!We are looking for an experienced IT Support specialist with high service awareness who will support 250+ users and will respond to all Help Desk tickets in a dynamic environment. Maintaining an active inventory of all IT assets, setting up new users, and assorted other IT-related tasks.What you’ll do:Respond to requests for technical assistance (in person, via phone, email and ticket system).Diagnose and resolve technical hardware and software issues.Install and troubleshoot end user equipment, software, hardware, and multimedia systems.Support IT purchasing upon demand.Provide guidance, assistance, coordination and follow-up on client questions and problems.Follow IT procedures, logging all IT interactions and administering helpdesk software.Identify and prioritize tasks and situations requiring attention.Setup and maintain of IT systems. Requirements:What you’ll need:At least 2 years of experience as a Help Desk/IT Support Specialist.High customer orientation skills.Familiarity with hardware components (desktops, laptops and network HW).Experience handling IT tasks on Windows OS and MacOS.Good understanding of an IT backend environment Azure Active directory, Google Workspace, GPO, Single Sign-On, Office-365.Experience working with a cloud-based servicesWell-experienced in supporting end-user desktop applications such as internet browsers, printing, Office apps, etc.Knowledge of networking and infrastructure (Lan/Wan, Wi-Fi, TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS).Strong communication skills for interfacing with employees in a multitasking environment.Solid knowledge of information security principles and practices.Fluent Hebrew & English
Requirements: ['Respond to requests for technical assistance (in person, via phone, email and ticket system).', 'Diagnose and resolve technical hardware and software issues.', 'Install and troubleshoot end user equipment, software, hardware, and multimedia systems.', 'Support IT purchasing upon demand.', 'Provide guidance, assistance, coordination and follow-up on client questions and problems.', 'Follow IT procedures, logging all IT interactions and administering helpdesk software.', 'Identify and prioritize tasks and situations requiring attention.', 'Setup and maintain of IT systems.', 'At least 2 years of experience as a Help Desk/IT Support Specialist.', 'High customer orientation skills.', 'Familiarity with hardware components (desktops, laptops and network HW).', 'Experience handling IT tasks on Windows OS and MacOS.', 'Good understanding of an IT backend environment Azure Active directory, Google Workspace, GPO, Single Sign-On, Office-365.', 'Experience working with a cloud-based services', 'Well-experienced in supporting end-user desktop applications such as internet browsers, printing, Office apps, etc.', 'Knowledge of networking and infrastructure (Lan/Wan, Wi-Fi, TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS).', 'Strong communication skills for interfacing with employees in a multitasking environment.', 'Solid knowledge of information security principles and practices.', 'Fluent Hebrew & English']

Title: Junior QA
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: inManage, a software development company, specializing in sophisticated e-commerce solutions, is looking for a motivated, talented and skillful Junior QA to join our growing team.The position includes manual testing for web and mobile platforms. Among our customers are huge brands such as Domino's Pizza, McDonald's, Azrieli, Aroma Israel, Shlomo Group, Meshulam, Htzone, NewDeli and more.This is a great opportunity to show your talent, work with amazing people, advanced technologies and big customers.Requirements:Graduates of a QA course or another relevant field - must.Experience in Web and Mobile testing.Experience using Jira.Strong technical background.Problem solving and investigative skills.Experience with testing methodologies.Responsibilities:Plan, write and execute manual tests.Work with Developers & Project Managers to coordinate new releases and clarify requirements.Reporting bugs and working with the QA team to resolve them.

Title: Head of Product Marketing
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: What could be better than owning Product Marketing of a product for… marketers? Yes, this is not a joke. You have a rare opportunity to come to work everyday, and market a product for people like you - marketers! Sounds interesting? Read on.Brew is looking for a Head of Product Marketing to be responsible for successfully launching new solutions into the market, helping create demand and ensuring that sales, marketing and customer success are consistent on messaging.Own the product marketing strategy, report directly to the VP of Marketing, and work closely with Product, Sales & Customer Success as the main point of contact.What will you do?Strategy; you’ll build and execute a product marketing strategy to help improve the success of our solutions in the market.GTM; build and lead the go-to-market strategy.Manage the core messaging of the Brew offering. Define a compelling and differentiated messaging that clearly states our value proposition and serves as a blueprint for all content to follow.Own and manage Brew’s website, design, brand, messaging, social media, sales and customer success collateral, user communication & more.Work closely with sales, product, and customer success teams to ensure lead generation, revenue, and customer satisfaction objectives are met while supporting the company’s overall strategy and goals.Work with the extended marketing team in the design and execution of events, thought leadership and account-based marketing strategies.Develop and implement coordinated plans for launches and announcements.Create successful case-studies and Work with content marketing and design teams to create suitable content for each stage of a customer’s digital journey (such as blogs, whitepapers, site copy, videos, slides, podcasts, and customer stories)Manage Brew’s participation in webinars, podcasts, virtual and in-person eventsProduct Champion; help inform the overall marketing strategy with valuable product marketing intelligence. Be the evangelist, internally and externally, for our full solution set and monitor the performance of solutions to educate key stakeholders.Requirements:3-5 years of experience in product marketing - preferably in SaaS B2BProven experience as a manager and/or project manager working with internal and external stakeholders and agenciesPrevious experience in content, and/or copywritingProven experience in positioning and messagingHave an excellent track record of creating high-quality marketing collateral, across multiple channelsKnow how to distill complex concepts into clear, concise language and business valuesExceptional planning, organization and project management skillsAbility to work in a very fast-paced start-up environment with changing and evolving responsibilities

Title: Director of Finance
Location: Hod HaSharon, Center District, Israel
Text: What we are looking for:We are looking for a talented, driven, sustainability-minded Director of Finance, to join our growing team; be based at TIPA’s headquarters, in Hod Hasharon, Israel. The position is full time and reports to the VP of Finance.﻿Role Overview: Manage the Monthly, Quarterly, and yearly consolidate reporting of the Company Manage the annual Tax reports for IL and subsidiaries Manage the accounting staff Coordinate the annual audit and tax return for LTD and subsidiaries (providing WP, sampling, and providing with other supporting documentation) Manage and review the Israeli & European Vat and monthly European Intra-Stat reports (filing and supporting documentation) Participate in Cogs/Inventory costing method Creating and monitoring ERP process in order to meet the company scale up process Manage the payments to suppliers’ process Manage the annual audit over OCS reports and European grants Oversee payroll process and related provisions' calculations (vacation, convalescence pay, severance, bonus, commissions) for IL and subsidiaries and Act as a focal point to the company employees on payroll related questions Implementing and leading new process in the finance departments Assisting VP Finance with Cash flow management Reporting to the VP financeRequirements: Alumni of one of the big 4 in the high-tech field 6 years of Controllership or Director of Finance experience in international growth companies Experience with Inventory and costing – a big plus Managerial experience Great Excel US GAAP Knowledge High standard of accuracy and precision. Organized and detail oriented Excellent English Ability to take ownership of projects and work independently

Text: Broadway Gaming is a dynamic and expanding online gaming company operating mainly in the UK gaming market.We offer Bingo, Casino and Slot products across multiple brandsWe're looking for a Full Stack developer to work in online gaming on the Bingo platform. Title: Marketing Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About SidelinesWith the ability to put some skin in the game, modern sports fans have the chance to get closer to the action of the game than ever before. But in the age of big data, the odds are stacked against them.Not anymore.With a platform dedicated to the fan, Sidelines unites technology, the community of sports fandom, and the excitement of sports betting, to bring a fun and fresh perspective to a changing landscape.We are seeking a highly motivated Marketing Analyst to join our team.What will you do?Manage and optimize large scale marketing campaignsHandle high budgets in highly competitive marketsCarry out marketing research & analyze marketing performance dataInitiate and implement improvements and creative solutions to increase campaigns activityWork closely with a variety of different teams – Business & TechnicalWhat will you bring to the table?University degree - Science, business or analytical academic backgroundExcellent analytical skillsA self-starter with strong multi-tasking ability and close attention to detailExcellent English (written and verbal)Team player, motivated, proactive and organized.If you are a creative enthusiast with a passion for sports, please reach out to us

Text: תיאור המשרה:לקבוצת קשת דרוש.ה מנהל.ת סושיאל ג'וניורהתפקיד כולל:פולואפ לתכניות הפריים בפייסבוק, אינסטגרם וטיקטוק של קשת ושל עמודי התכניותקידום והעלאת פוסטים בפייסבוק ובאינסטגרםהשתתפות בימי צילום וייצור תכניםRequirements:דרישות התפקיד:ניסיון בכתיבת תוכן לסושיאל- שנהפאשן לעולמות הטלוויזיההיכרות עם רשתות חברתיות ומגמות בתחוםיכולת כתיבה וניסוח ברמה גבוההחשיבה יצירתית וקריאטיביתידע בתוכנות גרפיות - יתרון

Title: Marketing and Business Development Marketer
Location: Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Deloitte Marketing and Business Development team is hiring for a unique role and searching for a talented marketer to support Deloitte technological businesses! What you’ll experience in the role:Work with senior executives on marketing strategy, plans, and execution.Create marketing content, including communications, newsletters, posts, and more (English and Hebrew).Plan and lead marketing projects, including events, webinars, roundtables, workshops, and more.Build, foster, and scale meaningful relationships with leading Israeli players.Create business development materials including client proposals, department eminence, marketing presentations, and more.In order to succeed, you should have:2-3 years of experience working in a marketing role (advantage working in technologic companies)Experience in marketing positions at B2B companies (advantage)Bachelor's degree / educational background in a relevant fieldExcellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Hebrew (Fluency in both required)Exceptional organizational and multi-tasking capabilitiesHigh level of professionalism and ability to work with senior executivesTeam player with great interpersonal skillsProficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and other Microsoft applications * We at Deloitte believe that diversity and inclusion among our people is a critical component of our success and that is why we cultivate an organizational culture that contains and embraces diversity in all its forms.

Title: VP People (HR)
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Roundforest's mission is to simplify shopping. We’re looking for a passionate candidate who gets excited from the opportunity to join our journey and impact 40,000,000 consumers (and counting).VP of People (HR) objective:Lead the discussion and communication around our company culture. Supporting Roundforest's leaders to be at their best and aligned with our set of values.In Roundforest, we value creative thinking and therefore often will do things differently. Accordingly, Roundforest's VP People role may differ in a few ways from similar positions out there: Our founders are passionate about company culture and are very proud of what we have created so far. We want to see it evolve along with our growth, while preserving our existing Roundforest’s magic. This is why our CEO aspires to be involved and set the tone (and we are ALWAYS looking to learn new things).Additionally, managing relationships in a fast-paced working environment can often be challenging - which is why we believe an open and direct communication culture is essential for a startup’s success.Therefore at Roundforest, we encourage our team members to talk to each other directly, and thus we do not perceive the HR staff as ambassadors of any team member, rather as professionals who should support an open, honest and direct discussion, that include a constructive and curious feedback exchange. Our team grows together.Finally, we’re looking for candidates with a ׳hop margin׳ - a secret ingredient we look for in all new hires. In other words, this position requires the candidate to leap into the next phase of their career and to step outside their comfort zones, while maintaining a reasonable learning curve. Let's evolve together!Requirements:Familiarity with HR processes in a fast-growing and dynamic environmentExperience in developing talent acquisition strategies and hiring processesA deep understanding of the challenges of the HR world, including a vast perspective on the high-tech industryPhenomenal interpersonal skillsAlways looking for ways to make things better, creative and thinking outside of the boxBonus QualificationsExperience in an evolving startup cultureCurious and up to date with the current trends, data and innovations in the industry - we love learning new things!Diverse Perspectives-We know that innovation thrives on teams where diverse points of view come together to solve hard problems. As such, we explicitly seek people that bring diverse life experiences, diverse educational backgrounds, diverse cultures, and diverse work experiences. Please be prepared to share with us how your perspective will bring something unique and valuable to our team.
Requirements: ['Familiarity with HR processes in a fast-growing and dynamic environment', 'Experience in developing talent acquisition strategies and hiring processes', 'A deep understanding of the challenges of the HR world, including a vast perspective on the high-tech industry', 'Phenomenal interpersonal skills', 'Always looking for ways to make things better, creative and thinking outside of the box', 'Experience in an evolving startup culture', 'Curious and up to date with the current trends, data and innovations in the industry - we love learning new things!']

Title: Customer Service Specialist
Location: Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Purpose of the job:The Customer Service Professional represents the first point of contact for Red Bull Customers providing support as well to the internal customers/stakeholders. He/she is responsible for the supply chain execution of finished goods & visibility items and for the execution of the order-to-cash process. Key Responsibilities, Tasks and Activities:Excellence in managing customers' orders end-to-end process and providing a high level of service.Excellence in operating principles and level of service provided.Placing orders for the use of the office and the needs of employees, handling current retainers and new supplier invoices, ongoing issues, etc.Track delivery from 3PL to end customer while ensuring high-quality service. Work towards the resolution of logistical and operational issues originating both from the 3PL and the customer.Provide accurate and helpful information to support internal and external customers being the interface with the logistics providers for issues related to the deliveries.Ensures that processes are executed according to corporate governance and guidelines. Escalates to the key user and Logistic Manager processes out of standards and contributes proactively to the improvement of processes.The Customer Care Specialist ensures and is responsible for registering and following up until the finalization of all customer orders. Performs all tasks in accordance with customer requirements (date of delivery, quantity ordered, a copy of the order in the package, invoice via mail).Customer Care Specialist will take over supply chain management duties for the firm and become instrumental in the forward growth of the company. Will coordinate with many other departments to ensure an efficient daily workflow.Propose actions to reduce costs and improve customer satisfaction.Receives, registers, centralizes, and follows up on all customer orders, requirements, and logistics claims according to assigned territory and prepares monthly reports by the deadline.Communicated and coordinated with the warehouse in regard to orders and deliveries, preparing dispatch documents for a warehouse in accordance with RedBull Standards, policies, and procedures.Ensures that all activities he/she is responsible for are carried out correctly, completely, and timely.Observes and apply the company's quality management policy, the objectives for its fulfillment, and the provisions of the approved work procedures/instructions in all his/her daily activities.Proposes preventive/corrective/improving actions required to both prevent the occurrence/recurrence of nonconformities and to improve activities.Support specific invoice processes for all suppliers in coordination with Finance.Assist in the arrangement of meetings, setting up agendas, hotel and transfer arrangements, car rental, and dinner arrangements.Communicate with various internal departments on a regular basis for customer/ related issues, including emergency shipments, customer account status, invoices, etc.Skills and Knowledge3+ years’ previous experience in customer service, logistics management, or coordination.Strong work ethic, strong communication and interpersonal skills, Ability to work with different stakeholders, Agile mindset, multi-task in a fast-paced environment, Self-starter, efficient, and organized.Capable of consistently producing high-quality work under pressure and in a timely fashion.Is able to adapt to a quick-pacing and complex environment.Strong experience in internal processes, driving process improvements, and setting priorities.Proficiency with ERP systems (e.g., SAP / APO / BW) and good skills in Microsoft Office.Customer-oriented (An excellent problem-solving ability).Ability to work in a team and independently, as well as with minimal supervision.Embraces curiosity/innovation.Listen, empathizes, and co-create.Collaborative demonstrates a sense of urgency and collective ownership.
