Title: Compliance Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About the company: At Luna, our mission is to make quality, affordable vision care accessible for all.Our diverse team is working to advance the vision industry with an ever-growing collection of innovative solutions designed to address the toughest challenges facing eyewear businesses and doctors. We offer suites of products and services that improve and increase vision prescription access, streamline online shopping with virtual try-on and facial measurements, and support fulfillment and delivery. We bring vision to the people.About the team and role:As a compliance manager you'll be part of the regulation and quality team. You will ensure that the company, its employees and projects comply with all relevant regulations, standards and specifications as well as internal policies and procedures.You will investigate the worldwide regulatory landscape and corporate with outsourced legal experts and internal company employees.What you'll do: Create, review and implement regulatory compliance, quality and submission documentationKeep track of regulatory updates and changes worldwideCollaborate with company's consultants and employees in promoting and implementing complianceCommunicate with regulatory authorities and organizations Maintain company's quality systemWhat you'll need:Bachelor's degree in law Native EnglishRegulatory and legal research capabilities (worldwide)Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilitiesAn analytical mindset with excellent organizational skillNice to have:Familiarity with GDPR, ISO 13485 or 9001Background with regulatory work in a software company Background in software products Background in medical devicesWe believe in our people. If you feel you are the right person for the position, we want you to apply, even if you do not meet all of the requirements listed above. If you are not sure, don't hesitate to send us your information, we would love to hear from you!
Requirements: ['Create, review and implement regulatory compliance, quality and submission documentation', 'Keep track of regulatory updates and changes worldwide', "Collaborate with company's consultants and employees in promoting and implementing compliance", 'Communicate with regulatory authorities and organizations', "Maintain company's quality system", "Bachelor's degree in law", 'Native English', 'Regulatory and legal research capabilities (worldwide)', 'Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities', 'An analytical mindset with excellent organizational skill', 'Familiarity with GDPR, ISO 13485 or 9001', 'Background with regulatory work in a software company', 'Background in software products', 'Background in medical devices']

Title: Service Advisor, Israel
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: What To ExpectAt Tesla, our Service Advisors consistently coordinate a seamless experience for customers servicing their vehicles. They constitute Tesla’s front line and are our brand ambassadors, supporting our mission to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable energy.As a Service Advisor, you will support customers from the moment they walk through our door or schedule a service visit to returning their vehicle, managing communication across physical and digital platforms. We’ve created one of the most innovative vehicles ever made, and you will help ensure an equally innovative service experience.To succeed at Tesla, you must be energetic, highly organized, and smart working. You should have a passion for the brand and the ability to create exceptional customer experiences.What You’ll DoProvide the highest level of customer service throughout ownership experience across physical and digital platformsConfidently communicate with customers as a Tesla ambassador through digital channels, phone and face-to-face to provide scheduling/status updates, product education, Tesla App education and answer any questions using customer friendly languagePrepare customer appointments both digitally and physically in the Service Centre, ready for the customer to seamlessly changesPull vehicle logs and submit for remote diagnosis and repair, accurately recording repair orders, interactions and data into our systems, finalizing invoicing and paymentPartner closely with customer experience is consistentEnsure all health and safety regulations and procedures are adhered to, for both employees and customersTake on additional responsibilities as required by the business What You’ll BringRelevant experience in a customer facing role delivering excellent service, preferably from a technical or automotive environment Thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment with multiple priorities while maintaining attention to detailExcellent communication skills and ability to establish and maintain strong working relationships with both internal stakeholders and customers Ability to excel in a team-based environment and achieve common goals Excellent problem-solving skills, and strong ability to take initiative and be proactivePossess an understanding of automotive techniques related to repair and servicing of vehiclesDigitally savvy – ability to adopt and adapt quickly to new technology and systemsGood knowledge of MS OfficeAble to communicate, read, and write effectively in the English language, and other local languages if requiredMust have and continue to maintain a valid driving license and safe driving record

Title: HR Business Partner
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Paragon is a fast-growing Cyber Start-up.Attracting the best talents to join our team is our top priority!As a HRBP You will be a focal point of the HR Department. You will lead significant organizational processes and act as a strategic partner with the company’s Managers.We are looking for a passionate, pro-active, and multitasking HR Business partner to join our team.Responsibilities: Accompanying managers, consulting and giving guidance on team management issues such as employee development, feedback processes and hiring employees on a strategic level. Deliver a full range of HR services for the different company departments. Working with individuals, developing organizational processes, solving problems and conflicts.Develop, lead and implement organizational change processes, guide the Managers in performing management and disciplinary actions. Ability to multi-task and to work through complexities in an ever-changing and high-growth business environment.Collaborator and a team player - an inclusive mindset and ability to build great relationships at all levels of the organization

Title: Video Editor
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: MAЁLYS is one of the fastest-growing D2C beauty brands in the world. And now that we’ve gotten the formalities out of the way, let’s be frank. We are crushing it. How? We are breaking the mold of the body care industry with innovative targeted body care solutions for specific skin concerns, an intricate and unique combination of data and marketing, and a seriously sassy and bold brand voice.What’s our vibe? We are a team of people who want to make lasting, impactful changes, who live (and love) to see results, who innovate with passion, and who have a badass sense of humor. Is our vibe your vibe? Then keep reading…We are looking for a Video Editor and Motion Designer to join our talented creative team. We create performance-driven videos for social media ads that we then analyze, iterate, and improve. We are looking for someone with a creative mind who is plugged into the latest trends and best practices and is eager to join a hard-working, fast-paced team that works collaboratively.Your life at MAËLYS will look like…Edit high-quality, emotionally engaging videos.Execute end-to-end production of scripted videos for multiple social formats (IG, TikTok, YouTube).Design and animate motion graphics and utilize visual effects.Ensure brand consistency in all video content created.Manage the copy required for video captions and subtitles.Create briefs and meet tight deadlines. You will thrive in this role if you have…Minimum of 2-3 years of video editing and motion graphics experience.Expert in Adobe Premiere, Adobe After Effects, balancing audio, color correcting, and fine-tuning cuts.Experience managing organized projects in After Effects and Premiere.Experience creating ads for social media (IG, FB, TikTok, YouTube, Snapchat).Strong design skills - must be able to conceptualize and execute visual ideas with typography, graphics, color, and layout.0

Title: Business Operations and Strategy
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are making the future of Mobility come to life starting today.At Autofleet we support the world’s largest vehicle fleet operators and transportation providers to optimize existing operations and seamlessly launch new, dynamic business models - driving efficient operations and maximizing utilization.We’re looking for a business operations associate to join our business team and lead complex and strategic processes with our partners around the world.In your day-to-day you will create data-driven insights for our customers, lead the submission of RFI/RFPs, develop case studies and content based on research and live implementations around the world, drive go-to-market strategy for penetration of new verticals, and manage multi-disciplinary projects including business, product, and development teams.What you’ll do:Extract, summarize, and analyze operational data to provide insights to customers and partnersSupport the process for submission of Scope of Work documents for potential clients, manage RFI/RFP processes with multinational corporationsHands-on development of go-to-market strategy for new business development opportunities Manage client-facing projects end-to-end: collection of requirements, work with product and development teams, delivery and training with operational teamsRequirementsSignificant experience leading analytical and business processes in client-facing environments. Title: Chief Finance Officer (Remote)
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About TruvityWe are a fast-growing decentralised identity management start-up looking for a talented Chief Financial Officer (CFO) who would help us develop the firm’s financial strategy and set robust foundations for long-term growth.Our CFO must be well-versed in all aspects of financial management ranging from accounting and reporting to complex financial modelling, budgeting and risk management. The ideal candidate is a strong leader with the ability to build the finance, planning and accounting functions. Being a good steward to capital, CFO contributes to strategy formulation and drives our capital-raising efforts.Excellent analytical, planning and communication skills would be key to a technology start-up environment whereby the CFO is responsible for establishing governance and controls mechanisms internally across teams and communicating with stakeholders, vendors and banking and financing partners. The goal is to help the firm establish an efficient and sustainable finance function that would ensure our firm’s successful growth.The role means:Drive the company’s financial planning including building the firm’s financial model, budgeting and forecastingBuild the accounting and reporting functionsBuild the firm’s financial model for valuation and cash flow management purposes including parametrising and monitoring all key cost and revenues factorsAdvise on capital allocationDefine and lead the organisation’s fundraising plansMonitor and manage cash flowsSet up and oversee the company’s finance IT systemPerform risk management by analyzing the organization’s liabilities and investmentsManage vendors and partners relationshipsPrepare periodic and ad-hoc reports to management, shareholders and other stakeholdersManage the firm’s audits and reviewsWork in a multi-jurisdictional environment including the EU and UKManage corporate governance from the finance perspectiveEnsure compliance with the law and company policies.RequirementsProven experience as CFO, finance officer or relevant role in the EU, UK.Proven track records in fundraising in the EU/UK/ globally.In-depth knowledge of accounting principles and procedures (including IFRS), corporate finance, tax, corporate financial law and risk management practicesExcellent knowledge of data analysis and forecasting methods including financial modelingProficient in the use of MS Office and financial management software (e.g. Xero, Sage etc.)Ability to strategize and solve problemsStrong leadership and organizational skillsExcellent communication and people skillsAn analytical mind, comfortable with numbersBSc/BA in Accounting, Finance or relevant field; MSc/MBA is a plusFluent EnglishBenefitsWe have successfully proved that our product is (and will be) required worldwideWork directly with an experienced start-up team in a very hot industryWork on the cutting-edge of technology Challenging projects with enough possibilities for personal developmentFlexible hours to give you freedom and increase the productivityWorking in a team of the most senior professionals with high standards and looking out for the most efficient solutionsLearning environment and budget, the best place for self-realization and growth.Top-notch work equipmentVacation and holidays in accordance with your country of residence Competitive salaryBe a part of the international team of outstanding talentsRemote work.

Text: הובלת תהליך הטמעת מתודוגליית אג'ייל ,ייזום תכנון וניהול תוכנית הטמעת מתודולוגיות אג'ייל בחטיבת טכנולוגיות מול גורמים עסקיים .בניית תוכנית עבודה ארוכת טווח להובלת שינוי ארגוניהנעת תוכנית הפעולה להטמעת מתדולוגיית אג'ילבניית תוכנית עבודה וגיבוש דרכי פעולה,התאמת כלים, איסוף נתונים, ביצוע ניתוחים, גיבוש מסקנות והמלצותליווי וניהול שלבי היישום של כלל הגורמים בתהליך, תיאום מול ממשקים רבים והנעת המשתתפיםניהול אפקטיבי של הממשקים עם הלקוחות הפנימייםניהול מטריציוני של גורמים רבים בארגון וניהול ממשק עם מגוון גורמים חיצונייםRequirements:תואר ראשון בהנדסת תעשייה וניהול , כלכלה, מדעי המחשב או תחום רלוונטייכלת תעדוף משימות והנעה ללא סמכותנסיון מוכח של לפחות 3 שנים בניהול פרויקטים עסקיים טכנולוגיים אג'ייל וניתוח מערכותידע וניסיון בעבודה עם ספקים/יועצים - הגדרת דרישות , ניהול ובקרה על הביצוע

Title: Bookkeeper
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Background. Theator is a team dedicated to the alleviation of variability and disparity in the world of surgery. We do so by leveraging cutting-edge deep tech to understand what surgical best practices look like in the real world. Computer vision allows us to structure unstructured surgical footage. A variety of other AI tools help us understand context, then identify best practices to guide humans and robots and provide billions around the world with access to safe and affordable surgical care.We're looking for a Bookkeeper to join our Finance team in Tel Aviv.Main Job Responsibilities:Establish internal bookkeeping @TheatorImplementation of new finance ERP systemPrepare month-end closing and reconciliationsBank account management and reconciliationsAP management local & global -Invoice processing & paymentsInter-Company reconciliationsOverseeing the Company’s payroll processReports to the authorities -VAT, Income Tax, and Social SecurityRequirements:Requirements:Bookkeeping qualification- Level 2-must, Level 3- advantage4 years of bookkeeping experience, Hi-Tech Companies or multi-national company- AdvantageStrong Microsoft excel skillsHighly organized with strong attention to detailsAbility to work in a hyper-growth environmentExcellent communication and organizational skillsHighly motivated and Self drivenPriority/NetSuite Experience – AdvantageTeam player and service-orientedSolid verbal and written English skillsHow do you know if you fit right in? You’re frustrated with the status quo around you and are passionate about improving. You’re creative, thrive in ambiguity and uncertainty and enjoy blazing a trail. You practice transparency. You want to be surrounded by stellar team-members and work well with others. You want to leave a mark.If interested, please reach out to:Suzan Amir - suzan@theator.io

Title: HR Business Partner
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are looking for a passionate, motivated, and innovative HRBP to join our team and grow with us.This role includes supporting employees in various HR-related topics, support in recruitment processes, developing and implementing HR processes, talent management, and more.﻿If you’re looking to work in a fast-paced, growing company, alongside amazing co-workers, then this role is for youResponsibilities:Act as a first-line HR Business partner and be the main focal point to employees in different departments of the org. Responsible for the full employee life cycle – from recruitment, through onboarding, and career development, pulse checks to offboarding.Build long-term and trusting relationships with employees.Initiate, integrate and execute effective HR programs, such as talent development, feedback, employee retention, recognition etc.Interview candidates. Facilitate inquiries that come into HR such as benefits, policies, ‘how to’, etc.Support the Director of HR with day-to-day tasks, HR administration, and implementation of HR programs.Conduct and document exit interviews.Work closely with Payroll and IT to ensure a smooth transfer of information.Be an HR partner with the business in terms of being a trusted and reliable resource.Requirements:1-2 years of experience as an HRBP in global tech companiesAl least 2 years of experience as a recruiter - Advantage Good understanding of employee conditions: law labor, benefits, etc.Good understanding of HR practices and the full HR cycle: recruitment, Onboarding, performance management, talent management, reward and retention, employee relations, and employee engagementAbility to work under high pressure and tight deadlinesHighly organized, ability to multitaskCreative and curiousA great communicator with excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written skillsEnthusiastic, a team player with a strong drive to create a positive work environment Be able to operate independently, and have attention to detailsHigh-level of English proficiency - written and verbalAbout ActiveFence:ActiveFence is the leading tool stack for Trust & Safety teams, worldwide. By relying on ActiveFence’s end-to-end solution, Trust & Safety teams – of all sizes – can keep users safe from the widest spectrum of online harms, unwanted content, and malicious behavior, including child safety, disinformation, fraud, hate speech, terror, nudity, and more. Using cutting-edge AI and a team of world-class subject-matter experts to continuously collect, analyze, and contextualize data, ActiveFence ensures that in an ever-changing world, customers are always two steps ahead of bad actors. As a result, Trust & Safety teams can be proactive and provide maximum protection to users across a multitude of abuse areas, in 70+ languages. Backed by leading Silicon Valley investors such as CRV and Norwest, ActiveFence has raised $100M to date; employs 300 people worldwide, and has contributed to the online safety of billions of users across the globe.

Title: VP Finance
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Navina is a fast-paced and exciting AI startup in the field of digital health. Navina brings physicians a complete, integrated picture of their patients in a single intelligible view. It enables them to identify the clinical data they need, making any case reviewable in minutes. The result is better treatment, reduced missed diagnoses, and better economics for healthcare.As Navina’s VP of finance, you will oversee all financial aspects of the business and drive the company’s financial strategy. You will be responsible for assessing the financial performance of the company, potential risks and investments.The VP of Finance will be reporting to the CEO and will be a part of Navina’s management team.Requirements:Proven experience as the VP of Finance or the leading finance professional in a fast growing company (post-sereis B Round)At least 5 years in a similar role/leading financial rolesExperience navigating the financial, tax, regulatory and compliance matters of a global companyAt least 3 years of experience in SAAS start-upsExperience in healthcare - an advantageBeing part of the scaling journey of a startup from early sales to market leadership - an advantageExcellent English – writing and verbal skillsResponsibilities:Oversight of all Finance, Accounting, Tax, Legal and Operations functions across the company and its subsidiariesAssess and evaluate the financial performance of the organization with regard to long-term operational goals, budgets, and forecasts.Provide insight and recommendations to both short-term and long-term growth plans of the organization.Serve as a business partner to the CEO and a key member of the leadership team, taking part in strategic business decisions, providing insights into the financial & operational implications of the company’s performance and presenting them to management and board of directors.Lead FP&A functions, building business plans and models to achieve company objectivesEnsure the timely and accurate preparation and filing of the Company’s financial reportsDevelop and improve company work processes, policies and compliance to support company objectives and growthEnhance and implement financial and accounting system processes, tools, and controlsManage cash, banks and all currency strategySupport company fundraising and investor relationships

Title: Creative Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: MAЁLYS is one of the fastest-growing D2C beauty brands in the world. And now that we’ve gotten the formalities out of the way, let’s be frank. We are crushing it. How? We are breaking the mold of the body care industry with innovative targeted body care solutions for specific skin concerns, an intricate and unique combination of data and marketing, and a seriously sassy and bold brand voice.What’s our vibe? We are a team of people who want to make lasting, impactful changes, who live (and love) to see results, who innovate with passion, and who have a badass sense of humor. Is our vibe your vibe? Then keep reading…We are looking for a Creative Manager that will become an essential part of our marketing team. You will be in charge of every step of the creation of all new ads - from ideation and writing the scripts to post-production with our internal video editing team. You will analyze the data to learn how our ads perform, and use that data to write and create new ads, in an effort to always optimize, refine, and further scale our immense growth.Your life at MAËLYS will look like…Ideate and write engaging scripts for new ads.Work with 3rd-party production partners to create visual assets on a regular basis.Attend all shooting days to ensure our standards and needs are met.Work with our internal video editing team for all post-production needs.Analyze performance data, and conceive new ideas and iterations for existing ads, based on performance.Work with our internal data and performance teams to build daily/weekly/monthly reports. You will thrive in this role if you have…Proficient English Level, both verbal and written - Must!Keen attention to detail, and critical thinking skills.Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.Advantage: experience creating performance-driven ads for Facebook, TikTok, Youtube, and Snap.Requirements:Lightricks, mixtiles, Advertising agencies Taboola, Wix, Ourcrowd, Skai, Outbrain, Fiverr,Etoro , Elemntor , Playtika, Jolt,

Title: Social Content Specialist

Text: Artlist is a fast-growing creative technology company providing video creators with high-quality music, sound effects, footage and digital assets for video, as well as powerful video and image editing software. With our revolutionary license and cutting-edge creative tools, we’re on the fast track to becoming the ultimate 360 degree solution for video creators.Today, Artlist is the go-to licensing provider for creators in over 160 countries. Among our 16M clients are Google, Apple, Nike, Coca-Cola, Ikea, Mercedes, Samsung, Wix, Netflix, Dior and many more.Artlist consists of 4 products:Artlist.io, a royalty-free music and SFX platformArtgrid.io, a curated stock footage platformMotionArray.com, an all-in-one marketplace for creators that offers video templates, presets, music, SFX, stock footage, motion graphics and stock photosFXhome, a cutting-edge video, VFX and image editing softwareWe’re looking for a full-time Social Content Specialist to join our vibrant Creative team in Tel-Aviv.﻿﻿Wake up for this:Create and publish compelling and engaging daily video content from A to Z, across multiple social media platformsActively engage with our audiences on various social media platformsLead initiatives and campaigns to promote Artlist’s products through social media.Research the latest social media trends, competitors and audiences and come up with creative content ideas to further Artlist’s growth, retention & brand awarenessRequirements:At least 2 years of experience as a Content Creator, Social Content Specialist, Social Media Manager or in a similar roleNative English speaker - a mustMultitasker with the ability to handle multiple priorities/projects simultaneously and tight deadlinesExperience with video and image editing software (Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop) - a big advantagePortfolio is a must

Title: Financial Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: How would you like to work on an exciting and meaningful business and have an impact as of day one? Are you passionate about crunching the numbers to make strategy come to life? If so, we have the perfect role for you.This is a unique opportunity to obtain insights into the world of finance through a fast-moving consumer goods company and benefit from:Business topics at the heart of today’s news – Evolving channels (Discounters, E-commerce), competition, and customers' reality makes working in a consumer good's business dynamic every single day!Recognized Financial leadership - Our finance people are part of every multi-functional team and are the key actors in business development and decision-making.Responsibilities as of Day 1 – You will have total ownership of your projects from the start and will work on very concrete projects. Whether it's external negotiations, crafting new marketing / sales plans or improving productivity of logistics, you will feel your impact.Continuous mentorship – We work with passionate people and like to give both formal training as well as day-to-day coaching. Your interactions with your Manager and the other functions managers will be a key enabler for your success.Dynamic and respectful work environment – Our employees are at the core of everything we do. We value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance.About the role:You will work as the finance leader on a team with representatives from various other functions that is responsible for a brand or category. Our focus is to win as a team with everyone's strong individual contributions. Within the team, you will find strong collaboration among team members and an environment where everyone's opinions are valued and encouraged to be shared. You will play a role in setting strategy, decision-making, business planning, and analysis across all aspects of the business.We want people who want a career, not just a jobWe will make sure that your career is filled with meaningful, challenging and diverse assignments. We intended to sharpen your functional skills while building out your broader business and leadership skills.As you progress, you may have the opportunity to work globally – via business travel or to complete a 3 to 4-year assignment somewhere else in the world. If you prefer, you can choose to “specialize” in one of the sub-functions and become a subject matter expert for the company. Ultimately, we want to help build the career path that is right for you.QualificationsWe are looking for the very best mind to work with usStrong academic backgroundExemplary leadership experience Up to 5 years’ experience  Fluency in English and Hebrew  Excellent analytical, strategic and leadership skills  An ability to innovate and develop creative solutions  Strong ability to communicate and influence others

Title: Junior Fraud and Payment Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Tango is a successful, market leader, a live-streaming Platform with 450+ Million registered users, in an industry projected to reach $240 BILLION in the next couple of years.The B2C platform, based on the best-quality global video technology, allows millions of talented people around the world to create their own live content, engage with their fans and monetize their talents.Tango live stream was founded in 2018 and is powered by 300+ global employees operating in a culture of growth, learning, and success!The Tango team is a vigorous cocktail of hard workers, creative brains, energizers, geeks, overachievers, athletes, and more. We push the limits to bring our app from “one of the top” to “the leader”.The best way to describe Tango's work style is not to use the word “impossible”. And we believe that success is a thorny path that runs on sleepless nights, corporate parties, tough releases, and of course our users' smiles (and as we are a LIVE app, we truly get to see our users all around the world smiling right in front of us in real-time!).Do you want to join the party?Requirements:At least 1 year hands-on experience with mobile app monetization, chargeback, fraud and dispute resolution handling.At least 1 year experience in consumer-focused Support / Risk Department / FinanceUnderstanding of fraud screening and mitigation, chargeback, payments monitoring systems.Fluent EnglishAnalytical skills, ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced results-oriented environment.High proficiency in a computer field.Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint advanced level.Knowledge of SQL will be an advantage.Responsibilities:Develop and maintain fraud monitoring system for a very large international user base.Process and evaluate incoming and outgoing payments and Refund.Process and Monitor Chargeback to reduce risk.Coordinate issue resolution with the product, marketing & technical teamsIncrease the efficiency of service to top customers and in generalGenerate development ideas based on feedback

Title: Financial Controller
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Imagine your dream office... Now, try again. Mindspace is a rapidly growing global provider of inspiring workspaces for teams of all sizes. Our community consists of enterprise companies and established startups, as well as small businesses, entrepreneurs, and creative freelancers. With members in more than 34 locations across 7 countries, we are setting the gold standard for flexible workspaces around the world.Who is the financial Controller?This full-time position is based in Tel Aviv and entails managing the financial policies of Mindspace. The ideal candidate should have several years of experience in a top accounting firm, experience as a controller/ assistant controller and a creative team player with strong interpersonal and management skills.Your day at Mindspace.With a strong understanding of accounting and financial measures, you will be ensuring that business operations are aligned with the company’s policies. You’ll be handed a lot of responsibility including managing a team based in and outside Israel. We trust that you are an independent, responsible, and professional who is able to work in a fast-paced environment with cross-organizational teams and interfaces.What You Will Be Responsible For, Mainly.Guides financial decisions by establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures. Monitors and confirms financial condition by conducting audits; providing information to external auditors ( local and foreign )Preparing ongoing reports to the company’s stakeholdersAnalyzing company’s financial results with respect to profits, trends, margins, costs and vs. budgetManaging employees .Month-end close processEnsure invoicing is done on time and includes all the necessary accounts, involved in complicated billing issues, revenue recognition, and debt collectionTax - comply with local, government reporting requirements and tax filingsResponsible for managing and reporting monthly CFPreparation of quarterly reporting package and related working paper.Ensuring global compliance with IFRS 16.Preparing annual budget.Requirements:Experience & Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in accounting - a mustCPA from a Big 4 accounting firm, with a minimum of 1-2 years of experience after internship (experience from a global company – an advantage)Excellent computer skills; experience in SAPGood knowledge of Israel Tax and tax reporting experienceExceptional knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting, cost accounting and cost control principles, and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.High level of English and Hebrew - MUSTAdvanced knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting best practices, laws, standardsAnalytical ability to develop and implement improvements or recommendationsCritical Competencies for Success:We may be an international firm – but you must possess a strong understanding and knowledge of Israeli taxation and compliance lawsYou’ll be handed a lot of responsibility – so we trust that you’re an independent and responsible worker who is able to work in a fast-paced environment with cross-organizational teams and interfacesThere are no taking shortcuts here – transparency is key!You should be a highly-creative team player who is able to think on his feet when the going gets toughBuilding infrastructure processes and procedures should not be out of your comfort zone – so come prepared with a can-do attitudeFired up about Mindspace; you are ready to live, eat and breathe Mindspace, spreading the love to everyone you encounterPlease submit your application in English.Mindspace is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Operations Support Engineer
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: The Operations Support Engineer is viewed as a focal point for constantly working to optimize and maximize production through all of EMED's offshore and onshore facilities. Systems included are: inlet fluids production, gas dew-pointing, gas export, liquids separation, condensate stabilization, MEG pre-treatment/reclamation/regenaration, produced water treatment, utilities and more…This role is in support of two offshore gas production facilities and three onshore gas processing and midstream facilities. These facilities are world-class in both design and operation by providing >70% of daily electricity to the domestic grid in addition to expansive regional export of gas sales to both Jordan and Egypt.Operations SupportProvide day-to-day support to Operations in process monitoring, optimization, troubleshooting, and process control.Evaluate operating ranges of process variables throughout the facilities.Provide limits, tools, and training to Operations to assist with maintaining stable operation.Provide counsel and advice to operations and maintenance teams on the engineering aspects of systems and equipment.OPEX review and identification of improvements for cost efficiency.Support EHSR to ensure environmental compliance and excellence related to air emissions and water overboard discharge.Process and Production OptimizationWork to implement safe and reliable solutions to relieve constraints where economically attractiveInvestigate and determine precursors that lead to upset conditions.Investigate and analyze problems with directed objectives and develop solutions for equipment and systems in operating facilities.Document history of upsets and highlight repeat occurrences to analyze data and communicate to stakeholders.Use facility models, process models and technology specific programs to perform detailed evaluations.Build process monitoring tools for systems that stretch across multiple units or operating areas.Identify gaps between current performance and best-in-class. Maintains awareness of industry standard performance.Solve unusual or complex problems within the facilities requiring comprehensive understanding of Process and Production Systems while integrating other disciplines technologies and customer constraints. Engages SME’s appropriately.Procedure ManagementDevelop process startup procedures, operating instructions and operator training guides.Review and update operating procedures and/or operating manuals.Lead operations team in step-by-step review of procedures.Project ManagementPropose modifications by following the Management of Change (MOC) process, provide instruction for installations when necessary and ensure proper documentation is included as part of the change.Manage and/or support the life cycle of process/production related brownfield projects stemming from MOCs.Multi-Disciplinary SupportProvide engineering support to other Chevron EMED technical staff and departments such as finance, accounting, and EHSR as requiredSupport and provide input to EHSR for regulatory and environmental compliance mattersChevron participates in E-Verify in certain locations as required by law.
Requirements: ['Provide day-to-day support to Operations in process monitoring, optimization, troubleshooting, and process control.', 'Evaluate operating ranges of process variables throughout the facilities.', 'Provide limits, tools, and training to Operations to assist with maintaining stable operation.', 'Provide counsel and advice to operations and maintenance teams on the engineering aspects of systems and equipment.', 'OPEX review and identification of improvements for cost efficiency.', 'Support EHSR to ensure environmental compliance and excellence related to air emissions and water overboard discharge.', 'Work to implement safe and reliable solutions to relieve constraints where economically attractive', 'Investigate and determine precursors that lead to upset conditions.', 'Investigate and analyze problems with directed objectives and develop solutions for equipment and systems in operating facilities.', 'Document history of upsets and highlight repeat occurrences to analyze data and communicate to stakeholders.', 'Use facility models, process models and technology specific programs to perform detailed evaluations.', 'Build process monitoring tools for systems that stretch across multiple units or operating areas.', 'Identify gaps between current performance and best-in-class. Maintains awareness of industry standard performance.', 'Solve unusual or complex problems within the facilities requiring comprehensive understanding of Process and Production Systems while integrating other disciplines technologies and customer constraints. Engages SME’s appropriately.', 'Develop process startup procedures, operating instructions and operator training guides.', 'Review and update operating procedures and/or operating manuals.', 'Lead operations team in step-by-step review of procedures.', 'Propose modifications by following the Management of Change (MOC) process, provide instruction for installations when necessary and ensure proper documentation is included as part of the change.', 'Manage and/or support the life cycle of process/production related brownfield projects stemming from MOCs.', 'Provide engineering support to other Chevron EMED technical staff and departments such as finance, accounting, and EHSR as required', 'Support and provide input to EHSR for regulatory and environmental compliance matters']

Title: General open position
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About Juno Journey:Our mission is to Connect employees' ambitions with the company's goals through one journey of personal development.Our ValuesBe Product Obsessed - We love making our product the best in the world. Every feature, every screen, every word is thought through. It’s like magic, smooth, easy, fantastic.Grow every day - We make big bets and we believe in the power of feedback and encourage a mindset of continuous learning and growth.Have Internal-Drive- We’re a company of builders who are internally driven to do good work. We understand that we can get to about the 90th percentile in our field by working either smart or hard, which is still a great accomplishment. But getting to the 99th percentile requires both.Collaborate- We know that many of our biggest advances grow out of work done across multiple teams. We communicate and love working in teams.Be Accountable- We own challenges, problems, solutions, and outcomes. We don’t blame our team, circumstances, or luck. We take ownership, find issues, and execute quickly to improve.If you want to be part of the journey but you didn't find your right role, send us your cv and we will try to find for you something/

Title: Banking Analyst - Expert Graduate Programme - 2023
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Join the world of bankingEvery day, corporations worldwide come to Barclays for our banking expertise. We help drive global commerce by providing comprehensive financial, advisory and capital-raising services. Our bankers advise on everything from mergers and acquisitions and privatisations to debt and equity financings and restructuring. Want in? Join us as an analyst.The chance to make an impactYou May Work OnAfter several weeks of intensive training to start, you’ll join one of our industry, product or geographic groups and start working on live deals and business development projects right away. Within small deal teams, you’ll quickly play an important role on a variety of demanding assignments.financial analysis and modelingvaluationindustry researchbusiness evaluation and strategic assessmentbusiness and idea generationexternal and internal stakeholder communication.A place where you can thrive At Barclays, you’ll be surrounded by people who will help you achieve your ambitions. Our collaborative, supportive environment gives you the chance to build solid relationships with senior leaders, peers and clients alike. What’s more, dedicated programme managers will support and advocate for you throughout the first several years of your career at Barclays, ensuring you develop the skills you need to succeed.During Your Analyst Years, You’ll Alsoparticipate in formal and informal training designed to give you the knowledge you need when you need it receive detailed performance coaching and feedbackhave opportunities to expand your network and develop leadership skills.Your role as a Banking analyst will provide you with the skills and experience needed for a successful career in the world of finance. We’ll also provide you a visible path to the necessary steps for promotion to associate and the tools to get you there.To Be Considered For This Programme, You Mustbe motivated with a strong degree or expected degree – in any area.Ideally You Would Havea strong interest in business and finance, though no specific subject degree is required a candidate with course experience in accounting (strongly recommended) someone who shows resourcefulness, team-orientation, enthusiasm and an entrepreneurial spirit, demonstrated through participation in extracurricular activities.It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.
Requirements: ['financial analysis and modeling', 'valuation', 'industry research', 'business evaluation and strategic assessment', 'business and idea generation', 'external and internal stakeholder communication.', 'participate in formal and informal training designed to give you the knowledge you need when you need it', 'receive detailed performance coaching and feedback', 'have opportunities to expand your network and develop leadership skills.', 'be motivated with a strong degree or expected degree – in any area.', 'a strong interest in business and finance, though no specific subject degree is required', 'a candidate with course experience in accounting (strongly recommended)', 'someone who shows resourcefulness, team-orientation, enthusiasm and an entrepreneurial spirit, demonstrated through participation in extracurricular activities.']

Title: מנהל איכות
Location: Petah Tikva, Center District, Israel
Text: לחברת בטחונית העוסקת בפיתוח וייצור מערכות אלקטרו-אופטיות דרוש/ה מנהל /ת איכות.קידום והטמעת את הבטחת האיכות של החברה בין העובדים בעבודה השוטפת.סיפוק מידע עדכני על מצב האיכות של החברה, תוך סיוע להנהלה בזיהוי בעיות איכות כלליות שבאחריותה לטפל בהן.הכנת המצע לסקר הנהלה ולנהל את הסקר.בחינת תהליכי הפיתוח, ההנדסה והיצור במגמה לאבחן בהם גורמי סיכון העשויות לגרום לבעיות איכות. לוודא קיום תהליך בקרת תיעוד בהתאם לנוהל החברה.ליזום ולתרום לפיתוח תרבות ארגונית בתחום האיכות ולהטמיע את יעדי האיכות בעובדי החברה.לבחון את התהליכים המתקיימים בחברה ע"י מבדקי איכות, על מנת להבטיח יישום של מדיניות האיכות.לוודע ביצוע תהליכים בהתאם לנהלים והוראות העבודה של החברה.להוביל את כל תהליכי הבדיקה בתהליכים השונים (QC) ולקיימם בתיאום עם מנהל התפעול.ליזום ולעקוב אחרי ביצוע תהליכי פעילות מתקנת ומונעת במגמה למנוע הישנות בעיות איכות.לנהל ולתחזק רשימת יצרנים מורשים לפריטי הרכש (Qualified Vendors Listלוודא יישום תוכניות ההדרכה של החברה.לפקח על ציוד המדידה והבדיקה של החברה.לעקוב אחר מוצרים חריגים ודוחות תקלה. להיות שותף בביצוע חקרי תקלה.לעקוב אחר יישום שינויים שהוגדרו על ידי הנדסה.להתניע פעולות מתקנות ומונעות בהתאם לנדרש.להכין תוכניות איכותאחריות לקידום המודעות לדרישות הלקוח בארגוןלפקח על תהליכי הפיתוח ועמידה בדרישות לקוח.טיפול ב MRB Requirements:ניסיון כמנהל איכות של 5 שנים לפחות בארגון פיתוח וייצור בתחום ההייטק.הכשרה רישמית של קורס מנהלי איכות.ניסיון עבודה מול גורמי צה"ל והתעשייה הביטחונית - יתרוןיכולת פרזנטטיבית והובלה יחסי אנוש מעוליםיכולת הנעה של תהליכיםשליטה בתוכנות OFFICE , יכולת הכנה והצגת מצגות בתחומי האיכות וההדרכה.אנגלית ברמה טובה.ידע בהכנה ותחזוקה של נהלים.הכרת תקנים ISO 9001 . רצוי גם IPC A 610,IPC A620ניסיון בהכנת הארגון למבדקים חיצוניים.ידע בביצוע מבדקים פנימיים ולקבלני משנה.הכרת תהליכי פיתוח חומרה ותוכנה.הכרות עם תוכנות ניהול תצורה ומלאי, רצוי פריוריטי ו PLM .

Title: Customer Success Manager (Hybrid)
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: GrowthSpace is looking for a self-motivated and proactive Customer Success Manager to oversee the lifecycle of customers from onboarding to renewal and beyond! As a Customer Success Manager, you'll join a great team who are laser focused on delivering the best experience to GrowthSpace's customers. Come grow with us!GrowthSpace is all about employee growth! It's created an innovative platform in the employee learning & development space that's personalized, data-driven, and connected to business KPIs. It sets employees up with the most relevant one-on-one and group development options, workshops and lectures that are tailored to each individual by using data. GrowthSpace supports global customers like Intel, Taboola, Monday.com, Applied Materials, MSD, Siemens, Federal Bank and Johnson & Johnson, as well as many other companies in over 35 countries & languages. About the role: Become an expert on GrowthSpace's platform -- provide training and educate our customers on new features and use cases Manage relationships with VP's of HR/HR Business Partners & Directors of Organizational Development and become a trusted advisor to our customers Conduct executive business reviews with key stakeholders to share wins, industry best practices, and share impact on our customer outcomes Recommend use cases & best practices to address our customers business needs and key KPIs Manage customer situations that require cross department collaboration Invite, facilitate, and document customer product ideas Flexible working policy (mostly remote) and great company benefitsRequirements: Background in customer success, product management, or account management at a SaaS, B2B, and/or learning & development company Experience working with multiple accounts across a diverse set of industries, company sizes, experience levels Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Hebrew & English A fast learner who is naturally curious and thrives in a fast paced and dynamic work environmentBonus Points: Background in learning & development 2+ years managing B2B accounts Positive attitude, empathy, and high energyWhy GrowthSpace: Work for the world’s first platform for personalized, human-led development – at scale A one-of-a-kind, Digital HR Tech Solution that is disrupted People Development market You can “Own your domain” We encourage people to “Do whatever it takes” Work with the leading companies in North America A vision and growth trajectory that is challenging and exciting You will work with a great entrepreneurial team – that possesses a “get it done culture” – with people who always care﻿
Requirements: ["Become an expert on GrowthSpace's platform -- provide training and educate our customers on new features and use cases", "Manage relationships with VP's of HR/HR Business Partners & Directors of Organizational Development and become a trusted advisor to our customers", 'Conduct executive business reviews with key stakeholders to share wins, industry best practices, and share impact on our customer outcomes', 'Recommend use cases & best practices to address our customers business needs and key KPIs', 'Manage customer situations that require cross department collaboration', 'Invite, facilitate, and document customer product ideas', 'Flexible working policy (mostly remote) and great company benefits', 'Background in customer success, product management, or account management at a SaaS, B2B, and/or learning & development company', 'Experience working with multiple accounts across a diverse set of industries, company sizes, experience levels', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Hebrew & English', 'A fast learner who is naturally curious and thrives in a fast paced and dynamic work environment', 'Background in learning & development', '2+ years managing B2B accounts', 'Positive attitude, empathy, and high energy', 'Work for the world’s first platform for personalized, human-led development – at scale', 'A one-of-a-kind, Digital HR Tech Solution that is disrupted People Development market', 'You can “Own your domain”', 'We encourage people to “Do whatever it takes”', 'Work with the leading companies in North America', 'A vision and growth trajectory that is challenging and exciting', 'You will work with a great entrepreneurial team – that possesses a “get it done culture” – with people who always care\ufeff']

Title: Social Media Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: MAЁLYS is one of the fastest-growing D2C beauty brands in the world. And now that we’ve gotten the formalities out of the way, let’s be frank. We are crushing it. How? We are breaking the mold of the body care industry with innovative targeted body care solutions for specific skin concerns, an intricate and unique combination of data and marketing, and a seriously sassy and bold brand voice.What’s our vibe? We are a team of people who want to make lasting, impactful changes, who live (and love) to see results, who innovate with passion, and who have a badass sense of humor.We are looking for a Social Media Manager to create & plan content, as well as grow and manage our online community of over 1M followers across multiple social platforms. The ideal candidate is a native English speaker with excellent copywriting skills, is a beauty/retail connoisseur, and has excellent time management & organization skills. You love creating engaging content, you speak hashtag & check what’s trending on Tik-Tok & Instagram on a daily!This role is extremely fast paced, so a highly organized and self-motivated individual is essential. If you are hungry and solution oriented, we want you!﻿Your life at MAËLYS will look like…Manage MAËLYS social media platforms (Instagram, Tik-Tok, Pinterest, Twitter, Snapchat & LinkedIn)Set, plan, and implement social media campaigns and strategiesWork on ideation and writing of accurate, engaging scripts for new video content (Reels + Tik-Tok)Organize & manage monthly video shooting daysCreate engaging content and maintain the company’s online presenceBe a creative storytelling champion for the social strategy in partnership with brand, influencer, and content marketing teamsAnalyze performance data and conceive new ideas based on performanceWork closely with different departments to execute strategic, engaging, and creative social campaignsRequirements:You will thrive in this role if you have…Native English Speaker - Advantage2+ years of experience in the organic social media field (in-house or agency)Strong record of developing and executing successful large-scale social media brand campaigns with measurable resultsExperience in either the production or creative side of video creation is an advantageKeen attention to detail, and critical thinking skillsStrong organizational and multitasking abilities

Title: Financial Controller

Over a decade of research and development stands behind the company’s proprietary market-leading computer vision technology. Title: eCommerce Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About UsDropit is a pioneering omnichannel retail technology company that unifies brands' physical and online inventory. Founded in 2016, Dropit operates in the US, UK, Canada and Europe, allowing brands to sell in-store inventory online, transform physical locations into last-mile distribution points and source orders to locations closest to the customer, thereby reducing the environmental impact of the retail industry.About YouYou're an experienced eCommerce Manager who loves a challenge! You will take ownership of our two existing marketplaces, manage their day to day and lift their performance to new heights. You have the right mix of eCommerce, marketing, data, and tech knowledge, you live and breathe Shopify, and are experienced in app integrations, have hands-on marketing experience, and are tech-savvy. You are a fast learner, a team player with a can-do approach, and possess a precise eye for the finer details. You love the challenge of scaling operations and thrive on data-centric iterations.About The RoleAs an eCommerce Manager, you will be a part of the Marketing team, responsible for the day to day growth of Dropit's two eCommerce marketplaces built on Shopify. You will onboard new brands and curate the user experience by managing and maintaining the products and collections hierarchy. You will also be responsible to plan, manage, and execute B2C marketing activity, website analytics, site optimization, and marketplace content strategy.What You Will DoOwn day to day operations and ensure that the eCommerce marketplaces are running smoothly.Own catalog integrity. Make sure all products and collections are organized properly including hands-on tag management (creating and maintaining).Liaise with sellers and maintain positive relationships and ongoing communication.Collaborate with graphic designers for changes and additions to the marketplace.Work closely with the Product team to onboard new merchants. Work with internal and external content creators to build and implement a B2C content strategy.Implement marketing calendar promotions on the marketplaces.Plan and execute long & short-term projects.Integrate and operate apps in the Shopify platform.Update marketplace assets such as banners, discounts, pop-ups, etc...Manage email marketing: lists, flows, campaigns.Maintain ongoing performance reporting dashboards, track shoppers' behavior and shopping statistics with Google Analytics, Shopify Analytics, and internal BI tools.You'll Be Great For This Role If You Have3+ years of experience managing eCommerce operations on Shopify - a must!Previous experience working in a tech company - A must! Experience in a Startups - advantage.Experience with CRM platformsExperience with Google Analytics / Tag ManagerData structure understanding (tags, hierarchies, categorization, etc...)Knowledge of project management platforms like Monday and JiraKnowledge in SEO - advantageKnowledge of HTML/CSS - advantageKnowledge of BI tools - advantageHigh level of both written and spoken English - a mustTech-savvy with strong problem-solving and analytical skillsEqual OpportunitiesWe believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our values. Our goal is to ensure that Dropit upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. We welcome applicants of any educational background, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, and disability.

Title: Duty Supervisor - Tel Aviv
Location: Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: It’s an exciting time to work for Etihad Airways and in particular our Global Network and Operations function; we’ve grown from a national carrier to a global aviation group, transforming the industry through creativity and innovation with a clear drive to optimize commercial value whilst delivering exceptional products and services to our guests.We have an exciting opportunity to join our team in Tel Aviv as Duty Supervisor. In this role the job holder will be responsible in planning, directing and supervising the airport operation, overseeing team and service provider performance. Ensure financial, customer service, quality, safety and security objectives are delivered in accordance with all applicable safety, security, regulatory and company requirements and standards. Supervise all elements of operations while on duty.AccountabilitiesOversee all passenger and aircraft handling operations on a shift basis, ensuring adherence to all arrival/departure checklists, brand requirements, company policy/procedures and regulatory requirementsResponsible for the effective management of safety and security outcomes on a shift basis through hazard identification, safety and compliance monitoring and reportingEnsure all flight editing and special guest requirements are met, including but not limited to assessment, planning and coordination of VIP/MAAS, PRM and special category guestsEffectively liaise with Guest Control, Network Control and SOC to manage operational disruption recovery and reduce impact to guest service and operational integrityDeliver, maintain and rehearse station emergency response plan, disruption planning, diversion/delay handling and business continuity plansResponsible for on time performance on a shift basis including coordination, mitigation, accurate reporting and follow-up of delaysAirport ancillary sales promotion, coordination, process compliance monitoring and adherence to associated targetsResponsible for promotion, delivery, monitoring and reporting on customer service-related standards, including performance against associated KPIsEnsuring adherence to local authority requirements, including but not limited to arrival/departure documentation and reporting.Make day-to-day operational decisions to manage and mitigate operational safety and security-related risks on a shift basis at station level, through effective evaluation and decision-making based on conditions, hazards and threatsIdentification and reporting of safety and security-related occurrences and hazards in accordance with company procedures and local regulationsAdditional responsibilities defined in full JD on intranet.Education & ExperienceDegree level education desirable (A-level or baccalaureate equivalent) or relevant industry experience, with a demonstrable knowledge of frontline service delivery and communication skills. Previous exposure to highly pressured and multicultural environment in a supervisory role within a shift environment requiredMinimum 5-7 years' experience within service, hospitality, airline or retail industry, with a relevant knowledge of aviation, travel industry and/or airport policies. Role requires mature personality with outstanding communication skills, supervisory skills and passion to deliver service. Role must balance guest-centric focus and corporate interest while maintaining highest safety and security standards and coordinating teams and service providers on shift

Title: Office Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: In a nutshell:If you are a people-person, go-getter ’re fun and make new friends easily, and bring good vibes to everything you do - vcita is perfect for youRequirements:+2 years in a relevant similar position (experience in Hitech a bonus)).Excellent time management skills and the ability to multitask and prioritize work.Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and HebrewOrganized and pays attention to details.Capable of working both independently and on a team.Eager to learn and grow with the company.Proficient in various software such as Google suite (docs, sheets, slides), Office suite (Word, Excel, PPT), etc.Full Description:vcita is looking for a service-oriented, multi-tasking, self-driven Facilities & Office Manager to join vcita’s fabulous Operations Team.The position would provide a wide range of support for the vcita office and team.The ideal candidate is hands-on, resourceful, adapts well to a fast-paced environment, organized and responsible with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.This is a unique opportunity to contribute to a fast-growing start-up.About the company:vcita is a growing start up of about 200+ vcitizens that bring their best foot forward to their work every day. Our mission is to support small businesses in their journey towards digital transformation, and offer them the tools they need to manage their business online. We trust our people to get the job done, and love that our product makes a BIG impact on small businesses.Scope of work:Sunday – Thursday, Full-time positionWork is on-siteResponsibilities:A people person with a positive and service-oriented attitudeBe responsible for all front desk activities, assisting employees with office & administrative requests.Manage and oversee vendors and office inventory, kitchen supplies, office equipment, IT equipment, cleaning services, etc.Complete responsibility for administrative tasks, such as assisting with scheduling, expense reporting, managing meeting rooms, etc.Ensure the office work environment is well-kept and organized to a high standard.Responsible for new hires' onboarding set-up (including office space, IT equipment, supplies, etc.).Support and assist the Operations Team with different projects as needed.

Text: Arbe is leading a RADAR REVOLUTION, driving a zero-road-fatality reality by enabling truly safe driver-assist systems, and paving the way for a fully autonomous-driving future. The next level of road safety is dependent upon a vehicle’s ability to ‘sense’ the world around it. Arbe’s unparalleled 4D high-resolution imaging radar is disrupting the automotive industry by redefining what’s possible. Title: Office Manager & Travel Coordinator
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Minimum Qualifications To Apply This Role 3+ Previous experience as an office admin / administrative experience in a startup/ High tech environment.  1+ year experience as a travel coordinator, preferably from a high-tech company.  Fluency Hebrew and English (both written and spoken)  Experience with MS Office, Excel ,travel system.  Excellent time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work.  Strong interpersonal skills, service-oriented, positive, proactive, quick thinker, and solution-focused attitude with a love for team work! About The Role As a Travel Coordinator you will oversee travel arrangements of individuals and groups, including flights, accommodation and ground transportation, enforce Travel Policy implementation, optimize hotel bookings and contracts to ensure Melio receives the best rates.  As our Office Manager, you’ll be joining the Office management team. You'll focus on providing our employees and guests with top-notch office space and everything in it. How your day is going to look like?  Act as the first point of contact for all employees when it comes to in-office requests , operations and travel.  Take active part in executing company welfare activities together with the HR team.  You will be the point of contact between the travel agency and Melio employees. About MelioMelio builds business-to-business (B2B) payment tools so small business owners can spend less time in the back office and more time on their craft. As the fastest-growing B2B payment platform in the US, Melio is working hard to find new and better ways to help small businesses succeed in the ways that work best for them.With offices in New York, Denver, and Tel Aviv, and a vibrant work culture, Melio is expanding every single day. We are a diverse group of people who love what we do and do what we love. If you are a driven and passionate team player, you will fit right in. We are an equal-opportunity employer and are always on the lookout for top-notch talent—please reach out if you would like to join us on this exciting journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: The RoleIn this role, you will be responsible for researching data and ensuring we deliver the highest quality data to our customers.We are looking for a highly motivated data enthusiast who enjoys working with multidisciplinary teams in a rapidly changing environment and growing company.ResponsibilitiesYou will be in charge of weekly data delivery to enterprise clients, working with our data QA team to ensure the quality of delivery.Conduct analysis on our database for custom enterprise client requestsResearching and validating new data sources to continuously grow Tarci’s data repository.Work closely with the R&D team to implement our big data tools to collect, normalize and classify the data.Qualifications1-2 years of experience working with SQLExcellent EnglishProficient in Excel / Google SheetsExperience working with AWS Athena, Regex or XML is a plus!Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyStrong management skills who enjoys working with multidisciplinary teams in a rapidly changing environmentAbout TarciTarci is a VC backed Continuous Intelligence platform on a mission to improve the ROI in every touchpoint between an Enterprise and its business customers through advanced insights from external data.Through a mix of AI driven big data processes and applications on top of the data that help action the data, we are able to help enterprises targeting SMBs dramatically improve their revenue.In 2 years, Tarci's service has already been adopted by enterprises including Fortune500, fintech unicorns and financial services and insurance companies.A few more things to knowThis is a great opportunity for the right individual to be a part of a high-caliber team in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment. We love coaching and training and look for people who will be long-term partners on the amazing Tarci journey.

Title: Autonomous Vehicles Test Driver
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Arbe is leading a RADAR REVOLUTION, driving a zero-road-fatality reality by enabling truly safe driver-assist systems, and paving the way for a fully autonomous-driving future. The next level of road safety is dependent upon a vehicle’s ability to ‘sense’ the world around it. Arbe’s unparalleled 4D high-resolution imaging radar is disrupting the automotive industry by redefining what’s possible. Join our team of technologists, radar specialists, and scientists to make zero road fatalities a reality, for everyone.We’re looking for a talented Autonomous Vehicles Test Driver to join our System Testing team.Requirements:At least 3 years of driving experience with clean driving recordsTechnical capabilitiesGood interpersonal and communication skills, ability to interface directly with a diverse range of stakeholders including customersHighly responsible, organized and detail-orientedAbility to work independentlyFast learnerStrong verbal communication skills in EnglishWorking days – Sunday to ThursdayResponsibilities:Safely operate test vehicles in a wide range of testing conditionsCollecting data by driving Arbe's vehicle and uploading the data into the company's databaseMaintain focus on test goals during execution and collaborate with Test engineers and Algo teams to ensure safe, efficient, and accurate testingWrite accurate, detailed, and organized test reportsCoordinate and arrange travel logistical aspects, involving location, resources, and tools to ensure a successful testOwnership of test equipment maintenance and trackingAbility to drive safely in daylight, darkness, and different weather and road conditions

Title: Mechanical Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Syqe Medical is a pioneering tech startup that’s disrupting the pharmaceutical industry with the world’s first inhaler capable of delivering a precise dose of medical cannabis.We are looking for Mechanical Engineer to join its mechanical engineering team to be a key player in all product stages from research and development to design and manufacture, through to installation and final commissioning.As part of Syqe’s R&D team, you will be responsible for designing and developing complex multidisciplinary medical devices. Research, design, develop, build, and test mechanical systems, including complex mechanisms, tools, engines, and machines.Responsibilities: Perform a full lifecycle product development from concept to engineering release, including 3D modeling, design, prototype manufacturing and production transfer. Design systems and mechanisms that meet internal, customer, and patients’ needs and requirements Conduct experiments methodically, analyze data, and interpret results Identify, formulate, and produce effective solutions to emerging problems Prepare product reports and documentation and development documentation as per regulatory requirements. Supporting the Engineering and V&V teams as part of the R&D mechanical team.Requirements:Requirements Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering. Mechanical designer with 5-8 years of relevant experience in multidisciplinary product design and development with a solid understanding of the product lifecycle. Experience in designing acoustical appliances – advantage. Experience in design for Plastics Injection, 3D Printing, and Electronics. Proficient in 3D CAD software (SolidWorks preferred). Experiences in the following fields: Motor systems, mechanisms, and electro-mechanics. Ability to work independently and in a team, push to initiate ideas, and carry out investigations and improvements independently. Hands-on capabilities and self-motivated. Working experience with product lifecycle management (PLM)- EPDM, preferred. Experience in medical device development- advantage. Work Experience in plastics- advantage.
Requirements: ['Perform a full lifecycle product development from concept to engineering release, including 3D modeling, design, prototype manufacturing and production transfer.', 'Design systems and mechanisms that meet internal, customer, and patients’ needs and requirements', 'Conduct experiments methodically, analyze data, and interpret results', 'Identify, formulate, and produce effective solutions to emerging problems', 'Prepare product reports and documentation and development documentation as per regulatory requirements.', 'Supporting the Engineering and V&V teams as part of the R&D mechanical team.', '', 'Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering.', '', 'Mechanical designer with 5-8 years of relevant experience in multidisciplinary product design and development with a solid understanding of the product lifecycle.', '', 'Experience in designing acoustical appliances – advantage.', '', 'Experience in design for Plastics Injection, 3D Printing, and Electronics.', '', 'Proficient in 3D CAD software (SolidWorks preferred).', '', 'Experiences in the following fields: Motor systems, mechanisms, and electro-mechanics.', '', 'Ability to work independently and in a team, push to initiate ideas, and carry out investigations and improvements independently.', '', 'Hands-on capabilities and self-motivated.', '', 'Working experience with product lifecycle management (PLM)- EPDM, preferred.', '', 'Experience in medical device development- advantage.', '', 'Work Experience in plastics- advantage.']

Title: Creative Lead
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Mixtiles is on a mission to create homes people love. We are one of the biggest B2C startups in Israel; manufacturing and delivering over a million framed photos every month to happy customers in the US and Europe. If you ask the average American about us, they would probably know us. You should too.We started with the world's best way to put photos on walls, using simple yet powerful software and frames that stick to walls. Now millions of people have homes full of beautiful memories and we've become one of the largest photo companies in the world.We are constantly expanding our product catalog, offering both art and houseplants as the newest members, both of which are growing at a rapid pace!Today, Mixtiles is one of the biggest advertisers in the country on Facebook, TikTok, and Instagram. This deserves a lot of focus from the best people out there, and for that, we need someone really great to join us and to help us rock the world, do amazing work, and have lots of fun in the process.Who are we looking for?We're looking for a great Creative Lead who can tell a story and have the ability to capture people's attention with creative, rich videos for social media. As Creative lead, you will work closely with our media team to communicate our vision, brand, and product to the world. We're looking for someone who can come up with ideas and produce them all the way through.What type of person are we looking for?Hands-on experience producing successful ads for social media - from idea to executionA Great story-tellerExperienced in creating UGC-like content High standards in copywriting, clarity, and aestheticsAbility to deeply understand customer context and translate to messaging and creativesAn independent mindset Great communication skills Strong operator, able to work at high volume and intensityWhat kind of person are you?You're driven, transparent, and always strive for excellence. You love working closely in a team and are great at communicating. You're an owner - whenever you do something, you do it 100%.In addition to being highly creative, you need to have good attention to detail, project management skills, and people skills.
Requirements: ['Hands-on experience producing successful ads for social media - from idea to execution', 'A Great story-teller', 'Experienced in creating UGC-like content', 'High standards in copywriting, clarity, and aesthetics', 'Ability to deeply understand customer context and translate to messaging and creatives', 'An independent mindset', 'Great communication skills', 'Strong operator, able to work at high volume and intensity']

Title: COO
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Who we are:Autobrains is the leading Israeli AI company developing automated driving products and capabilities. The technology is based on a fundamental paradigm shift from a traditional deep-learning approach to a biologically plausible self-learning AI.The technology is protected by over 250 patents and adopted by multiple leading automotive players. Autobrains technology solves several key gaps on the way to full, safe and scalable autonomous driving.Autobrains is backed by top investors and key players in the automotive industry such as Temasek, Toyota, BMW, Continental, Vinfast, and Knorr-Bremse, with headquarters at the heart of Tel Aviv.RESPONSIBILITIES:Management of several ADAS product lines, including R&D, delivery, and technical partnerships with Tier1 companies. Title: Assistant Controller
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Wiliot brings connectivity and intelligence to everyday products and packaging that previously were disconnected from the Internet of Things. The Wiliot Platform combines cloud services and IoT Pixels, computing elements that can power themselves by harvesting radiofrequency energy. This revolutionary mixture of cloud and semiconductor technology is being used by some of the world’s largest brands, food, and pharmaceutical companies to change how we make, distribute, sell, use and recycle products. Our investors include Amazon, Verizon, NTT DoCoMo, Qualcomm, PepsiCo, and Softbank Vision Fund 2.
