Title: Head Of Marketing
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About The CompanyAgritask, a well-financed startup whose agronomic Intelligence & Analytics platform helps the world’s largest Food & Beverage Enterprises create a more sustainable and predictable world. Agritask is an agronomic intelligence & analytics platform that has the mission to provide Global Food & Beverage Enterprises, with greater control over supply by:Guiding, monitoring, and enforcing sustainable and agronomic practices at scaleForecasting yields and detecting supply risks early, leveraging historical & in-season dataWe are unique in our ability to aggregate & structure agronomic data from multiple sources. Data analytics on the platform provides actionable insights and alerts at portfolio and plot levels, enhancing agronomic reach with an adaptable, engaging workflow.The Impact of climate change on global food systems, and specifically on the Food & Beverage industry, is becoming ever more apparent. Yield reduction and volatility patterns in food crops compromise and break supply chains. This, combined with growing concern for farm communities and the environment by both manufacturers and consumers, is pushing the industry to adopt solutions that will help the transformation toward predictable and sustainable supply chains and production practices.We are looking for a creative Head of Marketing to lead the company's B2B marketing, establish the brand, create awareness, and demand generation, through physical and digital engagement, connecting the dots in the marketing, technology, sales, and product offering.You WillBrand- Define and manage the brand communication strategy across different channelsLead Generation- drive the growth with demand generation and lead the strategies and the team to create awarenessContent- Lead the team with a powerful and effective content strategyBusiness- Cooperate with sales to manage sales development inbound and outbounds teams while increasing their reachManage a team- mentor and develop a team with high-performing, matrix-based oriented that can scale up the company's growth, translate business objectives into strategy and KPI'SRequirements10+ years of marketing experience, preferably with SaaS B2B startups5+ years of experience leading marketing teams at a startup utilizing ABM techniquesExperience partnering with Sales leadership to achieve business objectives.A strong focus on analytics, a data-oriented mind that understands the value of measuring, reporting, and knowing your numbersTrack record of managing marketing budgets, funnel performance, and forecasts, to achieve new sales and revenue growth goalsAn out-of-the-box thinker with excellent interpersonal skillsA bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communication, or other related fieldsNative English or equivalentNice to haveMBA Degree

Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Chaos Lab's mission is to secure the future of finance. We’re looking for an HR & Ops Manager to help us build our team and lead People Operations across Tel Aviv and NYC.At Chaos Labs, we’re developing a cloud security platform for DeFi (Decentralized Finance) protocols through run-time simulations. We work with protocols to automate economic security, risk management, parameter selection optimization, and battle test protocols through the most chaotic (🤗) market conditions. Our platform and tools are used by leading protocols, helping them manage and secure over 50 Billion in assets.Chaos Labs was founded by ex-Facebook, Apple, Instagram, Amazon, and Microsoft engineers, being 8200 (Israeli Cyber Intelligence) and Technion alumni. We’re looking for curious, hungry engineers to join the team and help define the security and risk stack of the future.Responsibilities:This is a generalized HR role that will be tailored to the candidate selected to fill it. As the first HR hire, we are expecting the day-to-day to revolve around both People Operations and RecruitingResponsibilities - People operations:Create and manage employee onboarding and offboarding procedures and processes to ensure new team members get up to speed rapidlyAssist with HR analytics, conduct and analyze onboarding surveys, and HR processes to make actionable recommendations to improve processes based on dataDesign and develop training materials and internal wikis for employees, managers, and new hiresPartner with leadership and people managers to ensure that the appropriate systems and processes are in place for employee happiness (some examples Semi-annual review and feedback processes, 1:1 templates and products, Compensation guidelines)Ensure legal compliance in all relevant areasResearch and select new tooling for streamlined employee engagement with HR functionsParticipate in (if not lead) workforce and org chart planning sessions to help guide team expansionInfluence and coach managers on organizational design, job titles and leveling, team member engagement, recognition, retention strategies, performance management, and development plansTake leadership role regarding employee wellness, benefits, and other tools to ensure employee retentionResponsibilities - Recruiting:Work closely with management to define a holistic hiring thesis for the company that includes cultural values and hiring manager expectations to ensure: (1) Every candidate has an amazing interview experience with Chaos Labs (2) We maintain a rigorous talent bar for new hires to continue pushing the company forwardPartner with hiring managers to advise on the end-to-end recruiting process, including: Standardizing JD template and providing feedback to managers on new drafts; Help design interview structure and take home assignments for standardization and efficiency; Coordinate a candidate’s interview process to ensure a seamless candidate experience; Advising on appropriate compensation levels for potential candidates based on internal and market guidelines; Drafting of offer materialsHelp maintain and optimize the internal Applicant Tracking System (Lever) and onboard managers into the tool to recruit for new rolesDevelop new sourcing channels & strategies to ensure we introduce Chaos Labs to the top talent in IsraelRequirements5+ years of experience in HR-related roles with prior proof points of project & process ownershipHistory of 0-1 process and program creation where you find problems and solve them with minimal oversightPreviously managed other people through tough, interpersonal situationsDeep care for your fellow employees with a desire to set them up for success at all levels of the companyAn understanding of world-class end-to-end recruiting processes and how they can be built from the ground upDemonstrated experience (& excitement for) working in self-managed, fast-paced environmentsExcellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to explain complex topics in a clear way to both crypto-native and novice audiencesLet's connect! Send your resume today to careers@chaoslabs.xyz

Title: Procurement Specialist
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: MAЁLYS is one of the fastest-growing D2C beauty brands in the world. And now that we’ve gotten the formalities out of the way, let’s be frank. We are crushing it. How? We are breaking the mold of the body care industry with innovative targeted body care solutions for specific skin concerns, an intricate and unique combination of data and marketing, and a seriously sassy and bold brand voice.What’s our vibe? We are a team of people who want to make lasting, impactful changes, who live (and love) to see results, who innovate with passion, and who have a badass sense of humor. Is our vibe your vibe? Then keep reading…We are looking for a Procurement and Supply Chain Associate with a passion to learn and become an essential part of the company’s Supply Chain and Operations team.In this role, you will help execute the company’s operations plan by creating and sending purchase orders to domestic and international suppliers, initiating and implementing cost reduction strategies, and managing inventory through several systems. The ideal candidate is highly motivated and passionate about operations and logistics, thoughtful, organized, efficient, and a flexible team player with attention to detail.Your life at MAËLYS will look like…Procurement:Create and manage purchase orders (POs) in the ERP systemCommunicate new POs to suppliersReceive and inspect shipping documents and update suppliers and manufacturers on delivery schedulesMaintain the up-to-date data regarding delivery dates in the company’s systemsHandle suppliers' deposits payments, balance payments and Invoice approvalsMaintenance of suppliers' pricelists in ERPSupport costing procedures in ERP, discrepancies investigation, and analysisSupport cost reduction initiativesNegotiate with suppliers to reduce costs and improve delivery timesInventory management:Receive inbound reports from manufacturers/3PLsCreate inventory-related transactions in ERP - inventory inbound, inventory assembly, inventory transfersInventory discrepancies investigationEnsure inventory accuracy through the organizationMonthly inventory alignment between the company's ERP and 3rd party warehousesInitiate and manage periodic inventory counts at 3PLs and manufacturing warehouses You will thrive in this role if you have…1-3 years of experience in purchasing or inventory managementA relevant B.A/B.Sc. degreeExperience with ERP systems (Priority is an advantage)Experience with ExcelStrong attention to detail and organizational skillsTeam player with a "no task is too small" attitudeEnjoys working in a fast-paced and ever-changing environmentStrong communication skillsFluent English

Title: Controller
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: 365Scores is a global sports technology hub providing real-time results, in-depth stats, original content, customized news feeds, and more. Our mission statement is to make fans' experience better, more accurate, and more fun. We are located in Tel-Aviv with offices in Hong Kong, London and São Paulo, almost 100 employees world wide and growing.We are looking for a finance controller to join us.You’ll enjoy a friendly, innovative, and creative atmosphere in a fast-growing and dynamic startup company.As a Controller you will oversee a company's financial records, manage the day to day operational activity, work with bookkeeping teams, optimizing financial processes and controls, support statutory audit for several entities and other ad hoc projects required in the finance team.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting from a university or a leading college - a mustLicensed CPA - a must2 years experience from one of the BiG 5 firmsExcellent Excel skillsDetail-oriented with superior analytical and problem-solving skillsStartup mentality, roll up your sleeves attitudeSelf-motivated and proactiveStrong communication skills and service orientationA team player with good interpersonal relationsWork level proficiency in English and Hebrew (both verbal and written)Responsibilities:Support many aspects of accounting management (review of journal entries, invoices, payments, monthly closure, billing, etc.).Oversee the daily financial operations of the companypreparations of consolidated financial statementsOngoing financial planning and management of the company’s budgeting processesEnsure the timely and accurate preparation and filing of the company’s financial reportsWork closely with outside bookkeepers (Israeli and foreign) and payroll controllers on day-to-day financial operations, including payroll, AP, and AR processes.Provide comprehensive financial updates to management by evaluating, analyzing, and raising flags as needed.Work with the company's external auditors on quarterly reviews/ annual auditssupport Ad-hoc financial projects

Title: Head of Content
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Are you a passionate, strategy-focused content creator who’s looking for a challenge that will let you build something meaningful for a product that makes a huge impact on people’s lives and careers?If so, read on!GrowthSpace has created an innovative platform in the employee development space that's personalized, data-driven, and connected to business KPIs — with a variety of one-on-one and group development options tailored to each individual using data. GrowthSpace supports Fortune 500 customers like Intel, Applied Materials, MSD, Johnson & Johnson, and tech unicorns like GainSight, Check Point, and Taboola in over 35 countries & languages.As GrowthSpace’s Head of Content, you’ll be the strategic creator and gatekeeper of all of GrowthSpace’s communications, including blog posts, webinars, emails, ebooks, videos, and everything in-between. You’ll build a content strategy that will help position GrowthSpace as the leading solution for employee growth while generating high-quality content on a regular basis.Content will be created by you and a team of content contractors, who will craft short and long-form content that clearly communicates GrowthSpace’s value.Responsibilities:Plan and execute content strategy and calendarConceptualize and create content in all forms - ebooks, webinars, infographics, sales collateral, video, social etc. Increase web traffic across platforms by managing content distribution to online channels and social media.Edit, proofread and rewrite content written by other company stakeholdersCraft thought leadership bylines that will help position GrowthSpace as a subject matter expert. Look for opportunities to externally share GrowthSpace’s story in a compelling way through content partnerships, event speaking slots, and awards.Manage external content writers, video creators and more; eventually build out an internal team (early 2024). Be a true team member and strategic thinker; collaborate with VP Marketing on brand awareness, thought leadership and category creation. Requirements:True native English speaker. This is an absolute must. Please do not apply if your English level is below true native. Leader, thinker, problem solver and collaboratorAt least 8 years of experience as a content writer/manager in a B2B Saas setting. Outstanding oral and written communication skills.Basic knowledge of SEO best practices, and CMS management; experience with WordPress Elementor a major plus. The ability to manage big projects end-to-end, and work with other teams in the company. Self-starter, able to find opportunities and take initiative. Why GrowthSpace:Work for the world’s first platform for personalized, human-led development – at scaleA one-of-a-kind, Digital HR Tech Solution that is disrupted People Development marketYou can “Own your domain”We encourage people to “Do whatever it takes”A vision and growth trajectory that is challenging and excitingYou will work with a great entrepreneurial team – that possesses a “get it done culture” – with people who always care

Title: IT Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: TriEye is the pioneer of the world’s first SWIR sensing technology. Based on nanophotonics research, TriEye’s technology is disrupting the world of vision sensors for the automotive market along with other exciting applications.We are looking for some exceptional talent to join our team as an IT Manager. In this role you will be fully accountable for the definition and implementation of both short and long-term growth of IT systems to support the fast-paced advancement of the company. Building and streamlining new and existing IT infrastructure and integration of IT Systems.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.3+ years of experience working in IT Operations.Experience in Microsoft or Google cloud services for business.Experience in Microsoft Active Directory.Experience in Virtual Machines management.Professional experience in working with Linux/Unix.Professional experience in Networks.Knowledge of scripting languages (*sh/perl/python) or programming languages - an advantage.End-to-end IT project leadership skills.Great interpersonal skills.Your Day to Day:Responsible for all IT systems and infrastructure at the company.Continuous security improvements of applications and information systems.Develop, plan, and implement IT systems, policies, and procedures.Define IT infrastructure strategy, architecture, and processes.Manage security of data, networks, and servers.Manage day-to-day technical support and troubleshooting for hardware and software issues. Manage all user accounts, licenses, and subscriptions. Manage IT equipment, stock, and purchasing.Support fast-paced growth of the company, planning ahead and maintaining best practices for a scaling company.Why should you be a TriEyoneer?:Timing is everything! You want to be a part of a fast-growing deep-tech company backed by industry leaders, as it enters a significant stage of global growth.Inspiring skill development by providing growth opportunitiesInterest in supporting TriEye’s mission to improve and save lives by making Short-Wave Infrared (SWIR) technology accessible to everyone. Harnessing the power of SWIR sensing to provide superior vision, enables access to mission-critical image data even in the most challenging visibility conditions. This is a unique opportunity to take an active part in building a world’s first technology.Benefits:GymParkingGenerous holidays and BD gifts10bisGenerous vacation allowanceHappy hours and team eventsGeneral statement:TriEye is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Junior Operations Associate
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About CandexCandex is a rapidly growing fintech player in the B2B payments market, which is one of the hottest markets in technology. Our solution is used by the Global 2000 to pay vendors in 30+ countries, fast & compliantly - clients include brands like 3M, Starbucks, Dell, Pfizer, Danone, L'Oréal, HSBC, Roche, Colgate, and many others. We have a world-class management team and $37m in funding from investors like Amex, JP Morgan, Altos, NFX, and Partech. As a member of our company, you will have a golden opportunity to reshape and impact how the biggest companies in the world manage a meaningful part of their business.The company is growing rapidly, and we seek a Junior Operations Associate. This position will report to the VP of Operations. This is an opportunity to join the Candex Finance team and make a significant impact at a rapidly growing multinational fintech company.The RoleThis is a key role in delivering supreme support and service to our customers. You will be a valuable resource throughout the payment process and a crucial point of contact for our customers. If you have excellent interpersonal and communication expertise, strong writing and analytical skills and a desire to leverage your knowledge of fintech and payments; this opportunity is a perfect fit.Responsibilities:Handle day to day customer email/phone support related to the entire payment process. Provide guidance to new customers to ensure they are on-boarded successfully. Administer pending payments and registrations. Work with customers to correct payment details provided or to obtain any missing information. Send out client invoices ensuring they are accurate and compliant. Review customer invoices received ensuring their accuracy and timeliness. Reconcile bank payments received against invoices. Prepare bank transfers and ensure that customer bank details are verified. Verify customer data by performing compliance checks. Requirements:Undergraduate Bachelor's degree in economics/finance/accounting is preferred. Fluent English language skills – written and verbal – a must. Fintech/Hi-tech experience is preferred. Able to accommodate global working hours - Mon-Thurs 11am-7pm, Fri 10am-5pm. Impressive interpersonal and communication skills. Strong computer skills with advanced Excel skills. Outstanding attention to detail, with an ability to spot numerical errors. Highly organized with the ability to multitask and work under pressure. Tech savvy and the ability to pick up new technology quickly.
Requirements: ['Handle day to day customer email/phone support related to the entire payment process.', 'Provide guidance to new customers to ensure they are on-boarded successfully.', 'Administer pending payments and registrations.', 'Work with customers to correct payment details provided or to obtain any missing information.', 'Send out client invoices ensuring they are accurate and compliant.', 'Review customer invoices received ensuring their accuracy and timeliness.', 'Reconcile bank payments received against invoices.', 'Prepare bank transfers and ensure that customer bank details are verified.', 'Verify customer data by performing compliance checks.', "Undergraduate Bachelor's degree in economics/finance/accounting is preferred.", 'Fluent English language skills – written and verbal – a must.', 'Fintech/Hi-tech experience is preferred.', 'Able to accommodate global working hours - Mon-Thurs 11am-7pm, Fri 10am-5pm.', 'Impressive interpersonal and communication skills.', 'Strong computer skills with advanced Excel skills.', 'Outstanding attention to detail, with an ability to spot numerical errors.', 'Highly organized with the ability to multitask and work under pressure.', 'Tech savvy and the ability to pick up new technology quickly.']

Title: Mechanical Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Syqe Medical is a pioneering tech startup that’s disrupting the pharmaceutical industry with the world’s first inhaler capable of delivering a precise dose of medical cannabis.We are looking for Mechanical Engineer to join its mechanical engineering team to be a key player in all product stages from research and development to design and manufacture, through to installation and final commissioning.As part of Syqe’s R&D team, you will be responsible for designing and developing complex multidisciplinary medical devices. Research, design, develop, build, and test mechanical systems, including complex mechanisms, tools, engines, and machines.Responsibilities: Perform a full lifecycle product development from concept to engineering release, including 3D modeling, design, prototype manufacturing and production transfer. Design systems and mechanisms that meet internal, customer, and patients’ needs and requirements Conduct experiments methodically, analyze data, and interpret results Identify, formulate, and produce effective solutions to emerging problems Prepare product reports and documentation and development documentation as per regulatory requirements. Supporting the Engineering and V&V teams as part of the R&D mechanical team.Requirements:Requirements Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering. Mechanical designer with 5-8 years of relevant experience in multidisciplinary product design and development with a solid understanding of the product lifecycle. Experience in designing acoustical appliances – advantage. Experience in design for Plastics Injection, 3D Printing, and Electronics. Proficient in 3D CAD software (SolidWorks preferred). Experiences in the following fields: Motor systems, mechanisms, and electro-mechanics. Ability to work independently and in a team, push to initiate ideas, and carry out investigations and improvements independently. Hands-on capabilities and self-motivated. Working experience with product lifecycle management (PLM)- EPDM, preferred. Experience in medical device development- advantage. Work Experience in plastics- advantage.

Title: Brand Manager P&G Israel
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Are you looking for meaningful work? Come to P&G where Brand Management was born! Did you know P&G invented the concept of branding and data-driven brand management? Over the years, we have remained consistently among the top in marketing by finding new and exciting ways to reach consumers.As a Brand Manager, you will be responsible for making sure we win with consumers' preferences in each of the following areas: When they learn about our product, When they choose to buy the product, When they use the product at home.We are looking for the world's best marketing pros who follow one simple concept: "Consumer is boss".Working in brand management at Procter & Gamble means being more than just a marketer, it means being a total business owner. We need someone who is dedicated and who can guide the vision and strategy behind a brand by developing marketing plans and driving innovation. Our Assistant Brand Managers need to work regularly across functions to identify consumer, shopper, and customer insights and execute marketing tactics that will continue to grow your brand profitably.Together, we'll continue to create leading brand experiences and make a difference for nearly 5 billion consumers every single day. Pretty cool, right?What we offer you:Responsibilities from Day 1 – You will start of working on key brands from the beginning. Over time, as you expand your impact on the business, your responsibility and ownership of a brand will quickly grow.Recognized state of the art marketing skills – We will constantly help you improve your marketing knowledge and management abilities.Continuous coaching & mentorship– We are passionate about our work. We will make sure you receive both formal training and regular mentorship from your manager and others.Dynamic and respectful work environment – We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. We value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance.As a Brand Manager, you will have opportunity to work on brands, driving the business results. You will engage with multi-disciplinary teams (including Sales, Finance, Product Supply, Advertising, and Media Agencies) to develop top strategies for your brand's success.You will lead a mix of Marketing and Brand Management projects enabling you to show the breadth and depth of your leadership. You will need to derive insights from the data, which will enable brand leaders as they set the direction for brand growth. As your skills increase, you can expect to advance in roles with increased responsibilities. Overall, we want people who aren't afraid to take smart risks and innovate.QualificationsWe want someone with:Strong academic backgroundExcellent visionary, strategic and courageous leadership skillsStrengths with strategic and analytical thinkingAn ability to drive innovation and brand growthStrong ability to communicate and team capabilitiesUp to 5 years’ experienceFluency in English

Over time, as you expand your impact on the business, your responsibility and ownership of a brand will quickly grow.', 'Recognized state of the art marketing skills – We will constantly help you improve your marketing knowledge and management abilities.', 'Continuous coaching & mentorship– We are passionate about our work. We will make sure you receive both formal training and regular mentorship from your manager and others.', 'Dynamic and respectful work environment – We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. Title: Fraud and Payment Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Tango is a successful, market leader, a live-streaming Platform with 450+ Million registered users, in an industry projected to reach $240 BILLION in the next couple of years.The B2C platform, based on the best-quality global video technology, allows millions of talented people around the world to create their own live content, engage with their fans and monetize their talents.Tango live stream was founded in 2018 and is powered by 300+ global employees operating in a culture of growth, learning, and success!The Tango team is a vigorous cocktail of hard workers, creative brains, energizers, geeks, overachievers, athletes, and more. We push the limits to bring our app from “one of the top” to “the leader”.The best way to describe Tango's work style is not to use the word “impossible”. And we believe that success is a thorny path that runs on sleepless nights, corporate parties, tough releases, and of course our users' smiles (and as we are a LIVE app, we truly get to see our users all around the world smiling right in front of us in real-time!).Do you want to join the party?Requirements:Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinkingStrong SQL knowledgeExperience with data visualization tools (Looker - advantage)Experience in online b2c companiesExperience in payments/ fraudAbility to perform under pressure in a fast-paced changing environment. Flexible thinking and ability to adjust and find solutionsAbility to manage and prioritize people and tasksStrong stakeholder management skillsExperience in building machine learning models - advantageResponsibilities:Analyze streamers, gifters and payments data to find fraud patterns and anomalies.Analyze payments data with the various acquirers and route transactions accordingly to maximize acceptance rates at the minimum cost.Suggest and implement new measures to counter fraud: tools, rules, procedures, fraud rings detection, analysis etc.Serve as a focal point for all fraud and payments reporting and analysis matters.Work closely with the FinOps team, Payments and fraud monitoring team.Analyze user journey around payments and fraud to ensure minimum friction to the customer and minimum drop-off.Work in collaboration with other departments: products and engineering units to solve fraud, payments service concerns to the best outcome of Tango.

Title: General Pipeline

Text: Who We Are?We are a growing startup company revolutionizing the Storage Processor world, with an ingenious solution. Founded in 2017 by industry leaders. We’re the cream of the crop, with a positive disposition, an optimistic vibe, and a can-do attitude.We’re stronger together, at home and at work. Title: HR Business Partner (HRBP)
Location: Kfar Sava, Center District, Israel
Text: Are you passionate about people, processes and projects? Do you know how to motivate and engage stakeholders, while connecting the dots across a large organisation? Do you aspire to work for a company, which brings life-changing treatments to its patients? If so, then this role might be just what you’re looking for!The PositionAs our HR Business Partner you will ensure business success by linking people strategy & performance and driving HR programs and processes. Our core purpose is to enable Novo Nordisk to attract, retain and reward the right people in the right place through sustainable, competitive, flexible and compliant reward practices.Your key responsibilities as HRBP will be to advice, support and collaborate with stakeholders on HR related matters and to execute HR projects / programs / processes effectively & efficiently to continuously improve the employee life cycle. You will ensure the implementation of Novo Nordisk vision, values, culture, strategies and business objectives according to the Novo Nordisk Way, local laws and regulations.Besides your role as HRBP, you will also be responsible for driving the Total Rewards (Compensation & Benefits) area in Novo Nordisk Israel through collaboration with Global Total Rewards CoE (Center of Excellence).You Will Also Be Responsible ForImplementation of total rewards guidelines/ processes/ policies in collaboration with regional TR Partner including: annual compensation review; bonus payments, sales incentives, LTI; Salary & benefit surveys; salary structure and job architecture (e.g. job levels, salary ranges, equal & gender pay).Manage and execute employee benefit programs in NNIL- Car Policy, Health insurance, allowances etc.Support the annual Organisational Development Plan and the Headcount Budget.Support the performance management process (Hi / Low performers, outstanding employees).Support incoming and outgoing Expatriate / Short term Assignments (Visa, housing etc) in line with global mobility policy.Use relevant HR IT systems while ensuring data privacy guidelines.ExperienceMin 8 years of relevant HRBP experience including 4 years of experience in Total Rewards (Compensation & Benefits)- must. Previous experience in multinational / global organisations- must.Pharmaceutical / Healthcare industry experience- a plus.Education BackgroundAcademic Degree (BA / BSc) in relevant area, possibly Human Resources, Social Science, Business Administration, Labor Studies, Industrial Engineering.Master MA / MBA in relevant area, possibly Organizational Psychology, Organizational Consultation, Business Administration - a plus HR Professional Certification and Coaching Certification- a plusQualifications And SkillsBuild strong working relationships with Business Units / department leaders and employees. Excellent in consulting, coaching, facilitation and training.Planning and project management skills- Strong executor who drive things forward. Ability to lead projects & programs and to work in deadlines and deliver timely.Ability to work in high pace working environment and fast-changing businesses requirements.Outstanding written & verbal communication and presentation skills Team Player- actively supports and develops team members.Diagnostic, analytical and problem-solving skills.Technical SkillsFluent in Hebrew and in English (verbal and written)- must!Strong Analytical skillsProficient in Excel (advanced knowledge)Building presentations (PPT, Canva)Experience and strong orientation in implementing new HR IT systems Ability to travel abroad (~10%)About The DepartmentYou will be part of the People & Organisation department which consists of: People & Organisation Specialist, Training & Development Specialist, Sustainability and Wellbeing Lead and you will report to People & Organisation Director.Working at Novo Nordisk At Novo Nordisk, we are driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic conditions. Novo Nordisk is a global healthcare company with nearly 100 years of innovation and leadership in diabetes care and other serious chronic conditions: Haemophilia, Growth disorders and Obesity.Headquartered in Denmark, Novo Nordisk employs approximately 48,000 people in 80 countries. Novo Nordisk Israel office is located in Kfar-Saba and we are the leading company in Diabetes care in Israel.Contact AboutIf you have questions about these opportunities, please feel free to contactTo submit your application, please upload your CV online (click on Apply and follow the instructions). Internal candidates are kindly requested to inform their line Manager before applying.Keren Berko, People & Organisation Director – knbk@novonordisk.com.Deadline Apply before November 30We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Text: Who are we?Papaya Global is an established B2B tech unicorn in hypergrowth. Our automated platform helps companies hire, onboard, manage, and pay people in more than 160 countries.We don’t just cover the globe with our solution; we are global. Text: ל- Citadel דרוש/ה מנהל/ת פרוייקטי אבטחת מידע מנוסהבמסגרת התפקיד: הובלת פרויקטי אבטחת מידע מורכבים מול הלקוחות הכי גדולים במשק טיפול בפרויקטי אבטחת מידע מהשלב ההתחלתי עד לסיום הנעת תהליכים מול מחלקות שונות בארגון וכן מול הלקוח ניהול תקציב ולו"זRequirements: שנתיים נסיון בתחום הייעוץ - חובה היכרות עם מוצרי אבטחת מידע ופתרונות אבטחת מידע- חובה היכרות עם טכנולוגיות ענן, תשתיות מחשוב, תשתיות תקשורת וטכנולוגיות IT - חובה היכרות טובה עם נהלים, רגולציות ותקנים של מערכות מידע ואבטחת מידע - חובה ניסיון מוכח בניהול פרויקטים בתחום של אבטחת מידע- חובה ניסיון בניהול סיכונים ובקרות אבטחת מידע- יתרון היכרות עם רגולציות אבטחת מידע בתחום הפיננסי- יתרון ניהול סקרי אבטחת מידע, בדיקות חדירה (Penetration Tests), בדיקות תשתיות (סיסטם, תקשורת) יחסי אנוש מעולים, אחריות אישית, עבודת צוות אסרטיביות, עצמאות ויכולת לנהל, לרכז ולהוביל פרויקטים ייצוגיות ותודעת שירות גבוהה גמישות והבנה עסקית, ביצוע משימות באופן יסודי יכולת עבודה תחת לחץ וניהול מספר משימות במקביל

Title: Senior Material Planner

Title: Creative Director
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: This is usArtlist is a fast-growing creative technology company providing content creators with high-quality music, sound effects, footage and digital assets for video, as well as powerful video and image editing software. With our revolutionary license and cutting-edge creative tools, we’re on the fast track to becoming the ultimate 360 degree solution for video creators.Today, Artlist is the go-to licensing provider for creators in over 160 countries. Among our 17M clients are Google, Apple, Nike, Coca-Cola, Ikea, Mercedes, Samsung, Wix, Netflix, Dior and many more.Artlist consists of 3 products:Artlist.io, an all-in-one platform for video creatorsMotionArray.com, a horizontal marketplace for creators that offers video templates, presets, music, SFX, Design graphics, stock footage, motion graphics and stock photosFXhome, a cutting-edge video, VFX and image editing softwareWe’re looking for a full-time creative director to join our vibrant production team in TLV.Wake up for this:Work with different stakeholders within the marketing department to create high-performing, brand-oriented ads and campaigns for Artlist, in order to bring conversionsCollaborate with the User Acquisition team to A/B test creatives after delivery and improve performanceDeep dive into Artlist’s products to understand how to market them betterOngoing market research of our competitors in the spaceRequirements:Portfolio showcasing a range of video/creative projectsCommercial and video directing skillsDeep knowledge in at least one of the following: After Effects, Premiere Pro, C4D, Houdini, Blender 3DA wide and diverse range of references from which to draw inspirationExperience working in a high tech environment is a plus

Title: VP Marketing
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: At eko, we make great tech telling great stories. We're a SaaS startup company, and we're building a platform that creates and publishes interactive, choice-driven video experiences that users can publish on their brand websites, online retail stores, and any other consumer-facing medium. We've worked with Walmart, P&G, Unilever, Mattel, Coca-Cola, and LEGO, ranked a top-10 Israeli startup to work for by Dun & Bradstreet for 3 consecutive years, and we're looking to grow our team!Reporting to the General Manager, e-Commerce Platform, you won't just build and lead a Marketing team, you'll scale a new SaaS platform. Your mission will be leveraging all of what makes eko different into what makes us actually stand out. You'll touch all facets of the company, and you'll shape eko's positioning and our unique product. You'll champion team environments that encourage experimentation without sacrificing efficiency.What You'll Do...Build a marketing team focused on growth, who can design and execute our B2B demand generation strategy to attract our target market segments. Define, budget, and execute paid and organic customer acquisition strategies establishing a new platform offering in the market across channels. Define our brand identity and manage content calendar across web properties and owned channels. Oversee content creation for marketing, including emails, product pages, and other marketing materials (case studies, whitepapers, e-books, email campaigns, blog, social, newsletters.) Partner with Product and Research to define and use personas to create specific campaigns and effectively measure increase in leads. Build a lead capture program with sales and support sales enablement activities. Build strong relationships with Customer Success leadership to gain insights into use cases and what drives value. Determine and implement optimal CRM, social media, and MarTech stack strategies. OUR DREAM CANDIDATE HAS…Experience and a proven track record leading growth in a B2B SaaS company, scaling from $0 to $20m ARR and beyond. A rigorously creative spirit and entrepreneurial approach to leading a team. Experience building a digital brand and developing an avid base of consumers. Exceptional analytic, leadership, and communication skills. An ability to cultivate and motivate a team that over-delivers on multiple objectives within tight timeframes. We believe in hiring people, not just skills. If you don't meet 100% of the qualifications we mentioned, that's ok! We encourage you to apply if you think this role will make you excited to come to work every day.Who We AreAt eko, we believe in a creative approach to everything, no matter what role we're in. We believe in meaningful choice, both at work and in life, and know our workplace only gets better when people can bring their whole selves to the office. We're software developers and spray paint artists, poets and producers, fantasy sports fans and financial whizzes, chess-heads and UXperts, pop culture nerds and product managers, data wizards and yoga instructors. We have as many stories as we do people, and we can't wait to hear yours. Eko is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce and to representing everyone who wants to build a more creative future. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider all candidates for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military or veteran's status (including protected veterans), sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected class. We're based in NYC with offices in Tel Aviv.
Requirements: ['Build a marketing team focused on growth, who can design and execute our B2B demand generation strategy to attract our target market segments.', 'Define, budget, and execute paid and organic customer acquisition strategies establishing a new platform offering in the market across channels.', 'Define our brand identity and manage content calendar across web properties and owned channels.', 'Oversee content creation for marketing, including emails, product pages, and other marketing materials (case studies, whitepapers, e-books, email campaigns, blog, social, newsletters.)', 'Partner with Product and Research to define and use personas to create specific campaigns and effectively measure increase in leads.', 'Build a lead capture program with sales and support sales enablement activities.', 'Build strong relationships with Customer Success leadership to gain insights into use cases and what drives value.', 'Determine and implement optimal CRM, social media, and MarTech stack strategies.', 'Experience and a proven track record leading growth in a B2B SaaS company, scaling from $0 to $20m ARR and beyond.', 'A rigorously creative spirit and entrepreneurial approach to leading a team.', 'Experience building a digital brand and developing an avid base of consumers.', 'Exceptional analytic, leadership, and communication skills.', 'An ability to cultivate and motivate a team that over-delivers on multiple objectives within tight timeframes.', "At eko, we believe in a creative approach to everything, no matter what role we're in. We believe in meaningful choice, both at work and in life, and know our workplace only gets better when people can bring their whole selves to the office. We're software developers and spray paint artists, poets and producers, fantasy sports fans and financial whizzes, chess-heads and UXperts, pop culture nerds and product managers, data wizards and yoga instructors. We're based in NYC with offices in Tel Aviv."]

A successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to quickly grasp the business, financial and accounting concepts, exercise judgment and provide on-time accurate financial and managerial reports.A successful candidate will have strong verbal and written communications skills in English and the ability to work in a collaborative and fast-paced work environmentThis position will be a strong resource for the local Finance Team as well as the global team.The position will be assisting with the monthly, quarterly, and annual financial close processes, as well as implementing statutory and company accounting policies.The controller will report to the Finance Director.Responsibilities & Scope Of RolePreparation of quarterly and annual consolidated financial statements (U.S. GAAP)Work with subsidiaries across the world to provide guidance on issues arising from financial information, accounting and tax.Develop, document, and enforce compliance with accounting policies, procedures, and internal controls.Manage relationships and budgets of external service providers including tax, audit, and banking.Support M&A transactions and Integration of acquired companiesSupport the Business Development Department with due diligence and other tasksWork with various interfaces within the finance (treasury, taxes FP&A), corporate, and other departments Work with external auditors/advisors on audit, accounting, and other financial mattersRequirements:CPA with 5+ years of experienceBIG 4 high-tech department experienceAt least 3 years of experience as Assistant Controller / Controller in a global companyKnowledge and experience in preparing financial statements according to U.S. GAAPExcellent OfficeSuite skills - MustOracle experience - AdvantageFluent in written and spoken EnglishHighly motivated, independent thinker with the ability to effectively prioritize in a dynamic environmentHands-on approach, detail-orientedExcellent analytical, communication, and influencing skills

Title: Bookkeeper
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Ermetic's mission & CultureErmetic is a dynamic, fast-growing startup with $100M in funding in just under two years, and our 2021 business results will knock your socks off! We grew revenues by 800%, increased our customer base by 6X and quadrupled our headcount. We are unstoppable.Our product helps companies answer the number one question in cloud security today: "Who can access my data?" With Ermetic, organizations can now secure their cloud environment and protect their data and their customer's data to make sure they are safe from malicious attacks.At Ermetic, we're constantly challenging ourselves to climb higher, go further and do more. We believe that a company is built by its people. We strongly believe that every person is a leader of her / his domain - so if you thrive in an ecosystem where you can influence, where you work as part of an amazing global team, enjoy brainstorming and executing, love to see how your work contributes directly to the company's success and you see the value in a true partnerships - this is the place for you!Our growing finance team is looking for you if:A passionate bookkeeper, type 1-2, that wants to enter a dynamic and fast-growing start-up and support its current employees, suppliers, payments, and growth.We are looking for a fast learner who is eager to learn and develop in a high-tech bookkeeping role, and that accounting is in their veins.In your day-to-day you will: Play an important role in maintaining all financial aspects of the companyManage and record vendors' invoices and paymentsManage and record reimbursement of employee's travel and expenses reports Manage Bank & Credit card reconciliationsServe as a point of contact, helping with queries related to purchases, and as a point of contact for accounts payable (AP) processesWork globally with different departments in our company and directly with the operation teamQualificationsType 1-2 certificated bookkeeper- a must. 0-3 years experience (from high or low tech)English (reading, writing, and speaking) - a mustExcel skills - an advantageNetsuite experience - an advantage. Our highly experienced team is willing to guide, qualify and mentor you within your first/second bookkeeper role - if you are a Detail-oriented Perfectionist and a team playerErmetic is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations. By fostering a diverse business environment, Ermetic welcomes opportunities to learn from each other, our customers, investors, suppliers, and business partners.Ermetic respects your privacy and is committed to protecting the personal information you share with us, please refer to Ermetic's Privacy Policy for more details.

Text: Noname Security, founded in 2020, is rapidly growing with more than 200 team members globally and only a year out of stealth the company is the first API Security Unicorn, at $1B valuation and $220M in total financing. Noname Security is also one of the fastest growing cybersecurity companies ever.Our mission is to reduce the risk of API security vulnerabilities and cyber attacks. Our API Security Platform is an out-of-band solution that doesn’t require agents or network modifications, and offers deeper visibility and security than API gateways, load balancers, and WAFs. No one addresses the API security challenge like Noname.Requirements:2+ years of experience as manual QA experience testing API's.Experience working with Postman- nice to have.working Software Test Plan/Description/Report(STP/STD)Experience in testing Networking / Cybersecurity products - advantageResponsibilities:Build our QA processes from scratch and execute manual end-to-end testingTake ownership of quality health (e.g. testing coverage, performance, best practices, etc.)Innovate on testing tools, quality, and team processesWork closely with the development teamEffectively use test management tool to maintain and execute test scriptsPerform functional and regression testingAutomation knowledge- advantage

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: The Manufacturing Engineer supports the operations in improving the production process, responsible for correcting missing or wrong functionality and resolving technical issues arising in the products by proposing, testing, and implementing design changes to improve the product reliability and performance.Roles And ResponsibilitiesContinuous improvement of released products by changing the design to improve reliability, manufacturability and cost.Non-conformance investigations regarding component failures, finished goods failures, and product returns. Title: PMO
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: קביעת מתודולוגיה לניהול הפרויקטים, ליווי מנהל הפרויקט, ביצוע בקרה בכל שלבי מחזור החיים של הפרויקט.אחריות לספק למנהל הפרויקט ליווי במגוון נושאים כגון לוחות זמנים, סיכונים, תקציב ומשאבים. תקשורת ודוחות במסגרת הפרויקט.יישום פתרונות וכלים בתחום תכנון ובקרת הפרויקטים, התאמה והטמעה של כלים לניהול פרויקטים ובקרתם.הבאת תמונת מצב אינטגרטיבית וניתוח של מגון אספקטים בפרויקט כתמיכה בתהליכי קבלת החלטות.ביצוע מעקב ובקרה אחר מגמות במהלך הפרויקט ומציף נקודות העשויות לחרוג מתוכנית הפרויקט.בניית תוכניות עבודה ובחינת תכנון מול ביצוע.ליווי מנהלי הפרויקט .Requirements:תואר ראשון בהנדסת תעשייה וניהולPMO בארגון גדול כשנתיים

Title: Business & Analysis Partner

Title: Data Analyst
Location: Ra'anana, Center District, Israel
Text: Octopol is a pioneer company that integrates statistics modules and algorithms with a passion to sports, mainly soccer.We are looking for a data analyst to join our research department. The data analyst function will support several stakeholders in Octopol. Working with the research team and be the one to look and understand the bigger picture. Learning the data gathering mechanism. Face and solve business problems by analyzing data and provide insights to the business,covering a range of topics. Develop complex logic flows to identify predefined events and generate desired insights. Support the researchers on their projects. Responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business stake holders. Research and integrate new tools and methods to enrich datasets.Requirements:Requirements +2 years of experience as Data Analyst. High hands-on SQL skills (MySQL, SQL server) background in programming (R or Python). knowledge in statistics.Added bonuses if you have: interest in FinTech, Algo Trading – a big advantage. interest in sports (soccer in particular)

Title: Manufacturing Manager
Location: Rehovot, Center District, Israel
Text: Emendo is developing a transformative gene editing technology to cure severe genetic diseases. We are looking for a motivated Manufacturing Manager to join our Development team. As the Manufacturing Manger you will report directly to the Director of Process Development and be responsible for tech transfer and manufacturing of cell therapeutics for clinical studies, while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.This product is the first in line to enter clinical stage. The environment is exciting, fast-paced and offers the opportunity to work at the cutting edge of gene therapy. If you seek a meaningful job, working with great colleagues – this is your opportunity.ResponsibilitiesEstablish a manufacturing site for gene-edited cell therapy programLead the tech transfer of the manufacturing processBe responsible for the manufacturing of clinical batchesAs the cell therapy technical expert for GMP aseptic manufacturing, providing hands-on technical leadership and operational oversightWork cross-departments with process development, quality, and analytics for the implementation of the manufacturing processes.Provide oversight and guidance related to training materials, SOPs and batch records.Qualifications and Skills:M.Sc. degree in sciences, engineering, or related discipline with a minimum of 10 years of industry experience.Cell and Gene Therapy experience.Hands-on experience in GMP manufacturing of cell products.A minimum of 2 years managing projects and teams.Experience in GMP documentation and compliance.Excellent leadership skills with the ability to motivate and manage a team within matrix reporting.Excellent verbal communication, documentation, and technical writing skills.Powered by JazzHReMMWsju6wb

Title: Marketing Associate
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Papaya Global is an established B2B tech unicorn in hypergrowth. We are on a mission to reimagine the payroll category with a game-changing, disruptive technology. Papaya Global is reinventing workforce management, global payroll and payroll payments to remove the friction of complexity and regulation create. Our automated platform helps companies hire, onboard, manage, and pay people in more than 160 countries. We don’t just cover the globe with our solution; we are global. We are comprised of people from different countries, different cultures, and different backgrounds. Diversity is our secret weapon.Papaya Global is looking for an entry-level marketing Associate for a position working across 2 teams in the marketing department. The role involves working 3 days per week to develop and grow the company affiliate program, and 2 days per week assisting the Account Based Marketing (ABM) team.This is an excellent opportunity for someone to acquire B2B online marketing knowledge in a leading Israel scale-up company. You will have the opportunity to learn and acquire knowledge across 2 key lead generation channels.You will:Affiliate Management:Recruiting new affiliates: including building target lists of potential partners, hunting down contact information, crafting high performing outreach email sequences, following up on high-potential affiliates, managing an outsourced virtual assistantAccount management: managing existing affiliates, ensuring maximum revenues from every partner, assisting affiliates with any issues or requirements they haveReporting; determining the return on investment across the program and from specific affiliatesPlatform management: onboarding new affiliates on our affiliate platform (Partnerstack), managing any integrations issues between Partnerstack and our tech stack, checking for duplicate leads.Account Base Marketing:Data Enrichment: making sure all the data we are collecting is valid. Be responsible to data accuracy and data cleansing processes.Understand in depth the ABM activity, QAing, and monitoring the ABM processes.Reviewing our target account list, making sure all the accounts fit our ideal customer profile (ICP) criteria.Requirements:Mother tongue level English: this is not a content writing position, but you will be expected to write at least medium length emails of grammatically correct English (this will be tested)Microsoft Office skills: proficiency across Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Self-initiative and personal drive; whilst guidance will be given, you will be expected to learn on the job, research and implement initiativesPush and sales ‘chutzpah’: willing to ‘knock’ several times on virtual doors, perseverance and enjoy hunting for the right contactFirst degree (in any subject) from a good university/collegeAn energetic, goal-oriented self-starter who is self-organized, adaptable, inquisitive, and eager to work in a fast-paced environment.

Title: Influencer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Tango is a successful, market leader, a live-streaming Platform with 450+ Million registered users, in an industry projected to reach $240 BILLION in the next couple of years.The B2C platform, based on the best-quality global video technology, allows millions of talented people around the world to create their own live content, engage with their fans and monetize their talents.Tango live stream was founded in 2018 and is powered by 300+ global employees operating in a culture of growth, learning, and success!The Tango team is a vigorous cocktail of hard workers, creative brains, energizers, geeks, overachievers, athletes, and more. We push the limits to bring our app from “one of the top” to “the leader”.The best way to describe Tango's work style is not to use the word “impossible”. And we believe that success is a thorny path that runs on sleepless nights, corporate parties, tough releases, and of course our users' smiles (and as we are a LIVE app, we truly get to see our users all around the world smiling right in front of us in real-time!).Do you want to join the party?Requirements:Native English speaker. Additional languages, a PLUS! Ability to work with the camera! Big advantage for influencers / live streamersExperience in Storytelling and being able to CLEARLY relay the messageResponsibilities:Broadcast live and interact with the Tango community worldwideWork closely with the marketing and content teams to create and produce compelling and engaging LIVE content for our usersExplain and showcase Tango’s new featuresLIVE customer support (Respond to any technical issues customers have as they happen)Get feedback and ideas from new users, and share OUR ideas with them

Title: Director of HR
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Who we are:We are a series A Cloud/DevOps startup, on a mission to make the cloud better for everyone. We help DevOps, SRE, and security teams predict the impact of cloud configuration changes, prevent downtime and security issues, and troubleshoot faster at scale. We closed our series A funding ($30M) earlier this year, we’re growing fast and things are great. But there’s just one thing missing: YOU!The Director of HR will play a pivotal role in crafting and executing various Lightlytics HR strategies. You will oversee the entire lifecycle of this company process, from basic ongoing research to develop a strategic rationale, through managing and all the way up to global implementation, retrospection, and continuous improvement of our company.As the HR leader, you are responsible for all the HR concerns and needs. Develop a scaling solution, Hiring, OD & Learning guilds and collaborate with the People the executives and create insights that shape and lead the organization forward.This position has high accountability and reports directly to the CEO.What you will be doing:Manage, lead, and develop the HR EcoSystem of the company. collaborate with teams in Israel and all global employees (currently US).Recruiting and talent acquisition: leading all talent and running our global recruiting and talent acquisition activities including defining and implementing strategies to attract, hire, and retain top talent across the company with a focus on building a diverse and inclusive team.Responsible for defining and maintaining all processes of HR Department, including recruitment, evaluation processes, employee feedback, compensation review, workforce planning, managers' training programs, HR policies etc.Leading the global HR strategy, bringing best practices and external perspectives to analytics.Manage the HR and welfare BudgetRequirements:Your Skills And Experience:Minimum 7 years of HR experience in hi-tech global companies as HR leader.Worked In a startup environment.Experience and Recruitment Marketing strategiesSense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company’s successStrong planning and execution skills to build the HR processesMust be close but doesn’t fulfill all requirements, please apply. Lightlytics is on a mission to build a special company. To achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring the best with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.Lightlytics is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Title: Community Associate
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Imagine your dream office... Now, try again.Mindspace is a rapidly growing global provider of inspiring workspaces for teams of all sizes. Our community consists of enterprise companies and established startups, as well as small businesses, entrepreneurs, and creative freelancers. With members in more than 30 locations across 7 countries, we are setting the gold standard for flexible workspaces around the world.Who is the Community Associate? This full-time position is based in Herzliya and will report directly to the Senior Community Manager. The Community Associate is an integral part of our family and is the heart and soul of each location. As a successful Community Associate, you will support the company’s growth and the community and operations team, and help it thrive.Your day at MindspaceAs the Community Associate, you will take care of all front desk logistics and assist with all office and community management tasks.What will you be responsible for: Serve as a point of contact (POC) for all members and guests within the Mindspace CommunityMonitoring the front desk during operation hoursPoint person for maintenance, mailing, shipping, supplies, and equipment.Organize office operations and proceduresWork on community tasks together with the Community Managers and take an active role in itSolve member-related issues to ensure a smooth operationAssist with building operations, maintenance, and upkeep of Mindspace facilitiesRequirements:Minimum Qualifications1-2 years of experience in customer service, sales, or project managementExceptional organizational and multitasking skillsHigh level of English & Hebrew - verbal and writingCritical Competencies for SuccessCustomer-centric and a people personGetting the job done! Title: Buyer
Location: Hod HaSharon, Center District, Israel
Text: Who we are: Allot is an industry leader in network security and visibility. A global growing company in cyber-security with a strong Tier1 customer base. We embrace an Agile way of working, priding ourselves on being fast, diverse, and dynamic. We are real team players who are ready to go the extra mile to succeed. We believe that anyone can make an impact and together our team spirit makes all the difference. This is your opportunity to develop, professionally and personally.What we’re looking for:We are looking for a procurement professional to join our global procurement department. The buyer will manage Allot’s business engagements with various providers in the indirect procurement domain.Roles and Responsibilities:Manage sourcing projects to completion - from initiation through the bidding process, RFP, supplier selection activities, negotiation, and contractingIdentify and drive cost reduction opportunities across the supply baseTrack Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s)Work with various Allot teams on their requirements and long-term needsCollaborate with finance, HR, and Legal to continuously improve Allot engagements (Pricing, Quality, etc)As part of the procurement team, support various procurement tasks and projectsOrder management- Review relevant internal requests, issue Purchase ordersRequirements:What should you have:Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field: Economics /Business administration/Law/ Industrial Engineering Experience in Procurement in High Tech companiesStrong negotiation skillsOutstanding service orientationHigh level of English, spoken and writtenERP Oracle experience – advantageExcellent interpersonal skills, Must be able to communicate effectively with partners, internal customers and vendors across different countries and culturesGood presentation skillsAbility to work under pressure and strict timelinesAbility to work independently and as part of a teamPositive attitude, assertiveness, and multitasking capabilityExcellent verbal and written communication skills

Title: Data Analyst
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our BI team to assist in building and maintaining a robust analytics platform for internal and external purposes.As a Data Analyst, you will serve as an analytics expert, working closely with various departments across the organization helping to drive growth and success of our company.If you are excited to work in a cutting-edge big data environment, if you are eager to expand our data-driven culture and drive actionable insights to meet always changing business needs, we’d love to meet you!We are looking for someone with exceptional analytical skills who is resourceful, bright, proactive, works well independently and as part of a team and who will be passionate about what she or he does.Requirements:Proven 2 years of experience with Tableau/Looker (or equivalent) and ability to communicate insights in a visual and slick mannerStrong SQL (at least 2 years) with experience in querying large and complex data setsExcellent verbal and communication skills (in English)BSc/BA in highly quantitative field such as Industrial Engineering / Economics / Statistics or equivalent academic knowledgeBonus Points:Hands-on experience with SnowflakeProficiency with Tableau ServerExperience in Python scripting and data wranglingExperienced in various methods of predictive analyticsTrue passion for gaming (i.e. you identify yourself as a gamer).Experienced in the gaming industryFamiliar with AirflowAbout Us:Overwolf is the world’s leading platform for in-game creators and gamers who build or consume user-generated content around their favorite games. We’re talking about some of the biggest AAA titles out there – games like Minecraft, League of Legends, World of Warcraft, PUBG, and Fortnite – to name just a few.The way people create and play games around the world is changing, and Overwolf is leading the revolution. We empower just about 100K creators to make the best games even better - giving them everything they need to create unique gaming experiences that serve more than 31M gamers every month.Our mission is to turn in-game creation into a new profession and build the next generation of games. And we’re just getting started.Are you ready to join the pack and shape the future of gaming?Responsibilities:In this role, you will:Serve as a cross-organization data champion, helping to drive growth and successIdentify data related key insights and needle movers across business unitsDrive data value for both internal and external customers, presented in clear and aesthetic Tableau dashboards and reports
Requirements: ['Proven 2 years of experience with Tableau/Looker (or equivalent) and ability to communicate insights in a visual and slick manner', 'Strong SQL (at least 2 years) with experience in querying large and complex data sets', 'Excellent verbal and communication skills (in English)', 'BSc/BA in highly quantitative field such as Industrial Engineering / Economics / Statistics or equivalent academic knowledge', 'Hands-on experience with Snowflake', 'Proficiency with Tableau Server', 'Experience in Python scripting and data wrangling', 'Experienced in various methods of predictive analytics', 'True passion for gaming (i.e. you identify yourself as a gamer).', 'Experienced in the gaming industry', 'Familiar with Airflow', 'Serve as a cross-organization data champion, helping to drive growth and success', 'Identify data related key insights and needle movers across business units', 'Drive data value for both internal and external customers, presented in clear and aesthetic Tableau dashboards and reports']

Title: Head of Content Marketing
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About CloudShare:CloudShare is a leading product experience platform that helps software companies increase customer acquisition and retention by providing their end-users with engaging hands-on virtual POCs, demos, and training experiences in the cloud. We are proud to serve leading global software companies such as Atlassian, SAI Global, ForgeRock, Motorola, and many more.Our Culture:We are a people-first company. We believe in honest communication, transparency, and respecting the fact that people have other things going on in their lives unrelated to work that are equally important to us. Our Israeli offices are located in Tel-Aviv (14 Yad-Harutzim street, a 12 min walk from HaHagana train station), although we work in a hybrid format with a remote-centric focus.The Role:As Head of Content Marketing, you will report to the CMO. A natural storyteller with a strong creative mind, you’ll be defining, creating, and editing content that enables our sales team to close more deals, faster. Whether that’s positioning CloudShare as a thought leader or sparking interest in incoming leads, this is an opportunity to couple your analytical, and innovative talents in one role that will build awareness, generate and nurture leads, and improve the conversion funnel. This role is both hands-on and strategic, allowing you to be creative and execute content to an exceptional level, driving high-quality work that has a mission-critical impact on the organization.Key Responsibilities:Develop and edit a variety of content assets including case studies, blog posts, ebooks, videos, infographics, white papers, email campaigns, and paid ads.Ability to handle social media presence across channels (LinkedIn, Facebook, TikTok, YouTube, and Twitter) ensuring high levels of traffic and customer engagement.Brainstorm new ideas and strategies for effective content.Research and contribute creative ideas to support key content goals, such as increasing conversion rates in the sales funnel, growing blog subscribers and LinkedIn followers, growing inbound organic traffic, and more.Manage multiple projects and competing priorities.Collaborate with key leaders and subject matter experts within the organization to develop use case requirements for high-quality content that aligns with business outcomes.Use a variety of analytics tools to monitor content performance and optimize its impact.Requirements3+ years of experience in content marketing.Experience in content creation for enterprise B2B SaaS companies.Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a deep-rooted understanding of what it takes to engage readers with compelling and modern content.Hands-on with an understanding of the goals of the content marketing role.The ability to distill complex ideas in understandable, relatable, and human-friendly ways.Comfortable in using data analytics to measure and continually improve the impact of content on lead generation, thought leadership, and paid campaigns.Experience with video editing and video productions– a plusEnglish - mother tongue
Requirements: ['Develop and edit a variety of content assets including case studies, blog posts, ebooks, videos, infographics, white papers, email campaigns, and paid ads.', 'Ability to handle social media presence across channels (LinkedIn, Facebook, TikTok, YouTube, and Twitter) ensuring high levels of traffic and customer engagement.', 'Brainstorm new ideas and strategies for effective content.', 'Research and contribute creative ideas to support key content goals, such as increasing conversion rates in the sales funnel, growing blog subscribers and LinkedIn followers, growing inbound organic traffic, and more.', 'Manage multiple projects and competing priorities.', 'Collaborate with key leaders and subject matter experts within the organization to develop use case requirements for high-quality content that aligns with business outcomes.', 'Use a variety of analytics tools to monitor content performance and optimize its impact.', '3+ years of experience in content marketing.', 'Experience in content creation for enterprise B2B SaaS companies.', 'Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a deep-rooted understanding of what it takes to engage readers with compelling and modern content.', 'Hands-on with an understanding of the goals of the content marketing role.', 'The ability to distill complex ideas in understandable, relatable, and human-friendly ways.', 'Comfortable in using data analytics to measure and continually improve the impact of content on lead generation, thought leadership, and paid campaigns.', 'Experience with video editing and video productions– a plus', 'English - mother tongue']

Text: At Redefine Meat, we love meat. Really, really love meat.We believe that the world deserves New-Meat™, plant-based meat, that’s not only good for the environment but is also kind to animals. Having studied animal meat’s unique components, and perfected cutting-edge technologies, Redefine Meat provides a wide range of high-quality products that are just as delicious as the meat you already know and love. Title: Customer Success Manager
Location: Givatayim, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: WSC Sports develops an AI-based automation solution for real-time sports content creation and distribution and is the fastest-growing sports-tech company in the world.Why WSC Sports:You’ll work in an awesome environment alongside some of the most innovative people around, using cutting-edge technologies and tools (video editing, AI, data, etc.), and have the opportunity to directly influence the products and tools used by our clients who include sports giants such as the NBA, Bundesliga, FIBA, ESPN and more. And that’s just the beginning of what WSC Sports has to offer!What you’ll do:Serve as the primary point of contact for the client. Maintain an ongoing relationship for all client-related aspects, from product implementation onwards.Utilize project management skills to drive all aspects of project planning, governance, and onboarding including detailed deployment timelines.Deliver quarterly business reviews to reflect the value the customer derives from our service.Extract value matter data from a complex database, BI tools, and reports.Build best practices methodologies and be your trusted customer's consultant.Identify upsell opportunities, leveraging, and discussing them directly with the customer.Requirements:What you’ll need:2+ years of Customer Success/Account Management/equivalent role background.Experience working in a tech B2B company, with a SAAS product.Ability to understand complex technology and explain it simply.Prior experience in on-boarding/project management/training.Willingness to frequently travel domestically and abroad.Fluent in English, both written and verbal.Bonus Points:Experience in video/social media/media streaming.Interest in sports, watching and talking sports on a daily basis.

Title: Data Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Wiliot was founded by the team that invented one of the technologies at the heart of 5G. Their next vision was to develop an IoT sticker, a computing element that can power itself by harvesting radio frequency energy, bringing connectivity and intelligence to everyday products and packaging, things previously disconnect from the IoT. This revolutionary mixture of cloud and semiconductor technology is being used by some of the world’s largest consumer, retail, food and pharmaceutical companies to change the way we make, distribute, sell, use and recycle products.Our investors include Softbank, Amazon, Alibaba, Verizon, NTT DoCoMo, Qualcomm and PepsiCo.We are growing fast and need people that want to be part of the journey, commercializing Sensing as a Service and enabling “Intelligence for Everyday Thing”.This role offers a unique opportunity to engage in tactical data exploration and to build out solutions on top of the insights you identify. You will sift through massive amounts of data to discover “Ah ha!” moments for key customers that connect the dots between our technology and their key problems. You will then work with internal teams, and key customer teams to turn these insights into integrated solutions. Creativity, curiosity, and resilience are key for this role as you often won’t know what we’re looking for until we’ve found it.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Math, CS, data science/engineering or equivalent analytical degree2-5 years of relevant professional experienceStrong Python skillsExperience with SPARK strongly preferred.Visualization tools experience including UI design (Plotly, Tableau, PowerBI, Grafana)Understanding of statistical analysis and relational database structures (SQL, Influxdb a plus)Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving abilitiesExcellent interpersonal and communication skillsAbility to be self-sufficient and execute quickly when given autonomyExperience with IoT data streams and business context a plusFlexible team player who will thrive in a dynamic, constantly evolving environmentResponsibilities:Participate in customer meetings and carefully listen for pain points and business problemsDevelop visualization interfaces (internally and in customer systems) to maximize data value and useability in the customer business contextMold real time series data stream into actional insightsHunt to uncover new insights in data generated by customer deploymentsBuild and deliver technical presentations to customersCommunicate effectively with engineers from many disciplines (including algorithm, software, and hardware engineers)Work with internal product teams and customer teams to turn insights into integrated solutions.
