Title: Director of Project Management, Science Operations
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: In this role, you will orchestrate the process of executing scientific projects by the Science Operations team. The process involves the coordination of within-team activities and the team’s activities with other related company units. We are looking for an experienced, passionate Director of project management to optimize the combination of science, technology, and customer-facing activities.Requirements:At least MSc. in bioinformatics or related fieldExperience as a project manager, business operations or product operationsExperience in multidisciplinary product operationsStrong communication skillsFamiliar with agile methodologiesStrong English skills – written and verbalResponsibilities:Lead the Science Operations projects planning and writing work plansOversee operational execution of the scientific projectsContribute to the definition and prioritization of Science Operations tasks and dependencies in developments by other unitsOversee and support the execution of cross units/ Science Operations processes

Title: IT Digital Application Director
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: The digital workplace application leader is a senior-level role responsible for delivering the portfolio of applications that supports digital employee experience and elevates the digital dexterity of the workforce. This critical leader has an endless curiosity for new technology, is relentless in their pursuit of new ways of working and has strong business relationship acumen. This role is pivotal to delivering the future of work by crafting a digital workplace program that supports the workforce of today and the future.How my day will look like?Develop a digital workplace ambition that provides focus to program goals to modernize applications, support new ways of working and enable business transformation.Seek out innovative technology trends that should be brought into the workplace and gather digital workplace best practices by participating in continuing education, peer groups and industry events.Support and facilitate innovative digital workplace applications and strategies to test new ideas to support the future of work.Demonstrate digital dexterity and create a culture of workforce digital dexterity by driving leadership in adoption (what), enablement (how) and influence (why) to drive digital business goals (when).Involve business process management professionals to optimize work processes by rethinking, simplifying and redesigning them.Build and maintain key stakeholder partnerships across the business units to ensure alignment of digital workplace application strategy to support mission-critical business outcomes.Craft a digital workplace strategy that aligns application selection with business objectives for digital transformation.Lead the development, publication and maintenance of the digital workplace framework for contextualizing employee attention and connective services.You will be the owner of information system in the organization, maintain, support and purchasing of new applications and process implementation with the different business unitsOwnership of CRM, ERP and many moreRequirements:10+ years of experience in IT application fieldDeep knowledge of business process implementation around ERP, finance, Sales, CRMAbility to right well defined requirements Project management skills
Requirements: ['Develop a digital workplace ambition that provides focus to program goals to modernize applications, support new ways of working and enable business transformation.', 'Seek out innovative technology trends that should be brought into the workplace and gather digital workplace best practices by participating in continuing education, peer groups and industry events.', 'Support and facilitate innovative digital workplace applications and strategies to test new ideas to support the future of work.', 'Demonstrate digital dexterity and create a culture of workforce digital dexterity by driving leadership in adoption (what), enablement (how) and influence (why) to drive digital business goals (when).', 'Involve business process management professionals to optimize work processes by rethinking, simplifying and redesigning them.', 'Build and maintain key stakeholder partnerships across the business units to ensure alignment of digital workplace application strategy to support mission-critical business outcomes.', 'Craft a digital workplace strategy that aligns application selection with business objectives for digital transformation.', 'Lead the development, publication and maintenance of the digital workplace framework for contextualizing employee attention and connective services.', 'You will be the owner of information system in the organization, maintain, support and purchasing of new applications and process implementation with the different business units', 'Ownership of CRM, ERP and many more', '10+ years of experience in IT application field', 'Deep knowledge of business process implementation around ERP, finance, Sales, CRM', 'Ability to right well defined requirements', 'Project management skills']

Title: Administrative Assistant
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Energean is an independent E&P company focused on developing resources in the Mediterranean and UK North Sea. With presence in nine countries Energean is operating production, development and exploration assets with an excellent HSE track record. The company has an approximately 70% gas weighted portfolio with more than 800 MMboe 2P reserves and 2C resources and our flagship development assets are the multi-tcf Karish, Karish North and Tanin gas fields, offshore Israel.Energean is committed to sustainable development and to be a net zero emitter by 2050 contributing to the global net zero target. The company also strives to meet United Nations' 17 Sustainable Development Goals through its day-to-day operations and a wide range of corporate social responsibility initiatives.Being an equal opportunity employer and valuing diversity Energean does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.Summary:Energean is seeking to employ an Administrative Assistant for our offices in Tel Aviv. The Energean Administrative Assistant is responsible for planning, directing/coordinating the administrative services of the organization (such as record and information management, mail distribution, facilities planning and maintenance and other office support services), as well as coordinating the Country Manager's office activity.Key Accountabilities: Monitor Energean facilities to ensure that it remains safe, secure, and well-maintain Acquire, distribute and store supplies Analyse internal processes and recommend and implement procedures or policy changes to improve operations, such as supply changes or disposal of records etc. Process and report all Office expenses Prepare presentations, spreadsheets and reports as needed. Manages all travel arrangements for Energean staff. Plan and host meetings.Qualifications and Experience: High school diploma; additional qualification in Office Administration is a plus Proven work experience as in Administrative Position Highly proficient with MS Office Suite (particularly MS Word and MS Excel) Familiarity with office equipment like printers and video-conference, etc.Skills: Strong networking and communication skills externally and internally – ability to cultivate and build strong internal and external relationships with business counterparts. English speaker Flexible with can-do attitudePlease apply online by hitting the 'Apply' button.Applications will ONLY be accepted via the ‘Apply’ button.This role is being handled by the Energean recruitment team and no agency contact is required.

Title: Assistant for our CEO
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are looking for a Personal Assistant for our CEO. In this role you will provide administrative assistance, meetings and events scheduling, travel planning and more.We are looking for a fast learner, highly organized, Independent, strong sense of service level with a proactive approach in a fast-paced environment.Requirements: Proven experience in administrative positions with the ability to prioritize and work independently. Highly computer literate in all Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Ability to be flexible in response to changing priorities and needs Fluency in both English and Hebrew, with exceptional written and verbal communication skills.Responsibilities: Support our CEO with daily administrative and personal tasks Handle complex scheduling for the CEO - you will need to always be one step ahead of our CEO's busy schedule Compose, collect & distribute presentations & documents on behalf of the CEO Available to work full days at the office, with an option of flexibility according to business needs

Title: Global IT Director
Location: Gan HaDarom, Center District, Israel
Text: Hundreds of millions worldwide choose Viber as their top messaging and calling app daily. Our mission is to connect people freely and securely, no matter who they are or where they are from.We’re looking for a highly motivated Global IT Director to lead our global IT teams, located mainly in Israel and Belarus.In this role you will lead a team of professionals, who are providing service and support to more than 500 employees located worldwide.Requirements:8+ years of experience working in IT operations, supervising technology teams, and overseeing large information technology projects, in global companiesProven experience in managing IT and helpdesk teamsExcellent understanding of computer systems, security, network and systems administration, back-office systems, identity management, hardware, and new developments in the IT domainFamiliar with cloud-based IT solutions - preferably AWSDesired Personal Skills:Fluent in English, both written and verbalRussian Speaker - big advantageLeadership and management skillsService orientedHave a “can-do” approachExcellent interpersonal and communication skillsAbility to work in a global environmentDesire for constant improvement and excellenceResponsibilities:Oversee IT operations and supervise systems and IT staff across all company sitesDevelop, manage, and track the IT department's annual work plan and budgetOversee global team leads, evaluate them according to established goals and provide guidance to support their personal growth.Provide the necessary infrastructure to support the company growth and scaleEnsure smooth delivery and operation of IT servicesCreate processes and standards for selecting, implementing, and supporting systemsProvide direction, guidance, and training to IT staffWork closely with the security team to enforce IT security policies and implement requirements and configurations

Title: Test Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Syqe is a med-tech company developing technologies that enable the precise delivery of a wide range of therapeutic molecules by inhalation. Utilizing its breakthrough technology, Syqe aims to relieve the suffering of as many patients as possible in the fastest possible way.We are looking for a qualified Test Engineer to join our engineering department. The Test Engineer will take part in the test automation efforts of the company, both production line ATEs and lab testing setups.Design, run and analyze automated tests for Syqe’s emerging products. Design JIGs and compatible testing software and hardware. Take part in defining and executing the V&V plan.ResponsibilitiesDevelopment, implementation, documentation, and maintenance of production line Automatic Test EquipmentDevelopment and maintenance of analysis tools and scriptsDevelop, extend, and maintain test JIGs for V&V and QC stagesTake part in defining the V&V test planTake part in V&V test plan executionCompose test protocol and report the results in accordance with the system requirements and V&V planWork closely with the developers to resolve and detected issues, i.e. isolate, report, and manage electromechanical and software bugsTroubleshooting and writing analysis reportWork in alignment with statistical methods and company’s statistics sampling procedureRequirements:RequirmentsEngineering degree in Electronics or Mechanical engineering or a related field2+ years of Electro-Mechanical hands on experience, from medical device industry - preferredExperience with GUI testing tools and testing equipmentProven analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skillsStrong test protocols and reports writing skillsExperience in LabVIEW programming - MustExperience in MATLAB programming - advantageExperience in SolidWorks design - advantageExperience in 3D printing manufacturing - advantageSoftware development processes and methodologies experience - advantage

Title: QA Manager
Location: Hod HaSharon, Center District, Israel
Text: We are looking for a talented, driven, sustainability minded QA Manager to join our company.Role Overview: Set quality mindset throughout the company Oversee the activity of the quality assurance department Drive for continuous improvement in product, processes, and company-quality’s work modes Take responsibility for subcontractors and partners qualification in the Plastics’ field Establish product quality management, and effectiveness of internal and external processes, from developmental, throughout commercial production Manage customer complaints, investigations, lessons learned and CAPA processes Focus on process design, such as documenting standard operating procedures (SOPs), system and employee’s training, to ensure consistent product quality and prevent defects before they occur Build, execute and monitor an annual work-plan, in the field of quality; including KPIsResponsibilities and Authority: Write, review, and implement procedures, forms and management tools for the QMS Compliance with regulatory and company’s quality goals Lead and maintain compliance with ISO 9001 and other relevant standards Act as a company-global supplier of quality management, and conduct internal and external audits Design processes and specifications that will ensure the manufacture of high-quality products, to meet regulatory requirements and customers’ needs and expectations Focus on the prevention of inconsistencies and continuous improvement, by conducting investigations and managing complaints, and CAPA implementation Prepare quality documentation and reports, by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information, as well as trends -along with QC and lab – to include failed processes, investigations and corrective actions Align and characterize systems, to support quality needs Take responsibility for onboarding and ongoing training, for global employees, in the field of qualityRequirements:Education and experience: BA or BSc degree in Business, Industry Management or Engineering 3-5 years of experience in quality management and supplier quality management Experience with relevant standards: ISO 9001/14000/22000/13485 and others Experience in internal & external auditing Experience in quality management in an industrial/operational industry – an advantage Experience with an ERP systemKnowledge, skills, and abilities: Excellent English – verbal and written Proven self-management and team-management skills Excellent knowledge of Excel and project management tools Excellent social and communication skills Strong leadership skills Capability of multi-tasking and working on several projects at onceDetail orientation and data analysis capabilitiesAdditional Information:The role reports to the Head of Planning, Supply Chain & QA Compliance, based at TIPA's HQ, in Israel.

Title: Head of Product
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Are you smart, curious, nimble, relentless leader and quick learner enough to tackle one of society’s largest emerging problems?If you answer yes to all of the above, we might have one of the most interesting product leadership roles out there, just for you.We are Assured Allies and we are reinventing the products that help our parents better live when they retire… We are already changing how hundreds of thousands of aging adults in the US age and we need a product magician to help us push us to the next level.Why a magician? Because on a day-to-day you will need to-Speak the language of actuaries, data scientists, clinicians, developers, operations team and account managementCut to the chase and drive your team to pull a lot of decisions quickly from their hats (and know what to do if they end up wrong)Retrospect what you and your team did to make sure we do not make the same mistake twiceBuild and manage a team in a merit based and data driven environment. (e.g. give and receive frank, timely and honest feedback, solicit the best ideas, have solid foundations for decisions)Ensure nothing disappears (e.g. falls through the cracks) Quickly call out risks and problems but not be discouraged by themFew Other Critical Requirements-We do not provide broomsticks so this position will require some air travel. (It reports to the VP Product Management in our US office and works extensively with our R&D teams in Israel)7+ years of software product management experience2+ years leading product management activities and deep knowledge of either one of these books ( “Lean Startup”,“Startup Owner’s Manual”)>5 years utilizing Agile and/or Scrum software methodologiesExperience in healthcare / case management systems is a plusPowered by JazzHRQinQMQRS3v

Title: VP Marketing & Communications
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: The fast-growing Mitrelli Group is looking for an experienced, innovative, result-oriented and engaging VP marketing and Communications Officer.  The VP marketing and Communications Officer is responsible for defining and implementing the Marcom strategy and workplans for the Group and is the go-to-person for anything related to Marketing and Communications (marcom) within Mitrelli Group (incl. its Subsidiaries).Your Main Responsibilities Will Include Lead the development of integrated, result-driven marcom plans, including strategies and tactics that increase Mitrelli and its Subsidiaries’ brands’ awareness, relevancy, and generate demand, while reflecting local priorities. Ensure each brand has an ownable positioning strategy that is communicated in consistent manner across all channels and touchpoints. Enhance and protect the reputation of the Mitrelli Group by Leading the planning and implementation of public & press relations and other marcom initiatives targeted at the Group’s external stakeholders Developing a crisis management preparedness program to mitigate potential risks Working in close collaboration with the Leadership and Human Resources teams to lead the internal communication efforts to create opportunities for the leadership to engage and communicate with their teams Planning, implementing and monitoring the Group’s offline and online marketing activities and campaigns incl. events, websites, social media, SEO/SEM, demand generation activities, … Support the business developments efforts by providing informatics and research analytics Manage the marcom budget and work with vendors and agencies, to create/localize marcom activities and develop compelling content and supporting assets Provide regular updates and share reporting on activities progress and impactRequirements:Key Skills And Qualifications Required Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business Admin., Public Relations, or related field Business orientation and demonstrated experience in a similar role Proficiency in planning, managing, tracking and measuring demand generation programs that keep stakeholders engaged throughout the funnel Capability to develop compelling content and master social media and digital communication methods Extensive experience in managing complex and sensitive issues, incl. ability to anticipate issues and opportunities that may impact on the group English native speaker with exceptional verbal & written communication skills. Mastering Portuguese and French: Major advantage High level of attention to detail including proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously Excellent interpersonal skills and adept at building relationships with different stakeholders Highly motivated, well organized, creative and innovative Free to travel to Africa and other Mitrelli’s countries of operations as required

Title: Podcast Producer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: MarketingWho Connecteam is:Connecteam is a TLV-based startup that's on a mission to change the work experience for 80% of the world's global workforce - the frontline employees.Our business management platform helps thousands of businesses thrive by taking away the daily hustle and complexities of managing teams, so they can have the peace of mind to grow and run their business.As Connecteam's Podcast Producer, you will be working with a dedicated team to strategize, plan, and execute marketing efforts to grow the audience, awareness, and revenue through our podcast channel.What's the job?As Connecteam's podcast producer you will manage, oversee, and execute our podcast's development process. You will be in charge of production management, scheduling, audio management and editing, publishing, analytics, and overall leadership. You will be in charge of our podcast's different topics, episode lengths, episode frequency, and recording equipment.We see our podcast as an important channel to be distributed via all social media - audio and video - and extend our reach to the targeted audience to raise awareness of the problems and solutions around in our arena, and state our mission and our company as a leader in the field of managing frontline employees and growing businesses across the globe.What you'll be doing: Manage the podcast's production processManage the podcast production schedule and developmentRecord and produce all podcast episodesCall, email, and schedule guests to join the podcastPrep the host and guest before a podcast recordingPrepare questions prior to an interviewEnsure podcasts meet internal deadlinesGuide guests on talking points throughout the recordingManage each episode's editing, recording, and distributionMonitor each episode's analytics and metricsManage the podcast production budgetBuild up fan communities across platforms and raise awareness of the podcast channel. Which qualifications you'll need:Native written and spoken English - MUST3+ years of experience in Podcast Production - MUSTSolid understanding of the podcast industry 3+ years of experience in video editing - MUSTHigh-performance execution Autodidact and a can-do mentality Excellent interpersonal and organizational skillsAbility to work under pressure and meet tight deadlinesAbility to collaborate and work with diverse stakeholders Enthusiastic to learn and grow Experience in SaaS B2B - an advantageBackground working with SMB audiences - an advantageHiring process with us: At Connecteam, we aim to complete our hiring processes at lightning speed, keeping the time between when we receive your CV until you (hopefully) sign with us super short, communicative and transparent.Joining Connecteam Is The Smart Move:We build our people up. Every team member is treated as a long-term investment and we recognize the value in always nurturing and training them so they can go above and beyond in their skills and job duties. We make an impact on our customer's business. We are on a mission to provide managers of all business types and sizes with the tools they need to communicate, operate, engage, and run their deskless workforce. Our product offers them an effective and affordable solution to run their business. We get the job done. Connecteam employees are passionate in executing their job duties so they can drive the company forward and provide real value to our customers. We have fun! From weekly happy hours to holiday parties, we always enjoy each other's company (and good food, of course). Connecteam is like one big, happy family!Everyone is welcome. Connecteam is committed to building an encouraging, caring, and supportive environment. We share a responsibility to support our team and enrich their lives. Together we will shape the future of work!Joining Connecteam Is The Smart Move:We build our people up. Every team member is treated as a long-term investment and we recognize the value in always nurturing and training them so they can go above and beyond in their skills and job duties. We make an impact on our customer's business. We are on a mission to provide managers of all business types and sizes with the tools they need to communicate, operate, engage, and run their deskless workforce. Our product offers them an effective and affordable solution to run their business. We get the job done. Connecteam employees are passionate in executing their job duties so they can drive the company forward and provide real value to our customers. We have fun! From weekly happy hours to holiday parties, we always enjoy each other's company (and good food, of course). Connecteam is like one big, happy family!Everyone is welcome. Connecteam is committed to building an encouraging, caring, and supportive environment. We share a responsibility to support our team and enrich their lives. Title: Assistant Controller
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: 888 is looking for a Revenues & Billing Accountant who is looking to jump-start his/her career and join a large international public firm, a leader in its field, as part of an accounting team. The Revenues & Billing Accountant will belong to a group of accountants who are responsible for monitoring and handling the company’s worldwide revenue recognition, calculating, and analyzing the settlements with suppliers and other service providers as part of the gaming activity, and managing the gaming tax and regulatory payments matters in various territories.At 888 you will enjoy a hybrid work model, combining in-office work with remote work (work from home) during the week.As An Assistant Controller You Will Be Responsible ForHandling and analyzing business agreements and contracts from a financial and an accounting perspective and accordingly will calculate the company costs.Managing the quarterly/monthly close process related to revenue and billing process, including analytical review and other reports.Working closely with other functional teams to improve business and system processes and reporting outputs.Providing financial and accounting consulting to the business divisions and participating in revenue and costs forecast procedures.Provisioning and accounting responsibility within the respective domain, including journal entries and posting.Responsible for external review and annual audit of the consolidated and solo results.This Job Is For You Only If You HaveBachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, and qualified CPA.Strong communication and organizational skills and detail-oriented self-starter with the ability to work independently to meet deadlines.High analytical skills – preparation, reporting and presentation to senior executives at the company.Excellent Oral and Written English communication skills.Previously worked at one of the Big 4 Accounting Firms.Excellent Excel proficiency.Ready for high intense and dynamic work environment.ApplicationJust fill in a few details below and we’ll be in touch if you’re a match for the positionPOSITION | Assistant Controller | Position ID: 05.53BPrivacy PolicyThe candidate consent that the information in this Candidate Application and any personal information concerning him/her which is obtained by the Company or from other sources, will be held and managed by the Company or on its behalf, and that the Company shall be entitled to use and transfer such information to third parties, including Company’s affiliates, business partners or contractors/service providers to the extent required while maintaining your right to privacy. The Company undertakes that the information will be used, and transferred for the purposes related to the recruitment process, including assessment of your qualifications against our work opportunities, verification and reference/background checks, communications with you about the recruitment process and/or your application and/or compliance with applicable laws, regulations, legal processes or enforceable governmental requests.Share this position with a friendRelated Positions

Title: Operations Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Who are we?:Join the world's fastest-growing mobile games company!SuperPlay is on a mission to create the world's best mobile games, and have fun while doing it. Founded in 2019 by industry veterans from Playtika, Rovio, and the movie industry, we set out to create delightful, memorable casual games that players can enjoy for years.Our first game Dice Dreams has become a top-100 grossing global hit, and our team has grown to include dozens of top-talent, dedicated, and driven individuals.Our future plans are even more exciting - if you want to be part of the journey, check out the role below!What will you do in SuperPlay?:As an Operation Manager, You will manage and plan, day-to-day activities and work closely with the monetization, product, game economy and R&D departments.Responsibilities:Managing day to day game activities operations and QA on the backoffice platformMonetization promotions executionEnsure and validate all production activitiesManaging technical requests from all departmentsA/B TestsLiveOpsCoordinate between all departments to make things happenWho are you?:We don't know. Title: Marketing Designer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: With over 30 Million users on our platform, we’re here to change the future of business. Our all-in-one platform makes starting a business affordable and accessible to everyone - we welcome more than 800k new business owners every month. From our products to our careers, there are endless opportunities for growth.Our team | Our core | Our dream fulfillersWhen we started Tailor Brands, we wanted to help people to accelerate their growth and fulfill their dreams. This also defines us internally; we put our focus on maximizing individual impact and creating an environment of absolute transparency.﻿About The RoleBeing a part of Tailor’s creative team means to ideate and create performance driven designs in a massively creative and agile environmentDevelop or update our brand identityInnovate continually within a design team to build new or updated marketing campaigns that engage our customersDesign targeted ads, marketing emails, landing pages, productions and many moreProduce marketing collateral consistent with our brand imageCommunicate ideas and concepts clearly; review work in an objective manner and with the aid of analytics, and apply learnings to future workWork within the Marketing department to gather information, understand the end goals and strategize communication approachesRequirements:A solid creative portfolio of digital and print work that features illustration, infographics, and creative branding projectsBachelor’s degree in Visual Communication from a leading design school (e.g. HIT, Shenkar, Bezalel, Wizo)Ability to produce quality materials in a high-paced, rapidly changing environmentAdvanced skills with commonly-used design software, including Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, etc.), Sketch, etc.Excellent organizational skills and highly collaborative with stakeholders from different teamsCreative and out-of-the-box thinker

Title: Marketing Analyst
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Papaya Global is an established B2B tech unicorn in hypergrowth. We are on a mission to reimagine the payroll category with a game-changing, disruptive technology. Papaya Global is reinventing workforce management, global payroll and payroll payments to remove the friction of complexity and regulation create. Our automated platform helps companies hire, onboard, manage, and pay people in more than 160 countries. We don’t just cover the globe with our solution; we are global. We are comprised of people from different countries, different cultures, and different backgrounds. Diversity is our secret weapon.Papaya Global is looking for a Marketing Analyst who will join our growing Marketing team and take a key role in making Papaya Global's marketing practice more data-driven.Your mission will be to consolidate and leverage our data to propose new ideas, tell the story behind the numbers, and guide the Marketing department's decision-making by providing actionable insights to support the teams' KPIs.You will be responsible for:Owning all Marketing & Sales analytics aspects Analyzing all marketing activities and business results, including attribution, marketing pipeline, etc.Building dashboards and measuring KPIs using BI tools to improve Marketing's effectiveness and help us achieve our business goals.Data Visualization: Crate and optimize dashboards and reports, to allow data-driven business decisions that will support the company's growth and KPIs.Creating a validation process for the data sources and optimizing the data collection process to instantly flag issues with the data collected.Consolidating data from different sources to find connections and trends and assist decision-making by providing inputs to stakeholders.Identifying areas for improvement and making recommendations for new opportunities.Performing funnel analysis to understand the path prospects take through the funnel and find new opportunities using different breakdowns.Develop strong relationships and collaborate with cross-functional teams within the Marketing organization and across the company (Sales, Product, others) to create comprehensive conclusions and recommendations.Constantly being on the lookout for ways to improve efficiency and clarity and deliver better value to the organization.Requirements:3+ years experience in a Marketing/ Business/ Data Analyst or similar role.Experience reporting on B2B marketing and sales funnels, lead generation and nurturing, email marketing, sales metrics, and website analytics.Experience in working with various data sources.Proven experience in translating business processes and KPIs into meaningful dashboards, including measurements, while raising business questions.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a deep understanding of data structures and data architecture principles.Full working proficiency in English is a must.High attention to detail and proven ability to multitask.Proficient level of SQL – Must.Proficiency with data visualization tool (Tableau) - Must.Curious, independent, rigorous, and proactive kind of person.Experience working with Salesforce and HubSpot (Reporting & Dashboards).Experience in end-to-end analytic work: defining the question, gathering the data, and drawing business-relevant conclusionsCommunication & presentation capabilities – ability to tell compelling stories and explain complex issues in simple ways.

Title: Technology Director
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Autobrains is a fast-growing start-up in the heart of Tel-Aviv, with a ground-breaking approach to unsupervised learning and signature-based data representation that is set to disrupt the next generation of vehicles and mobility.At Autobrains, you will face never-ending intellectual challenges as we redefine AI for scalable autonomous platforms and products to forever change driving and make the roads a safer place for all. You will work with bright and talented people in an environment where professional and personal development is a top priority.Autobrains is looking for a Technology Director to work at our Tel Aviv Headquarters.As a Technology Director, you will work closely with the R&D team and play a crucial role in the technological growth of Autobrains. We are looking for someone at the forefront of innovation that believes in our vision.The primary responsibility of the Technology Director is to Identify technological needs, or technological gaps and, based on your knowledge, experience and academic background, provide a real-time solution, including establishing a task force for a certain technological effort, understanding development processes and knowing how to disassemble and change them if necessary, and hands-on coding / code review.You will be part of our CEO team and report directly to the CEO. The ideal candidate must possess a can-do attitude, a hands-on approach, be open to new challenges, and constantly strive to drive plans to completion.Responsibilities: Part of the CEO team sets the vision for how technology will be used in the company.Help define the product vision and strategy.Create a technological roadmap and strategy for the different verticals on a cross-company level.Ensure that technological resources meet the company's short and long-term needs.Create timelines for the development and deployment of all technological services.Make executive decisions on behalf of the company's technological requirements.Act as a mentor to team members, including building a technology leadership team that can expertly manage the teams, develop a strong and focused culture, and be responsive to the organization's needsMaintain an innovative state of mind. Stay on top of technology trends and developments.Requirements:Must Have's:Ph.D. in Computer Science\ Electrical Engineering \ or another relevant field from a leading institute7+ years experience in leading R&D teams in fast-paced organizations7+ years experience in the Vision AI field (Deep Learning - advantage)Strong project management and people management skillsStrong ability in taking a business challenge, transforming it into a plan, and leading its executionHands-on approach and passion (This is not a direct people management position)Great people skillsBig Advantages:Experience in the autonomous vehicles sector, and passion for following and weighing in on the latest news and industry trends - a big advantageExperience as a CTO of a small startupStrong Python backgroundQualifications:Ability to carry requirements end to end without clear and close guidance.A friendly character that is passionate about technology, architecture, design, testing, and performance.A leader by example.
Requirements: ['Part of the CEO team sets the vision for how technology will be used in the company.', 'Help define the product vision and strategy.', 'Create a technological roadmap and strategy for the different verticals on a cross-company level.', "Ensure that technological resources meet the company's short and long-term needs.", 'Create timelines for the development and deployment of all technological services.', "Make executive decisions on behalf of the company's technological requirements.", "Act as a mentor to team members, including building a technology leadership team that can expertly manage the teams, develop a strong and focused culture, and be responsive to the organization's needs", 'Maintain an innovative state of mind.', 'Stay on top of technology trends and developments.', 'Ph.D. in Computer Science\\ Electrical Engineering \\ or another relevant field from a leading institute', '7+ years experience in leading R&D teams in fast-paced organizations', '7+ years experience in the Vision AI field (Deep Learning - advantage)', 'Strong project management and people management skills', 'Strong ability in taking a business challenge, transforming it into a plan, and leading its execution', 'Hands-on approach and passion (This is not a direct people management position)', 'Great people skills', 'Experience in the autonomous vehicles sector, and passion for following and weighing in on the latest news and industry trends - a big advantage', 'Experience as a CTO of a small startup', 'Strong Python background', 'Ability to carry requirements end to end without clear and close guidance.', 'A friendly character that is passionate about technology, architecture, design, testing, and performance.', 'A leader by example.']

Title: Customer Success Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Identiq’s Customer Success team plays a key role in defining and executing the company’s strategy. We are looking for an enthusiastic, highly intelligent individual to join our team as an Enterprise Customer Success Manager: a role that combines Customer relationship, project management, consulting, strategic thinking, and business analysis.In this position, you will take on leads of Identiq's enterprise clients, develop relationships with multiple Fortune 500 companies, onboard them to our member platform and identify their unique needs and challenges to drive them to success and growth. You will collaborate with other teams at Identiq to ensure a seamless onboarding process and use insights from client feedback to improve our product and offering.We are looking for someone who can hit the ground running, experienced in working with Enterprise companies. Someone who is eager to turn our vision into reality and who can transfer their enthusiasm to our customers' success in a highly professional, smart, and friendly way.This role is an opportunity to take your relationship skills to the next level by owning the enterprise customer relationship; guiding our most complex and sophisticated customers and driving ongoing value throughout their journey with Identiq. The Enterprise CSM team is a hard-working team focused on onboarding our customers and building long-lasting partnerships at all levels of the customer organization. We work to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction, retention and growth within the enterprise customer base.Requirements:2+ years of B2B enterprise success experience, managing end-to-end customer life cycle in tech companies, and/or a hyper-growth B2B SaaS startupYou’ve managed complex software onboarding projects delivering on time and creating value to the customer and the companyYou’ve managed projects where data transformation was a key componentYou can demonstrate a track record of success in effectively developing and managing complex deployments and partnerships within Enterprise AccountsYou’ve launched newly onboarding customers on the road to successYou are a trusted resource and have developed relationships between customers and our support teamsYou’ve identified ways to grow and expand our customer footprint while partnering with our Sales teamsYou’ve become the “voice of the customer”You have analytical backgroundPayment/fraud/risk industry in a customer-facing role- an advantageWilling to travel up to 25%Willing to work flexible hours and meet clients in North American hours.Responsibilities:During the first six months at Identiq your focus will be on onboarding your customers to our member platform. This will include hands-on project management and interaction with our customer, our data team and engineering. You will own the relationship with the customer during the evaluation period and during the implementation phase. Our CSM’s are measured on the time to value and growth.Once the customers are onboarded and in go-live mode, you will be responsible for evaluating the performance and value, as well as deepening the relationship to find additional use cases and drive growth.During the onboarding project you will be responsible for:Defining and managing goals and milestones of the evaluation process.Fully understand the resources needs, dependencies, data flow.Building great relationships with customer project managers and working teams.Defining the R&R with the customer and Identiq teams.Understanding the customer project plan and timeline to complete the project.Providing strategic analysis and critical thinking as we keep growing our product offering and expand to new markets and industries.Developing a deep understanding of the payments, fraud, identity & trust industries and building relationships with key players in the space.The clients you will manage will be North American

Title: Commercial Counsel
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We’re looking for a driven Commercial Counsel to join our Finance team!Overwolf is revolutionizing the way people create and play games. With over 15B yearly downloads of in-game apps and mods, we empower over 95K creators to build gaming experiences that serve 31M gamers monthly.We're on a quest to turn "in-game creator" into a new profession and build the next generation of games.Ready to join the pack?Requirements:Bachelor's degree in law from a top universityValid certification/license to practice law4+ years experience either at a reputable law firm or as an in-house counselAbility to conduct research and have detailed oriented approachStrong negotiation skillsAbility to work independently and collaborativelyHighly motivated and reliableStrong organizational and interpersonal skillsEnglish - Native or full professional proficiencyExperience with other law types, such as compliance and/or corporate - AdvantageAbout Us:Overwolf is the world’s leading platform for in-game creators and gamers who build or consume user-generated content around their favorite games. We’re talking about some of the biggest AAA titles – games like Minecraft, League of Legends, World of Warcraft, PUBG, and Fortnite – to name a few.The way people create and play games worldwide is changing, and Overwolf is leading the revolution. We empower just about 100K creators to make the best games even better - giving them everything they need to create unique gaming experiences that serve more than 31M gamers monthly.Our mission is to turn in-game creation into a new profession and build the next generation of games. And we’re just getting started.Are you ready to join the pack and shape the future of gaming?Responsibilities:The Role:As Overwolf’s first in-house legal counsel, you’ll team up with our departments across the company, customers, suppliers, and partners as our go-to person for commercial contracts and legal advice. This role reports directly to our CFO.In this role, you will:Draft, review, negotiate and close various commercial contracts with Company’s international customers, suppliers, and partnersInteract with all other Company departments in Israel and with our subsidiaries abroadHandle IP matters, copyright, and trademark-related issuesExamine company documents and employment agreements for loopholesExamine and advise on business mergersEnsure compliance with various regulatory mattersWork and coordinate with local outside counsel as necessary

Title: HR Business Partner
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Weka is a fast-growing startup developing the world’s fastest and most scalable data platform. WEKA lives anywhere the data does, whether on-premises, in the public cloud, or in a hybrid environment, and was built from the ground up to meet the diverse needs of modern data workloads.At Weka, we are constantly putting our technology and ourselves to the test to solve today’s biggest data storage challenges while enabling heightened productivity.We currently enable Fortune500 companies to push the boundaries of what’s possible, achieve breakthrough innovations, and solve previously unsolvable problems. Want to join the ride?What makes a Wekkie?If you have a positive “can-do” attitude, a relentless curiosity about all things tech, and you thrive on pushing limits and breaking barriers, you’ll fit right in at Weka!We’re a super friendly bunch who support each other, promote best practices, and we always encourage collaboration and sharing ideas. Even on rainy days, our sunny spirits shine through. And as we grow, we’re inviting those who are like us to join in the fun!What you'll be doing:We are looking for a HR Business Partner to up our HR team. You will join our current HR BP and report to HR, Senior Director.Responsibilities of an HR Business PartnerCoaching and consulting employees about HR matters and provide advice where necessary Provide guidance on the creation and implementation of HR processes and policiesBe up-to-date on employment laws and regulations, as well as other legal requirements regarding people management, to help leaders ensure complianceHelping HR director to deal with organizational, people, and change-related issuesCollaborating with other HR team members on implementing innovative and inclusive HR processes Assisting in developing compensation and benefits strategyImplementing reward and recognition interventions to increase employee engagement Provide advice and suggestions for culture-related initiativesWorking together with HR director and team leaders if needed, to solve conflicts and help facilitate positive employee relations, maintain a good working environment, build morale, and decrease unwanted turnoverRequirements:1-3 years of experience as HR specialist/ Junior HR BP in startup companies Understanding of HR analytics techniquesFamiliarity with data collection methods, both quantitative and qualitativeFamiliarity with HRIS systems (such as Hibob)Excellent mentoring and relationship building skills Ability to empathize with othersExcellent written and verbal EnglishOther SkillsGreat communication and presentation skillsCollaborator and a team player - an inclusive mindset and ability to build great relationships at all levels of the organization.Holds analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, experience in using data to identify insights and trends that drive action and exercises solid judgment.'Can do' attitude and proactivity A good understanding of the many disciplines within HR, including diversity and inclusion, performance management, compensation and benefits, talent management, employee and union relations, etc. Good change management and project management capabilities

Title: Helpdesk Technician
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Atera is seeking a Helpdesk Technician who strives to work in a complex and ever-changing computing environment to join our ServiceDesk team. As a Helpdesk Technician, you will provide setup and maintenance of a complex technical infrastructure to effectively serve the entire organization, including installing, maintaining, deploying, and troubleshooting systems; responding promptly users' problems resolving them efficiently.Our ideal candidate has a strong technical orientation, is a creative problem-solver, a quick self-learner, a highly motivated individual seeking to advance in the field. Must also be a team player with a genuine willingness to assist, a strong commitment to given tasks, and have a great sense of humorResponsibilities: Provide IT support for the company infrastructure (hardware and software) Install, configure, upgrade and troubleshoot Microsoft Windows, macOS, and applications. First response for on-perm IT network and equipment issues Monitor system performance Implement onboarding process for new employees Maintain backups Support AV\Video conference rooms Follow procedures and maintain the IT systems documentation Provide after-hours support, and on-call when neededRequirements:Requirements: A minimum of 2 years experience as a Helpdesk Specialist in Windows & macOS oriented environment Experience with different hardware (Dell, HP, Lenovo etc.) Basic knowledge of shell scripting, APIs and integrations Familiarity with computer networking Ability to troubleshoot and solve problems independently Service-oriented and a team player Good written and spoken communication skills in EnglishAdvantages: Experience with networking equipment (routers, switches, firewalls, DNS/DHCP ) Familiarity with virtualization technologies Basic Windows administration experience Familiarity with Storage systems Familiarity with AteraSome Of Our BenefitsAtera is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time to learn from your teammates and contemporaries, time off to relax and recharge, community volunteer days, an annual budget to support your learning & growth, a company paid trip and lots more.More About AteraSmall and medium IT operators are the heroes behind the scenes supporting companies around the world. They care a lot for their clients (external or internal) and often work virtually 24/7. However, small and medium IT service providers have always been underserved.Atera was built for exactly that. With the vision to simplify and streamline the work of Managed Service Providers and IT professionals. To create something that saves them time, energy, and money. To free them from needing to constantly put out fires.That vision created the remote-first IT management software – enabling IT professionals to shift from reactive task takers to proactive problem solvers.Now operating from our beautiful offices on Rothchild in Tel Aviv, Atera is currently used by thousands and thousands of IT professionals all over the world (105+ countries).As we rapidly grow, our goal remains the same: to transform the IT industry with revolutionary technology, while creating one of the happiest and healthiest work environments in the world.

Title: Personal Assistant
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Chain Reaction designs and builds hardware that fuels disruptive blockchain technologies by accelerating compute performance. Our world class teams are transforming the future of data, creating the infrastructure that will power the next generation of secure, scalable, green computing. The main bottleneck in scaling cutting edge solutions in privacy tech, data-analysis and real-time computing is acceleration – existing hardware cannot keep up with data processing needs. Chain Reaction’s products reshape how data is processed and used on a global scale, and we’re looking for the brightest people to join us.About the Position:As A Personal Assistant you will help manage the many responsibilities of our CEO. We are looking for a proactive, independent, hard-working, fast learner who can drive execution and work in a fast-paced environment.Role and responsibilitiesCollaborate with multiple interfaces, including the CTO, other C-level executives, management level, and highly senior industry professionalsParticipate in management meetings, take minutes during meetings and follow-up on action itemsManage projects, both internal and externalResearch relevant topics and provide industry updates on the product landscapeHandle complex scheduling, including conferences and teleconferences, meeting coordination, and follow-up correspondenceSupport our CEO with daily administrative tasks, ensuring a smooth, efficient day-to-day flowManage travel, such as booking flights, hotels, and local transportation, and proactive schedule adjustmentsRequirements:Fast learning abilities, diligent, capable to take the initiative and perform well under pressureIn-depth organization, prioritization, and project management skillsFocused on efficiency, deliverables, and timelinesHigh-level competency with Microsoft Office SuiteExcellent verbal and written communications skills both in Hebrew and English.Experience in startups - advantageMBA or relevant Master’s degree - knowledgeable in business, marketing, and hi-tech - advantage

Title: Fraud Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Gett is on a mission to power global corporate ground transportation. We have built a product that enables the integration of multiple ground transportation providers on a single platform and that integrates with the back office systems of our corporate clients to provide a seamless travel experience to business travelers, while at the same time increasing transparency and control over ground transportation spend. Gett serves over a quarter of Fortune 500 companies in a market worth over $90bnThis is a great opportunity to join the Anti-fraud & Payment Global Operations team at Gett. As a Fraud Analyst you will be shoulder to shoulder to other team members fighting against fraud. This is a true detective role to investigate, catch and prevent fraudulent activities within Gett business.Responsibilities:Analyse users, rides, and payments data to find fraud patterns and anomalies.Chargebacks management.Create, review performance and edit anti-fraud rules.Process “Requests for information” to adhere to GDPR user rights.Serve as a focal point for all fraud and payments reporting and analysis matters.Keep, enhance and be accountable for anti-fraud and payments KPIs. Analyse payments with the various acquirers and route transactions accordingly to maximise acceptance rates at the minimum cost.Suggest and implement new measures to counter fraud: tools, rules, procedures, fraud rings detection, analysis, etc.Work closely with the global fraud operations manager and transaction monitoring team.Analyse user journey around payments and fraud to ensure minimum friction to the customer and minimum drop-off.Work in collaboration with other departments and units to solve fraud, payments service concerns for the best outcome of Gett.Requirements:2+ working experience in Analytics, Anti-Fraud or Payments.Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinkingStrong SQL knowledge.Experience in building statistical models.Experience in payments/ Fraud.Ability to perform under pressure in a fast-paced changing environment. Flexible thinking and ability to adjust and find solutions.Ability to work under tight deadlines.Strong stakeholder management skills.Excellent written & oral communication in English.Experience in building machine learning models - advantage.Experience in the ‘on-demand’ online industry - advantage.

Title: Research Associate – Protein Production
Location: Rehovot, Center District, Israel
Text: Emendo is developing a transformative gene editing technology to cure severe genetic diseases. We are looking for a highly motivated Research Associate to join our Bio-materials department. The successful candidate will take part in the development of our high throughput protein production process and support the company’s effort to discover, characterize and optimize Novel CRISPR nucleases.The environment is exciting, fast-paced and offers the opportunity to work at the frontier of Cell and Gene Therapy. If you seek a meaningful job and the chance to work with great colleagues using cutting edge science, Emendo is the place for you.This position is a full-time, lab-based employment.Responsibilities:Take part in improvement and operation of our HTP protein production platform.Independently design, execute and analyze experiments.Stay up to date with relevant scientific literature.Adhere to Lab Notebook guidelines regarding accurate documentation of protocols.Qualifications & Skills:MSc or higher degree in the fields of biochemistry, protein engineering, molecular biology, or a closely related field with Demonstrated experience in the followings:Experience in protein purification and separation methods.A working knowledge and practical experience with E. coli expression systems.Experience with high throughput processes (advantage).Familiarity with DoE strategies (advantage).Experience with ELISA assays (advantage)A motivated, responsible, and creative scientist with a strong attention to details and ability to work under pressure.A dedicated scientist with can-do approach and good social skills Ability to work independently as well as a part of a team.Fluent in English, both oral and written.Powered by JazzHRN0id1VVNrM

companyHands-on experience with HubSpot, Webflow, AmplitudeWorked in the audio/video/media industry

Title: QA Specialist
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Syqe is a med-tech company developing technologies that enable the precise delivery of a wide range of therapeutic molecules by inhalation. Utilizing its breakthrough technology, Syqe aims to relieve the suffering of as many patients as possible in the fastest possible way.As a QA Specialist at Syqe, you will need to work closely with our contracted manufacturer’s QA personnel, to support and consult on issues arising at the production line. In addition, you will be assisting the QA Manager at Syqe to control and manage the quality system via internal auditing, preparation of periodical data analysis, Management Reviews, control of deviations and non-conforming materials, and control of changes.ResponsibilitiesWork closely with our contracted manufacturer’s QA and Production on QA issues related to the production of Syqe products (The contracted manufacturer is located in the North of Israel).Be prepared to visit 2 times a month at the contracted manufacturer’s facility in the North (Tiberias).Excellent familiarity with ISO13485 standard (EU GMP – an advantage).Ensure that all products released by the subcontracting manufacturer comply with the company’s specifications and regulatory requirements.Work closely with Syqe medical engineers and the R&D team.Approval of changes related to Syqe’s product and equipment.Support risk management for Syqe’s product(s).Conduct batch release.Ensure validation processes are performed and documented.Review and assist with the reviewing of process validation protocols and reports.Control and manage non-conformities and deviations.Assist with investigations, root cause analysis, and risk analysis.Assist with follow-up on CAPA activities.Support other QA department’s functions as needed.Visit 2 times a month (minimum) the contracted manufacturer facility.Requirements:RequirementsA bachelor’s degree in a technical or scientific discipline is required3-5 years of experience in the management of quality assurance, in the Medical Device,Experience with quality management systems interactions and auditsUnderstanding of quality assurance in a regulated environmentExperience with R&D QA and with validation processesFamiliar with quality management standards and methodologies (ISO, GMP,)Fluent in English and Hebrew, and writing proficiency
Requirements: ['Work closely with our contracted manufacturer’s QA and Production on QA issues related to the production of Syqe products (The contracted manufacturer is located in the North of Israel).', 'Be prepared to visit 2 times a month at the contracted manufacturer’s facility in the North (Tiberias).', 'Excellent familiarity with ISO13485 standard (EU GMP – an advantage).', 'Ensure that all products released by the subcontracting manufacturer comply with the company’s specifications and regulatory requirements.', 'Work closely with Syqe medical engineers and the R&D team.', 'Approval of changes related to Syqe’s product and equipment.', 'Support risk management for Syqe’s product(s).', 'Conduct batch release.', 'Ensure validation processes are performed and documented.', 'Review and assist with the reviewing of process validation protocols and reports.', 'Control and manage non-conformities and deviations.', 'Assist with investigations, root cause analysis, and risk analysis.', 'Assist with follow-up on CAPA activities.', 'Support other QA department’s functions as needed.', 'Visit 2 times a month (minimum) the contracted manufacturer facility.', 'A bachelor’s degree in a technical or scientific discipline is required', '3-5 years of experience in the management of quality assurance, in the Medical Device,', 'Experience with quality management systems interactions and audits', 'Understanding of quality assurance in a regulated environment', 'Experience with R&D QA and with validation processes', 'Familiar with quality management standards and methodologies (ISO, GMP,)', 'Fluent in English and Hebrew, and writing proficiency']

Title: Quality Inspector
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Shopic is an AI start-up specializing in retail solutions and shopping experiences. Our technology turns any shopping cart into a smart cart. Powered by computer vision and data analytics, the cart lets shoppers grab the products they want and skip the checkout lines when they leave the store.We are based in Tel Aviv, deployed by major grocery chains worldwide, and employ some of the best minds in the AI sector. We’re looking for a passionate details-oriented Quality Inspector which loves tackling challenges.Our supply chain and manufacturing department is managing the hardware activities of the company end-to-end, from engineering and development to sourcing, production, quality control and logistics. We aim to streamline the entire process while keeping cost in mind.Requirements:A minimum of 2-3 years’ experience in a QC inspection at Sub-contractors site.High school diploma or equivalent qualification.Certification in quality control is preferred.Well knowledge with reading product work instruction and item drawing / blueprints.Excellent knowledge of MS Office.Strong understanding of quality control standards and testing techniques.Good team player who can work efficiently with minimal supervision.Responsabilities:Perform on-going quality assessments audit at all production flows, starting incoming materials receiving process up to final products shipment stage.Reject products and materials that fail to meet quality standards.Read drawing parts, product work instruction and quality specifications to understand the requirements of products and parts.Measure products and materials dimensions, implement product function test, and compare the final product to the specifications.Recommending on improvement steps at manufacturing process to ensure products quality standards.Quality document inspection report by completing detailed reports and performance records.Teach and training the production team about quality control concerns to improve product excellence.Project management in front of manufacturing facility in regard to production line testing equipment, fixtures and so on.
Requirements: ['A minimum of 2-3 years’ experience in a QC inspection at Sub-contractors site.', 'High school diploma or equivalent qualification.', 'Certification in quality control is preferred.', 'Well knowledge with reading product work instruction and item drawing / blueprints.', 'Excellent knowledge of MS Office.', 'Strong understanding of quality control standards and testing techniques.', 'Good team player who can work efficiently with minimal supervision.', 'Perform on-going quality assessments audit at all production flows, starting incoming materials receiving process up to final products shipment stage.', 'Reject products and materials that fail to meet quality standards.', 'Read drawing parts, product work instruction and quality specifications to understand the requirements of products and parts.', 'Measure products and materials dimensions, implement product function test, and compare the final product to the specifications.', 'Recommending on improvement steps at manufacturing process to ensure products quality standards.', 'Quality document inspection report by completing detailed reports and performance records.', 'Teach and training the production team about quality control concerns to improve product excellence.', 'Project management in front of manufacturing facility in regard to production line testing equipment, fixtures and so on.']

Title: Marketing Analyst
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Papaya Global is an established B2B tech unicorn in hypergrowth. We are on a mission to reimagine the payroll category with a game-changing, disruptive technology. Papaya Global is reinventing workforce management, global payroll and payroll payments to remove the friction of complexity and regulation create. Our automated platform helps companies hire, onboard, manage, and pay people in more than 160 countries. We don’t just cover the globe with our solution; we are global. We are comprised of people from different countries, different cultures, and different backgrounds. Diversity is our secret weapon.Papaya Global is looking for a Marketing Analyst who will join our growing Marketing team and take a key role in making Papaya Global's marketing practice more data-driven.Your mission will be to consolidate and leverage our data to propose new ideas, tell the story behind the numbers, and guide the Marketing department's decision-making by providing actionable insights to support the teams' KPIs.You will be responsible for:Owning all Marketing & Sales analytics aspects Analyzing all marketing activities and business results, including attribution, marketing pipeline, etc.Building dashboards and measuring KPIs using BI tools to improve Marketing's effectiveness and help us achieve our business goals.Data Visualization: Crate and optimize dashboards and reports, to allow data-driven business decisions that will support the company's growth and KPIs.Creating a validation process for the data sources and optimizing the data collection process to instantly flag issues with the data collected.Consolidating data from different sources to find connections and trends and assist decision-making by providing inputs to stakeholders.Identifying areas for improvement and making recommendations for new opportunities.Performing funnel analysis to understand the path prospects take through the funnel and find new opportunities using different breakdowns.Develop strong relationships and collaborate with cross-functional teams within the Marketing organization and across the company (Sales, Product, others) to create comprehensive conclusions and recommendations.Constantly being on the lookout for ways to improve efficiency and clarity and deliver better value to the organization.Requirements:3+ years experience in a Marketing/ Business/ Data Analyst or similar role.Experience reporting on B2B marketing and sales funnels, lead generation and nurturing, email marketing, sales metrics, and website analytics.Experience in working with various data sources.Proven experience in translating business processes and KPIs into meaningful dashboards, including measurements, while raising business questions.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a deep understanding of data structures and data architecture principles.Full working proficiency in English is a must.High attention to detail and proven ability to multitask.Proficient level of SQL – Must.Proficiency with data visualization tool (Tableau) - Must.Curious, independent, rigorous, and proactive kind of person.Experience working with Salesforce and HubSpot (Reporting & Dashboards).Experience in end-to-end analytic work: defining the question, gathering the data, and drawing business-relevant conclusionsCommunication & presentation capabilities – ability to tell compelling stories and explain complex issues in simple ways.

Title: Project Manager
Location: Givatayim, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: חברת abra מגייסת מנהל/ת פרויקטים לפעילות יישום אסטרטגיות.ניהול והובלת פרויקטים טכנולוגיים ועסקיים חוצי ארגון, משלב הייזום ועד שלב ההטמעהאחריות להגדרת צרכים עסקיים ותרגומם לדרישות פיתוח, בנייה והטמעה של תהליכים ארגוניים מורכביםליווי יישום והטמעה של הפרויקט עד למסירה ללקוחהתפקיד כולל עבודת ממשקים מרובה, פנימיים וחיצוניים מול לקוחות עסקיים, גורמי פיתוח, תשתיות, ספקים, שותפים עסקייםדרישות:ניסיון של 8 שנים בניהול פרויקטים מורכבים בארגון מטריציוני- חובהתואר ראשון- חובה, תואר ראשון בהנדסה תעשייה וניהול- יתרוןיכולות ניהול פרויקטים מקצה לקצה בסביבה עסקית משתנה ומורכבתהיכרות וניסיון בניהול פרויקטים טכנולוגים מורכבים בעולם הבנקאות ופיננסים- יתרון משמעותיכישורים אנליטיים מעולים ויכולת התבטאות טכנית/עסקית גבוהה באנגלית בכתב ובע"פכישורים בינאישיים מצוינים; יכולת עבודה עצמאית ובתנאי לחץ, הובלה והנעה של צוותי עבודהראייה מערכתית רחבה ואינטגרטיביתרקע בניהול פרויקטים בסביבה טכנולוגית

Title: Marketing Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Imagine your dream office... Now, try again. Mindspace is a rapidly growing global provider of inspiring flexible spaces for teams of all sizes. Our customer base includes blue-chip companies, enterprises, and SMBs, in 31 locations, 16 cities and 7 countries across Europe and the US.Who is the Marketing Manager?This role, reporting to the Marketing Lead, is responsible for Mindspace’s launch and ongoing marketing activities in various markets simultaneously, across physical locations and channels: online, offline, media, partnerships, community, etc.Your day at MindspaceYou will work with internal and external stakeholders to execute the marketing plans of the markets you are responsible for.You’ll also focus on analyzing and exploring the data, as well as connecting with the local sales and community teams, to learn and optimize local and global marketing efforts.You will be responsible for: Create a smart marketing plan, based on statistics, facts, insights, and experience, to maximize the ROI, generate leads that convert to tours for various Mindspace locations, - all geared to meet Mindspace sales goalsBuild a campaign plan based on research, budget, past experience, and local vendorsManage marketing efforts for Mindspace locations in order to keep high occupancy levelsPromote Mindspace’s brand in the countries we operate inManage market research and analysis and get marketing insights on new marketsIdentify, hire and manage local vendorsGenerate leads for Mindspace locations, offerings, and servicesLead launch activities for new locations and new offerings, including market analysis, messaging, launch plans, budgets, and executionAttract major ecosystem events to Mindspace locations and facilitiesDrive Mindspace’s presence at major conferences, trade shows, and startup eventsLead or oversee the creation of collateral for Mindspace’s offerings: presentations, campaigns, PRs, case studies, demos, videos, sales enablement tools, etc.Manage the ongoing marketing for operating sites globallyBuild metrics and refine them constantly in order to have a better prediction and insights on new markets as well as a measurement system to evaluate the successRequirements:Do you have the following experience? High level of English and Hebrew - MUST3 + years of relevant global marketing management experienceBachelor's degree in communications, public relations, journalism, marketing or related fieldExperience in online advertising and campaign managementExperience in press and media relations, and managing PR firms - an advantageExperience in both B2B and B2C marketing – an advantageExperience with CRMs such as Hubspot or SalesForce - a plusKnowledge and experience with digital marketing measurement models Critical Competencies for Success:You must be a great communicator with great presentation skills and a passion for public speakingYou’re an ace in execution, the one who can meet stressful deadlines You’re a self-starter, multi-tasking expert, and able to manage your schedule and tasks by priorities.You’re analytical and data-drivenA problem solver – you are a highly resourceful thinker who is able to provide insightful, innovative solutions to any problem. You’re proactive in finding solutions rather than get stuck on problems.You are a mover & shaker, with strong interpersonal skills, who adapts well to a dynamic and fast-paced environment.Using technology in your work is easy for you – including Windows, MS Office (and especially PowerPoint), Google apps, social network tools, task management tools, etc. Mastering a new tool takes you no time.You're a strong team player who is also capable to work independently in an effective manner.You're excited about Mindspace after doing your research on who we are and what we doPlease submit your application in English.
