Title: Controller
Location: Lod, Center District, Israel
Text: SysAid is a service automation company delivering software for organizations that want to get more done. Our SaaS ITSM (IT Service Management) and Asset Management solutions serve more than 5,000 customers across the globe. We do the heavy lifting for IT and anyone delivering services in the digital workspace by leveraging automation, analytics, and AI.We are looking for a Controller to join our finance team in Israel, reporting directly to the Director of Finance.As a controller, you will be overseeing the finance and accounting operations globally and supporting the preparation of the consolidated financial statements of the group. You will be a key part of building finance strategy, processes, reporting, and monitoring subsidiaries’ activities.About the role:Ensure the timely and accurate preparation of the monthly, quarterly, and annual consolidated financial close.Manage our global bookkeeping team, hands-on responsibility for the day-to-day finance operations (GL maintenance, reconciliations, payments, banks, cash flow).Ensure controls over financial reporting processes are in place and ensure company-wide compliance.Manage the day-to-day audit process including the preparation of Financial Statements and interactions with the external audit firm.Work closely with FP&A to manage the financial results of the businessPreparation of statutory financial statements and tax return reports for our Israeli and foreign subsidiaries.Manage Israeli and foreign tax filing processes.Manage the continued build-out of our accounting systems to support significant anticipated business scaleAssist with special projects and ad-hoc requests, as necessary.Requirements:C.P.A, from one of the big 4 (Hi-Tech sector- a plus).3-5 years of relevant experience in similar accounting/finance positions in global SAAS, Hi-Tech companies/ high-growth start-up environments.Experience and thorough knowledge of US GAAP.Knowledge and experience working with NetSuite / Priority ERP software or a similar system - big advantage.Team management experience – an advantage.High proficiency in English.Solid Microsoft Office skills, full proficiency in Excel.High integrity and work ethic.Team player with excellent interpersonal relations.Fast learner and independent.Proactive and well-organized.
Requirements: ['Ensure the timely and accurate preparation of the monthly, quarterly, and annual consolidated financial close.', 'Manage our global bookkeeping team, hands-on responsibility for the day-to-day finance operations (GL maintenance, reconciliations, payments, banks, cash flow).', 'Ensure controls over financial reporting processes are in place and ensure company-wide compliance.', 'Manage the day-to-day audit process including the preparation of Financial Statements and interactions with the external audit firm.', 'Work closely with FP&A to manage the financial results of the business', 'Preparation of statutory financial statements and tax return reports for our Israeli and foreign subsidiaries.', 'Manage Israeli and foreign tax filing processes.', 'Manage the continued build-out of our accounting systems to support significant anticipated business scale', 'Assist with special projects and ad-hoc requests, as necessary.', 'C.P.A, from one of the big 4 (Hi-Tech sector- a plus).', '3-5 years of relevant experience in similar accounting/finance positions in global SAAS, Hi-Tech companies/ high-growth start-up environments.', 'Experience and thorough knowledge of US GAAP.', 'Knowledge and experience working with NetSuite / Priority ERP software or a similar system - big advantage.', 'Team management experience – an advantage.', 'High proficiency in English.', 'Solid Microsoft Office skills, full proficiency in Excel.', 'High integrity and work ethic.', 'Team player with excellent interpersonal relations.', 'Fast learner and independent.', 'Proactive and well-organized.']

Title: Customer Success Expert
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are looking for a Customer Success Expert, specializing in the defense industry arena.As a Customer Success Expert, you will play a crucial role in advocating for customer’s needs, while promoting the company’s agenda:Understand the customer’s needs, develop partnerships, align expectations, and ensure a high customer satisfaction level. Lead and perform the implementation plans for our end users. Collaborate with internal departments: Programs, Engineering, QA, and Operations to provide a coherent and great customer experience (HW and SW). Collaborate with the account manager– daily/ weekly briefs to accommodate the customer’s needs while strategically promoting the company’s goals. Title: Junior Customer Success Engineer
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About The PositionIguazio is looking for a Data Engineer to be part of our all-star Customer Success Team, that spearheads the company's customer engagements, and play a critical role in our mission delivering a ground-breaking solution to the market.The Customer Success Team is responsible for enabling customers to build new data science applications they could only dream of, building batch and real-time data pipelines using serverless distributed frameworks.You can expect to drive Data Science Platform POCs for Data Scientists and their Data engineering teams, consult and implement data solutions within Tier1 enterprise customers.What You'll DoEngage directly with customers on data science automation at scale including data pipeline acceleration and optimizationWork closely with Data scientists and take part in data science tasksWork directly with Iguazio teams of Solution Architect, Sales, Product Management and R&D, feeding requirements and prioritiesEssential SkillsYou must be a fast thinker and executor, have great communication skills, patient, a people's person, sharp and details oriented.Does This Describe You? 1-2 years of experience with Python / Scala / Java / GO Coding - must1+ years of experience building solutions with the Big Data tools and frameworks such as Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra, NoSQL, etcExperience working with external clients as PS engineer/customer engagement and great communication skillsExperience with Cloud-Native and Cloud Data Services such as GCP, Azure or AWS (DynamoDB, Kinesis, EMR or RedShift) - advantageExperience with Docker, Kubernetes and serverless computing and architecture - an advantageExperience working closely with Data scientists - big advantageExperience working on Data science tasks and/or data science training / courses - big advantageAbout The CompanyData science is too important to today's enterprise to be held back by delays and inefficiencies.We're building a faster, easier, and smarter way for data science to flow seamlessly from raw idea to real-world impact. This is data science brought to life.Iguazio provides an MLOps (machine learning operations) platform which automates and accelerates the data science process, enabling the rollout of new AI services continuously across the enterprise. The company raised $72M from top financial and strategic VCs, is led by a team of serial entrepreneurs, and serves a diverse set of customers worldwide, ranging from technology companies such as NetApp, financial service companies like Payoneer and healthcare customers like the Sheba Medical Center.We're looking for top talent to help us continue our growth — and grow with us!
Requirements: ['Engage directly with customers on data science automation at scale including data pipeline acceleration and optimization', 'Work closely with Data scientists and take part in data science tasks', 'Work directly with Iguazio teams of Solution Architect, Sales, Product Management and R&D, feeding requirements and priorities', '1-2 years of experience with Python / Scala / Java / GO Coding - must', '1+ years of experience building solutions with the Big Data tools and frameworks such as Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra, NoSQL, etc', 'Experience working with external clients as PS engineer/customer engagement and great communication skills', 'Experience with Cloud-Native and Cloud Data Services such as GCP, Azure or AWS (DynamoDB, Kinesis, EMR or RedShift) - advantage', 'Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and serverless computing and architecture - an advantage', 'Experience working closely with Data scientists - big advantage', 'Experience working on Data science tasks and/or data science training / courses - big advantage']

Title: User Acquisition Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Communix is the biggest up-and-coming social gaming start-up and we're looking for a talented User Acquisition Manager.This is an opportunity to join a dynamic Marketing team and carry out end-to-end marketing campaigns. You’ll be expected to be data-driven and to be able to make challenging decisions regarding campaigns and creative.We're looking for a talented individual who has a holistic understanding of the mobile marketing ecosystem, analytical thinking, perfect execution, and communication habits.Requirements:1 year experience in mobile application User Acquisition in Facebook, Google Ads, Apple Searches, TikTok Ads, Snapchat, Ironsource, Applovin, UnityAds, Tapjoy, Fyber, DSP Media Buy, etc.Experience with SQL - A MUST!Data-driven approach and strong analytical skills are definiteGood understanding of building successful campaigns, 3rd-party mobile attribution tracking, and campaign optimization.Strong analytical abilities & interest in mobile marketing and an understanding of the mobile gaming industry is an assetProfound knowledge of MS-Office Products (Excel in particular).Fluent in English - both verbal and writtenResponsibilities:Track, report, and analyze user acquisition initiatives and campaignsDevelop content strategies that leverage existing marketing distribution channels such as email, push, and product features.Collaborate with the BI (Business Intelligence) and BA (Business Analysis) team(s) to measure and analyze data around the effectiveness of campaignsBuild and maintain relationships with external partners, publishers, and traffic sources to buy and negotiate ad traffic and ratesConduct market research to identify industry trends and growth opportunitiesData Analysis (Identifying trends, opportunities, discrepancies).Guide the creative team to create new concepts, and iterate based on the performance of the creativesHands-on management of large-scale advertising budgetsAdvantages:BA/B.Sc. In marketing, economics, statistics, or engineeringAn understanding of advanced data analysis, Tableau, and the mobile gaming space is a definite plus.Experience working in fast-paced environmentsGaming industry experience Proficient with the ASO (app store optimization) fundamentals and best practices

Title: Director of Product Management
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Snappy is looking for an experienced Director of Product Manager that will take ownership of delivering new products, features and improvements in a major product area. They will work closely with designers and R&D to write requirements, guide implementation, set timelines and track the outcomes of product releases. This is a great opportunity for a high-energy, design-minded team member to help build products used by the world's leading organizations.‍What will you be doing?Guide product development—from conception to launch—of new products, features and improvementsDefine, prioritize, and communicate short and long term product goalsDevelop an understanding of Snappy's customers by conducting research, data analysis, customer interviews, and usability testingCollect and create requirements for product changes based on feedback from Sales, Customer Success and your own researchPartner with engineers and designers to create extraordinary productsPartner with marketing and sales to launch new products and educate customersQualifications+3 years of leading high performance product management teams (3+ people)+8 years of product management experience in a fast-paced environmentBachelor's DegreeKeen product intuition and an eye for UI/UX design experience, with a desire to discover and fulfill the needs of usersGreat verbal and written communication skills that allow you to align with different teams across the organization, in Hebrew and EnglishA deep sense of ownership and commitment that enables you to take a product from ideation to launchBackground in consumer-facing apps preferredSnappy is an award winning, all-in-one gifting platform that helps companies reward their employees and customers - boosting loyalty and engagement through a fun and engaging digital experience. Snappy's gifting algorithm automates the selection and sending off personal gifts and messages at scale, and notifies recipients through fun and personalized digital unboxing experiences.We specialize in building recognition programs for all sorts of businesses - Amazon, Zoom, Salesforce, Microsoft, Uber, Deloitte and over 3000 more, Plus, we're growing everyday, if you want to get technical!We've seen firsthand that our experience boosts morale, improves performance, and (most importantly!) spreads joy.Snappy has its headquarters in New York and 300 employees in four countries (New York, Tel-Aviv, London, and Ukraine).
Requirements: ['Guide product development—from conception to launch—of new products, features and improvements', 'Define, prioritize, and communicate short and long term product goals', "Develop an understanding of Snappy's customers by conducting research, data analysis, customer interviews, and usability testing", 'Collect and create requirements for product changes based on feedback from Sales, Customer Success and your own research', 'Partner with engineers and designers to create extraordinary products', 'Partner with marketing and sales to launch new products and educate customers', '+3 years of leading high performance product management teams (3+ people)', '+8 years of product management experience in a fast-paced environment', "Bachelor's Degree", 'Keen product intuition and an eye for UI/UX design experience, with a desire to discover and fulfill the needs of users', 'Great verbal and written communication skills that allow you to align with different teams across the organization, in Hebrew and English', 'A deep sense of ownership and commitment that enables you to take a product from ideation to launch', 'Background in consumer-facing apps preferred']

Title: Customer Success Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Job OverviewThe Customer Success Manager is responsible for coordinating the launch activities of new clients, as well as with existing clients for new countries, categories or applications. They will work closely with the account leads and R&D to provide overall project management during the launch period, from green light through Go Live. The Customer Success Manager will be responsible for working with the client teams on communicating and gathering all materials, aligning decisions on configuration and documentation required to take a client live with Candex. This position will report to the Customer Success Sr. Director.Responsibilities And DutiesCoordinate the launch of clients including project management, technical coordination, training & communications plans. Identify, set up and hold meetings with various internal and external teams in order to progress the project. Oversee and address any support and/or technical issues associated with clients during this period. Identify product enhancements, improvements or expansions in order to meet the needs of Candex customers and create value for the organization and our clients prior to launch. Understanding of the company's products inside and out is essential. Responsible for assembling documentation for each client relevant to training, systems, information, settings, configurations, contacts, etc. Responsible for communication around timelines, project management & actions items. Capable of working hours Monday-Friday 11am-8pm with flexibility (friday can end early)QualificationsQualified candidates should possess strong interpersonal and organizational skills. They need to be highly organized and have meticulous attention to detail. They should also be excellent communicators both orally and in writing. They need to be capable of driving projects and timelines, while at the same time building relationships and establishing trust. Candidates will be self-motivated and self-directed.Core skills: Minimum: Bachelor's Degree Proficient in Google Suite and Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and PowerPointKnowledge of customer service practicesGreat at relationship buildingTechnical aptitude and ability to learn software applications and integrationsProject management Experience supervising othersAdvanced skills: Bachelor's or Advanced Degree preferred in areas such as Business, IT, Purchasing, FinanceKnowledge of technologies such as, IT networking, internet technologies, web servers and XMLKnowledge and/or experience with Purchasing systems and processes (Ariba, Coupa, SAP, Taulia, etc.)Knowledge and/or experience with Accounts Payable and Payment processes & software Experience with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software such as, SalesforceCertified Project Manager

Title: Community Associate
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: ReceptionistsAt Spaces, we call our receptionists Community Associates. Our customers come to us for an inspiring work environment. As one of our receptionists, you’ll help deliver it. How? By providing sparkling service. Going the extra mile. And making sure everyone who visits us feels totally at home.A typical day at SpacesYou arrive 15 minutes before your centre opens to make sure everything is ready to go. You make it your responsibility to order the first cappuccino of the day at the bar and make your round through the business club to make sure all lights are turned on and the place looks tidy.Slowly, the first members start to arrive and one of them asks you for the changed WiFi code. Afterwards, while digging through your emails, a guest walks in and says she’s coming to provide training in one of the meeting rooms. You check the meeting room agenda and notice that almost all of the meeting rooms will be occupied today. You take her to the right meeting room, but you find out that our catering partner forgot to put coffee in the room and make sure that this is still done.A bit later, a member asks you if his mail has already arrived; he’s expecting a really important letter. Later that morning, the mail comes in and you put it in the corresponding mailboxes – and send an email to the member that came by earlier, saying that his mail arrived and that it’s waiting for him in his mailbox.After a hectic morning, it’s time for lunch. You grab a homemade soup and a healthy salad together with your favourite colleagues in the restaurant.After lunch, you sit down with the Community Manager to discuss the organisation of next week’s summer event. However, he mentions that one of the members just had a baby. You take it upon yourself to organise an act of kindness from Spaces, and to congratulate the parents of the new-born. Once you’re done with ordering, a guest pops by to sign up for a membership. Because your Sales colleague isn’t available right now, you help the guest with the online registration. Once the registration is done, you immediately hook her up with a badge (and immediately arrange one for the new employee on the 4th floor who just emailed you as well).At 6:00pm, it’s time to gently ask the large group in meeting room 3 to wrap it up. Maybe they would like to join us for drinks at our weekly Friday drinks, or you direct them to that nice nearby restaurant you know so that they can grab a bite. Once the last people have left the building, and everything’s left behind nice and tidy, you head home to enjoy your eveningBring your personality to workYou Also Need To BeWe look for people who are sociable and outgoing and who can bring their own style to our fun, thriving work environment. Super customer-focused  A great team player  Someone who takes good care of their appearance  Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages Last but not leastOn Top Of a Competitive Salary Package We Offer An inspiring work environment with room for your ideas  Lots of social events you won’t want to miss  Training and development
Requirements: ['Super customer-focused', 'A great team player', 'Someone who takes good care of their appearance', 'Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages', 'An inspiring work environment with room for your ideas', 'Lots of social events you won’t want to miss', 'Training and development']

Title: Quality and Reliability Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: TriEye is the pioneer of SWIR sensing technology. Based on nanophotonic research, TriEye’s technology is disrupting the world of vision sensors for the automotive market along with other exciting applications.We are looking for some exceptional talent to join our product team as a Quality and Reliability Manager, to lead the quality function in the company and to ensure that all company products and services meet quality standards before they go to market.Requirements:Bachelor’s or higher degree in exact engineering, statistics or a related fieldAt least 5 years of proven experience in the roles of quality/reliability management in multidisciplinary high-tech company including experience of quality/reliability management of the product in mass productionExperience of work with manufacturing suppliers in far east including ChinaExperience with automotive quality/reliability/safety standards is a big advantageExperience with the products involving imaging, image processing and lasers is an advantage Quality control certification is an advantageExcellent attention to detailsFluent EnglishStrong interpersonal skills and teamworkYour Day to Day:Engage with customers and gather feedback about the required quality/reliability requirementsBe a contact point to the customers and prospective customers quality department. Provide support for and give presentations as required. Generate reliability reports for internal and customer use to clearly articulate the reliability of the products.Ensure that all necessary systems and procedures are in place to satisfy all customer requirements and audits of external certification bodies. Introduce new systems and procedures where appropriate Introduce the Quality Management System (QMS) and implement all relevant procedures to ensure compliance Ensure the product/company compliance to all the necessary quality standards including Automotive safety standards (ISO26262).Take responsibility for quality performance of key suppliers of Electronic Assemblies, Electromechanical and Mechanical parts/assemblies.Perform internal and supplier auditsEnsure products are designed with adherence to quality, reliability and safety standards. Engage with engineering to provide early assessment of the quality/reliability of new products that the company plans to introduce. Agree appropriate screening methods to ensure that unreliable product is not shipped to our customers.Evaluate the final output of products to determine their quality. Evaluate product recalls. Participate in investigations of accidents or incidents to determine their causes and contributing factors. Determine the appropriate corrective actions for each situation.Train others in all aspects of the quality system and application of procedures.Why should you be a TriEyoneer?:Timing is everything! You want to be a part of a fast-growing deep-tech company backed by industry leaders, as it enters a significant stage of global growth.Inspiring skill development by providing growth opportunitiesInterest in supporting TriEye’s mission to improve and save lives by making Short-Wave Infrared (SWIR) technology accessible to everyone. Harnessing the power of SWIR sensing to provide superior vision, enables access to mission-critical image data even in the most challenging visibility conditions. This is a unique opportunity to take an active part in building a world’s first technology. General statement:TriEye is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST - Dubai, UAE
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Location: Dubai, UAE (We provide visa sponsorship & relocation assistance)Starting salary of USD 60,000 per annum - 0% tax environmentAbout Cobblestone EnergyCobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading.We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. In doing so, we help to balance the electricity grid, lowering the cost to end consumers, and aiding the transition to a renewable future. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.At Cobblestone Energy, we are a diverse team of over 50 people from 20+ nationalities - we believe in hiring extraordinary talent from all around the world. Our flat organizational structure helps us in giving our team members complete ownership of the work and ensures ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people alongside constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways. With the right performance and potential, you could be managing the power desk for an entire country within eighteen months in your role. Come join our dream team!Cobblestone ValuesLifelong learning with continuous reflectionIndependent thinking through a meritocracy of ideasThe team is more important than the individualBeing the best in any market we enterHiring and keeping only the most effective peopleOthers must benefit from our existenceWhat We Offer In This RoleA full-time position on our Commercial teamCommitted and remarkably talented colleaguesHighly competitive compensation dependent on performanceAn exciting, challenging and fulfilling careerInvestment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in businessEquity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long termThe key to success of a winning trade can be found in the fluid processing of the latest relevant data. As a Junior Data Scientist, you have a key role in this process. The gathering, structuring, and using of the data into models to be able to translate it into usable information for the traders is an essential part along the chain.As a Junior Data Scientist your focus will be but not limited to:Developing deep understanding of the industry and delivering key insights by analysing dataForecasting different fundamentals such as wind power generation and demandResearching and implementing new trading strategiesBuilding and developing new or existing data infrastructureYour backgroundHaving basic programming skills, like for example Python, R or MATLAB,Strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or modellingExperience that demonstrates your team-oriented, innovative, and strategic working styles. Familiarity with data visualisation toolsPro-active and flexible work mentalityInterest in data-driven tradingFluency in English, both written and spoken. The Hiring ProcessAfter your application is evaluated, assessments will include psychometric tests, a trading simulation, research project and remote interviews. All the finalists will then be invited for final round of the recruitment process which is a one-week training program, the Commercial Training Program (CTP), at our Dubai office. We will cater for all relocation costs, including flights, tickets, accommodation, work visa paperwork, and related expenses.Those who pass the CTP will be offered a full-time role at Cobblestone Energy and join our 7-12 month long Commercial Development Programme (CDP). The CDP is a well-structured rotational programme giving you exposure to data science, trading, and analytics. In the CDP, you will work alongside our seasoned commercial team members, who will mentor you on the market fundamentals to help you develop potent analytical skills.

Title: Risk Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: There are 2 billion adults worldwide who don’t have a bank account. That’s close to 40% of the world’s adult population. 350 million of them live in Sub-Saharan Africa. They are hardworking, young, connected adults that lack access to the traditional banking system. Fido is changing that. We are empowering individuals and entrepreneurs to take advantage of opportunities in Africa.The latest innovation from Fido called Fido Score will shift power back to the people by empowering them to build and maintain a digital financial track record.We build consumer products powered by a magical cocktail of real-time mission-critical machine-learning models, behavioral psychology, and financial engineering. We promote meritocracy, act quickly, commit, and worship data.Ready for your next career move?Are you sharp, motivated, and purpose-driven? We are looking for youJoin us in our mission to make financial services accessible in Africa.What you will doRegularly monitor exposure to various credit risks applicable to our unique financial products/services, business jurisdictions and delivery channels, and provide root-cause, incident analysis and other periodic reports to management on trends and current exposure levels;Conduct research across public sources and develop new and innovative applications, models and frameworks for mitigating credit risks in existing/new products.Provide business insights share knowledge on existing products with other teams and stakeholders within the organization.Review and help in improving credit machine learning models in place, and implement new risk measurement systems.Strong collaboration with internal teams across the globe.Who you are3+ years of experience in a similar role for a financial institution (i.e banks, credit insurance firms, regulators, etc) - Prior experience in FinTech is an advantage.Hands-on experience in SQL - mustExperience in Python - AdvantageAdvanced understanding of financial concepts and products - mustStrong analytical skills and experience analyzing complex dataComfortable working with multidisciplinary teams (i.e. data, finance, product)B.Sc in exact sciences fields or B.A in economics, accounting or finance - mustM.Sc or MBA in one of the above fields - An advantage

Title: Vehicle Preparation Specialist
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: What To ExpectA Vehicle Preparation Specialist at Tesla is a key contributor to the delivery experience by ensuring the most efficient set up and vehicle flow for the local delivery operations. You will be an essential part of our delivery operation to efficiently get Tesla vehicles into the hands of our customers. This position is responsible for managing vehicle intake for all incoming vehicles arriving at the delivery location, including undertaking extensive vehicle inspection in order to identify any potential vehicle issues before organizing the vehicles into parking lots and delivery bays. It is crucial to communicate with local stakeholders, rectification team and delivery operations teams to prepare vehicles in time of the delivery appointment. We are looking for an individual that is reliable, possesses a high level of attention to detail, and who takes satisfaction in doing a great job.What You’ll DoPerform vehicle inspection, spot checks and quality control to ensure vehicles meet our Tesla standard before deliveryCoordinate with local Service and Body Repair teams, and follow-up on vehicles in repair statusesManage the vehicle lot and yard for optimum capacityTrack delivery schedules, prioritize, and manage time effectively to meet deadlinesEnter repair work in systems and track to completionCommunicate and coordinate with various teams that are involved in the vehicle preparation and delivery processesKeep track of inventory and reorder suppliesIdentify issues and escalate to management when neededClean vehicle exteriors and interiors in compliance with company standardsSupport team in ensuring an efficient flow of cleared vehicles to delivery baysPerform additional responsibilities as assigned to meet business needs What You’ll BringThrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment with multiple priorities while maintaining attention to detailExcellent problem-solving skills, and strong ability to take initiative and be proactivePossess an understanding of automotive techniques related to repair and servicing of vehiclesGood knowledge of MS OfficeAble to communicate, read, and write effectively in the English language, and other local languages if required

Title: Customer Engagement Operations
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are growing our diverse and super-charged Product Marketing team to support our continued growth and are looking for a passionate and enthusiastic Customer Engagement Ops to join us.As a Customer Engagement Ops, you will provide support and insight to ensure we follow a customer-centric approach and deliver a consistent customer experience across all touchpoints and at all stages of our customer journey. You will work under the direct guidance of our Product Engagement Manager to craft and implement in-app messaging, manage in-app feature launches, execute marketing research programs, evaluate, and recommend data-driven revisions.What makes you a good fit?You have the right mix of business, technical and content know-how. You’re a flexible, enthusiastic team player who is cross-functional and loves the thought of working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You are self-driven and can drive results with direct and cross-functional teams. You are analytical and can juggle multiple projects simultaneously. responsibilities :Collaboration with Product Marketing team to achieve product marketing strategyCreating and maintaining in-app guided flows, in-app messaging, and other user flowsAnalyzing data for optimization and improvement of the marketing efforts and work processesTroubleshooting to ensure the flows are functional with every major updateSatisfying the customer with our solution and the in-app support providedMulti-tasking several projects under tight deadlinesRequirements:Requirements2+ Years experience in project management in marketing (preferably in SAAS companies)Experience with product engagement tools (e.g., Appcues, Walkme, Intercom etc.)Familiarity with monitoring performance and optimizing impactA bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Information Technology/ Information Systems/Business administration)A great level of attention to detail and good work ethic; ability to remain focused on repetitive tasksAbility to work in a very fast-paced start-up environment with changing and evolving responsibilitiesExcellent communication skills and a problem-solving attitudeAbility to work independently and in cross departments teamFluent in English and Hebrew (both written and verbal)More About AteraSmall and medium IT operators are the heroes behind the scenes supporting companies around the world. They care a lot for their clients (external or internal) and often work virtually 24/7. However, small and medium IT service providers have always been underserved.Atera was built for exactly that. With the vision to simplify and streamline the work of Managed Service Providers and IT professionals. To create something that saves them time, energy, and money. To free them from needing to constantly put out fires.That vision created the remote-first IT management software – enabling IT professionals to shift from reactive task takers to proactive problem solvers.Now operating from our beautiful offices on Rothchild in Tel Aviv, Atera is currently used by thousands and thousands of IT professionals all over the world (105+ countries).As we rapidly grow, our goal remains the same: to transform the IT industry with revolutionary technology, while creating one of the happiest and healthiest work environments in the world.

Title: Import Coordinator
Location: Holon, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Job Location: HOLONCompany DescriptionFerrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella®, Tic Tac®, Ferrero Rocher®, Raffaello®, Kinder Bueno® and Kinder Surprise®. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in more than 50 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? 38,767 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them.Diversity StatementFerrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding.Main Responsibilities:Manage loading plans and shipments from production factoriesOrganize and plans day-to-day work of shipment requestsFollow-up shipment status in the customs and during transportManage products arrival data and coordinate with relevant stakeholdersWork with Customs Brokers to release shipments from customTrack deliveries, pickup goods and tracking receipt of goods to warehousesCoordinate daily arrival data internallyImport purchasing orders – open and controlDealing with new products approvals with Ministry of Health to ensure that all documentation is in order prior to shipmentWho we are looking for:Team player - great interpersonal skills, "can do" attitudeHigh ability to handle multiple priorities while being detail orientedHigh proficiency in English, both oral and in writingSupervisory And Leadership Experience PreferredExperience as Import coordinator – advantageKnowledge in Excel and ERP (SAP - an advantage)Working knowledge in the manufacturing industry- advantageKnowledge of Incoterms - advantageHow to be successful in the role and at Ferrero:Consumers, quality and care are at the heart of everything we do. So, to be successful at Ferrero, you’ll need to be just as consumer and product centric as we are - dedicated to crafting brilliant results for consumers around the world.

Title: Community Associate
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: ReceptionistsAt Spaces, we call our receptionists Community Associates. Our customers come to us for an inspiring work environment. As one of our receptionists, you’ll help deliver it. How? By providing sparkling service. Going the extra mile. And making sure everyone who visits us feels totally at home.A typical day at SpacesYou arrive 15 minutes before your centre opens to make sure everything is ready to go. You make it your responsibility to order the first cappuccino of the day at the bar and make your round through the business club to make sure all lights are turned on and the place looks tidy.Slowly, the first members start to arrive and one of them asks you for the changed WiFi code. Afterwards, while digging through your emails, a guest walks in and says she’s coming to provide training in one of the meeting rooms. You check the meeting room agenda and notice that almost all of the meeting rooms will be occupied today. You take her to the right meeting room, but you find out that our catering partner forgot to put coffee in the room and make sure that this is still done.A bit later, a member asks you if his mail has already arrived; he’s expecting a really important letter. Later that morning, the mail comes in and you put it in the corresponding mailboxes – and send an email to the member that came by earlier, saying that his mail arrived and that it’s waiting for him in his mailbox.After a hectic morning, it’s time for lunch. You grab a homemade soup and a healthy salad together with your favourite colleagues in the restaurant.After lunch, you sit down with the Community Manager to discuss the organisation of next week’s summer event. However, he mentions that one of the members just had a baby. You take it upon yourself to organise an act of kindness from Spaces, and to congratulate the parents of the new-born. Once you’re done with ordering, a guest pops by to sign up for a membership. Because your Sales colleague isn’t available right now, you help the guest with the online registration. Once the registration is done, you immediately hook her up with a badge (and immediately arrange one for the new employee on the 4th floor who just emailed you as well).At 6:00pm, it’s time to gently ask the large group in meeting room 3 to wrap it up. Maybe they would like to join us for drinks at our weekly Friday drinks, or you direct them to that nice nearby restaurant you know so that they can grab a bite. Once the last people have left the building, and everything’s left behind nice and tidy, you head home to enjoy your eveningBring your personality to workYou Also Need To BeWe look for people who are sociable and outgoing and who can bring their own style to our fun, thriving work environment. Super customer-focused  A great team player  Someone who takes good care of their appearance  Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages Last but not leastOn Top Of a Competitive Salary Package We Offer An inspiring work environment with room for your ideas  Lots of social events you won’t want to miss  Training and development
Requirements: ['Super customer-focused', 'A great team player', 'Someone who takes good care of their appearance', 'Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages', 'An inspiring work environment with room for your ideas', 'Lots of social events you won’t want to miss', 'Training and development']

Title: QA Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Flytrex is revolutionizing the food delivery industry by making drone delivery a reality. We are looking for an experienced QA engineer to join a fast-growing multidisciplinary team in our vibrant working environment in the center of Tel Aviv.As a QA Engineer at Flytrex, you will be part of the team in charge of the quality of the company’s products.This is a unique opportunity to work on the world’s leading drone delivery system and be a part of a revolution in the making.The role includes:Performing comprehensive QA planning and coordination for multiple projects from the design stage until delivery.Collaborating with internal teams (Product, R&D, Field Engineering) to identify system requirements and plan a coherent test plan accordingly.Planning & developing automated tests for various components of the Flytrex system.Managing, analyzing, and handling support tickets that arise from the customer’s end.Creating detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured ATP, STP & STRs.Improving the company's products’ reliability levels.Requirements:Curiosity and hunger for knowledge are a must.2-3 years of proven hands-on experience in manual software QA .Experience in writing test documentation (STP, STD, STR) .Experience in testing mobile applications in virtual and physical environments.Fluent in English - written and verbal .Independent, motivated self-learner, with meticulous attention to detail.Team player, highly organized with excellent people skills.

Text: Who we are:KAZUAR is a cyber-security start-up that offers a new game-changing solution for data and access security.Our products create self-contained, cryptographically isolated workspaces which provide cyber protection against the most sophisticated strategic risks to businesses and organizations.Our team of proactive, self-motivated, and diligent people with a creative and resourceful attitude who works well independently and as a team is expanding.We are looking for like-minded people to join us.Job DescriptionWe are currently hiring a hands-on IT Specialist to join our company as a single function to oversee all IT aspects in the Israeli office. Title: Head of Product, easyplant
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Mixtiles is a home design startup, our mission is to create homes people love. Today, home design is kind of boring!All companies make the same products, with slightly different styles and prices. Not us! We bring tech, design and engineering to the challengeWe started with the world's best way to put photos on walls. Then we got into art and built the world's best art service!And and now we are thrilled to introduce an exciting product that is helping people to fill their homes with beautiful long-living plants and improve the way we all live and breath.Meet easyplant - who we are?As part of our mission to make home design frictionless we understood that plants are the worst home design product that dies constantly. We believe this is an engineering issue and we forged our focus towards a mission to prevent plants from dying. Hence, we invested 2 years and developed a self-watering system that prevents plants from dying (no over water no under water). The adoption rates of the product in the market are just phenomenal and we are accelerating our activity constantly which is increasing our need for a top-notch Product Manager to take our product to the next level and drive the business growth.This is an amazing opportunity to join the core team of a new, promising startup, that operators under the umbrella of "Mixtiles", one of the top largest Israeli consumer companies.About The RoleDefine easyplant's strategic growth roadmap; establish a shared vision & roadmap of growth opportunities that will support our mission. Identify opportunities for growth around the whole user journey and work with hypotheses and experiments to understand our users better. Lead the ideation and execution of product changes that drive growth. Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of productsCommunicate details, updates and implementations across all stakeholders and teams with extreme attention-to-detailIdentifying new levers to help move key metricRequirements3-4 years of hands-on experience as a product designer leading consumer products Great understanding of UI/UX Possess natural abilities and entrepreneurial qualities - self-driven and feel comfortable motivating, leading, and making decisions without consensus. Strong execution capabilitiesStrong communication skills and have the ability to thoroughly explain the rationale of your decisionsExperience working with many stakeholders (Data, Dev, Marketing, Operations…)A fast learner, adaptive, and thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environmentAdvantageExperience with SQL or other programming languagesLove for Plants

Title: Director of Growth
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Tomorrow.io is strategically expanding its footprint in the weather and climate industry by hiring a Director of Growth for our enterprise business unit. With existing customers including JetBlue, the NFL, Ford, Uber and more, you will have momentum at your back with industry leaders already established as champions and advocates of Tomorrow.io. As the Director of Growth, you will set the direction and execute on our global GTM strategy to grow leads and pipeline in accordance with revenue growth targets.Director of Growth Will: Expand existing demand team to support our next stage of growthAssume ownership of target leads and pipeline goals within enterprise core verticalsLaunch active marketing campaigns targeting key accounts and personas Work across top, middle and bottom of the funnel for end-to-end lead nurturingImplement multi-touch prospect experiences both on and offline Grow outbound efforts via both ABM and paid marketing programsManage inbound marketing efforts through existing SEO and brand momentumImprove conversion rates via website and product led growth effortsCreate a consistent flow of campaigns with value-based content and ROIImprove and modify technology stack currently powering demand generationPartner with our customer team on account expansion opportunities Work alongside our SDR teams and sales reps to amplify coordinated lead generation effortsCollaborate with Tomorrow.io's senior leadershipWhat You Will Need:Proven leadership experience within the demand vertical Experience within a hyper-growth company and fast-paced environmentProven ability to successfully sync new technology and process to scale demand generation Working background and understanding of an Enterprise SaaS sales organization Scalable testing framework and analytical mindset Ability to harness differentiated creative and customized value propositions for target personasThe vision to convey a unique and compelling story for Tomorrow.io's brandExcellent leadership, communication, organizational and presentation skillsEfficient time management and problem-solving skillsCustomer-first mindset focused on unique value solving business challengesStrategic operational skills with the ability to also be creative in specific situations Understanding of how to adapt to an ever-changing technological landscapeSo if you interested in taking an already high growth company to the next level - this is the place for you! You will have full ownership end-to-end, a qualified team around you and full buy-in from the organization.If you have reached this point and you are super excited but not sure you check all the boxes - we still want to speak with you! Your passion is priceless. Other things can be learned.___________________________________________________________________________________________About tomorrow.io:Tomorrow.io is helping Countries, Businesses and Individuals better manage their Climate Security Challenges. Fully customizable to any industry impacted by the weather, customers around the world including Uber, Delta, Ford, National Grid and more use Tomorrow.io to dramatically improve operational efficiency. Tomorrow.io was built from the ground up to help teams predict the business impact of weather, streamline team communication and action plans, improve productivity, and optimize profit margins.Space: In case you have not heard, we are also going to space with our Operation Tomorrow Space initiative. We are building the first-of-its-kind proprietary satellites equipped with radar, and launching them into space to improve weather forecasting technology for everyone on Earth.How we roll: We work in an "one office" environment. We believe that magic happens when people work together. Together also includes Zoom meetings, flexible hours and unlimited vacation days. Your success is achieved by your impact and deliveries and not by the hours you put in. We believe in transparency and directness, putting work before ego and empathy. We grow fast and move faster but we always see people first. Each person has their own career growth path for we believe that the only way for the company to grow is if you grow.

Title: Director of Finance
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: At Wiz, we move quickly. We’ve set the record for the fastest first year revenue growth of any tech startup, the fastest company to acquire more than 25% of the Fortune 500 as customers, the fastest company to reach $1B (and then $6B) in valuation, and now the fastest-growing software company ever by going from $1M to $100M in ARR in just 18 months. Most importantly, we provide the fastest ROI of any security product – Wiz connects to the entire multi-cloud environment within 15 minutes and identifies the specific infiltration vectors that make clouds susceptible to a breach in under 24 hours so organizations of all sizes and industries can rapidly identify and remove the most critical risks in AWS, Azure, GCP, and Kubernetes. Join us as we help organizations create secure cloud environments that accelerate their businesses.SummaryWe'er looking for Director of Finance to join us in spreading the power of Wiz.What You’ll DoDirectly manage company's global financial controllers' team (part of it currently outsourced)Oversee all finance, accounting, payroll, tax and cash flow process in the company and its subsidiaries.Lead the process of period close process (monthly, quarterly, and annually) under US GAAP.Serve as main point of contact for banks, authorities, auditors, and tax advisors.Work cross-functionally to optimize business processAdministration of other finance related matters andWhat You’ll BringMinimum of 8+ years of experience leading finance process in a global high growth companyCPA, degree in accountingStrong US GAAP knowledgeExperience in Saas industry – significant advantageExperience with ERP, and NetsuiteEfficient and creative problem-solving skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced global company, meet tight deadlines and handle multiple prioritiesFluent EnglishIf your experience is close but doesn’t fulfill all requirements, please apply. Wiz is on a mission to build a special company. To achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring Wizards with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with Wiz's Privacy Policy.

Text: JustPlay.LOL is one of the fastest-growing game studios in Israel that develops 3D multiplayer online games and was recently acquired by Playtika. The company's highest-grossing game 1v1.LOL (Battle Royale third- person shooter game) has over 50 million downloads worldwide. Title: JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST - Dubai, UAE
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Location: Dubai, UAE (We provide visa sponsorship & relocation assistance)Starting salary of USD 60,000 per annum - 0% tax environmentAbout Cobblestone EnergyCobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading.We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. In doing so, we help to balance the electricity grid, lowering the cost to end consumers, and aiding the transition to a renewable future. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.At Cobblestone Energy, we are a diverse team of over 50 people from 20+ nationalities - we believe in hiring extraordinary talent from all around the world. Our flat organizational structure helps us in giving our team members complete ownership of the work and ensures ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people alongside constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways. With the right performance and potential, you could be managing the power desk for an entire country within eighteen months in your role. Come join our dream team!Cobblestone ValuesLifelong learning with continuous reflectionIndependent thinking through a meritocracy of ideasThe team is more important than the individualBeing the best in any market we enterHiring and keeping only the most effective peopleOthers must benefit from our existenceWhat We Offer In This RoleA full-time position on our Commercial teamCommitted and remarkably talented colleaguesHighly competitive compensation dependent on performanceAn exciting, challenging and fulfilling careerInvestment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in businessEquity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long termThe key to success of a winning trade can be found in the fluid processing of the latest relevant data. As a Junior Data Scientist, you have a key role in this process. The gathering, structuring, and using of the data into models to be able to translate it into usable information for the traders is an essential part along the chain.As a Junior Data Scientist your focus will be but not limited to:Developing deep understanding of the industry and delivering key insights by analysing dataForecasting different fundamentals such as wind power generation and demandResearching and implementing new trading strategiesBuilding and developing new or existing data infrastructureYour backgroundHaving basic programming skills, like for example Python, R or MATLAB,Strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or modellingExperience that demonstrates your team-oriented, innovative, and strategic working styles. Familiarity with data visualisation toolsPro-active and flexible work mentalityInterest in data-driven tradingFluency in English, both written and spoken. The Hiring ProcessAfter your application is evaluated, assessments will include psychometric tests, a trading simulation, research project and remote interviews. All the finalists will then be invited for final round of the recruitment process which is a one-week training program, the Commercial Training Program (CTP), at our Dubai office. We will cater for all relocation costs, including flights, tickets, accommodation, work visa paperwork, and related expenses.Those who pass the CTP will be offered a full-time role at Cobblestone Energy and join our 7-12 month long Commercial Development Programme (CDP). The CDP is a well-structured rotational programme giving you exposure to data science, trading, and analytics. In the CDP, you will work alongside our seasoned commercial team members, who will mentor you on the market fundamentals to help you develop potent analytical skills.

Title: Software Dev Engineer Intern
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONWe’re on the lookout for the curious, those who think big and want to define the world of tomorrow. At Amazon, you will grow into the high impact, visionary person you know you’re ready to be. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth.How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you’ll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow.If you’re insatiably curious and always want to learn more, then you’ve come to the right place.With us, you’ll get good at making fast decisions, taking calculated risks and fearlessly chasing excellence.As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to impact the evolution of Amazon technology as well as lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimization, scalability, and security – just to name a few.Key job responsibilitiesCollaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative products and services.Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.Ability to design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems.Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software.Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. For an update on your status, or to confirm your application was submitted successfully, please login to your candidate portal. Please note that Amazon works with a high volume of applicants. We appreciate your patience as we review applications for future Amazonians!Please include a grade sheet/academic transcript (in English) along with your CV in a single PDF when submitting your application.Basic QualificationsCurrently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of applicationAlthough no specific programming language is required – you should be familiar with the syntax of languages such as Java, C/C++, or PythonKnowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design, data structures, problem solving and complexity analysisPreferred QualificationsPrevious technical internship(s) if applicableExperience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databasesExperience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimizationAbility to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutionsAdept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractlyCompany - Amazon Data Services IsraelJob ID: A2238926
Requirements: ['Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative products and services.', 'Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.', 'Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.', 'Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.', 'Ability to design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems.', 'Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software.', 'Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of application', 'Although no specific programming language is required – you should be familiar with the syntax of languages such as Java, C/C++, or Python', 'Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design, data structures, problem solving and complexity analysis', 'Previous technical internship(s) if applicable', 'Experience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases', 'Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimization', 'Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions', 'Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly']

Title: מנהל פרויקטים עם רקע הבדיקות תוכנה

Text: חברת abra מגייסת מנהל פרויקט עם רקע בעולם הבדיקות תוכנה לפעילות BI& Developmentבמסגרת התפקיד: ניהול בודקי תוכנה, לנהל את המשימות, להניף דגלים כשצריך. להניע לפעולה, לשבת עם גופי הפיתוח, לעבוד עם ממשקים רבים. להציף בעיות ולוודא שנפתר. צריך לתת מענה בעולם הדיגיטלי ובתחום של תוכניות עבודה. Title: מנהל/ת חשבונות וחשב/ת שכר
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: לחברת סטארט אפ מצליחה דרוש/ה מנהל/ת חשבונות וחשב/ת שכר.התפקיד כולל:אחריות וניהול רישום ובקרה של ספרי החשבונות של החברהסגירה עד מאזן כולל הפרשות, התאמות, בדיקת שלמות וניהול ספר רכשהכנת משכורות, מענה לשאלות עובדים, בקרות ודוחות ניהוליים תמיכה בהכנת דוחות כספיים חודשיים, רבעוניים ושנתיים. תמיכה בהכנת דוחות ניהוליים ובקרותבקרה וביצוע תשלומים לספקים ונותני שירות תמיכה בהוצאת חשבוניות גבייה מלקוחות, בקרה ודוחות ניהולייםעבודה מול סוכן פנסיונידיווחים לרשויות המסהנהלת חשבונות סוג 3 וחשבות שכרמשרדי החברה נמצאים בתל אביב, מרחק הליכה של פחות מ5 דקות מתחנת הרכבת.Requirements:תעודת הנהלת חשבונות סוג 3ניסיון של לפחות 3 שנים כמנהל/ת חשבונות עד מאזן ניסיון כחשב/ת שכרשליטה מלאה באקסל (PIVOT, VLOOKUP)אנגלית ברמה גבוהה ניסיון בתוכנת Priority או דומה יכולת גבוהה להתמודדות עם משימות מרובות יכולת גבוהה לעבוד בצורה עצמאית יתרונות:ניסיון קודם בחברת הייטק ניסיון קודם כמנהל/ת חשבונות וחשב/ת שכר יחיד/ה בחברת סטארט אפ - יתרון משמעותיניסיון והוצאת חשבוניות וגבייה ועבודה מול לקוחות גלובליים
Requirements: ['אחריות וניהול רישום ובקרה של ספרי החשבונות של החברה', 'סגירה עד מאזן כולל הפרשות, התאמות, בדיקת שלמות וניהול ספר רכש', 'הכנת משכורות, מענה לשאלות עובדים, בקרות ודוחות ניהוליים', 'תמיכה בהכנת דוחות כספיים חודשיים, רבעוניים ושנתיים. תמיכה בהכנת דוחות ניהוליים ובקרות', 'בקרה וביצוע תשלומים לספקים ונותני שירות', 'תמיכה בהוצאת חשבוניות גבייה מלקוחות, בקרה ודוחות ניהוליים', 'עבודה מול סוכן פנסיוני', 'דיווחים לרשויות המסהנהלת חשבונות סוג 3 וחשבות שכר', 'תעודת הנהלת חשבונות סוג 3', 'ניסיון של לפחות 3 שנים כמנהל/ת חשבונות עד מאזן', 'ניסיון כחשב/ת שכר', 'שליטה מלאה באקסל (PIVOT, VLOOKUP)', 'אנגלית ברמה גבוהה', 'ניסיון בתוכנת Priority או דומה', 'יכולת גבוהה להתמודדות עם משימות מרובות', 'יכולת גבוהה לעבוד בצורה עצמאית', 'ניסיון קודם בחברת הייטק', 'ניסיון קודם כמנהל/ת חשבונות וחשב/ת שכר יחיד/ה בחברת סטארט אפ - יתרון משמעותי', 'ניסיון והוצאת חשבוניות וגבייה ועבודה מול לקוחות גלובליים']

Title: Financial Analyst - Financial and Valuation Advisory
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Business UnitFinancial and Valuation AdvisoryIndustryPV - Portfolio ValuationHoulihan Lokey (NYSE:HLI) is a global investment bank with expertise in valuation, mergers and acquisitions, capital markets, financial restructuring, and strategic consulting. The firm serves corporations, institutions, and governments worldwide with offices in the United States, Europe, the Middle East, and the Asia-Pacific region. Independent advice and intellectual rigor are hallmarks of the firm’s commitment to client success across its advisory services. Houlihan Lokey is ranked as the No. 1 global M&A fairness opinion advisor over the past 20 years according to Thomson Reuters.Financial Valuation Advisory Over the past 50 years, Houlihan Lokey has established one of the leading global valuation practices. We conduct over 1,000 discrete valuation assignments every year on behalf of a variety of clients including financial institutions, governments, financial sponsors, and companies. Clients seek out Houlihan Lokey for strategic advice on the hardest to value assets for a variety of ongoing activities or transactions.Houlihan Lokey’s Financial and Valuation Advisory Practice based in Tel Aviv is primarily focused on offering the following services:Portfolio Valuation: Preparing valuation reports utilized for financial reporting, tax, litigation and regulatory purposesValuation for Transaction-related Purposes: Independent valuation provided to key stakeholders in transaction processes including management, Independent board of directors, lenders, trustees and administratorsFairness Opinions: The provision of fairness opinions on various M&A and financial restructuring transactionsPortfolio Acquisition and Divestiture Services: Assisting alternative investors in the underwriting of large complex transactionsRestructuring Valuation Services: Assisting lenders, new money providers, debtors and other stakeholders in understanding the value of stressed and distressed assets in ongoing restructuring processes Scope Houlihan Lokey’s Financial and Valuation Advisory team is looking to hire a Financial Analyst to be based in our Tel Aviv office.As an Analyst in this team, you will be a fully integrated member of our engagement teams. You will work with a dedicated, highly talented staff of professionals who will give you broad exposure to many issues and concerns affecting businesses today.We offer a unique opportunity to work on a wealth of projects that provide exposure to various financial advisory challenges, including the valuation of complex businesses, securities, and transaction structures.ResponsibilitiesDevelop complex financial models and analyze financial statements, industry developments, acquisitions and divestitures, and various investment attributes of publicly traded and privately held companies.Support active engagements and participate in our firm’s marketing efforts.Assist in the preparation of materials for clients, conduct market, industry and company analyses.Review target company financial information and other data to identify: historical and projected financial and operating and commercial trends, quality of earnings, working capital and net debt considerations, and potential liabilities and risks which impact valuation and negotiation of the target company.QualificationsThe environment at Houlihan Lokey is collegial and entrepreneurial and, as such, rewards staff with substantial responsibility and interaction with senior-level professionals and clients. The ideal candidate thinks strategically, is motivated, detail oriented, creative, outgoing, and possesses strong quantitative skills.Basic QualificationsHave strong undergraduate qualifications or higher in a relevant degreeMinimum of one year of work experience at an accounting or valuation firm in a valuation capacity, or an investment bankKnowledge of key databases, e.g. Capital IQ, Bloomberg, Refinitiv and other equivalent data sources, including the ability to create templates and formulas to extract necessary data in an efficient mannerUnderstanding of financial statements analysis with the ability to work through key assumptions, implicit caveats, and limitationsStrong quantitative, financial and analytical skillsStrong qualitative and quantitative research and analytical abilitiesExcellent verbal and written communication skills in EnglishAn exceptional strong work ethicPreferred QualificationsExperience and proficiency in the valuation of stressed and distressed assetsExcellent Excel skills, including the ability to automate repetitive tasks using Excel’s native syntax, and to manipulate large datasets in an efficient mannerHave strong demonstrable experience in constructing and analyzing financial models; including knowledge of DCFs and LBOsExperience in conducting transaction related analysis and due diligenceAdvanced Hebrew language skills preferredAbility to work independently in a fast-paced environmentWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Requirements: ['Portfolio Valuation: Preparing valuation reports utilized for financial reporting, tax, litigation and regulatory purposes', 'Valuation for Transaction-related Purposes: Independent Title: Product Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: As a Product Manager at Zengo, you will gain a deep understanding of our customers, live the fast-moving dynamics of Crypto and distill it all into our product vision, strategy, and roadmap. As a result, you will play a critical role in bringing the next evolution of the Crypto economy to our users.We’re looking for someone with a passion for the industry, though work experience in the industry is not required. This role requires someone with a growth mindset, a passion for the craft of product management, and a very strong motivation to always be learning and challenged.We are unusually selective in our hiring process - if you have a proven track record of conceptualizing, building, and launching products and features for consumers at scale, and want to join a world-class team, we’d love to talk to you.Requirements:Deep understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and deliveryExperience as a consumer product managerDemonstrated success launching and growing productsExcellent communication skillsBachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experienceExtra creditWork experience in fintech with emphasis on payments Data Science, UX Design or crypto industry experienceOutstanding technical background
Requirements: ['Deep understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and delivery', 'Experience as a consumer product manager', 'Demonstrated success launching and growing products', 'Excellent communication skills', 'Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience', 'Work experience in fintech with emphasis on payments', 'Data Science, UX Design or crypto industry experience', 'Outstanding technical background']

Title: Midstream Analyst-1
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Advertise and market Chevron's products through activities such as brand management and developing campaigns and channel strategies. Responsible for allocating quantities of natural gas to export customers on a daily basis. Nominate all contractual data on a timely basis to the applicable customer or pipeline operator/transportation companies (midstream). Communicate between gas suppliers, pipelines operator and export customers to ensure that contractual nomination data is coordinated throughout the delivery chain. Coordinates for implementation of the contractually required customer processes and obligations. Prepare the monthly, quarterly, and annual invoice, volume management and reconciliation processes of the midstream contracts. Work with gas marketing personnel to validate daily, monthly, quarterly, and annual data. Optimizing sales to export customers while aligning with relevant internal and external stakeholders during routine gas day and during unplanned events. Tracks the movement of all physical gas sales to export customers and maintains spreadsheets and EC screens showing the contractual movements of gas. Works with suppliers, export customers and pipeline operators to monitor and minimize imbalances. Develops and cultivates favorable relationships with export customers and pipeline operators. Notify internal and external stakeholders of any pipelines maintenances and utilize other pipelines in order to optimize gas delivery during the maintenance periods. Backup to Gas Controllers manager.RequirementsBachelor’s degree. Significant related industry work experience may be substituted.Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in the natural gas industry is preferred.Demonstrated proficiency in spreadsheet development (Excel/Access)Fluent in Hebrew and EnglishExcellent communication (verbal and written) skillsBasic understanding of oil and gas exploration and production business-preferredDemonstrate work ethic, teamwork, leadership, and professional achievementAble to work in shifts at the Chevron office. (5 days a week – each shift 8 hrs Fr/Sat – on call) – will be reviewed and approved by HRWorking ConditionsNormal Office Environment (Hybrid).Chevron participates in E-Verify in certain locations as required by law.
Requirements: ['Responsible for allocating quantities of natural gas to export customers on a daily basis.', 'Nominate all contractual data on a timely basis to the applicable customer or pipeline operator/transportation companies (midstream).', 'Communicate between gas suppliers, pipelines operator and export customers to ensure that contractual nomination data is coordinated throughout the delivery chain.', 'Coordinates for implementation of the contractually required customer processes and obligations. Title: Senior Customer Successes Manager
Location: Holon, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: As a Senior Customer Success Manager, you will be making a HUGE impact on the company revenues. Actual experience in Ad-Tech is a MUST for this role. You will own the relationships and growth of our publishers, many of which are world class software companies, generating millions of dollars with CodeFuel search products, powered by Microsoft Bing.This is a very fast paced environment so we're looking for someone who can work under pressure, manage priorities, and meet/exceed deadlines. You should excel in both developing strategic relationships and in analyzing data. You will be trusted to manage and coordinate between cross-functional stakeholders, internally and externally, including Product, Sales, and Compliance teams, to facilitate timely launch of search related products .Job Responsibilities:Serve as primary point of contact for Codefuel’s publishers while building strong, long-lasting relationshipsAnalyze and optimize product performance by communicating details of campaign deploymentCreate presentations, forecasts and growth plans Identify upsell and growth opportunities and collaborate with sales to hit quarterly targets. Mobilize internal resources (Finance, Product, Legal, Compliance, Analytics, Sales) to deploy, optimize, and upsell web, software and mobile publishersKey Requirements:Minimum 2 years of Adtech experience in a client-facing, quota-carrying role- is a MUST!A combination of strong analytical and interpersonal skills Fluent English - written and spokenStrong knowledge of digital media KPIs such as CPC, CPM, monetization, analytics and measurementHigh attention to detailExperience in Tableau, SalesForce - an advantageBy pressing “Submit Application”, you agree and accept to ourPowered by JazzHRxEdvJlqNC3
