Title: Office Manager
Location: Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: At ironSource, we’re driven by people. ironSource is a place to grow personally and professionally by challenging yourself, bringing in new ideas, and simply daring to explore. We’re always looking for like-minded professionals to join our amazing team. Come grow with us! As an office manager, you will be an integral member of the reception team, the first point of contact for employees, guests, and partners, and responsible for fostering a positive and professional work environment. If you are a people person, organized, and a fast learner, we want you!Please note that this is a part time position, 3 full office days a week. Who are we?ironSource is a leading business platform that enables mobile content creators to prosper within the App Economy. App developers use ironSource's platform to turn their apps into successful, scalable businesses. What you will do:Greet guests, employees, and visitors at the reception deskDaily office organization & ongoing administrative support Direct assistance to managementManagement of vendors and record office expenses General operational supportManage supply of equipment, and support office maintenanceCoordinate activities within the organization and with external entities This is a Part-time position from our offices. the position requires 3 full working days a week.What you will need:A great team player and a people personService oriented, with a can-do approach Multitasker, adaptiveOrganized, with attention to detailsAble to work under pressureFamiliar with a wide range of office software, including google apps and ExcelFluent in English: reading, writing, conversationalProven work experience in similar roles - Advantage
Requirements: ['Greet guests, employees, and visitors at the reception desk', 'Daily office organization & ongoing administrative support', 'Direct assistance to management', 'Management of vendors and record office expenses', 'General operational support', 'Manage supply of equipment, and support office maintenance', 'Coordinate activities within the organization and with external entities', 'This is a Part-time position from our offices. the position requires 3 full working days a week.', 'A great team player and a people person', 'Service oriented, with a can-do approach', 'Multitasker, adaptive', 'Organized, with attention to details', 'Able to work under pressure', 'Familiar with a wide range of office software, including google apps and Excel', 'Fluent in English: reading, writing, conversational', 'Proven work experience in similar roles - Advantage']

Title: Data Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are looking for a hands-on, business-oriented and highly motivated Data Analyst to join our data analyst team. Our team is aimed to shape business decisions and provide data insights, via professional analytics, collaboration and creativity.As a data analyst, you’ll need to have in-depth understanding of the business, data and vast knowledge in SQL & Excel. You will be responsible for creating analysis, tools and reports to help the growth and success of our business.A perfect candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insights into business decisions.What you will do:Collaborate with various stakeholders in order to improve, grow and reach our business goals.Analyze large, complex data sets and translate it into effective and efficient action items.Execute quantitative analysis, reports, statistical models and more.Creation and development of automated tools to transform business needs into scalable and data driven solutions.Lead data and analytical focal point in different projects across business, product and R&D teams.What you will need:1+ years experience of analytical work, preferably for a web or mobile company, Online advertising industryExcellent SQL skills with experience in querying large, complex data sets - a mustExperience working with Microsoft ExcelPassionate about data with outstanding analytical & technical skillsMethodological approach for data together with the ability to present the data clearly and efficiently to support business decisions.Ability to manage multiple tasks and drive them to completionAbility to think critically when leading projects and take an initiative approach – a mustAbility to collaborate with colleagues and the ability to work autonomouslySelf-motivated and independentAdvantages:Knowledge of Python (or similar languages) for data manipulation & analysis.Experience working with big data in a high scale environment.Deep understanding of statistical significance, models and tools.
Requirements: ['Collaborate with various stakeholders in order to improve, grow and reach our business goals.', 'Analyze large, complex data sets and translate it into effective and efficient action items.', 'Execute quantitative analysis, reports, statistical models and more.', 'Creation and development of automated tools to transform business needs into scalable and data driven solutions.', 'Lead data and analytical focal point in different projects across business, product and R&D teams.', '1+ years experience of analytical work, preferably for a web or mobile company, Online advertising industry', 'Excellent SQL skills with experience in querying large, complex data sets - a must', 'Experience working with Microsoft Excel', 'Passionate about data with outstanding analytical & technical skills', 'Methodological approach for data together with the ability to present the data clearly and efficiently to support business decisions.', 'Ability to manage multiple tasks and drive them to completion', 'Ability to think critically when leading projects and take an initiative approach – a must', 'Ability to collaborate with colleagues and the ability to work autonomously', 'Self-motivated and independent', 'Knowledge of Python (or similar languages) for data manipulation & analysis.', 'Experience working with big data in a high scale environment.', 'Deep understanding of statistical significance, models and tools.']

Title: Partnership Manager (MENA)
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Who We Are And What We DoDeel is a global team that helps businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily. Deel consists of more than a thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 75 countries. Our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the Deel platform and our products for customers.Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. Our market-leading technology, expertise, and global team are crucial to the success of Deel’s platform. We deliver the best products and platform features in our space, enabling millions of jobs worldwide and connecting the global workforce with the best companies and opportunities.Why should you be part of Deel's success story?A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer dictate how companies hire because great talent lives everywhere. Deel sees a world without hiring borders and endless talent that pairs perfect candidates with great companies.We offer global teams all the tools they need to hire, onboard, manage, pay, and scale at full speed. We aim to foster a diverse global economy by building a generational platform that seamlessly connects companies with talent worldwide.There’s never been a more exciting time to join Deel — the market leader in international payroll and compliance.DutiesIdentifying organizations who Deel should form partnerships with and building partnerships with themClosing, managing, and enabling partners to successfully refer clients to DeelNurturing partnerships throughout their whole lifecycleIdeating, launching, and optimizing co-marketing campaigns (webinars, events, email, content sharing)Partnering with Marketing, Sales, and Operations to drive channel referral growthBuilding and maintaining the partnerships P&LRequirementsYou are proficient in spoken and written English and have strong research skillsYou have a way with words and can write email copy and sequence campaigns that activate partnersYou are adaptable and comfortable with a fast-paced environmentYou are an active relationship builder who can collaborate with internal and external teams to consistently improve processes and communication workflowsYou have a strong understanding of the professional service, venture capital, tech landscape and are well connectedWe’d especially love to speak with you ifYou have worked for an HR or FinTech companyYou've worked at a fast-growing startupYou have previously successfully worked in a remote & distributed teamYou have 4+ years of experience in any form of sales/partnership roleTotal RewardsOur workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.At Deel, you’ll enjoy:A laptop required for this position will be delivered to your door, plus items of your choice from a selection of remote-working equipment available in your region (to be ordered through our service provider)Stock grant opportunities for new hires, promotions, performance, and refreshFlexible Paid Time OffParental leave$100 per month Health and Wellness budget$30 per month Learning and Development budgetChoose where you work with FlexWork. Work from your home, the beach, a Deel office, or the WeWork global membership program.At Deel, we're an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: PMO מערכות מידע
Location: Holon, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: חברת abra (לשעבר אורנטק) מגייסת pmo עם ניסיון בפרויקטי מעבר לוגיסטי עם היבט טכנולוגי במערכות. מעקב אחר פרוייקט ותתי-פרוייקטים בעולמות התשתיות ומערכות המידע חקר ומיפוי צרכים ארגוניים/תפעוליים הקשורים לפרוייקט ותרגום לגורמים הבקרה השונים יכולת הובלה גבוהה של ממשקים מטריציוניים. דיווחים שוטפים ברמת חטיבות והנהלה תחזוקה שוטפת של מפת הפרוייקט בארגון – תכנון מול ביצועRequirements:מי מתאים לנו ?PMO עם ניסיון בהובלת פרויקטי מעבר לוגיסטי עם היבט טכנולוגי במערכות. יכולת התנסחות גבוהה בכתב ובע"פתואר בהנדסת תעשיה וניהול יכולת בין אישית מעולה יכולת ניתוח נתונים, מעקב, בניית גאנטים ועמידה בלוחות זמנים של אבני דרך שנקבעושליטה בכלי OFFICE ו/או מערכות לניהול ומעקב פרוייקטים
Requirements: ['מעקב אחר פרוייקט ותתי-פרוייקטים בעולמות התשתיות ומערכות המידע', 'חקר ומיפוי צרכים ארגוניים/תפעוליים הקשורים לפרוייקט ותרגום לגורמים הבקרה השונים', 'יכולת הובלה גבוהה של ממשקים מטריציוניים.', 'דיווחים שוטפים ברמת חטיבות והנהלה', 'תחזוקה שוטפת של מפת הפרוייקט בארגון – תכנון מול ביצוע', 'PMO עם ניסיון בהובלת פרויקטי מעבר לוגיסטי עם היבט טכנולוגי במערכות.', 'יכולת התנסחות גבוהה בכתב ובע"פ', 'תואר בהנדסת תעשיה וניהול', 'יכולת בין אישית מעולה', 'יכולת ניתוח נתונים, מעקב, בניית גאנטים ועמידה בלוחות זמנים של אבני דרך שנקבעו', 'שליטה בכלי OFFICE ו/או מערכות לניהול ומעקב פרוייקטים']

Title: Internal Communications Leader
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: SolarEdge is a top global leader, creating smart energy solutions. By leveraging world-class engineering capabilities, and with a relentless focus on innovation, SolarEdge creates smart energy solutions that power our lives and drive future progress.We are looking for an exceptional Internal Communications Leader who will bring in story-telling, communications, employee engagement, and strategies to cascade our goals and messages. Communications approaches should be innovative to build ongoing engagement across all company, driving collaboration and interaction. The ideal candidate will be a candidate who excels at building bridges, deliver consistent messaging, and communicating in a sharp and creative way.What will you do?Lead the ICOM strategy and execution: Develop, shape, and execute an internal communication strategy that drives employee engagement and organizational alignment of SolarEdge.Be responsible for the EVP Implantation in the organization.Build Icom for unique critical populations – focus on R&D, HR, Business aligned with the SolarEdge culture.Simplify complex business information and produce engaging and effective content in a variety of styles and formats for multiple channels at the global, regional, and site levels.Ensure organizational initiatives and projects are successfully communicated to employees and stakeholdersPlan, edit, and write content for a variety of internal communications mediums, such as a staff intranet, monthly magazine, or regular email bulletin. You may also be required to work on the layout of content.Ensure internal communication messages are consistent with external communication messagesSelect effective tools, mediums, and technologies for message delivery in alignment with communication strategy.Act as program manager for all communications initiatives.Provide internal communication guidelines across businesses units around important messages and SolarEdge goals.Required Skills/Experience5-10 years of overall experience in corporate communications, PR, or marketing with a focus on internal communications. Excellent native English language verbal and written communication skills.Proven experience in corporate writing and communications experience.Experience with a variety of communications techniques.Social media experience is a must and a focus.The passion of Storytelling.Creative thinking.Strategic communications planning.Social and multimedia communications approach (written, video & animation, blogging, social).Demonstrated ability to operate both strategically & execute tactically as required.Experience with Icom inside a business.
Requirements: ['Lead the ICOM strategy and execution: Develop, shape, and execute an internal communication strategy that drives employee engagement and organizational alignment of SolarEdge.', 'Be responsible for the EVP Implantation in the organization.', 'Build Icom for unique critical populations – focus on R&D, HR, Business aligned with the SolarEdge culture.', 'Simplify complex business information and produce engaging and effective content in a variety of styles and formats for multiple channels at the global, regional, and site levels.', 'Ensure organizational initiatives and projects are successfully communicated to employees and stakeholders', 'Plan, edit, and write content for a variety of internal communications mediums, such as a staff intranet, monthly magazine, or regular email bulletin. You may also be required to work on the layout of content.', 'Ensure internal communication messages are consistent with external communication messages', 'Select effective tools, mediums, and technologies for message delivery in alignment with communication strategy.', 'Act as program manager for all communications initiatives.', 'Provide internal communication guidelines across businesses units around important messages and SolarEdge goals.', '5-10 years of overall experience in corporate communications, PR, or marketing with a focus on internal communications.', 'Excellent native English language verbal and written communication skills.', 'Proven experience in corporate writing and communications experience.', 'Experience with a variety of communications techniques.', 'Social media experience is a must and a focus.', 'The passion of Storytelling.', 'Creative thinking.', 'Strategic communications planning.', 'Social and multimedia communications approach (written, video & animation, blogging, social).', 'Demonstrated ability to operate both strategically & execute tactically as required.', 'Experience with Icom inside a business.']

Title: VP Sales & Marketing
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: SuperCom is seeking an experienced leader to join our executive team as VP Sales & Marketing. We are looking for someone who can thrive in a results and performance-based culture and brings an exceptional combination of strategic understanding, drive, persistence, and execution. You will report to the CEO and lead the company’s sales and marketing department across all global regions and our 3 business units– IoT, Cyber and eGov.As part of this role, you will develop the company’s worldwide sales and marketing strategy, forecast sales volumes and oversee the department’s day-to-day activities.Responsibilities:Lead our global sales and marketing teams with set annual quotas and goals.Design and oversee marketing campaigns, including production of marketing collateral and messaging content.Influence, collaborate and work with cross-functional leaders, departments, and teams to develop and execute successful strategies.Monitor customer, market and competitor activity and provide feedback to company leadership team and other company functions.Coach, grow and develop employees on a regular basis to build a dynamic sales and marketing organization.Requirements: At least 15 years of sales experience with complex tech solutions and products. 5 years of experience managing a sales and marketing team. 5 years of experience in government sales to customers in North America and Europe. 5 years of experience in direct sales with a personal quota. Proven experience leading a company’s sales and marketing organization in a global setting with focus on North America and Europe. Experience with B2G sales relying heavily on public procurement processes. Experience in selling both directly and through partners (system integrators, channel partners, agents etc.). Successful experience building a go-to-market strategy and corporate sales plan. Proven success driving consistent revenue growth year-over-year. Experience with solutions consisting of both hardware and software - an advantage. Experience with public safety solutions - an advantage. Experience with cyber security products – an advantage. Great problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Flexible in a dynamic environment.
Requirements: ['Lead our global sales and marketing teams with set annual quotas and goals.', 'Design and oversee marketing campaigns, including production of marketing collateral and messaging content.', 'Influence, collaborate and work with cross-functional leaders, departments, and teams to develop and execute successful strategies.', 'Monitor customer, market and competitor activity and provide feedback to company leadership team and other company functions.', 'Coach, grow and develop employees on a regular basis to build a dynamic sales and marketing organization.', 'At least 15 years of sales experience with complex tech solutions and products.', '5 years of experience managing a sales and marketing team.', '5 years of experience in government sales to customers in North America and Europe.', '5 years of experience in direct sales with a personal quota.', 'Proven experience leading a company’s sales and marketing organization in a global setting with focus on North America and Europe.', 'Experience with B2G sales relying heavily on public procurement processes.', 'Experience in selling both directly and through partners (system integrators, channel partners, agents etc.).', 'Successful experience building a go-to-market strategy and corporate sales plan.', 'Proven success driving consistent revenue growth year-over-year.', 'Experience with solutions consisting of both hardware and software - an advantage.', 'Experience with public safety solutions - an advantage.', 'Experience with cyber security products – an advantage.', 'Great problem-solving skills.', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.', 'Flexible in a dynamic environment.']

Title: VP Product
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About SternumSternum is on a mission to “Secure the future of Things”. We are building the infrastructure of every smart device around us, from medical devices to routes to railway systems. We do that by breaking the boundaries of what is possible within the embedded/IoT edge device limits and bringing self-protection and instrumentation-based data visibility and analytics to any device, from any sector, at any stage of the product life cycle.Building a product that enterprises and security leaders NEED and developers LOVE, is what makes working at Sternum a unique mission that is shaping our future connected world.We are backed by the world’s most valued and innovative investors known for their world-shaping investments, a team of truly passionate, diversified, and talented people, and a patented, ground-breaking technology that is already deployed on mission-critical devices.If you love technology, are not afraid of breaking boundaries and building exceptional products that change industries, want to make a true impact, and love to be a part of an extraordinary team – come join us!Requirements:Ideal candidates will have:6+ years of experience as a VP Product Significant background in one or more of the following fields: cybersecurity, machine learning, data analysisProven presentation and customer-facing skillsProven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authorityExcellent teamwork skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong analytical skillsStrong organizational skillsProactive and independentProficiency in EnglishResponsibilities:Develop and shape strategy for cutting-edge technology, both on device and cloud platforms, that will allow real-time protection together with visibility and security to millions of mission-critical IoT devices all around the world.Lead, manage and mentor a team of product managers, developers, and related personnel.Work closely and collaboratively with technical engineers, UX/UI, and marketing teams on innovative solutions. Lead and participate in technical discussions and assessing technical trade-offs. Responsible of product lifecycle management from concept to launch of all productsUnderstand and analyze the IoT ecosystem, sectors, and competitive landscape as well as user needs and requirements in depth. Define the product vision and the roadmap to deliver, in accordance with the company's strategy.Own the product roadmap - Define and prioritize new products features, improve existing ones, and design them end-to-end, while always striving for the best user experiences.Define, represent and communicate product strategy to all stakeholders.Define pricing and competitive positioning for each product.Become the key evangelist of OT Security and participate in press activities, conferences, and discussions with thought leaders and market analysts.Advantages:﻿Join our awesome team if you’re:Intelligent, hard-working, curious individual, that loves to learn and explore.A detail-oriented person, who can see how to construct a huge building from small bricks and stones.
Requirements: ['6+ years of experience as a VP Product', 'Significant background in one or more of the following fields: cybersecurity, machine learning, data analysis', 'Proven presentation and customer-facing skills', 'Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority', 'Excellent teamwork skills', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills', 'Strong analytical skills', 'Strong organizational skills', 'Proactive and independent', 'Proficiency in English', 'Develop and shape strategy for cutting-edge technology, both on device and cloud platforms, that will allow real-time protection together with visibility and security to millions of mission-critical IoT devices all around the world.', 'Lead, manage and mentor a team of product managers, developers, and related personnel.', 'Work closely and collaboratively with technical engineers, UX/UI, and marketing teams on innovative solutions. Lead and participate in technical discussions and assessing technical trade-offs.', 'Responsible of product lifecycle management from concept to launch of all products', "Understand and analyze the IoT ecosystem, sectors, and competitive landscape as well as user needs and requirements in depth. Define the product vision and the roadmap to deliver, in accordance with the company's strategy.", 'Own the product roadmap - Define and prioritize new products features, improve existing ones, and design them end-to-end, while always striving for the best user experiences.', 'Define, represent and communicate product strategy to all stakeholders.', 'Define pricing and competitive positioning for each product.', 'Become the key evangelist of OT Security and participate in press activities, conferences, and discussions with thought leaders and market analysts.']

Title: Service Desk Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Atera is seeking a full time Service Desk Manager to lead a small team (2-3 members) of Service Desk techs in supporting computer systems and networks for the company’s employees. You will manage a team that solves technical IT and application problems, either over the phone or in person. The appropriate candidate will demonstrate the following at a high professional level: strong communication and customer service skills, excellent organizational skills and the ability to multitask.Responsibilities :Manage the team members’ personal queues, case backlog and ensure customer service is handled in a timely and accurate manner daily.Manage help desk team (Tier 1), evaluate the team's performance and provide feedbackEstablish and maintain strong relationships across teams and with staff/clientsManage critical escalations and situations within the teamProvide technical leadership - Train and support the teamImprove productivity by establishing best practices through the entire technical support processSupport the roll-out of new applications and hardwareBuild cross-organization IT related processes such as onboarding, offboarding, inventory & software management , etc.IT procurementRequirements:Requirements:Proven work experience as a global Helpdesk team leader for at least 1 yearMin. of 3 years prior experience as an IT support engineerAt least 3 years of proven experience in Active directory, Intunes, GSuite, Office 365, VPN, Printers, Personal computingKnowledge and experience in supporting development (R&D) teamsStrong knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating system’ Microsoft Office products,Knowledge & experience managing audio & video conference roomsProven record of designing and implementing cross-organization IT workflowsGood understanding of a “service business” and KPI’s (SLA, Response time, CSAT, etc.)Excellent communication and customer service skillsOutstanding time management skillsAbility to multitask across multiple projects and prioritize in a fast-paced environmentMore About AteraSmall and medium IT operators are the heroes behind the scenes supporting companies around the world. They care a lot for their clients (external or internal) and often work virtually 24/7. However, small and medium IT service providers have always been underserved.Atera was built for exactly that. With the vision to simplify and streamline the work of Managed Service Providers and IT professionals. To create something that saves them time, energy, and money. To free them from needing to constantly put out fires.That vision created the remote-first IT management software – enabling IT professionals to shift from reactive task takers to proactive problem solvers.Now operating from our beautiful offices on Rothchild in Tel Aviv, Atera is currently used by thousands and thousands of IT professionals all over the world (105+ countries).As we rapidly grow, our goal remains the same: to transform the IT industry with revolutionary technology, while creating one of the happiest and healthiest work environments in the world.
Requirements: ['Manage the team members’ personal queues, case backlog and ensure customer service is handled in a timely and accurate manner daily.', "Manage help desk team (Tier 1), evaluate the team's performance and provide feedback", 'Establish and maintain strong relationships across teams and with staff/clients', 'Manage critical escalations and situations within the team', 'Provide technical leadership - Train and support the team', 'Improve productivity by establishing best practices through the entire technical support process', 'Support the roll-out of new applications and hardware', 'Build cross-organization IT related processes such as onboarding, offboarding, inventory & software management , etc.', 'IT procurement', 'Proven work experience as a global Helpdesk team leader for at least 1 year', 'Min. of 3 years prior experience as an IT support engineer', 'At least 3 years of proven experience in Active directory, Intunes, GSuite, Office 365, VPN, Printers, Personal computing', 'Knowledge and experience in supporting development (R&D) teams', 'Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating system’ Microsoft Office products,', 'Knowledge & experience managing audio & video conference rooms', 'Proven record of designing and implementing cross-organization IT workflows', 'Good understanding of a “service business” and KPI’s (SLA, Response time, CSAT, etc.)', 'Excellent communication and customer service skills', 'Outstanding time management skills', 'Ability to multitask across multiple projects and prioritize in a fast-paced environment']

Title: Operations Support Associate
Location: Hod HaSharon, Center District, Israel
Text: What we are looking for:We are looking for an Operations Support Associate to process and follow up on shipments of TIPA’s compostable packaging with international warehouses, carriers, and manufacturers. In addition, the candidate will be managing the local warehouse and shipments, assisting with monitoring purchase-orders, and supporting the Operations team (including planning of assignments).What will you be doing? Assisting the Operations department’s missions, as needed. Monitoring open purchase-orders. Managing the local warehouses. Support of planning assignments. Communicate with international warehouses, carriers, manufacturers, purchase-orders. Correspond with drop/export/import carriers, to confirm shipping and logistics. Understanding of shipping methods, i.e; Air, Ground, Ocean, freight forwarders, courier companies, etc. Prepare export documentation. Update of the ERP system with shipment-status. Advise shipping information to the different departments like: Sales, Marketing. Negotiate shipping rates and schedules. Respond to customer shipping inquiries. Proactively track & trace worldwide shipments. Packing assistance.Requirements: Up to one year’s experience in a similar role, that includes most aspects, as mentioned above. Fluent English (speaking/reading/writing), & Hebrew. Knowledge of shipping documents. Knowledge of OFFICE suite, Excel. Mandatory: detail-oriented, organized, and a team-player, with excellent communication skills. Service oriented, planning and organization skills, and proactive. Experience in working on ERP information system (PRIORITY-preferred). Desire to learn. Excellent human relations. Ability to withstand pressure and intensive work.
Requirements: ['Assisting the Operations department’s missions, as needed.', 'Monitoring open purchase-orders.', 'Managing the local warehouses.', 'Support of planning assignments.', 'Communicate with international warehouses, carriers, manufacturers, purchase-orders.', 'Correspond with drop/export/import carriers, to confirm shipping and logistics.', 'Understanding of shipping methods, i.e; Air, Ground, Ocean, freight forwarders, courier companies, etc.', 'Prepare export documentation.', 'Update of the ERP system with shipment-status.', 'Advise shipping information to the different departments like: Sales, Marketing.', 'Negotiate shipping rates and schedules.', 'Respond to customer shipping inquiries.', 'Proactively track & trace worldwide shipments.', 'Packing assistance.', 'Up to one year’s experience in a similar role, that includes most aspects, as mentioned above.', 'Fluent English (speaking/reading/writing), & Hebrew.', 'Knowledge of shipping documents.', 'Knowledge of OFFICE suite, Excel.', 'Mandatory: detail-oriented, organized, and a team-player, with excellent communication skills.', 'Service oriented, planning and organization skills, and proactive.', 'Experience in working on ERP information system (PRIORITY-preferred).', 'Desire to learn.', 'Excellent human relations.', 'Ability to withstand pressure and intensive work.']

Title: Bookkeeper
Location: Hod HaSharon, Center District, Israel
Text: Open Position: BookkeeperProfiSea is a boutique DevOps and Cloud company.Our mission is to help our customers to create secured and cost-effective Cloud environments, maintain state-of-the-art CI-CD pipelines for Development and Operations, build immutable micro-services architecture and ensure reliability of the production site.We are looking for a Bookkeeper with analytical and organizational skills to join our fast growing company and to grow with us. You will drive day by day financial execution and assist with Executive Administration activities.What You'll DoLeading all bookkeeping aspects of the company including payments, invoices, income and receipts and entering data into accounting software or databases then filing hard copiesWorking with vendors to get, file and pay invoices Completing VAT returnsWorking with customers invoices and paymentsReconciliation bank accounts Managing employee expense claimsVerifying the accuracy of business accounts and alerting the Finance of errorsAssist to Finance Controller with administrative duties and preparing yearly accountsExecutive Administrative support (meetings coordination, vendors management and negotiation, purchasing)About YouAt least 5 years of bookkeeping experience (advantage to startup\high-tech companies).Bookkeeping certification diploma Type 03 or aboveDeep Knowledge and proven experience of Priority systemAcademic degree - an advantageAssociate's degree in Accounting, Finance or Economics – a huge advantageExcellent knowledge of general accounting principles.Able to review and understand a financial statement.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.Highly organized, responsible, accurate, and can work independentlyStrong Excel skillsFluent in Hebrew and Professional Working Knowledge of English Comfortable learning and adapting to new concepts and using new tools and grow with the role.What We OfferOpportunity to be part of a growing company and to grow with usGreat Salary and Compensation Package Work from homeBeing at the peak of DevOps and Cloud industryProfessional working environment, where you’d be an essential member of our companyWork with a team of fun and motivated professionalsFull-time or part-time positionInterested in more details? Don’t miss the boat. Reach out either via www.profisea.com, Michael@profisea.com or 054-7851267 to chat about this position.

Title: Capital Market Associate
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Our U.S. Securities Group is expanding!Gross & Co.’s Capital Markets Practice, including its U.S. securities group, is one of the leaders in Israel, consistently ranked at the highest level (Tier 1) by the various rating guides.We are looking for talented and professional lawyers who are looking to grow professionally and are highly expressive both orally and in writing.ResponsibilitiesThe practice includes ongoing representation of Israeli companies traded in the U.S. as well as the representation of both issuers and underwriters in initial and follow-on U.S. public offerings, SPAC transactions, cross-border rights offerings, PIPE transactions and other private offering, Regulation S offerings, exchange offers and tender offers. We advise Israeli companies traded in the U.S. with respect to their compliance with corporate law, securities law, Nasdaq/NYSE requirements as well as corporate governance requirements. Our representation includes companies traded only in the U.S. as well as companies dual listed in Israel and in the U.S. Qualifications - two years of U.S. capital markets experience  - fluency in English (written and spoken)- able to prioritize tasks.- attention to detailAll interested applicants please email your CV to jobs@gkh-law.com Gross & Co. is an equal opportunity employer. The position is intended for both women and men alike. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment.

Title: Product Analyst
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We’re looking for an experienced analyst to join our analytics team and work closely with our fast-growing product team. The Product Analyst will play a key role within the product team, taking an integral part across the product life-cycle in providing data insights to support effective decisions in: ideation and discovery, roadmap prioritization, product requirements definition, testing hypothesis, and features impact measurement and tracking.What You’ll Be DoingWork together with product managers and provide data-driven insights to support their decision makingDefine tests and metrics to assess the success of features, and determine necessary enhancementsDefine the analytical requirements of new features to support the company’s ability to measure success at launchMaintain in-depth knowledge of products, solutions, and company offeringsWork alongside product marketing, engineers, data science, sales, and other key stakeholders in the company, to drive product launches, feature rollouts, etc.Taking part in formulating the product vision and roadmapUsing data visualization tools to uncover the story and insights behind the numbersWhat You Should Be Bringing To The TableAt least 3 years of experience as a data analystStrong analytical and problem-solving skills at both the strategic and functional levelExperience in visualizing analyses, generating actionable insights and communicating them to various RnD and Business stakeholdersExcellent SQL knowledgeExcellent communication skills (in English as well)Experience in AI product or in marketing technology - advantageB.Sc in Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or equivalent – advantagePython coding skills - advantage

Text: סיוע בהטמעת מערכת לניהול פרויקטים בדיקת איכות תכוניות עבודה בחינה רוחבית של התקדמות הפרויקט באגף יהיה גם הטמעה של מערכות משלימות חישוב מדדים דיווח להנהלה על מצב הפרויקט בקרה של זמנים לקחת נתונים מהSAP לעדכן בMS PROJRCTRequirements: סיווג בתוקף- ייתרון משמעותי משרה מלאה 5 שנים ניסיון כPMO ( או 5 שנים ניסיון בתחום של הנדסת תעשיה וניהול)תואר בהנדסת תעשיה וניהול.חייב ניסיון מוכח ב Microsoft Project יתרון ניסיון בבניית תשתיות

Title: Payroll Manager, Israel
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Who We Are And What We DoDeel is a global team that helps businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily. Deel consists of more than a thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 75 countries. Our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the Deel platform and our products for customers.Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. Our market-leading technology, expertise, and global team are crucial to the success of Deel’s platform. We deliver the best products and platform features in our space, enabling millions of jobs worldwide and connecting the global workforce with the best companies and opportunities.Why should you be part of Deel's success story?A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer dictate how companies hire because great talent lives everywhere. Deel sees a world without hiring borders and endless talent that pairs perfect candidates with great companies.We offer global teams all the tools they need to hire, onboard, manage, pay, and scale at full speed. We aim to foster a diverse global economy by building a generational platform that seamlessly connects companies with talent worldwide.There’s never been a more exciting time to join Deel — the market leader in international payroll and compliance.We are looking for an expert in Israel Payroll who ready to join our global remote team.Full time roleRemote, must be in payroll country time zone (or adjacent)What You’ll Do At DeelEvaluate and select relevant software for running payrollEnsure accurate and timely execution of payroll in IsraelPrepare and reconcile internal payroll reports, ensuring compliance with local tax authoritiesOwn all critical local payroll processes - setting up involuntary deductions; maintaining and reconciling liability payments; and evaluating union duesSchedule payroll expenses collections and reconcile collections to expensesAssess and improve rapid growth processes and procedures, ensuring compliance.Stay informed of relevant local regulatory and policies changes, communicating key changes across teamsWork cross-functionally to provide expertise on local payroll mattersAnswer complex payroll related questions from employees Some Key QualificationsBachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, or a related field from an accredited institution3+ years payroll experience with experience in relevant countryStrong working knowledge of local regulations and policies related to payrollAbility to prioritize multiple tasks while meeting deadlines timely and accuratelyStrong verbal and written skills, to connect clients and align with various stakeholders Strong interpersonal skills, explaining complex issues at an understandable level Advanced knowledge of local payroll software solutionsIntermediate knowledge of Microsoft ExcelStrong EnglishTotal RewardsOur workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.At Deel, you’ll enjoy:A laptop required for this position will be delivered to your door, plus items of your choice from a selection of remote-working equipment available in your region (to be ordered through our service provider)Stock grant opportunities for new hires, promotions, performance, and refreshFlexible Paid Time OffParental leave$100 per month Health and Wellness budget$30 per month Learning and Development budgetChoose where you work with FlexWork. Work from your home, the beach, a Deel office, or the WeWork global membership program.At Deel, we're an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Legal Counsel
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About UsDive right in. Swim with our pod.At Orca, we believe that in the right environment and with the right team, talent has no boundaries. This team spirit, together with our drive to always aim high (because the cloud is the limit), have quickly earned us unicorn status and turned us into a global cloud security innovation leader. So if you're ready to join an amazing team of people who inspire each other every day, now is the time to find your place in our pod.We're looking for driven and talented people like you to join our R&D team and our mission to change the future of cloud security. At Orca, we're proud of what we do and we always aim high. This, together with our belief in the power of teamwork, has quickly turned us into a global cloud security innovation leader (and a unicorn). Ready to dive in and swim with our pod?Highlights: Fast growth: This company has momentum. It's THE opportune time to join Orca Security. Disruptive technology: Orca Security completely changed the way cloud is secured and is leading a new approach of how security solutions should be built. It's completely agentless and detects every important risk in the cloud environment down to the data layer. It's fast, simple, and complete. Well-capitalized: Total funding is almost $630MM in less than 24 months. CapitalG, Redpoint, GGV, YL Ventures, and SVCI. SVCI is a syndicate of CISOs who invested their own money after careful due diligence. Founded and led by 8 architects and executives from Check Point and quickly joined by many senior engineers from Palo Alto and Check Point. About The RoleOn a typical day you'll: Structure, draft, negotiate and review all types and aspects of commercial agreements, including EULAs, DPAs, Supplier Agreements,NDAs and others. Ensure compliance with data privacy and GDPR regulations. Create and maintain standard templates, business processes and internal policies to help scale the business. Provide legal advice and work closely with all our marketing, business development and sales divisions. About You2-3 years of experience in the commercial department of a leading law firm or a SaaS based hi-tech company. Experience in drafting, negotiating, and finalizing SaaS and services agreements. Pragmatic, business-minded attitude. Ability to work independently and prioritize competing tasks in a fast-paced environment. Excellent interpersonal skills and strategic thinking. Strong writing skills, analytical approach, attention to details, and organizational abilities. LLB degree or foreign equivalent and license to practice law in Israel. English - Full Professional Proficiency -MUST (conferencing, presenting, editing and day to day tasks are solely in English).

It's completely agentless and detects every important risk in the cloud environment down to the data layer. It's fast, simple, and complete.", 'Well-capitalized: Total funding is almost $630MM in less than 24 months. CapitalG, Redpoint, GGV, YL Ventures, and SVCI. Title: Marketing Manager

Title: Support Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About PayUPayU, a leading payment and Fintech company in 50+ high-growth markets throughout Asia, Central and Eastern Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa, part of Prosus group, one of the largest technology investors in the world is redefining the way people buy and sell online for our 300.000+ merchants and millions of consumers.As a leading online payment service provider, we deploy more than 400 payment methods and PCI-certified platforms to process approximately 6 million payments every single day.Thinking of becoming a PayUneer and you are curious to know more about us? Read more about the life in PayU hereAbout The RoleThe Support Engineer team addresses the end-to-end needs of our customers, from pre-sales and integration assistance to post-sales support and analytics.You’ll be part of our dedicated and dynamic team collaborating with other global groups across the company, including Engineering, Infrastructure, Product Management, Sales, and Account Management. As a team, we teach and motivate one another, aspiring to deliver the best quality of work internally and to our customers on a daily basis. You’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with international customers who use our payments platform, using your creativity, analytical skills, and perseverance to tackle problems ranging from the straightforward to the complex.We are looking for a Support Engineer who will be responsible for providing global first-class service.You will need to be familiar with the Payments ecosystem and our platform and learn our customer needs this is a full-time position that includes being on-call during nights and weekends.Excited yet? Continue reading to find out More about the role: What you’ll doAnswer clients’ API questions via multiple support channels. Provide client support and technical issue resolution via email and phone. Review customer inquiries and questions, acquire all relevant details, troubleshoot and resolve issues. Provide timely, efficient and professional follow-up to customers inquiries.Communicate directly with clients and management to coordinate issue resolution. Assist and initialize training materials and internal/customer-facing documentation. Rotate On-Call duty with other staff members (if necessary). Escalates incidents when necessary. Open and monitor incidents created with 3rd party providers.What are we looking for?At least 3 years experience as a Support Engineer and working with global customers.Experience with Help Desk ticketing system management, ticketing routing and maintaining a high level of service according to SLA and KPIs. Tech-savvy and strong technical capabilities.Experience with API calls, logs, and SQL. Ability to understand and troubleshoot system/API/applications flows and provide solutions. Ability to learn and support new platforms quickly, self-taught and self-reliance when finding solutions. Strong attention to detail in organization and process workflows. Excellent communication skills including verbal and written English - mother tongue is an advantage. Experience in the Payments industry - an advantage.What we offerCareer progression program.Wellbeing programs.Flexible program and hybrid way of working.Free subscription to an Internal Elearning platform with courses from Udemy, Coursera, and many others.Truly International Environment with almost 40 different cultures.An inclusive environment that listens to a diverse range of voices when making decisions.A positive, get-things-done workplace.A dynamic, constantly evolving space (change is par for the course – important you are comfortable with this)Ability to learn cutting-edge concepts and innovation in an agile start-up environment with a global scale.A democratic work environment where you can drive your outcomes.About us:At PayU, we are a global fintech investor and our vision is to build a world without financial borders where everyone can prosper. We give people in high-growth markets the financial services and products they need to thrive. Our expertise in 18 high-growth markets enables us to extend the reach of financial services. This drives everything we do, from investing in technology entrepreneurs, to offering credit to underserved individuals, to helping merchants buy, sell and operate online. Being part of Prosus, one of the largest technology investors in the world, gives us the presence and expertise to make a real impact. Find out more www.payu.comOur Commitment To Building A Diverse And Inclusive WorkforceAs a global and multi-cultural organization with varied ethnicities thriving across locations, we realize that our responsibility towards fulfilling the D&I commitment is huge. Therefore, we continuously strive to create a diverse, inclusive and safe environment, for all of our people, communities and customers. Our leaders are committed to create an inclusive work culture which enables transparency, flexibility and unbiased attention to each and every PayUneer so they can succeed, irrespective of gender, color or personal faith. An environment where every person feels they belong, that they are listened to, and where they are empowered to speak up. At PayU we have zero tolerance towards any form of prejudice whether a specific race, ethnicity, or of persons with disabilities or the LGBTQ communities.

Title: Document Controller
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of today and tomorrow. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses and driverless trains, as well as infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a truly global community of more than 75 000 people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact.Purpose of the Job As part of the document Control Team, implement Documentation Management within the Project organisation. Ensure the whole project documentation availability. Categorize technical and management documents produced for the Project in accordance with: Alstom Transport internal rules Project needs and Contract signed with the Customer relative to documentation management.Responsibilities Ensure the Project Documentation Management plan is produced and validated. Manage and implement the Project Documentation according to the rules defined in the Project Documentation Management Plan. Confirm that rules are understood and respected by every Project Management team member. Adapt and implement the Transport standard documentation structure to the Project. Make sure internal validation of documents is done before submittal to Customer. Manage the documentation delivery in due time to Customer, Alert the Project Management team about next milestones related to documentation issues. Follow Customer and stakeholders’ documentation status,Create and update the Project document templates, Deploy and manage the AT standard Project EDMS (Electronic Documentation Management System) with IT support, Ensure the Project documentation recording in the EDMS, Define and maintain project internal and external distribution list, Apply the translation of the documentation, Provide documentation reporting and indicators to Site Documentation Manager, Project Manager, Project Management team and Customer, Define and manage documents storage during Project life and documents archiving at the end of the Project, Ensure the role of EDMS Key User (if no Site EDMS key user) at project level: First level support to EDMS users, EDMS users list update, Training new users, request account creation to EDMS administration team, Perform REX and suggest improvements of the activity (process, organisation, EDMS). Manage Project Documentation Management Controller(s) if any. Equal opportunity statement: Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.

Title: Graphic Violence, Suicide & Self-Harm Researcher
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: The Graphic Violence, Suicide and Self-Harm Researcher will be responsible for processing large amounts of qualitative and quantitative data to reach valuable insights, for example, indicators of online threats, ways of distributing content, motivations, and trends.You will be expected to:Create daily intel reports for the company’s clients Be the “final stamp” for each deliverableBe on top of trends and developments in the field of suicide, self-harm and graphic violence worldwide Contribute to the internal knowledge databaseDetermine the team’s research efforts and assign tasks to analysts This position is ideal for someone who enjoys delving deep into research and writing high level English reports on such extreme topics.Requirements:Excellent research and writing abilities - making sense of data and “telling a story” in a compelling way Research experience of 2+ years in the academia, journalism or private sector - a must Experience in research/intelligence analysis in the field of graphic violence - big advantageGreat attention to detailsOrganized, motivated, great at cross-functional workAbility to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentOSINT experience – big advantageNative English speaker + additional languages – advantageEducation:M.A - a must PhD - big advantageAbout ActiveFence:ActiveFence is the leading tool stack for Trust & Safety teams, worldwide. By relying on ActiveFence’s end-to-end solution, Trust & Safety teams – of all sizes – can keep users safe from the widest spectrum of online harms, unwanted content, and malicious behavior, including child safety, disinformation, fraud, hate speech, terror, nudity, and more.Using cutting-edge AI and a team of world-class subject-matter experts to continuously collect, analyze, and contextualize data, ActiveFence ensures that in an ever-changing world, customers are always two steps ahead of bad actors. As a result, Trust & Safety teams can be proactive and provide maximum protection to users across a multitude of abuse areas, in 70+ languages.Backed by leading Silicon Valley investors such as CRV and Norwest, ActiveFence has raised $100M to date; employs 300 people worldwide, and has contributed to the online safety of billions of users across the globe.

Title: FP&A Specialist

Founded in 2010, Playtika was among the first to offer free-to-play social games on social networks and, shortly after, on mobile platforms. Headquartered in Herzliya, Israel, and guided by a mission to entertain the world through infinite ways to play, Playtika has offices worldwide and over 4,000 employees.Playtika is looking for a Financial Analyst to join our rapidly growing team.Requirements:B.A in Economics or similar2-3 years experience as Financial Analyst in a global companyAdvanced Excel and PowerPoint skillsA high level of EnglishHighly motivated individualInitiative and problem solverExcellent communication skillsAbility to work effectively independently & in a team environmentHigh degree of accuracy and attention to detailKnowledge in SAP Business One – an advantage Knowledge in EPM Oracle – an advantage Responsibilities:Analyzing Actual vs. Budget reports on a monthly basis and providing insightsReviewing and Analyzing P&L and organizational KPIsPreparing and presenting periodic financial summaries to senior managementPreparing and analyzing the monthly forecastBeing a business partner to key budget ownersParticipating in the annual budget planning processReviewing & approving new purchase orders and new budget demands globallyReviewing & approving invoices that exceed budgetWorking closely with multiple teams in Israel and abroad including accounting and bookkeeping departmentsTaking part in the month-end close process

Title: Junior Product Manager - Israel
Location: Modiin-Maccabim-Reut, Center District, Israel
Text: About EScribersEstablished in 2005 by court reporting professionals, eScribers has grown to become the leader in reporting and transcription services for courts and government agencies across the US and UK.Our company is private equity backed and growing rapidly worldwide, leading the court reporting market in technology innovations and client services. With customers across the US and UK, we currently hold offices in Phoenix, Virginia, Maryland, London, and Israel.At eScribers we value professionalism, innovative thinking, and collaboration and this is what guides us in all aspects of our day-to-day operations.Come be a part of our growth by joining our outstanding team of professionals!Job BriefWe are looking for a junior product manager that will be part of the eScribers R&D team while working closely with the operation group as the primary internal customers as well as with key external customers using eScribers products and services. The person who will be on-boarded to this role will be the primary liaising between the internal and external customers and the R&D teams while setting the vision and building the product's road map.As a Junior Product Manager, you will:Own the end-to-end product management space, including product strategy, roadmap, requirements collection and classification, tasks priorities, scope of releases and their timelinesInteract with customers to identify their pain points and partner with them to design software that meets their needs while leveraging your technical background and skillsManage complicated products in terms of functionality and performanceDescribe various use cases and create user storiesCompose product and technical documentation including product specifications, guidelines, manuals, info notes, newsletters and RFI/RFP responsesIdentify user pain points and drive product innovationManaging the backlog and prioritization with the R&D team and the product features requirements listRequirements: Native English speakerHighly motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and proactivelyStrong technical background, preferably some software development skills and familiarity with SQLExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsExperience in working with development teams and understanding technical business needsA high degree of curiosity and fearless attitude when it comes to learning new technologies and processes, ability to learn fastLove for problem-solving Team playerPrior experience in web applications end-to-end design and user experience - an advantagePrior managerial experience - an advantage

Title: Support Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About PayUPayU, a leading payment and Fintech company in 50+ high-growth markets throughout Asia, Central and Eastern Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa, part of Prosus group, one of the largest technology investors in the world is redefining the way people buy and sell online for our 300.000+ merchants and millions of consumers.As a leading online payment service provider, we deploy more than 400 payment methods and PCI-certified platforms to process approximately 6 million payments every single day.Thinking of becoming a PayUneer and you are curious to know more about us? Read more about the life in PayU hereAbout The RoleThe Support Engineer team addresses the end-to-end needs of our customers, from pre-sales and integration assistance to post-sales support and analytics.You’ll be part of our dedicated and dynamic team collaborating with other global groups across the company, including Engineering, Infrastructure, Product Management, Sales, and Account Management. As a team, we teach and motivate one another, aspiring to deliver the best quality of work internally and to our customers on a daily basis. You’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with international customers who use our payments platform, using your creativity, analytical skills, and perseverance to tackle problems ranging from the straightforward to the complex.We are looking for a Support Engineer who will be responsible for providing global first-class service.You will need to be familiar with the Payments ecosystem and our platform and learn our customer needs this is a full-time position that includes being on-call during nights and weekends.Excited yet? Continue reading to find out More about the role: What you’ll doAnswer clients’ API questions via multiple support channels. Provide client support and technical issue resolution via email and phone. Review customer inquiries and questions, acquire all relevant details, troubleshoot and resolve issues. Provide timely, efficient and professional follow-up to customers inquiries.Communicate directly with clients and management to coordinate issue resolution. Assist and initialize training materials and internal/customer-facing documentation. Rotate On-Call duty with other staff members (if necessary). Escalates incidents when necessary. Open and monitor incidents created with 3rd party providers.What are we looking for?At least 3 years experience as a Support Engineer and working with global customers.Experience with Help Desk ticketing system management, ticketing routing and maintaining a high level of service according to SLA and KPIs. Tech-savvy and strong technical capabilities.Experience with API calls, logs, and SQL. Ability to understand and troubleshoot system/API/applications flows and provide solutions. Ability to learn and support new platforms quickly, self-taught and self-reliance when finding solutions. Strong attention to detail in organization and process workflows. Excellent communication skills including verbal and written English - mother tongue is an advantage. Experience in the Payments industry - an advantage.What we offerCareer progression program.Wellbeing programs.Flexible program and hybrid way of working.Free subscription to an Internal Elearning platform with courses from Udemy, Coursera, and many others.Truly International Environment with almost 40 different cultures.An inclusive environment that listens to a diverse range of voices when making decisions.A positive, get-things-done workplace.A dynamic, constantly evolving space (change is par for the course – important you are comfortable with this)Ability to learn cutting-edge concepts and innovation in an agile start-up environment with a global scale.A democratic work environment where you can drive your outcomes.About us:At PayU, we are a global fintech investor and our vision is to build a world without financial borders where everyone can prosper. We give people in high-growth markets the financial services and products they need to thrive. Our expertise in 18 high-growth markets enables us to extend the reach of financial services. This drives everything we do, from investing in technology entrepreneurs, to offering credit to underserved individuals, to helping merchants buy, sell and operate online. Being part of Prosus, one of the largest technology investors in the world, gives us the presence and expertise to make a real impact. Find out more www.payu.comOur Commitment To Building A Diverse And Inclusive WorkforceAs a global and multi-cultural organization with varied ethnicities thriving across locations, we realize that our responsibility towards fulfilling the D&I commitment is huge. Therefore, we continuously strive to create a diverse, inclusive and safe environment, for all of our people, communities and customers. Our leaders are committed to create an inclusive work culture which enables transparency, flexibility and unbiased attention to each and every PayUneer so they can succeed, irrespective of gender, color or personal faith. An environment where every person feels they belong, that they are listened to, and where they are empowered to speak up. At PayU we have zero tolerance towards any form of prejudice whether a specific race, ethnicity, or of persons with disabilities or the LGBTQ communities.

Title: Graphic Violence, Suicide & Self-Harm Researcher
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: The Graphic Violence, Suicide and Self-Harm Researcher will be responsible for processing large amounts of qualitative and quantitative data to reach valuable insights, for example, indicators of online threats, ways of distributing content, motivations, and trends.You will be expected to:Create daily intel reports for the company’s clients Be the “final stamp” for each deliverableBe on top of trends and developments in the field of suicide, self-harm and graphic violence worldwide Contribute to the internal knowledge databaseDetermine the team’s research efforts and assign tasks to analysts This position is ideal for someone who enjoys delving deep into research and writing high level English reports on such extreme topics.Requirements:Excellent research and writing abilities - making sense of data and “telling a story” in a compelling way Research experience of 2+ years in the academia, journalism or private sector - a must Experience in research/intelligence analysis in the field of graphic violence - big advantageGreat attention to detailsOrganized, motivated, great at cross-functional workAbility to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentOSINT experience – big advantageNative English speaker + additional languages – advantageEducation:M.A - a must PhD - big advantageAbout ActiveFence:ActiveFence is the leading tool stack for Trust & Safety teams, worldwide. By relying on ActiveFence’s end-to-end solution, Trust & Safety teams – of all sizes – can keep users safe from the widest spectrum of online harms, unwanted content, and malicious behavior, including child safety, disinformation, fraud, hate speech, terror, nudity, and more.Using cutting-edge AI and a team of world-class subject-matter experts to continuously collect, analyze, and contextualize data, ActiveFence ensures that in an ever-changing world, customers are always two steps ahead of bad actors. As a result, Trust & Safety teams can be proactive and provide maximum protection to users across a multitude of abuse areas, in 70+ languages.Backed by leading Silicon Valley investors such as CRV and Norwest, ActiveFence has raised $100M to date; employs 300 people worldwide, and has contributed to the online safety of billions of users across the globe.

Title: Junior Product Manager - Israel
Location: Modiin-Maccabim-Reut, Center District, Israel
Text: About EScribersEstablished in 2005 by court reporting professionals, eScribers has grown to become the leader in reporting and transcription services for courts and government agencies across the US and UK.Our company is private equity backed and growing rapidly worldwide, leading the court reporting market in technology innovations and client services. With customers across the US and UK, we currently hold offices in Phoenix, Virginia, Maryland, London, and Israel.At eScribers we value professionalism, innovative thinking, and collaboration and this is what guides us in all aspects of our day-to-day operations.Come be a part of our growth by joining our outstanding team of professionals!Job BriefWe are looking for a junior product manager that will be part of the eScribers R&D team while working closely with the operation group as the primary internal customers as well as with key external customers using eScribers products and services. The person who will be on-boarded to this role will be the primary liaising between the internal and external customers and the R&D teams while setting the vision and building the product's road map.As a Junior Product Manager, you will:Own the end-to-end product management space, including product strategy, roadmap, requirements collection and classification, tasks priorities, scope of releases and their timelinesInteract with customers to identify their pain points and partner with them to design software that meets their needs while leveraging your technical background and skillsManage complicated products in terms of functionality and performanceDescribe various use cases and create user storiesCompose product and technical documentation including product specifications, guidelines, manuals, info notes, newsletters and RFI/RFP responsesIdentify user pain points and drive product innovationManaging the backlog and prioritization with the R&D team and the product features requirements listRequirements: Native English speakerHighly motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and proactivelyStrong technical background, preferably some software development skills and familiarity with SQLExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsExperience in working with development teams and understanding technical business needsA high degree of curiosity and fearless attitude when it comes to learning new technologies and processes, ability to learn fastLove for problem-solving Team playerPrior experience in web applications end-to-end design and user experience - an advantagePrior managerial experience - an advantage

Text: In a nutshell:vcita is seeking a talented and creative Product Manager to join the family!﻿Requirements:You have at least 3 years of experience as a PM, preferably of B2C or B2B2C productsYou have a good eye for design, a passion for designing frictionless user experienceYou are a fast learner, work well independently while thriving in cross-functional team environments. In your day-to-day, you'll be spending lots of time bouncing ideas off colleagues, troubleshooting, collecting feedback, and inspiring us to deliver our clients with the best business management tool out there.We're looking for someone who sparks excitement in others - someone who leads by example and works to create a strong and happy team around them.Responsibilities:You'll be joining one of vcita’s top product groups, conducting payment and scheduling products, to lead one of its squadsGather all feature requirements coming from customers, partners, company vision and technology gaps to build your product area roadmapCollaborate with our Product design, Development and Data teams to plan, design and implement new features in an Agile work environmentGain valuable insights into our clients' day-to-day & offer innovative solutions that will help them flourish﻿Create simple & easy to understand UX, and transform rough mocks into beautiful featuresUse dataBrainstorm with our Marketing, Partners, Sales and CS teams to define the go-to-market strategy & messaging

Our all-in-one platform makes starting a business affordable and accessible to everyone - we welcome more than 800k new business owners every month. Title: Data Scientist
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: At Diagnostic Robotics, we imagine a world where clinicians, consumers, and health systems have access to all the information they need to make smarter, more cost-effective decisions about patient care. Our diagnostic solutions leverage artificial intelligence and predictive analytics models to make this world a reality.We are looking for a Data Scientist to research, develop, maintain, test and evaluate data solutions, ML models and experiments. This person will work with top talent in the industry including data engineers and physicians (domain experts) to solve real world problems with AI-based tools using billions of medical data entries. As part of the Data Science team, we publish literature and our products are used daily by millions of patients.Duties And ResponsibilitiesBringing machine learning based solutions to our AI product from research to production.Gain data expertise and apply knowledge to our data modeling processes - ETLs, complex data analyses, data enrichment.Research, develop healthcare models, and evaluate them on large, complex data sets. Creating algorithmic prototypes and turning them into shippable features and models in the fields of: causal machine learning, transfer learning, fairness, explainability and more.Work closely with data engineers and physicians on medical datasets.Possibility to present work in conferences alongside empirical work.Skills & ExperienceM.Sc. in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Electrical Engineering or related field with publications at top tier machine learning conferences or medical journals.2+ years of hands-on experience building machine learning solutions to real world problems.Strong theoretical and technical experience from research to production.Strong research capabilities, problem solving and critical thinking skills.Ability to communicate clearly scientific data to different stakeholders.2+ experience with Python or other programming languages.Experience with medical datasets is an advantage.

tests (for video, static and playable ads), and researching and analyzing creative industry trends.The ideal candidate is highly analytical yet creative, can work independently, manage multiple projects concurrently, as well as engage and collaborate with other teams & team members from across multiple disciplines and functions: Creative Marketing TL, User Acquisition & Retargeting managers, unfamiliar, and possibly daunting problems—to break them down into manageable bits and solve them.
Industries: Advertising Services, Computer Games, and Gambling Facilities and Casinos

Title: Community Associate
Location: Or Yehuda, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: At Regus, we’ve built the world’s largest workspace network so that our customers can work better, faster, happier. Join us in one of our Regus centre teams. Bring more freedom to more people and businesses. And you’ll be able to work better, faster and happier too.The opportunityAs a Community Associate, you’ll work closely with new and existing customers, solving problems for them and making sure they have everything they need.A typical day at RegusYou arrive 15 minutes before your centre opens to make sure everything is ready and check there’s nothing the cleaners have missed.Customers start coming in thick and fast. One asks you for a changed WiFi code. Another wants to know if his important package has arrived. A woman needs directions to her meeting room… and can you help her set up the projector and take an order for drinks?The mail arrives. You sort through it while dealing with a whole host of other customer requests, remembering to email the customer from earlier to let him know his package is waiting for him in his mailbox. And that’s lunch.Early afternoon, you sit down with the Community Manager to discuss the organisation of next week’s networking event. You plan and write the invites to customers, then create, print and put up posters on the noticeboards around the centre.The day is coming to a close. Time to gently ask the large group in meeting room 3 to start wrapping up. You direct them to the nice restaurant you know around the corner, so they can grab a bite and continue their discussion. Once the last person has left the building and everything’s nice and tidy, it’s time to head home.About YouWe’re looking for someone who knows how to manage multiple tasks while providing customers with the best possible service. You also need to be: A good communicator, with the ability to build strong professional relationships and empathise with people’s needs  Happy taking ownership of problems and finding ways to solve them  Positive, enthusiastic and able to adapt to fast-changing situations  Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages What We OfferOn top of a competitive salary package you’ll enjoy: A bright and inspiring work environment  Training and development opportunities
Requirements: ['A good communicator, with the ability to build strong professional relationships and empathise with people’s needs', 'Happy taking ownership of problems and finding ways to solve them', 'Positive, enthusiastic and able to adapt to fast-changing situations', 'Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages', 'A bright and inspiring work environment', 'Training and development opportunities']

Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 90,000+ passionate people. Powered by our diverse knowledge, insatiable curiosity, and desire to help all those who need it, we deliver innovative technologies that transform the lives of two people every second, every hour, every day. Expect more from us as we empower insight-driven care, experiences that put people first, and better outcomes for our world.In everything we do, we are engineering the extraordinary.Physical RequirementsThe physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The employee is also required to interact with a computer and communicate with peers and co-workers.At Medtronic, you will find a diverse team of innovators who bring their unique backgrounds and their individual life experiences to work every day. We work hard to cultivate a workforce that reflects our patients and partners, we believe it’s the only way to drive healthcare forward.
