Title: Global Corporate Banking Analyst Program - Summer Internship
Location: Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: 2023 Corporate & Investment Bank - Global Corporate Banking Analyst Program - Summer Internship – Tel Aviv Put your energy, insight and analytical prowess to work at the heart of J.P. Morgan. Spend time in our Global Corporate Banking (GCB) business, developing and working on solutions for the world's preeminent companies. Over the course of your internship, you'll work with senior bankers and clients, develop vital skills and start building your professional network as you get a first look at the biggest clients in Corporate Banking. In GCB you will learn a great deal about how the huge and sophisticated "engine" that is J.P. Morgan works.With operations in 100 countries, J.P. Morgan is a true global leader in the financial services industry. We believe the true measure of our success lies in the trusted relationships we share with our clients, our reputation in the industry, and the quality and integrity of the services we provide. In every area of our work, we're committed to being the best, and doing what's right for our clients. And it's that unshakeable commitment shared by everyone at J.P. Morgan which makes this such a rewarding place to build a career. What You Can ExpectThe program kicks off with an orientation and training led by our top professionals and expert instructors which will arm you with the technical and practical knowledge you'll need to make your mark in Global Corporate Banking.Our team members and mentors will help you navigate the firm and continue to learn about our businesses. Access to senior management and a strong network of peers will promote ongoing professional development throughout the summer. Top performing summer analysts may receive a full-time offer to join the two-year Global Corporate Banking analyst program. You’ll make an impact by:Assisting GCB bankers in managing internal aspects of existing client relationshipsHelping with industry and credit analysis, including reviewing financial statements, supporting the credit approval and documentation processGaining exposure to product, strategy, or client coverage-based teamsPreparing internal memos, for example senior management briefings, decision committee memorandaParticipating in the analysis and negotiation of financing requests in coordination with credit, product, legal and compliance teamsCoordinating with product and country teams to identify and execute transactions for clients globally across a range of products, for example capital markets, risk solutions, transaction bankingNetworking with industry leaders, accessing best-in-class training and learning how all our businesses work together to provide excellent customer serviceAbout YouGenuine curiosity about the Global Corporate Banking world is the starting point. We're looking for adaptable, accurate, enthusiastic students who thrive under pressure and in a team. There's no set degree for Corporate Bankers; but a demonstrated interest in finance and economics is advantageous.Key Skills Include:Exceptional analytical, research and project management skillsFamiliarity with business fundamentalsAbility to quickly solve problems on your own and with a teamEnthusiasm, energy and a drive to succeedA collaborative mindset and willingness to partner and work on a teamThe confidence and initiative to take on early responsibility and manage your own projectsProficiency in MS Word and ExcelFluency in English and HebrewExpected graduation date between January 2023 and August 2024But beyond that, what we're most interested in are the things that make you, you: the personal qualities, outside interests and achievements beyond academia that demonstrate the kind of person you are and the difference you could bring to the team.
Requirements: ['Assisting GCB bankers in managing internal aspects of existing client relationships', 'Helping with industry and credit analysis, including reviewing financial statements, supporting the credit approval and documentation process', 'Gaining exposure to product, strategy, or client coverage-based teams', 'Preparing internal memos, for example senior management briefings, decision committee memoranda', 'Participating in the analysis and negotiation of financing requests in coordination with credit, product, legal and compliance teams', 'Coordinating with product and country teams to identify and execute transactions for clients globally across a range of products, for example capital markets, risk solutions, transaction banking', 'Networking with industry leaders, accessing best-in-class training and learning how all our businesses work together to provide excellent customer service', 'Exceptional analytical, research and project management skills', 'Familiarity with business fundamentals', 'Ability to quickly solve problems on your own and with a team', 'Enthusiasm, energy and a drive to succeed', 'A collaborative mindset and willingness to partner and work on a team', 'The confidence and initiative to take on early responsibility and manage your own projects', 'Proficiency in MS Word and Excel', 'Fluency in English and Hebrew', 'Expected graduation date between January 2023 and August 2024']

Title: UX Designer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are looking for an experienced and talented UX designer to join our amazing team of dream makers!As a UX designer in our team, you will create satisfying and compelling experiences for our users (or “partners”, we call them). From user research to delivery, you will help shape our business and simplify our world-class, cutting edge technology software for users, and will often draw on results from user research and workflow analysis.You will own the entire product design lifecycle and bring the practices of Interaction Design, Visual Design, and other product design disciplines together into a single, user-centric design concepts and approach that create an identifying brand-language.You possess strong creative, technical and problem-solving skills. You are a team player and go-getter with a can-do approach, you have a keen eye for details and you know your way around visual design and development, information architecture, user research, microcopy and accessibility (e.g. WCAG).You have a solid understanding of graphic design and web technologies, and of wireframing tools such as Figma, UXPin or Adobe XD (or other). You don’t code, but you understand the basics of languages like HTML, CSS and JavaScript.Roles & Responsibilities:Working jointly with clients to understand their goalsExplaining user research results to internal and external stakeholdersDeveloping personas and usage scenariosConducting usability testingCreating wireframes, storyboards, sitemaps and screen flowsCreating product prototypesAnalyzing user feedback and activity, and iterating to enhance the user experienceConducting competitor and customer analysisWorking closely with development and QA to understand technical feasibility and ensure that designs are understood and implemented correctly.Taking part in creating a design system and style guide for our productRequirements:3+ years of experience as a UX Designer in web-based applicationsExperience with UX principles, personas, journey mapping, empathy mapping and other UX processesExperience working in Agile development teamsFamiliarity with several of the following tools like Sketch, Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, InVision, Figma and Mural.Prerequisites:Portfolio with projects demonstrating process (conceptualization through realization) and design justificationWorking on B2B/B2E/B2B2C experienceBonus PointsExperience in Developer Experience designBlockchain knowledge
Requirements: ['Working jointly with clients to understand their goals', 'Explaining user research results to internal and external stakeholders', 'Developing personas and usage scenarios', 'Conducting usability testing', 'Creating wireframes, storyboards, sitemaps and screen flows', 'Creating product prototypes', 'Analyzing user feedback and activity, and iterating to enhance the user experience', 'Conducting competitor and customer analysis', 'Working closely with development and QA to understand technical feasibility and ensure that designs are understood and implemented correctly.', 'Taking part in creating a design system and style guide for our product', '3+ years of experience as a UX Designer in web-based applications', 'Experience with UX principles, personas, journey mapping, empathy mapping and other UX processes', 'Experience working in Agile development teams', 'Familiarity with several of the following tools like Sketch, Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, InVision, Figma and Mural.', 'Portfolio with projects demonstrating process (conceptualization through realization) and design justification', 'Working on B2B/B2E/B2B2C experience', 'Experience in Developer Experience design', 'Blockchain knowledge']

Title: Director of Accounting Policy
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Who we are:We’re Vesttoo.We connect the insurance industry and the capital markets by combining proprietary AI-powered technology with expertise in data science, insurance and finance so that insurers have the capacity they need and investors have opportunities to diversify with confidence.Our digital insurance risk transfer platform, the Vesttoo Marketplace, is where insurers and global investors connect. It is the source of deal flow for many of our investment products, providing transparent, data-driven analytics to all participants.Beyond all that, we are a dynamic, fast growing and an exciting start-up, in a diverse and friendly atmosphere, where both our employees and our business are in the center.What you'll do: You will report to the VP of Finance and have direct interaction with the CFO, Chief FinancialEngineer and other business teams.Be responsible for providing accounting advice and determining accounting policy for the companyProvide guidelines on technical accounting issuesPrepare or review and update US GAAP & IFRS accounting policiesReview Financial Statements ensure compliance with accounting policiesAssist with Transaction Review and Accounting AnalysisSupport Emerging Guidance tracking, implementation, and presentationPerform accounting researchProvide financial statement reviewLead discussion on accounting policy matters for new products and complex transactionsPartner with the Financial Reporting, FP&A, Tax and Treasury teamsProvide mentorship to the Financial Reporting team on Accounting Policy mattersRequirements:Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance5+ years of related experienceCertified Public Accountant (CPA), Chartered Accounting or equivalent requiredStrong technical understanding and experience in practical application of US GAAP as it relates to Financial Instruments.Ability to multitaskEffective, high energy business partner with the ability to influence, collaborate, and work across the organization, with the CFO, controllers, treasury, tax and other finance leaders
Requirements: ['Be responsible for providing accounting advice and determining accounting policy for the company', 'Provide guidelines on technical accounting issues', 'Prepare or review and update US GAAP & IFRS accounting policies', 'Review Financial Statements ensure compliance with accounting policies', 'Assist with Transaction Review and Accounting Analysis', 'Support Emerging Guidance tracking, implementation, and presentation', 'Perform accounting research', 'Provide financial statement review', 'Lead discussion on accounting policy matters for new products and complex transactions', 'Partner with the Financial Reporting, FP&A, Tax and Treasury teams', 'Provide mentorship to the Financial Reporting team on Accounting Policy matters', "Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance", '5+ years of related experience', 'Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Chartered Accounting or equivalent required', 'Strong technical understanding and experience in practical application of US GAAP as it relates to Financial Instruments.', 'Ability to multitask', 'Effective, high energy business partner with the ability to influence, collaborate, and work across the organization, with the CFO, controllers, treasury, tax and other finance leaders']

Title: Head of Product Design
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: PayEm is a global procurement and spend management platform that automates finance processes from request to reconciliation. By reducing friction and tedious tasks for finance teams, our clients increase productivity, reduce risk and lower operating costs to contribute to business growth. This is an exciting opportunity with a rapidly growing company that is enjoying 3x growth year over year. PayEm is 3 years old and has over 150 customers and has paid suppliers and employees in over 200 countriesAs our Head of Product Design, you will own the overall user experience at PayEm and take the product experience to the next level. You will take a key part in shaping the experience of our product - from building a cohesive and unified design system, to turning deep user challenges into delightfully simple flows and beautiful designs. Our domain is full of complexities, and you will be resolving them in ways that our customers love, and work for our business.This is a one in a million opportunity to lead a team headed for huge success. If you want to make an impact, if you’re up for the amazing scale up challenge, if you’re passionate about design, data, and the possibilities of disruption - we’re saving you a front seat at our table.Requirements:3+ years of experience leading design teams of B2B SaaS companies. Experience in B2C a plus.6+ years of working experience as a product or UX designer, and examples of your recent work.Experience working in an early-stage startup.Experience in designing systems from different points of view for several personas Track record of applying design processes and best practices.Strong UX mindset, with emphasis on usability, an obsession for details, and a passion for delightful visual design.Experience designing consistent, elegant and thoughtful UI, working with an evolving design system.Passion to turn complex problems into simple flows and design solutions. You’re not just interested in how things look, but how they work, and why they were created in the first place. Learn as you go - you are eager to learn the challenges of the field in order to create the product to disrupt it.You are a design advocate at heart, you spark excitement in everyone around to build amazing products, and rally the team behind your designs.Knowledgeable and experienced with research practices, both qualitative and quantitative.Advantages:Illustration or motion graphics design skills.Previous experience with payments and/or SaaS products.2+ years of experience leading mobile product design.About The Role:Coach and develop design team members.Define and execute the UX Strategy of the company’s productsManage project goals and resource allocation.Lead the product design domain and strengthen UX practices; incorporating best practices and the latest methods/tools.Ensure that UX guidelines are produced and followed across products and platforms.Oversee the structure of the design team, and make the required adjustments throughout our company growth.Manage hiring and HR for the team, including onboarding new hires.Inspire creativity in all design work.
Requirements: ['3+ years of experience leading design teams of B2B SaaS companies. Experience in B2C a plus.', '6+ years of working experience as a product or UX designer, and examples of your recent work.', 'Experience working in an early-stage startup.', 'Experience in designing systems from different points of view for several personas', 'Track record of applying design processes and best practices.', 'Strong UX mindset, with emphasis on usability, an obsession for details, and a passion for delightful visual design.', 'Experience designing consistent, elegant and thoughtful UI, working with an evolving design system.', 'Passion to turn complex problems into simple flows and design solutions. You’re not just interested in how things look, but how they work, and why they were created in the first place.', 'Learn as you go - you are eager to learn the challenges of the field in order to create the product to disrupt it.', 'You are a design advocate at heart, you spark excitement in everyone around to build amazing products, and rally the team behind your designs.', 'Knowledgeable and experienced with research practices, both qualitative and quantitative.', 'Illustration or motion graphics design skills.', 'Previous experience with payments and/or SaaS products.', '2+ years of experience leading mobile product design.', 'Coach and develop design team members.', 'Define and execute the UX Strategy of the company’s products', 'Manage project goals and resource allocation.', 'Lead the product design domain and strengthen UX practices; incorporating best practices and the latest methods/tools.', 'Ensure that UX guidelines are produced and followed across products and platforms.', 'Oversee the structure of the design team, and make the required adjustments throughout our company growth.', 'Manage hiring and HR for the team, including onboarding new hires.', 'Inspire creativity in all design work.']

Title: Technical Support Engineer
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Papaya Global is a rapidly growing startup aiming to disrupt and simplify global payroll and employment. The combination of Papaya’s service and SaaS platform enables our customers, from startups to large enterprise companies, to expand their workforce globally, quickly, and in a compliant manner. Through our all-in-one global workforce platform, we connect companies to a global network of preferred suppliers of human resources and international payroll services.As a Papaya Global Technical Support Engineer, you know more about our products than any other function and you feel a sense of pride and satisfaction helping customers through their technical issues. We are serious about keeping our skills sharp, so we can supply first-class assistance in a constantly evolving technical landscape. We emphasize training, knowledge, and customer empathy — you’re learning opportunities will never end.You will collaborate with other Support Engineers to assist with customer issues creatively and passionately, while honing your technical skills. You will use your insight and imagination to help us find recurring or systemic problems and suggest ways we might address them.You will:Collaborate across teams to assist in solving complex technical customer problems across our product suite.Work closely with our software engineering teams to resolve advanced customer issues.Advocate for our customers to our Product Organization by collaborating on feature requests and bugs that improve the customer experience of the Papaya Global platform.Advance your skills through additional training and exposure to other features and capabilities of our ProductsAchieve greatness and delightfulness from assisting both internal and external customers with their daily issues!Requirements:Experience as a Support Engineer in Enterprise or SaaS companies (application support, not IT)You have 1-3 years' experience delighting customers, even those who are having a tough daySQL knowledge, preferably MySQL or Aurora AWSKnowledge in AWS suite (Cloud Practitioner certification – huge advantage)Expert troubleshooting skills, and can get creative when the answer is not obviousExperience collaborating across teams or disciplines to solve problemsAn appetite for knowledge - always wants to learn more and do better (we are like that around here)
Requirements: ['Collaborate across teams to assist in solving complex technical customer problems across our product suite.', 'Work closely with our software engineering teams to resolve advanced customer issues.', 'Advocate for our customers to our Product Organization by collaborating on feature requests and bugs that improve the customer experience of the Papaya Global platform.', 'Advance your skills through additional training and exposure to other features and capabilities of our Products', 'Achieve greatness and delightfulness from assisting both internal and external customers with their daily issues!', 'Experience as a Support Engineer in Enterprise or SaaS companies (application support, not IT)', "You have 1-3 years' experience delighting customers, even those who are having a tough day", 'SQL knowledge, preferably MySQL or Aurora AWS', 'Knowledge in AWS suite (Cloud Practitioner certification – huge advantage)', 'Expert troubleshooting skills, and can get creative when the answer is not obvious', 'Experience collaborating across teams or disciplines to solve problems', 'An appetite for knowledge - always wants to learn more and do better (we are like that around here)']

Title: Product Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: CYREBRO is the first interactive SOC Platform, transforming how today’s businesses respond to and mitigate cyber threats with a centralized security operations infrastructure. The platform provides complete clarity, insight, and real-time cyber recommendations for businesses of all sizes by integrating all of their security events into one central command.We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join CYREBRO growing product team. In this position you will be the voice of the user in front of CYREBRO internal teams, you will know the pains and the needs of the various personas using CYREBRO Platform and translate them to coherent flows and features. If you a passionate about complex problems with simple solutions and want to join a winning team in the cybersecurity ecosystem – You belong with us!Requirements: At least 2 years of experience in Product Management. Experience in Data-driven product management approach Experience working as part of the product team. Experience in working with persona sheets, user surveys, A/B testing, and other discovery methods. Experience working in Agile framework (Scrum/Kanban). Proven data orientation. English native speaker. Excellent communication skills – Must. BS.c in Computer Science, Engineering or similar field – advantage. Experience working with the cybersecurity B2B market – advantageResponsibilities: Analyze user behavior data to produce meaningful insights such as feature prioritization and UX optimization. Create user personas to make focused user stories according to Agile principles. Conduct user interviews and Surveys to identify new value propositions to be introduced to the platform. Define MVP requirements for complex technical issues, plan robust solutions and make sure they are developed and implemented properly to make an impact on Product KPIs. Develop user stories, define acceptance criteria, and continuously groom and prioritize the backlog according to agile principles. Build product roadmap according to CYREBRO go-to-market strategy.
Requirements: ['At least 2 years of experience in Product Management.', 'Experience in Data-driven product management approach', 'Experience working as part of the product team.', 'Experience in working with persona sheets, user surveys, A/B testing, and other discovery methods.', 'Experience working in Agile framework (Scrum/Kanban).', 'Proven data orientation.', 'English native speaker.', 'Excellent communication skills – Must.', 'BS.c in Computer Science, Engineering or similar field – advantage.', 'Experience working with the cybersecurity B2B market – advantage', 'Analyze user behavior data to produce meaningful insights such as feature prioritization and UX optimization.', 'Create user personas to make focused user stories according to Agile principles.', 'Conduct user interviews and Surveys to identify new value propositions to be introduced to the platform.', 'Define MVP requirements for complex technical issues, plan robust solutions and make sure they are developed and implemented properly to make an impact on Product KPIs.', 'Develop user stories, define acceptance criteria, and continuously groom and prioritize the backlog according to agile principles.', 'Build product roadmap according to CYREBRO go-to-market strategy.']

Title: Compliance Specialist- IL
Location: Petah Tikva, Center District, Israel
Text: We are looking for a Compliance Specialist to join the payments group. Title: PMO - Scrum Master
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Finonex is looking for a technological PMO with a can-do approach, strong interpersonal skills that thrives in a fast-paced environment, ambitious, persistent and highly motivated.We are looking for a PMO to play a key role in our product and R&D organization, continuously improving our ways of working, and driving towards operational excellence. You will be a critical part of many of our day-to-day decision-making, feature launches, and product roadmap items.This is a great opportunity to join our company of professionals and work with cutting edge technologies.Requirements:3+ years of experience in a similar role (Agile Project Manager / PMO)Experience working in a Tech environment.Experience working with agile project methodology (Scrum, Kanban) and management, and PMO processes (e.g., scheduling, budget management, Risks management)Knowledge & experience in managing and administrating TFS, troubleshooting, and system automationExcel Proficiency - pivot tables, functions, graphs, etcRelevant Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Information System (or equivalent degree).Excellent communication skills.On this role you will:Define working processes between departmentsDefine working processes between R&D and ProductAsist to set the new R&D methodologies in an increasing of R&D department + assist to define the R&D teamsSet and own of project management platform + integration to R&D system (Currently TFS)Manage R&D platform (TFS) transformation to Jira or any other solutionFind the appropriate solutionManage Cross organizational (not only in Finonex) projects such as: new regulation request, new implementations, Regulations reporting projectsBeing Scrum master of the company and teaching the teams + make a periodic scrum master from the R&D teamsManage implementation project in the organizationManage new implementation of suppliers and budget platformResponsible for projects progress trackingPerform reports with KPIsSupport the R&D routines: such, as periodical meetingsEnsure each person on a project team has the access to all materials neededEnsure that projects are planned correctly and that the owner of each deliverable is identified correctly to meet their KPIs and planned deliverablesProvide an integrative view and analysis of the various project aspects within the program to enable better decisions makingNurture agile squads, work closely with squads and their leadership to adopt agreed best practicesRefine and improve the definition of metrics as the company’s challenges and data evolveWork independently, solve problems and deal with ambiguityWill be nice that you have:Agile certification (SAFe, Professional Scrum Master)Experience working with BI tools

Title: Product Designer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Job SummarySpot by NetApp is looking for a talented Senior Product Designer to join our global UX team to help us take our products’ user experience to new heights and showcase our customer obsession with the best UX and UI possible. You will work closely with the Product team, developers and other Product Designers. This role is in our Compute business unit.On a Daily Basis You WillImpact how our features and products are built from the very first steps of the ideation phase. With that in mind, you will need to be well versed in Spot’s business goals, the industry landscape, and our product roadmap and strategy.Additional Responsibilities IncludeSolving complex design problems and turning user stories and roadmap requirements into intuitive, clear and effective user flows and experiences. Following features throughout their full life-cycle: from ideation to implementation, hands on in every stage, including: wireframes, prototypes, design mocks, developer guidelines & documentation, last minute changes, research, customer and stakeholders feedback, next phases and design QA. Collaborating cross-functionally with product management, development teams, customers and other UX designers to deliver high-level results, with attention to detail, craft, and consistent look & feel between products. Conducting user research, interviews and monitoring usage of shipped features in production. Participating in Spot UX Guild meetings and events, as well as larger, across NetApp UX teams alignments and meetups. Job RequirementsYou should apply if you:Have a portfolio or work that demonstrates your UX/UI or Product design knowledge or work experienceHave 5+ years of related product design experienceHave experience designing user experiences for B2B servicesHave a passion for creating optimal user experiences Have profound understanding of Design SystemsAre capable of expressing and communicating your design ideas and opinions in a cohesive and compelling wayAre curious, always striving to learn new things and are a fast learner that catches on quicklyAre a team player with a can-do attitude and great communication skillsSkills And Tools NeededGreat soft and people skillsExperience working with Figma Time management skillsHave good written and spoken English to work internationallyEducation in UX/UI design, visual communication, digital design or work experience as a UX/UI designerThese Attributes Will Give You Extra PointsFamiliarity with Cloud infrastructure environmentExperience working in a startup environment and mentality of getting things donePrototyping skillsExperience working with front-end developersTech savviness

Title: Product Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: With over 30 Million users on our platform, we’re here to change the future of business. Our all-in-one platform makes starting a business affordable and accessible to everyone - we welcome more than 800k new business owners every month. From our products to our careers, there are endless opportunities for growth.Our team | Our core | Our dream fulfillersWhen we started Tailor Brands, we wanted to help people to accelerate their growth and fulfill their dreams. This also defines us internally; we put our focus on maximizing individual impact and creating an environment of absolute transparency.About The RoleAs a Product Manager, you will lead the vision, strategy and goals of a startup-like group of engineers, designers, analysts and other specialists. ﻿Execute A/B tests, user calls & usability tests to validate your assumptions.Define business and product KPIs to track the performance of your products.Analyze feature performance and user behavior on a day-to-day basis.Conduct competitor and gap analysis.Work hand-in-hand with our Customer Success team to support knowledge-sharing and improve customer satisfaction.Create wireframes and UX flows for complex features, that will solidify the product strategy into new features and products.Orchestrate the product roadmap to meet aggressive goals, while creating alignment and motivation across the team.Make dreams come true - help aspiring business owners get closer to creating their dream business.Requirements:2+ years of experience in product management with a proven record of successfully launching products that create significant business impact. Must be with customer-facing products, preferably in the B2C industry.An AMAZING team player - we do things differently here, and we’re looking for someone who truly knows how to thrive as PART of a group, not just as a leader.User-Centered (not self-centered) approach - our decisions are based on research and evidence, not gut or personal opinions.Highly analytical - you will often find yourself acting as your own analyst, as part of your full ownership of the product (although we do have product analysts on the team).Deep understanding of UI/UX - at the end of the day, it all comes down to a good old-fashioned user experience.Great project management skills - you will need to know how to lead a small startup-like group, from planning through execution.English proficiency and experience working with English speakers - many of our users, as well as many of our team members, are English-native.A huge fan of collaboration - we’re looking for someone who knows how to engage, collaborate and motivate others to foster healthy discussions.Nice to have:Proven experience in the SaaS industryProven experience of launching a product end-to-endStartup experience and mentalityBasic Infrastructure and SQL knowledge
Requirements: ['Execute A/B tests, user calls & usability tests to validate your assumptions.', 'Define business and product KPIs to track the performance of your products.', 'Analyze feature performance and user behavior on a day-to-day basis.', 'Conduct competitor and gap analysis.', 'Work hand-in-hand with our Customer Success team to support knowledge-sharing and improve customer satisfaction.', 'Create wireframes and UX flows for complex features, that will solidify the product strategy into new features and products.', 'Orchestrate the product roadmap to meet aggressive goals, while creating alignment and motivation across the team.', 'Make dreams come true - help aspiring business owners get closer to creating their dream business.', 'An AMAZING team player - we do things differently here, and we’re looking for someone who truly knows how to thrive as PART of a group, not just as a leader.', 'User-Centered (not self-centered) approach - our decisions are based on research and evidence, not gut or personal opinions.', 'Highly analytical - you will often find yourself acting as your own analyst, as part of your full ownership of the product (although we do have product analysts on the team).', 'Deep understanding of UI/UX - at the end of the day, it all comes down to a good old-fashioned user experience.', 'Great project management skills - you will need to know how to lead a small startup-like group, from planning through execution.', 'English proficiency and experience working with English speakers - many of our users, as well as many of our team members, are English-native.', 'A huge fan of collaboration - we’re looking for someone who knows how to engage, collaborate and motivate others to foster healthy discussions.', 'Proven experience in the SaaS industry', 'Proven experience of launching a product end-to-end', 'Startup experience and mentality', 'Basic Infrastructure and SQL knowledge']

Title: Product Marketing Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Job SummarySpot by NetApp is looking for an outstanding Product Marketing Manager to help drive our continuing growth and expansion. This is an important role that is vital to the success of our efforts to build awareness, thought leadership, and demand for Spot’s market-leading products targeting DevOps users and use cases.This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing startup within an established company, combining the energy and flexibility of an innovative startup with the resources and backing of an established enterprise. Spot established itself as a rocket ship from the start, reaching $10M ARR in under one year, and is continuing its rapid growth as a key driver for NetApp’s public cloud business.This Product Marketing Manager will have a critical role within Spot’s marketing team, focusing on our product lines for DevOps and helping to distill our technology and value proposition into compelling messaging and content that successfully engages prospects, customers, partners and more. This person will have the opportunity to collaborate with, shape, and learn from the rest of our marketing team as well as key stakeholders across the company to identify and drive impactful projects and results for our current and future DevOps products.Responsibilities (what You Will Do)Distill our technology and value proposition into powerful, compelling and differentiated messaging, positioning and stories that target DevOps users and use cases Work closely with sales, marketing and product leadership to generate compelling content in a variety of forms including web copy, blogs, datasheets, whitepapers and presentations Collaborate with product teams for our DevOps products to understand product roadmap and to develop and implement coordinated plans for launches and announcements Work together with our demand generation team to support campaigns and initiatives for DevOps products and audiences across campaigns and events Help to educate and enable our sales and partner teams to sell the value and differentiation of our products and solutions Ultimately become the go-to person for messaging and customer-facing content for our DevOps products and solutions Skills & RequirementsJob Requirements5+ years of experience in a product, solution or technical marketing role Strong understanding and relevant experience related to cloud and SaaS market and to products targeting IT audiences Strong skills distilling and communicating the value of technical products into clear, differentiated messages and value propositions to diverse audiences Bonus for experience and understanding of DevOps processes, roles and technologies and experience marketing to DevOps audiences Fast, motivated learner with the ability to quickly grasp the key capabilities and value proposition of complex technologies Self-starter able to excel in a fast-moving startup environment Team player able to work cross-functionally and cross-culturally within our global team Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
Requirements: ['Distill our technology and value proposition into powerful, compelling and differentiated messaging, positioning and stories that target DevOps users and use cases', 'Work closely with sales, marketing and product leadership to generate compelling content in a variety of forms including web copy, blogs, datasheets, whitepapers and presentations', 'Collaborate with product teams for our DevOps products to understand product roadmap and to develop and implement coordinated plans for launches and announcements', 'Work together with our demand generation team to support campaigns and initiatives for DevOps products and audiences across campaigns and events', 'Help to educate and enable our sales and partner teams to sell the value and differentiation of our products and solutions', 'Ultimately become the go-to person for messaging and customer-facing content for our DevOps products and solutions', '5+ years of experience in a product, solution or technical marketing role', 'Strong understanding and relevant experience related to cloud and SaaS market and to products targeting IT audiences', 'Strong skills distilling and communicating the value of technical products into clear, differentiated messages and value propositions to diverse audiences', 'Bonus for experience and understanding of DevOps processes, roles and technologies and experience marketing to DevOps audiences', 'Fast, motivated learner with the ability to quickly grasp the key capabilities and value proposition of complex technologies', 'Self-starter able to excel in a fast-moving startup environment', 'Team player able to work cross-functionally and cross-culturally within our global team', 'Strong written and verbal communication skills in English']

Title: Energetic office manager that makes things happen
Location: Givatayim, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Are you... > A problem solver who likes to take initiative?> A fast learner, able to continuously master complex concepts? > A great communicator that people love working with? If so, we’d love to hear from you!Shahaf Ltd. is looking for an energetic office manager for our offices in Givatayim. We offer a creative and international work environment, lots of room to grow, and a warm and friendly team that cares for each other. Our people LOVE coming to work every day and are passionate and excited about the scale and novelty of the projects we lead globally and in Israel. We are now looking for someone who will be a great addition to our team. This is not an administrative position. This is a big role for a big personality. What you’ll be doing: You will be the right hand of the CEO and help him manage his day-to-day work, including thinking ahead and preparing materials for client meetings and callsYou will join client meetings, reach out to suppliers abroad, and visit worksitesYou will be searching for information online to find the right R&D partners (such as leading universities, top researchers, global experts, high-end suppliers, etc.) who can help us formulate new materials in our R&D labYou will help build relationships with global R&D experts and high-level / C-suite stakeholders such as architects, developers, designers, artists, etc. Eventually, you will be able to independently manage/supervise elements of work (e.g. check how the production team is getting along, see if the procurement team is on schedule, check to see what the R&D team needs in the lab, etc.), talk to clients, make sure projects are on schedule, etc.Requirements: Native Hebrew speaker with excellent written and verbal communication skillsNative or near-native English speaker who can easily communicate with our clients abroad Independent, mature, and reliable - can lead initiatives with minimal guidance  A fantastic communicator with great people skills ‘Joie de Vivre - being easy to work with, creating a fun work environment, humorAble to positively influence people with strong personalities, and manage delicate situationsCommercial, trustworthy, and professional - able to (eventually) manage client relationships Solution-oriented mindset - not afraid to go out there and find answers yourself Strong and assertive personality - you have a professional point of view and are not afraid to voice it out Able to constantly learn new and complex concepts Resourceful, sharp, and determined - able to research obscure information online, pick up the phone and find out what you need Confident - not afraid to ask questions, push back when needed, and come up with better ways of doing thingsThe fine print: You’ll be working from our offices (1 day from home, 4 days from the office, and sometimes joining client meetings in different locations in Israel)Did you recognize yourself in this ad? if so, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Webmaster Student (Part-time)

Text: MAЁLYS is one of the fastest-growing D2C beauty brands in the world. And now that we’ve gotten the formalities out of the way, let’s be frank. We are crushing it. How? We are breaking the mold of the body care industry with innovative targeted body care solutions for specific skin concerns, an intricate and unique combination of data and marketing, and a seriously sassy and bold brand voice.What’s our vibe? Title: Data Specialist (Student position)
Location: Center District, Israel
Text: Percepto is the leading provider of autonomous inspection and monitoring solutions, harnessing robotics, including our very own market-leading industrial drone-in-a-box solution. Our team is made up of software and hardware engineers, industry experts and professionals who are all passionate about innovation and driven to push the boundaries of what’s possible with software, AI, and hardware. We are a fast growing company with offices in Israel, the U.S. and Australia, with Fortune 500 clients around the world. Our company growth is not stopping any time soon, and we are looking for great talent like you to join our team!We are looking for a Junior Data Collection Specialist to join our computer vision and deep learning team. In this role, you will have the chance to train our product to achieve state of the art AI Algorithms.This is an opportunity to join a professional Machine Learning team, that gets our autonomous drone and robotics solutions to new heights!Why join Percepto? We care about the people we work with; we want our team members to grow and develop professionally, to find their job rewarding and intellectually stimulating, and of course - to have fun and feel that they are part of the Percepto family. Our Computer vision team develops state-of-the-art computer vision algorithms to address the various perception tasks required for our autonomous drones, such as object detection and scene perception.Requirements:Student in Industrial engineer or equivalentRelevant experience in IDF relevant units - An advantageStrong analytical skillsA self-motivated capable of working alone or in a small team to collect the best data to train our AIFluent English - mustResponsibilities:Analyze and Verify Data - research data sources, conduct thorough data analysis and make corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the recorded informationCreate a Digital Conversion Program, by writing scripts in PythonOversee data collection process, work closely with drone operators teams in the fieldGenerate and present reports, covering workflow and workflow disruptions, exceptions, and analysis results.

Title: Store Success Manager - North of Israel (Hadera to north)

Text: Shopic is an AI start-up specializing in retail solutions and shopping experiences. Our technology turns any shopping cart into a smart cart. Powered by computer vision and data analytics, the cart lets shoppers grab the products they want and skip the checkout lines when they leave the store.We are based in Tel Aviv, deployed by significant grocery chains worldwide, and employ some of the best minds in the AI sector. We are looking for a new member to join our team, the Store Operations Manager will be part of and lead the on-site operational team and provide training and support. As a Store Operations Manager, you will act as the primary interface between the customer and Shopic.Work will consist of conducting day-to-day operations to adhere to project deadlines, providing technical support, training shoppers, managing project schedules, and tracking on-site. Title: VP R&D

Its time to join in!We are looking for passionate Vice President of R&D to lead the company's research and development activity.This is a unique opportunity to join the most exciting space in the gaming industry and take an important part in today’s most desirable positions in the gaming space, you will challenge yourself, your team and the company's growing international well-known brand, to the next level of excellence.This position has high accountability, reporting directly to the CTO and collaborating with the CEO and executive team, including driving the company's technology growth, building the company's core infrastructure, attracting and retaining the best talent, creating and retaining highly productive and efficient teams, and supporting employees’ development.This role is a great opportunity to make an impact and take part in organizational success.Required QualificationsAt least 6 years of experience in managing and scaling R&D teams.Strong leadership skills for coaching and mentoring (preferably in a start-up environment)B.Sc. in Computer Science or equivalentM.Sc. in Computer Science or Mathematics – An advantageExperience with design and management of big data architecturesBackground in Blockchain-based B2C productsExcellent communication and problem-solving skillsAbility to adapt to various technologies and research new conceptsA true team player, with great leadership and interpersonal skillsProactive attitude and doing what it takes to get the job done – “I can move mountains!”What You'll Be DoingDefining R&D strategy and methodologies, optimize the work process and efficiencyDirect responsibility on the R&D deliveries; Title: Technical Program Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Ermetic's mission & CultureErmetic is a dynamic, fast-growing startup with $100M in funding in just under two years, and our 2021 business results will knock your socks off! We grew revenues by 800%, increased our customer base by 6X and quadrupled our headcount. We are unstoppable.Our product helps companies answer the number one question in cloud security today: "Who can access my data?" With Ermetic, organizations can now secure their cloud environment and protect their data and their customer's data to make sure they are safe from malicious attacks.At Ermetic, we're constantly challenging ourselves to climb higher, go further and do more. We believe that a company is built by its people. We strongly believe that every person is a leader of her / his domain - so if you thrive in an ecosystem where you can influence, where you work as part of an amazing global team, enjoy brainstorming and executing, love to see how your work contributes directly to the company's success and you see the value in a true partnerships - this is the place for you!What are we looking for? We are looking for an experienced Technical Program Manager with excellent communication and problem-solving skills to work closely with the R&D stakeholders and the tech teams and support and improve the entire development lifecycle.You will be a pioneer in this field at Ermetic and build the infrastructure, methodologies, and metrics for all our development Processes.You will work hand in hand with our CTO to build our execution timelines, and coordinate between the Product, R&D, and Customer Success teams.What will you do?You will Apply project management disciplines and methodologies, metrics creation, task management in order to manage complex, multi-work stream effortsYou will define cross-functional dependencies and enhance efficiency of program execution. You will help define the Product lines roadmap and timelines for product, engineering, development teams to prioritize the delivery of identified requirementsYou will build basic definitions for all Ermetic's life cycle in terms of execution. You will capture and manage risks, and proactively reduce project's exposure to them. You will identify tools needed for max efficacyWhat do you need to bring to the table? 8+ years of experience in Technical Program management/ PMOExperience in managing multiple software development projects or projects in a program with cross-functional team members. Profound project management experience in the software industry, Cyber - AdvantageExperience working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Decision-making, task prioritization, and on-time delivery capabilitiesIndependent, thinks outside the box, presentable, excellent interpersonal skillsExperience in Jira administrationKnowledgeable and experienced with Agile principles, methodologies, and frameworksKnowledge in quality methodologies / CI / CD– advantageFluent in English both written and verbalB.Sc. in Engineering or equivalentErmetic is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations. By fostering a diverse business environment, Ermetic welcomes opportunities to learn from each other, our customers, investors, suppliers, and business partners.Ermetic respects your privacy and is committed to protecting the personal information you share with us, please refer to Ermetic's Privacy Policy for more details.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on exploiting market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies – the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.WorldQuant’s success is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to think openly about problems, balancing intellectualism and practicality. Excellent ideas come from anyone, anywhere. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess an attitude of continuous improvement. That’s a key ingredient in remaining a leader in any industry.Our goal is to hire the best and the brightest. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an outstanding talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us build it. Our collective intelligence will drive us there.The Role: Research is at the core of WorldQuant. Through rigorous exploration and unconstrained thinking about how to apply data to the financial markets, our researchers are in constant search of new alphas. We strive to understand data in ways our competitors don’t believe is possible. Researchers at WorldQuant employ tested processes seeking to identify high-quality predictive signals that we believe are undiscovered by the wider market. These signals are mathematical expressions of data that are used as inputs in our quantitative models.WorldQuant is seeking an exceptional individual to join the firm as a Quantitative Researcher. The person must have a strong understanding of the investment research process to create computer-based models that seek to predict movements of global financial markets. While prior finance experience is not required, a successful candidate must possess a strong interest in learning about finance and global markets. Candidates will have a research scientist mind-set; be a self-starter, a creative and persevering deep problem solver who is motivated by unsolved challenges.Its Impact: As we pursue our goal of creating new alphas, we need researchers who will lead us there. WorldQuant’s unique investment platform is a leader amongst its peers and the methodology we employ is innovative. We desire people who will help us in our steadfast pursuit to succeed.Job Responsibilities (including, But Not Limited To, The Following)Building algorithmic, computer-driven modelsConducting research on academic quantitative finance literatureExploring and handling dataApplying an alignment of innovative methods in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science and Financial Economics.What You'll BringB.Sc. or an advanced degree from a leading university in a quantitative or highly analytical field (e.g. Electrical Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics)\Ranked in the top 10% of bachelor’s degree classPrevious experience as a quant in a research focused capacityShown ability to program in C/C++ on a Unix/Linux platform is a plusExcellent problem solving abilities and judgment with a strong attention to detail, creative, self-starterMature, with the ability to operate in a collaborative, team-oriented cultureStrong English language skills; ability to communicate sophisticated concepts in simple termsInterested and qualified candidates please send resumes to WQIsraeljobs@worldquant.com.Copyright © 2022 WorldQuant, LLC. All Rights Reserved.WorldQuant is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, age, marital status, citizenship, national origin, disability, military status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, or any other protected characteristic as established by applicable law.
Requirements: ['Building algorithmic, computer-driven models', 'Conducting research on academic quantitative finance literature', 'Exploring and handling data', 'Applying an alignment of innovative methods in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science and Financial Economics.', 'B.Sc. or an advanced degree from a leading university in a quantitative or highly analytical field (e.g. Electrical Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics)\\', 'Ranked in the top 10% of bachelor’s degree class', 'Previous experience as a quant in a research focused capacity', 'Shown ability to program in C/C++ on a Unix/Linux platform is a plus', 'Excellent problem solving abilities and judgment with a strong attention to detail, creative, self-starter', 'Mature, with the ability to operate in a collaborative, team-oriented culture', 'Strong English language skills; ability to communicate sophisticated concepts in simple terms']

Title: Data Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Bigabid is an innovative technology company led by data scientists and engineers devoted to mobile app growth. Our proprietary ad platforms powered by machine learning are the outcome of that devotion.We deliver valuable results and insights for a fast-growing clientele of major app developers using elite programmatic user acquisition and retargeting technologies.Our ever evolving, state-of-the-art machine learning technology analyzes 50TB of raw data per day to produce millions of ad recommendations in real-time. This data is used to power our machine learning predictions, business critical metrics, and analytics to power our decision making.Quality data is fundamental to Bigabid’s success. As a rapidly growing company, we are preparing for a future of tremendous growth and transformation. We are rebuilding our Data Engineering practice with a solid data foundation to enable further success.We are seeking professional Data Engineer to help us define and realize our vision for trustworthy data across the company. You will be joining a team responsible for the management of huge amounts of data at petabyte scale, creation and management of enterprise grade systems, and flows that process ~50TB of data every day and growing. The team will also create, from the ground up, an MLops infrastructure for our growing Data Science division.Responsibilities:Design and implement scalable data infrastructure that is architected for massive future growth in terms of amounts of data as well as types of fields and information managed in the system.Design and implement advanced ETLs, create high throughput, fault tolerant infrastructure for data discovery, transformation, streaming, and storage. Be involved in technology selection processes and implementation of new parts of the architecture using these technologiesHave a deep understanding of our data, how it is acquired, managed, versioned, made discoverable, its relations, and how it can be consumedRequirements:B.Sc / M.Sc in Computer Science / Software Engineering / Electrical engineering or similar+5 years of proven experience as a Data/Backend Engineer +3 years of experience skills with PythonExperience with designing and building ETL processes and data pipelines Experience with Big Data technologies and solutions (For example: Spark, Presto, Hive, Splunk, Hadoop, BigQuery, MapReduce, flink)Experience with Cloud Environment, advantage to AWS (S3, Athena, Ecs, Lambda, Emr, Glue, etc) Experience working with a high scale of data (we process 50 TB a day)Good Analytical skills in SQL.Advantage:Familiarity with Airflow, Pandas library, NodeJs, PySparkFamiliarity with data science and machine learning toolsKnowledge of Linux operating systemsGood knowledge in containerizingExcerpt:Join a new team that will be responsible for the management of huge amounts of data at a Petabyte scale, creation and management of enterprise grade systems, and flows that process ~50TB of data every day and growing.

Title: Client SDK Engineer - New Graduate
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: About AerospikeAt Aerospike, we dream big. Our focus is helping companies tackle seemingly insurmountable problems and doing what's never been done before. That is why we developed the world's leading real-time data platform that powers mission-critical applications at the world's most innovative, category-disrupting companies.Our customers have deployed extreme-scale real-time applications to fight fraud, dramatically increase shopping cart size, enable global digital payments, and deliver hyper-personalized user experiences to tens of millions of customers. Customers like Airtel, Experian, Nielsen, PayPal, Snap, Verizon Media, Wayfair, and many others rely on Aerospike as the data foundation for the future to help them act in the microsecond moments that matter. Aerospike is headquartered in Mountain View, California, and has a global presence with offices in London, Bangalore, and Tel Aviv.Job DescriptionAerospike Database is a high performance, highly scalable, distributed database optimized for SSD and advanced storage technologies, such as Intel's Optane persistent memory. Our database needs easy to use, high performance clients for developers to create applications in the language of their choice. Clients are offered to developers using Java, C, C#, Python, Node.js, PHP, Ruby, Go, and Rust.We are looking for a recent graduate with an interest in computer languages to join our client development team. Having an interest in computer languages is preferred. Title: Integration Technician
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Imagine there was a platform that allows operating multiple autonomous vehicles, in the air and on the ground, across the globe, from a single location. How awesome would that be?! What if you were the one to help build it from scratch? Blue White Robotics is a world leader in autonomous technologies and unmanned systems.Based in TLV , Bluewhite is a world leader in autonomous technologies and unmanned systems. We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated and experienced Integration Technician to join our ranks!You will be responsible for our products prototype system integration and give your insight of the final design. use your experience combined with deep familiarity with mechanical systems, to deliver sharp and focused engineering solutions to our customers.you should have excellent ability to provide solutions and a creative, outside the box thinking and solve complex design problems.You will be part of the BWR R&D HW team.Responsibilities - what you will be doing:Integration of systems in our test platformPrototype build and support System maintenance and retrofitWork and solve hydraulic and pneumatic problems and design dilemmas.Take part of the group that develop test equipment for the autonomous tractorWork site: Binyamina / TLV- SaronaRequirements:Requirements - does this describe you?Tractor License -MustAt least 3 years of experience in complex mechanical systems diagnostic and repair -Must.Familiarity in hydraulic, electrical, and power systems – MustMS windows and office software experience- MustPractical mechanical skills: metal work, welding - MustAbility to work efficiently in a multidisciplinary environment with tight, fast-paced development schedulesHands-on approach, a team player, and a leaderBe a self-starter with initiative personality, tackle issues and seek for solutionsFluent English and Hebrew- speak, wright, readingKnowledge in agricultural equipment and process – advantageDS SolidWorks experience – advantageValid US visa – advantageAbout UsBluewhite provides innovative autonomous systems and services globally. Our solutions aim to optimize operations and productivity in various domains like agriculture, security, and smart mobility. We help our customers adopt new autonomous technologies and improve efficiency and effectiveness on their existing products & services.Bluewhite is led by ex-IAF pilots and engineers with more than 20 years of experience in designing, developing, and operating autonomous systems both in the air and on ground. Our team of 100+ professionals is composed of autonomous operation experts, system engineers, robotics experts and optimization & AI algorithms developers. Among our customers and partners, you will find companies like Intel, Nvidia and Renault.

Title: Broker Relations and Sales Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Imagine your dream office... Now, try again. Mindspace is a rapidly growing global provider of inspiring workspaces for teams of all sizes. Our community consists of enterprise companies and established startups, as well as small businesses, entrepreneurs, and creative freelancers. With members in more than 40 locations across 7 countries, we are setting the gold standard for flexible workspaces around the world.Who is the Broker Relations and Sales Manager?This full-time position includes traveling between Mindspace sites in israel, and reporting to Israel’s sales manager. The Broker Relations and Sales Manager (BRSM) is a hunter, responsible for increasing demand and converting strategic accounts to Mindspace clients. The BRSM uses his exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to nurture great relationships with the brokers community, and utilizes his sales experience and passion to meet sales targets. The BRSM will work with the Israel Sales team in all aspects of pre-sales and sales of our spaces in order to achieve the team KPIs.Your day at Mindspace.You are the main POC for any related brokers areas in Mindspace Israel, and need to make sure they know, like and appreciate working with us. You will also prospect for new business and sell the services that Mindspace has to offer. Working closely with the Israel sales team, BRM global forum and the Israel community team, your main focus will be all about increasing the demand for Mindspace, especially via brokers’ leads and generating revenue.What You Will Be Responsible For, Mainly.Manage Broker Relationships and Partnerships to increase demand and revenueEngage the brokers community with our brand and ensure they always have Mindspace in mind Responsible for creating and executing a wholistic Brokers Strategy for Mindspace IsraelOnboarding new broker firmsQualify brokers’ leads and convert them to closed deals- Understand the customer’s needs, ensuring that solution that is provided matches customer expectations across all areas - functional, service, timeline, budget, quality, etc.- Provide a suitable proposal offer, based on Mindspace guidelines- Follow up with the customer and broker, maintaining a consistent, open channel Use data & Competitors analysis to identify trends and forecast future strategiesCreatively utilizing marketing budget to attract new partnerships with brokers and promote the Mindspace brand in IsraelResponsible for brokers payments and their satisfaction from MindspaceWork closely with the Israel Sales team and SDR team to ensure an effective and successful sales funnel Requirements:Do you have the following experience?2-3 years of relevant sales experience Experience in B2B sales, lead generation, pre-sale processes, market researchHands-on mentalityFamiliar with real estate, specifically the flexible office sector - an advantageBA degree in a related field- a plusExcellent oral and written communication skills both in Hebrew and English. Critical competencies for success.A fiercely independent worker who does not shy away from a fast-paced, hybrid work environment.You should be a motivated, self-starting individual with a strong work ethic, an understanding of how to work effectively as part of a team, and to have Mindspace’s best interests at heart.You are a people person, who can foster relationships easily and maintain them for the long term.You must be a great communicator, able to convey messages in a clear and concise manner.You should be organized and analytical at all times. Fired up about Mindspace; you are ready to live and breathe Mindspace, spreading the love to everyone you encounter.Please submit your application in English.Mindspace is an equal-opportunity employer.

Title: מנהל.ת מימון פרויקטים
Location: Yavne, Center District, Israel
Text: בוא.י להשתלב בחברה בינלאומית מובילה בתחום האנרגיה המתחדשת .אורמת מתכננת, מייצרת, מקימה ומפעילה תחנות כוח המפיקות חשמל ממקורות אנרגיה ירוקה. במסגרת התפקיד:  הובלת עסקאות בינלאומיות למימון פרויקטים ועסקאות למכירת הטבות מס בארה"ב, הכנת תיאורי פרויקטים למממנים פוטנציאליים, הכנה וניתוח מודלים פיננסיים מורכבים, עמידה באמות מידה פיננסיות, הכנת תחזיות פיננסיות, הערכות שווי, בדיקות כדאיות כלכלית, ניתוח התנאים העסקיים בהצעות למימון, השתתפות במשא ומתן מול מוסדות מימון והובלת התקשרויות עם יועצים הנדסיים, פיננסיים, משפטיים דרישות  :  תואר ראשון בכלכלה וחשבונאות או מנהל עסקים עם התמחות במימון ובנוסף תואר שני בתחומים הנ"ל או לחילופין תעודת רו"ח.ניסיון של לפחות 5 שנים בהכנת מודלים פיננסיים מורכבים - הכרחי .ניסיון של לפחות 5 שנים בהערכות שווי ובהכנת תכניות עסקיות .ניסיון בעבודה על פרויקטים של אנרגיה מתחדשת עם עדיפות לפרויקטים בחו"ל .עבודה במחלקה כלכלית או במח' יעוץ כלכלי במשרדי רו"ח . או בחברות אנרגיה ותשתיות עם פעילות בינ"ל.נדרשת שליטה מעולה ב Excel, Word, Power Pointאנגלית ברמה מעולה, לרבות ניסוח מסמכים חוזיים, הכנת מצגות ומו"מ עסקי. שפות נוספות (ספרדית, צרפתית)יתרון.ייתכנו נסיעות לחו"ל בהיקף של כשבועיים בשנה (משתנה).

Title: Technical Support
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Shopic is an AI start-up specializing in retail solutions and shopping experiences. Our technology turns any shopping cart into a smart cart. Powered by computer vision and data analytics, the cart lets shoppers grab the products they want and skip the checkout lines when they leave the store.We are based in Tel Aviv, deployed by major grocery chains worldwide, and employ some of the best minds in the AI sector. We are looking for a Technical support representative to join our CSM team. As a Technical Support representative, you will be responsible for the support of our strategic customers. You will serve as Shopic’s technical focal point for customers and on-site store operations managers and will collaborate with R&D, QA, Customer Success, and Sales teams.Our Customer Success department is focused on driving growth with top-tier global retailers, by ensuring excellent user experience and customer support. Our team is a collection of brilliant and interesting people from various backgrounds and cultures. We work in close collaboration and synergy. Our environment is dynamic and energetic and fun to be a part of.This is a full job that includes morning and evening shifts position, with a requirement for overtime and on-call duty.Requirements:At least 3 years of experience in technical support Hands-on experience dealing with incident and escalation managementStrong oral and written communication skillsStrong technical skills with the ability to prioritize and work independentlyA talent for problem-solving and troubleshooting2 years of experience working with LinuxExperience in reviewing system logs and drawing conclusionsExperience running Bash and Python scripts to debug issuesJIRA and Zendesk knowledge an advantageCoralogix/Kibana knowledge is an advantageNetworking knowledge desirable Responsabilities:Provide high-level technical support Support pre-production and production deployment, configuration, and testing while ensuring best practices are followed and recommendations are communicatedWork with engineering teams to help triage, manage and resolve issues to ensure successful support and issue resolutionSupport, monitor, test, and troubleshoot software issues to ensure proper escalation occurs for unresolved issues and assign appropriate priorityOccasionally assist the supply chain team in managing hardware issues Ensure that customer issues are appropriately logged, researched, and accurately resolved in a timely manner, meeting and exceeding expectationsCollaborate with relevant interfaces such as Sales, Product, Customer Success, etc.Proactively identify repeating issues, missing features, and customers at risk. Provide feedback to the product development, sales, and management teams
