Title: Media Buyer
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Join our advertising team as a Media Partnerships Manager!We're offering an amazing opportunity to manage substantial budgets, analyze data, and use the most up-to-date buying methods and platforms on the Advertiser side.Your RoleMedia buying through programmatic platforms, such as Google, Taboola etc.Ownership of at least one of our products- Budget planning, execution & optimizationCreating ongoing programmatic testing and evaluating the progress including: setup, creative & measurement.Buying media through various targeting techniques – user acquisition, awareness, content campaignsProvide real time insights on the activity through deep analysis, using multiple internal and external tools and platformsWorking closely with the business units to create a clear strategy for growing our products and client baseYour SkillsYou have 1 year of experience in media buying, including technical aspect, working on media platforms, ad servers, DSPs, SSPs and moreYou have deep knowledge and understanding of the online advertising landscapeYou have experience buying video, display and app installsYou have great Excel skillsYou have a BA (preferably in Economics / Business Administration / Industrial Management / Statistics)You are a superb communicator (English) with great analytical skillsYou possess outstanding organization skills to effectively manage and prioritize multiple requirements and projects, without losing sight of the detailsYou Have a Major Advantage IfYou have experience with buying on Google Ads / Campaign Manager platformsMore about 888 GroupAs one of the world’s leading betting and gaming groups, 888 provides customers with a safe and enjoyable experience underpinned by its unique technology and industry expertise. Being a responsible company means being a responsible employer first.The Group invests in a unique working environment that enables our people to flourish along with our business. We believe in talent development and investing in our people. Our unique culture and spirit are built on the values of fairness, collaboration, and continuous progress. The Group’s mission is to remain employee-centric and to attract and retain the best people by providing a rewarding environment with ample opportunities for personal development.More about the Marketing TeamEvery member of our Marketing Team is as unique as they are creative. A team of passionate trend-entrepreneurs, the promotional power driving our brands worldwide. From traditional offline channels through to groundbreaking digital marketing methodologies, we lead the market in fun, fair and safe global gaming products.ApplicationJust fill in a few details below and we’ll be in touch if you’re a match for the positionPOSITION | Media Buyer | Position ID: B3.43EPrivacy PolicyThe candidate consent that the information in this Candidate Application and any personal information concerning him/her which is obtained by the Company or from other sources, will be held and managed by the Company or on its behalf, and that the Company shall be entitled to use and transfer such information to third parties, including Company’s affiliates, business partners or contractors/service providers to the extent required while maintaining your right to privacy. The Company undertakes that the information will be used, and transferred for the purposes related to the recruitment process, including assessment of your qualifications against our work opportunities, verification and reference/background checks, communications with you about the recruitment process and/or your application and/or compliance with applicable laws, regulations, legal processes or enforceable governmental requests.Share this position with a friendRelated Positions

Title: Frontend Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: At Dazz, we're changing cloud security for the better. In an industry where virtually all of the innovation has been in finding security issues in the code-to-production development pipeline, we're focused on fixing them. And we're doing it in a dev-friendly way that massively improves efficiency and builds trust between security and engineering teams.Just out of stealth mode, with $60 million in Series A funding from top investors such as Cyberstarts, Greylock, Insight Partners, and Index Ventures.Dazz is a cloud remediation platform that maps the entire CI/CD pipeline down to resources and owners; collapses security alerts from CSPM, CWPP, and vulnerability management tools; helps engineering teams run fast by teeing up a one-click fix in code; and prevents issues from recurring.Reporting to a Team Lead, we are looking for a passionate and ambitious engineer who will play an integral role in building our product.Requirements:5+ years of experience as a frontend engineer, preferably on SaaS product in a cloud-native environment5+ years of experience in modern frontend frameworks (Vue, React, Angular, etc.)Knowledge and experience with modern frontend tooling like Babel, Webpack / Rollup / Parcel and languages (Typescript, ES6+).Experience in frontend testing methodologies - unit, integration and end-to-end testsPixel perfect approach, attention to details and knowledge in modern CSS technologies (PostCSS / CSS in JS / SASS / LESS, etc.)Vue 3 and Typescript hands-on experience - advantagePassion for new technologies, familiarity with emerging technologies and methodologies

Title: CRM Monetization
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Tango is a successful, market leader, a live-streaming Platform with 450+ Million registered users, in an industry projected to reach $240 BILLION in the next couple of years.The B2C platform, based on the best-quality global video technology, allows millions of talented people around the world to create their own live content, engage with their fans and monetize their talents.Tango live stream was founded in 2018 and is powered by 300+ global employees operating in a culture of growth, learning, and success!The Tango team is a vigorous cocktail of hard workers, creative brains, energizers, geeks, overachievers, athletes, and more. We push the limits to bring our app from “one of the top” to “the leader”.The best way to describe Tango's work style is not to use the word “impossible”. And we believe that success is a thorny path that runs on sleepless nights, corporate parties, tough releases, and of course our users' smiles (and as we are a LIVE app, we truly get to see our users all around the world smiling right in front of us in real-time!).Do you want to join the party?Requirements:2+ years experience - MUSTAnalytical thinking skills & attention to detail - MUSTAdvanced Excel, Tableau - MUSTStructural approach to data with strong quantitative and qualitative analysis skillsMethodological approach for data together with the ability to present the data clearly and efficiently to support business decisionsExperience from B2C companiesKnowledge of CRM, back-office systems, data structures, reporting and AB testing methodology A bachelor’s degree, preferably in Exact Science or EconomicsAdvanced technical skills, including MS Office and SQLMother tongue level English required. Title: Marketing Lead - temporary position
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Location: Ahad Ha’am, Tel avivImagine your dream office... Now, try again. Mindspace is a rapidly growing global provider of inspiring flexible spaces for teams of all sizes. Our customer base includes blue-chip companies, enterprises, and SMBs, in 31 locations, 16 cities and 7 countries across Europe and the US.Marketing Lead (Team Leader position) - temporary positionMindspace is looking for a seasoned marketing leader with diverse marketing experience, who is savvy, methodical, creative and has experience managing marketing teams. The ideal candidate will be a professional expert who is passionate about the startup ecosystem, innovation, the future of work, and lifestyle. This full-time position will be based in Tel-Aviv at Mindspace HQ offices.ResponsibilitiesManage a team of field marketing professionals. Recruit, onboard, provide direction, guidance, and leadership.Design and oversee Mindspace’s local marketing activities and advertising efforts to drive sales and build brand awareness. Lead go-to-market and launch activities for new Mindspace locations worldwide as well as new offerings, including market analysis, messaging, launch plans, budgets, and executionOversee all lead-generation programs for all Mindspace locations, offerings, and services.Drive Mindspace’s presence at major conferences, tradeshows, and startup eventsLead the creation of collateral for Mindspace’s offerings: presentations, campaigns, demos, videos, sales enablement tools, etc.Requirements:Experience & Minimum Qualifications:4+ years in global marketing management roles - a MUST;Experience from a luxury brand or startup – a plusFull writing fluency and a great command of English - a MUSTExperience in online advertising and lead generation campaign management - a MUSTProven experience in managing a marketing team and marketing campaignsFamiliar with CRM/Marketing automation software such as SalesForce and HubSpot - a plusCritical Competencies for Success:Management and leadership skillsYou’re an ace in execution with an ability to define and execute marketing programs, processes and deliverables on your ownYou understand business dynamics, including strategy, revenues & costs, value proposition, sales pipeline, competition, and differentiationYou’re analytical and understanding data and numbers, but also branding, messaging and emotional drivers.A problem solver – you are a highly resourceful thinker who is able to provide insightful, innovative solutions to any problem. You’re proactive in finding solutions rather than get stuck on problemsYou are a mover & shaker, with strong interpersonal skills, who adapts well to a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Using technology in your work is easy for you – including Windows, MS Office (and especially PowerPoint), Google apps, social networks tools, task management tools, etc. Mastering a new tool takes you no timeYou're a strong team player who is also capable to work independently in an effective mannerYou're excited about Mindspace after conducting your research on who we are and what we do

Text: קבוצת 'אבנון' – קבוצה בטחונית בעלת מספר חברות מחפשת איש.ת רכש ותפעול לחברה בתחום המל"טים.מתחומי האחריות: איתור ספקים בארץ ובחו"ל טיפול בהסכמים ובחוזי התקשרויות ניהול והובלה של תהליכי רכש תפעול ולוגיסטיקה משלב מציאת הספק ועד ניהול מו"מ ניהול תזרים הפרוייקט ותשלומים פיקוח ובקרה על כל התהליך הלוגיסטי לרבות שילוחים, שחרור ממכס, קבלת היתרים לייצוא/ייבוא, הובלות ועוד. ממשק ישיר ושוטף מול מנהלי מכירות החברה. העבודה דורשת אנגלית ברמת דיבור שוטף וכתיבה מדוקדקת!מיקום המשרה- כפר סבאלשליחת קורות חיים- avnon.97.C27@applynow.ioRequirements:דרישות המשרה: ניסיון והיכרות עם עולם הרכש הבינלאומי – חובה הבנה טכנית לפחות באחד התחומים : אלקטראופטיקה, תקשורות, מערכות מוטסות – חובה יכולת גבוהה בניהול מו"מ וניסיון בהוזלת עלויות ואיתור ספקים חדשים- חובה מוכנות לנסיעה לחו"ל- חובה ( 20%) ניסיון בעולם הביטחוני / עולם המל"טים- יתרון משמעותי היכרות עם מערכת Priority – יתרון משמעותי אנגלית ברמה גבוהה מאוד הן בכתיבה והן בדיבור - חובה שליטה בתוכנות OFFICE Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Word ברמה טובה - חובהלשליחת קורות חיים- avnon.97.C27@applynow.io

Title: Technical Writer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Noname Security, founded in 2020, is rapidly growing with more than 200 team members globally and only a year out of stealth the company is the first API Security Unicorn, at $1B valuation and $220M in total financing. Noname Security is also one of the fastest growing cybersecurity companies ever.Our mission is to reduce the risk of API security vulnerabilities and cyber attacks. Our API Security Platform is an out-of-band solution that doesn’t require agents or network modifications, and offers deeper visibility and security than API gateways, load balancers, and WAFs. No one addresses the API security challenge like Noname.Requirements:Bachelor's degree or relevant experience5+ years of experience as a technical writer for B2B enterprise-level softwareWritten and spoken English at a mother tongue levelProven ability and drive to learn and understand complex productsAbility to self-manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environmentExperience writing API documentation - AdvantageKnowledge and background in cybersecurity - AdvantageTeam player, confident, independent and enthusiastic!Responsibilities:The ideal candidate loves diving deep into new technologies, simplifying complex concepts for any target audience, has a passion for creating great user experiences, and loves writing!What You'll Be DoingPlan, write and maintain technical documentation (user guides, installation guides, API docs, release notes, etc.)Collaborate with developers/field engineers/support/relevant stakeholders to deliver documentation that is clear, accurate, and addresses our customers’ needsBecome an expert in the relevant product areas

Title: Credit Portfolio Analyst

Text: Job Id: 22519238ICG Risk Analysis (IRAUs) deliver best in class credit risk analysis in the 1st line of defense, the analyst is responsible for conducting and writing up credit reviews, credit approval and monitoring the portfolio to identify credit migration as a partner to ICG Risk Management and banking teams to ensure the safety and soundness of Citi Israel credit portfolio. The overall objective of this role is to analyze Citi Israel's portfolio exposure to clients and counterparties globally.Responsibilities:To be responsible for credit analysis and credit write up memos (including financial & industry analysis) of a portfolio of local customers (corporate/FI’s & NBFI’s)To perform risk, financial and data analyses including profiling, sampling, reconciliation, Title: Mechanical Process Engineer
Location: Netanya, Center District, Israel
Text: We are looking for an experienced Mechanical Engineer for our growing start-up.In this role you will: Design mechanical equipment. Review the production process and make improvements. Work with cross-functional teams to meet product performance, schedule, cost, reliability, and quality targets.Your activities will include: Design the manufacturing line for mass-production. Prepare production files including drawings and assembly instructions. Detect problems and bottle necks in the manufacturing line and lead necessary improvements. Perform process and machine failure investigations (corrective and preventive action, root cause analysis.) Create engineering documents (ECRs & ECOs), WI (work instruction), and equipment files.Requirements: B.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering or Biomedical Engineering. At least 3 years of experience in mechanical design using Solidworks or equivalent systems. Experience in production support and process troubleshooting. At least 2 years of experience in the medical device industry and ISO standards. Experience in writing manufacturing protocols. Ability to work on several projects at a time. Team player, independent, with a proactive attitude. Strong hands-on attitude, problem-solving ability, analytical skills, and creativity. Fluent in English – verbal and written.

Title: Senior People Operations & Talent Acquisition Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: LIQUiDITY is a high-growth fintech company. Our platform is based on the most advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, already making a massive impact on global capital markets. We’re literally reinventing the future of growth funding for companies around the world, changing how business analysis and growth investment are done. We’re currently based in Tel Aviv, NYC, Singapore, London, Abu Dhabi, and Dnipro.Your RoleAs Senior People & Talent Acquisition Manager, you will lead all aspects of recruitment and people operations at LIQUiDITY from A to Z. You will be a central address for all people operations and finding the right talent to fit our DNA and needs, globally. You will learn up and maintain existing systems and procedures and build new ones with your own initiative! You will have the opportunity to grow with the company and help develop and maintain top-performing talent in Tel Aviv and beyond!Requirements:You have:A Bachelor’s degreeFluent English and Hebrew Strategic thinking abilities, strong organizational skills, and excellent interpersonal skills - a mustHolistic experience in people operations including direct sourcing, recruitment, and people operationsExperience as a People/HR professional in a progressive team, including experience in recruitment, preferably at a growth stage startup - mustExperience in building and managing an HR department - helpfulResponsibilities:You will:Lead global talent acquisition activities including defining and implementing strategies to attract, hire, and retain top talent across the company with a focus on building a high-performing and diverse teamDefine and maintain all people operations globally incl. recruitment, onboarding, offboarding, and employee welfareSupport workforce planning, evaluation processes, managers’ training programs, HR policies processesSupervise Tel Aviv-based and global company activities (happy hours, off-sites)Work closely with executive management and employees on all People-related mattersHelp teams develop employee development plans, and provide professional guidancePreferred Qualifications:You are: A hands-on, “rosh gadol” type of person and a self-learnerAn extravert, passionate about peopleLooking for a new challenge to grow Life at Liquidity:Our work is dynamic, fast-pacedWe're a growing company - and we want you to grow with us!Open door policy

Title: Mechanical Integrator
Location: Center District, Israel
Text: Percepto is the leading provider of autonomous inspection and monitoring solutions, harnessing robotics, including our very own market-leading industrial drone-in-a-box solution. Our team is made up of software and hardware engineers, industry experts and professionals who are all passionate about innovation and driven to push the boundaries of what’s possible with software, AI, and hardware. We are a fast growing company with offices in Israel, the U.S. and Australia, with Fortune 500 clients around the world. Our company growth is not stopping any time soon, and we are looking for great talent like you to join our team!We’re looking for an Integrator to join our manufacturing team. In this role, you’ll be responsible for upgrading and refurbishing Percepto ground robots and drones.Why join Percepto? We care about the people we work with; we want our team members to grow and develop professionally, to find their job rewarding and intellectually stimulating, and of course - to have fun and feel that they are part of the Percepto family.Requirements:Experience with delicate mechanical assembliesFamiliarity with the field of drones and robotics.Experienced and capable in soldering and manufacturing electrical cablesKnowledge of working with a PIXHAWK flight controllerGood level of EnglishExperience in building and flying a variety of aircraftExperience with 3D printing - AdvantageKnowledge in C.N.C – AdvantageExperience in manufacturing with complex materials- AdvantageFamiliarity with programmed development controllers (RS-PI / ARDUINO) – AdvantageResponsibilities:You will join our R&D workshop that develops aircraft and autonomous ground tools.Manufacture, construction, assembly, and testing of Percepto’s tools and systems.Working closely with mechanical and electronics engineers

Title: מנהל/ת פרויקטים
Location: Center District, Israel
Text: למרכז שילוח אונליין במודיעין דרוש/ה מנהל/ת פרויקטים     תיאור התפקיד ותחומי האחריות:ייזום וקידום פרויקטים להצלחה ועמידה ביעדים.בניית כלים וסטנדרטים חדשים והטמעתם בתוך היחידה.כתיבת נהלים והוראות עבודה.תעדוף מתמיד של תכולות העבודה.עידוד שיח ושיתוף פעולה בין ממשקים לרבות ספקים וגורמי מטה.ניהול מעקב שוטף אחר תכניות העבודה.דיווח סטאטוס ,ניתוח והצגת הנתונים להנהלה.העבודה משולבת משרד+ שטח דרישות התפקיד:ניסיון של 1-2 שנים בניהול והובלת פרויקטים בשיפור תהליכי תפעול ושירות והגדרות דרישות טכנולוגיות(יתרון לניסיון בתחום השירות והאו"ש)ניסיון מחברות שירות/מוצרי צריכה-יתרוןמהנדס/ת תעשיה וניהולאנגלית ברמה טובה-כתיבה ודיבוריכולת אדמיניסטרטיבית טובהשליטה מלאה בתוכנות office,Excel, P.P,CRMשליטה בהכנת לו"ז ,MS PROJECTאוריינטציה מחשוביתיכולת הבעה בע"פ ובכתביכולת ניתוח נתונים, הסקת מסקנות ובניית תכנית עבודהיחסי אנוש טוביםתודעת שירות גבוההסדר וארגוןיכולת למידה מהירהיכולת עבודה עצמאית                                                                                                                                משרה מלאההמשרה במרכז שילוח אונליין במודיעיןלהגשת מועמדות ניתן לשלוח קו"ח למייל  R1-HR@shufersal.co.il

Title: Global Events Marketing Manager - Maternity Leave
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: As ActiveFence's Global Events Marketing Manager, you will join the Global Brand team and play an integral role in the Marketing department, planning and producing our global events efforts, both online and in-person. You will support our mission of making the internet a safer place by building our brand presence and driving relevant leads at industry events.You’re the ideal candidate if you're a multi-tasker, passionate about the small details, and have previous experience managing tech events, A to Z.Responsibilities:Owning and handling all event logistics from A-Z.Sourcing & securing sponsorship & speaking opportunities at industry events.Sourcing & negotiating with vendors and suppliers.Responsibility of connecting the relevant speakers & attendees to the relevant events. Tracking metrics, producing post-event reports, and analyzing opportunities for growth.Maintaining events budget; adhering to the budget & invoicing.Working with internal and external stakeholders to meet organizational goals.Collaborating with our internal teams to develop content for ActiveFence-hosted roundtables and virtual events, with the goal of driving inbound and outbound efforts.Developing marketing strategy and working with internal teams to create materials for our global in-person events including promotional material, content, swag, speakers, booth assets, and more.In-person support at events - some travel required.Scope:Maternity leave replacement - approx. 6 months.Requirements:2-5 years of global event management experience - a mustProject management experienceComfortable working with C-level stakeholdersStrong communication and interpersonal skillsComfortable giving and receiving feedbackTeam-player Can work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environmentExcellent organizational skills with the ability to multi-task several projects at onceExperience in tech - a must Experience in the trust & safety industry - big advantageExcellent verbal and written English skills - a mustExperience with Salesforce, Salesloft, Monday.com & HubSpot - big advantageExperience in B2B marketing - big advantageExperience in digital marketing, such as email marketing, inbound marketing, paid campaigns, and brand marketing - big advantageAbout ActiveFence:ActiveFence is the leading tool stack for Trust & Safety teams, worldwide. By relying on ActiveFence’s end-to-end solution, Trust & Safety teams – of all sizes – can keep users safe from the widest spectrum of online harms, unwanted content, and malicious behavior, including child safety, disinformation, fraud, hate speech, terror, nudity, and more. Using cutting-edge AI and a team of world-class subject-matter experts to continuously collect, analyze, and contextualize data, ActiveFence ensures that in an ever-changing world, customers are always two steps ahead of bad actors. As a result, Trust & Safety teams can be proactive and provide maximum protection to users across a multitude of abuse areas, in 70+ languages. Backed by leading Silicon Valley investors such as CRV and Norwest, ActiveFence has raised $100M to date; employs 300 people worldwide, and has contributed to the online safety of billions of users across the globe.
Requirements: ['Owning and handling all event logistics from A-Z.', 'Sourcing & securing sponsorship & speaking opportunities at industry events.', 'Sourcing & negotiating with vendors and suppliers.', 'Responsibility of connecting the relevant speakers & attendees to the relevant events.', 'Tracking metrics, producing post-event reports, and analyzing opportunities for growth.', 'Maintaining events budget; adhering to the budget & invoicing.', 'Working with internal and external stakeholders to meet organizational goals.', 'Collaborating with our internal teams to develop content for ActiveFence-hosted roundtables and virtual events, with the goal of driving inbound and outbound efforts.', 'Developing marketing strategy and working with internal teams to create materials for our global in-person events including promotional material, content, swag, speakers, booth assets, and more.', 'In-person support at events - some travel required.', 'Maternity leave replacement - approx. 6 months.', '2-5 years of global event management experience - a must', 'Project management experience', 'Comfortable working with C-level stakeholders', 'Strong communication and interpersonal skills', 'Comfortable giving and receiving feedback', 'Team-player', 'Can work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment', 'Excellent organizational skills with the ability to multi-task several projects at once', 'Experience in tech - a must', 'Experience in the trust & safety industry - big advantage', 'Excellent verbal and written English skills - a must', 'Experience with Salesforce, Salesloft, Monday.com & HubSpot - big advantage', 'Experience in B2B marketing - big advantage', 'Experience in digital marketing, such as email marketing, inbound marketing, paid campaigns, and brand marketing - big advantage']

Title: Product Manager- Payments
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Guesty is a start-up which provides an all-in-one platform that is innovating the short term property management industry. In Guesty we build products that help property managers operate their inventory efficiently, improve guest experience, reduce costs and optimize revenue generated from short term stays.One of our key strategic products is the payments product line which provides multiple offerings where property managers can collect payments from their guests and pay out the funds to their home owners and vendors.We’re looking for an excellent and experienced payments product manager to join the payments product team and lead one of the most impactful domains in our B2B2C SaaS platform.Requirements:Requirements:3+ years of product management experience for SaaS companies.1+ years experience leading payments products.Very high English proficiency - verbal and written.Excellent communication skills both with customers and within the organization.Experienced working with R&D teams and within cross-functional customer project teams.Strong UX capabilitiesResponsibilities:What you’ll do:Own and lead a domain and its group of products within the company.Define vision and roadmap.Be responsible for product planning and execution throughout the product life cycle.Join a cross-functional team that will design, build and roll-out products in your domain.Engage with customers and vendors to learn their needs and to help them gain more from their use of the productUse data and customer feedback to define and drive new products and features.Create and monitor your domain roadmap and KPIs to ensure company business objectives are met.Work closely with customer facing teams, data engineers and UX designers to drive product adoption.Be an expert of your domain and products. Including features, functionality, user experience, the domain market, its competitors and user behaviors.

Title: Director of Information Security
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: The Director of Information Security holds the highest responsibility and authority regarding Information Security in Snappy. The assigned person with that role is responsible for coordinating and overseeing Snappy's wide compliance with policies and procedures regarding the confidentiality, integrity and security of its information assets.The Director of Information Security works closely with the CTO and other Snappy's managers and staff involved in securing the company's information assets to enforce established policies, identify areas of concern, and implement appropriate changes as needed.Responsibilities:Defining Snappy's information security strategy and requirementsProvide leadership, Strategy and guidance on proposed cybersecurity best practicesMaking high-level tactical decisions pertaining to the information security policies and their content. Approve, in advance, exceptions to these policies on a case-by-case basisSetting, prioritizing, and managing Snappy's information security initiativesBuild strong relationships and influence decisions with internal and external stakeholdersOn an annual basis, coordinates a formal risk assessment to identify new threats and vulnerabilities and identify appropriate controls to mitigate any new risksAnnually review the information security policies and procedures to maintain adequacy considering emergent business requirements or security threatsRecommending security enhancements and features for Snappy's products and servicesDefining and managing ongoing security auditing and testing processesDefining required security mechanisms and managing their implementation and maintenanceManaging information security incident responseManaging security-related discussions with clients and other 3rd partiesRequirements:2+ years of experience as a Security Manager or equivalent roleSecurity governance, risk, and compliance management experienceHighly experienced in a cloud-oriented product-led companyExcellent written and verbal communication skills and high level of personal integrityUp to date with the latest security standards and emerging technologiesFamiliarity with security tools such as Okta, Wiz, Guard Duty, Coralogix, Anecdotes and ability to learn and adapt fast to new solutionsProactive and self-motivated, ability to deliver solutions with an "enabler" mindsetFluent in both written and verbalSnappy is an award winning, all-in-one gifting platform that helps companies reward their employees and customers - boosting loyalty and engagement through a fun and engaging digital experience. Snappy's gifting algorithm automates the selection and sending off personal gifts and messages at scale, and notifies recipients through fun and personalized digital unboxing experiences.We specialize in building recognition programs for all sorts of businesses - Amazon, Zoom, Salesforce, Microsoft, Uber, Deloitte and over 3000 more, Plus, we're growing everyday, if you want to get technical!We've seen firsthand that our experience boosts morale, improves performance, and (most importantly!) spreads joy.Snappy has its headquarters in New York and 300 employees in four countries (New York, Tel-Aviv, London, and Ukraine).
Requirements: ["Defining Snappy's information security strategy and requirements", 'Provide leadership, Strategy and guidance on proposed cybersecurity best practices', 'Making high-level tactical decisions pertaining to the information security policies and their content. Approve, in advance, exceptions to these policies on a case-by-case basis', "Setting, prioritizing, and managing Snappy's information security initiatives", 'Build strong relationships and influence decisions with internal and external stakeholders', 'On an annual basis, coordinates a formal risk assessment to identify new threats and vulnerabilities and identify appropriate controls to mitigate any new risks', 'Annually review the information security policies and procedures to maintain adequacy considering emergent business requirements or security threats', "Recommending security enhancements and features for Snappy's products and services", 'Defining and managing ongoing security auditing and testing processes', 'Defining required security mechanisms and managing their implementation and maintenance', 'Managing information security incident response', 'Managing security-related discussions with clients and other 3rd parties', '2+ years of experience as a Security Manager or equivalent role', 'Security governance, risk, and compliance management experience', 'Highly experienced in a cloud-oriented product-led company', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills and high level of personal integrity', 'Up to date with the latest security standards and emerging technologies', 'Familiarity with security tools such as Okta, Wiz, Guard Duty, Coralogix, Anecdotes and ability to learn and adapt fast to new solutions', 'Proactive and self-motivated, ability to deliver solutions with an "enabler" mindset', 'Fluent in both written and verbal']

Title: SDR (ISR)- Hybrid
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Are you passionate about talent development in yourself and others, self-motivated, and curious? If you enjoy initiating conversations, networking, thinking creatively and are not afraid to test and experiment or ask questions and are looking to grow professionally, then read on.GrowthSpace is looking for an SDR (Sales Development Representative) for the Israeli market!GrowthSpace is all about employee growth! It's created an innovative platform in the employee learning & development space that's personalized, data-driven, and connected to business KPIs. It sets employees up with the most relevant one-on-one and group development options, workshops and lectures that are tailored to each individual by using data. GrowthSpace supports global customers like Intel, Taboola, Monday.com, Applied Materials, MSD, Siemens, Federal Bank and Johnson & Johnson, as well as many other companies in over 35 countries & languages.Position Summary:The SDR will be responsible for generating meetings with the HR (Human resources) community in Israel specifically by connecting them via email, Linkedin, calling, and video etc. You will take an integral part in building GrowthSpace's customer base and successes in the Israeli region, by getting the word out about GrowthSpace and its mission to partner with orgs. to bring out the greatness in all their employees.You will also work closely with the marketing team to help with their various campaigns and follow up on leads that they generate for you.Responsibilities:Generate meetings from our own research and creative outreach - introducing companies and L&D and HR professionals to the company and our sales team using your own creativity and various tools to initiate conversations around talent development with professionals. Use tools like Zoominfo and Hubspot to manage your daily workWork with sales to optimize pipeline creation and efficient lead handoffIdentify target accounts and prospects and then effectively pitch GrowthSpace's unique solution to set appointments with qualified prospectsAnalyze data to identify trends and communicate appropriately to senior management.Work closely with Directors of Demand Generation and Sales Operations to follow up on incoming leads while convert them to prospectsRequirements:﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿Experience as an SDR/BDRHigh-level of Hebrew and English (written and verbal)High verbal skills Outbound experience with phone, email and LinkedInSocial media savvinessExtra bonus if:﻿You come from an L&D backgroundWhy GrowthSpace:Work for the world’s first platform for personalized, human-led development – at scaleA one-of-a-kind, Digital HR Tech Solution that is disrupted People Development marketYou can “Own your domain”We encourage people to “Do whatever it takes”A vision and growth trajectory that is challenging and excitingYou will work with a great entrepreneurial team – that possesses a “get it done culture” – with people who always care﻿

Title: Program Manager, Environmental Health and Safety
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Haifa, Israel; Tel Aviv, Israel.Minimum qualifications:Experience working in Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) across multiple facilities.Experience in safety evaluations and environmental compliance.Experience in communicating with government and local authorities regarding EHS issues.Preferred qualifications:Credentials from Board of Certified Safety Professionals, NEBOSH, or equivalent agency.Ability to coach, influence, and advise local employees to achieve impactful EHS outcomes.Demonstrated collaboration, project management, and communication skills.Excellent data quality troubleshooting and problem solving skills.Ability to travel up to 40% of the time.About The JobA problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.As a Program Manager, you'll be responsible for developing and delivering scalable Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) programs and services to a portfolio of technical infrastructure sites at all points of the asset lifecycle. You'll play a part in ensuring all EHS issues are identified and addressed by working cross-functionally across other departments. In addition, you’ll be responsible for driving continuous EHS improvement among the assets deployed across the region and globally.ResponsibilitiesManage Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) compliance for a portfolio of data center technical infrastructure sites. Build and sustain scalable EHS programs/guidance that can be deployed to enable the safe and compliant deployment of our technical infrastructure. Identify operational EHS risks for impact to the business, analyze risk scenarios to determine their potential impact to the business and design/lead programs to mitigate those risks.Assess EHS training needs based on identified operational risks and ensure workforce training activities are provided to meet business and legislative requirements. Perform environmental and safety compliance assessments at technical infrastructure facilities, and implement follow-up corrective actions to ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Requirements: ['Experience working in Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) across multiple facilities.', 'Experience in safety evaluations and environmental compliance.', 'Experience in communicating with government and local authorities regarding EHS issues.', 'Credentials from Board of Certified Safety Professionals, NEBOSH, or equivalent agency.', 'Ability to coach, influence, and advise local employees to achieve impactful EHS outcomes.', 'Demonstrated collaboration, project management, and communication skills.', 'Excellent data quality troubleshooting and problem solving skills.', 'Ability to travel up to 40% of the time.', 'Manage Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) compliance for a portfolio of data center technical infrastructure sites.', 'Build and sustain scalable EHS programs/guidance that can be deployed to enable the safe and compliant deployment of our technical infrastructure.', 'Identify operational EHS risks for impact to the business, analyze risk scenarios to determine their potential impact to the business and design/lead programs to mitigate those risks.', 'Assess EHS training needs based on identified operational risks and ensure workforce training activities are provided to meet business and legislative requirements.', 'Perform environmental and safety compliance assessments at technical infrastructure facilities, and implement follow-up corrective actions to ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations.']
Industries: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet

Title: Product Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are looking for a Product Manager to work cross-functionally with our teams and join our mission to build an Open Platform for B2B commerce. If you’re a capable Product Manager who’s full of team spirit and looking for a new challenge, we want to hear from you! We're located in the heart of Tel Aviv, on Rothschild Avenue and our hybrid work setup is perfect for getting in face-time with the team, lunching at the wide selection of restaurants (and evening hour bars) in the area!Roles & ResponsibilitiesGain a deep understanding of customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growth.Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes.Represent the company by visiting customers to solicit feedback on company products and services.Lead the end-to-end success of projects from discovery to launchOwn the product vision and work with our strategy & field teams to create meaningful problem statementsCollaborate with engineering, design and marketing teamsIdentify new areas for growth through quantitative search and UX studiesAnalyze market trends and maintain an awareness of competitor activityAnalyze market trends and maintain an awareness of competitor activityServe as the face of the product within the company, and act as the point person to leadershipDetermine your products’ metrics for successInfluence key stakeholders across our organization to align intent and prioritizationRequirements:5+ experience as a Product ManagerExperience in Blockchain, CryptoExperience in working with a UX/UI team.Experience in working on a platform, or migrating a product to platform

Title: Sales Admin Support
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We believe in a world where growth thrives across borders and cultures. That's why our Founder and CEO Rick Hammell started Atlas, coining the term Employer of Record (EOR) simultaneously. As an EOR, Atlas employs people to work for companies anywhere in the world. Before we came along, the only businesses offering a similar solution were essentially brokers. They'd outsource your HR and payroll services to third-party providers in different countries. Today, we're the only 100% Direct EOR in the world, partnering with clients to get to market 82% faster, at a reduced cost, and with lower risk through local expertise in over 160 countries.Atlas technology powers the idea that companies can employ whoever they want, wherever they are in the world. Through our cloud-based platform, we deliver the Human Resources infrastructure that underpins international growth, leaving companies free to focus on the strategy that makes it happen. We partner with our clients through their international life cycle from the first dip in the global pool until the moment it's time to set up their own entities and run payroll. Atlas is here from point A to point Z.The future of work is borderless, and so are we. So, it helps that our people are located around the globe — in the US, UK, India, China and beyond — and speak 90+ languages. Diversity and inclusion are at our core.We're excited about our next phase of growth. We're launching new tech, adding new solutions and now we're looking for YOU — eager for a challenge, energized by innovation and aligned with our mission to deliver a future of work without borders.Key ResponsibilityDesign and drive planning activities and reporting with the primary objective of enabling sales leadership to make effective, analytically driven and strategic operating decisionsDevelop strong collaborative relationships with key stakeholders across the company and represent the partnership functions with cross-functional teamsBusiness planning and insights:Support senior management in strategic, operational and financial planning and ensure decisions in line with the global sales organization's approachDrive operational reviews and rhythm of the business, leading business analysis including revenue, customer onboarding, finance review, implementation support and market analysisProvide timely and accurate reporting and clear visibility on revenue performance for the region and any other KPI required by leadership to manage these businessesCollaborate with internal Atlas departments while serving as a central communication stakeholder for the Global Sales TeamSupport HR and Talent Recruitment on Sales projects and initiatives while helping to develop the culture, talent, and the on-boarding experience for new Sales employeesWork with Regional and Country based Sales leadership and various trainings on meeting presentations, reporting, creative/marketing and best practices/collaboration across projectsManage regional sales pipeline for Sales division, while staying atop of industry trends and potential new business opportunitiesCreate and execute processes and best practices that improve office efficiency while maintaining a positive and innovative office cultureBuild and maintain a competitive analysis chart on global competition for sales teams to understand how to win deals vs certain competitors. Give examples of current clients who chose us and why. Be flexible and able to work as a "wildcard" for any small projects needed to improve the global sales team in any way. Manage regional sales pipeline in Hubspot while staying atop of industry trends and potential new business opportunities Build and maintain a top 100 pipeline for marketing automation purposes with the focus of setting meetings to be given to Regional or Country Business Development leadership to distribute between sales teams. About You Associate degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience; bachelor's degree is preferred Administrative experience Project management experience (preferred) Experience with Hubspot CRM software (preferred) Organizational skills Computer proficiencyWhat We OfferThe opportunity to work with a purpose — simplifying global expansion while supporting sustainable communities around the world A diverse and inclusive environment, with over 40 nationalities represented, 90+ languages spoken, and a workforce made up of 52% women Flexible PTO and birthdays off Growth and development opportunities with access to Coursera – a leading learning and certification providerThe opportunity to challenge yourself in a high-performing organization and leave each day knowing you have made an impact. This position description may not describe all duties, responsibilities, and skills associated with this position. It is intended to portray the major aspects of the job. Other duties or skills may be required.Atlas Technology Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Atlas is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Atlas are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Atlas will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Atlas encourages applicants of all ages.This role may be subject to a background check after an employment offer has been made and final employment will be subjective to a positive result, in addition, reference may be requested at the final stage of the process.

Title: NOC operator student
Location: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Access Fintech is an innovative risk management service for banks and buyside firms. The service helps firms track the trade lifecycle and get a true sense of prioritized risk, across an increasing number of systems. Access Fintech brings together Fintech providers and in-house technology, orchestrating the interaction of the distributed providers and creating a single visual display of the risk of financial transactions in a global sharable view.Read about us at: https://www.linkedin.com/company/access-fintech/The Job is Evening/ Night/ Weekend shifts – please send CV only if relevant.Requirements:High sense of responsibility, proven functional and technical analysis skills, handled pressure well, and strong analytical skills.Fast learner and comfortable with working in a fast-paced environment.Upper English level both spoken and written.Computer science student or equivalent.Basic knowledge in SQL, AWS, Networking. Worked night/weekend shifts previously. Responsibilities:Actively monitor our microservices-based application, using different monitoring and logging tools. Proactive communication on services and infrastructure health, impacts, escalations, and other critical analysis.Respond to events from the monitoring tools, with the goal of restoration of service.Provide first point of contact support; Used as a hub to escalate & communicate to other technical groups/management.Manage incidents and trigger on-call policies.Add and improve documentation associated with monitoring and procedures.Provide first-aid and initial troubleshooting on returning or new problems.Work closely with the Developments team, the Operations team and the Client Services.Be the first responder to any incident, drive to resolve ongoing issues, communicate them to the relevant teams and document them.Assist with core infrastructure monitoring including maintenance.Work independently and with global teams.Advantages:Worked in a monitoring environment.

Title: Solution Architect
Location: Herzliya, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Who we are?The Iguazio Data Science Platform enables enterprises to develop, deploy and manage AI applications at scale. With Iguazio, companies can run AI models in real time, deploy them anywhere (multi-cloud, on-prem or edge), and bring to life their most ambitious AI-driven strategies. Enterprises spanning a wide range of verticals, including financial services, manufacturing, smart mobility and telecoms use Iguazio to create business impact through a multitude of real-time use cases such as fraud prevention, self-healing networks and location-based recommendations.Iguazio brings data science to life.Who are we looking for?We are looking for an enthusiastic, result-driven Tech Jedi - Solution Architect with a very strong growth mindset. A Tech Jedi - Solution Architect must have an ambitious and technical win-motivation, passion for the completion of the sale cycle, a keen eye for spotting market trends, willingness to inspire both clients and colleagues, and a genuine desire to keep expanding technology/market knowledge.Working with a team of highly motivated and technical colleagues in a truly innovative technology sector of data science. If the modernization of older data systems sounds like the right challenge, then this is the right opportunity for you.What You'll Do?As the technical owner of the sale cycle, you will have overall responsibility for the development (identify and qualify), delivery, and orchestration of the activities driving towards a technical winYou will partner closely with Account Managers to develop account and technical solution strategies and will be directly responsible for driving the technical strategy forward to closureEngage with customers and prospects, execute the hands-on demonstration of Iguazio solutions and products, effectively communicate the key core value proposition and key differentiators, position Iguazio around competitive threats and alternatives. Collaborate with Product/R&D and Customer Success teams to ensure proper handoff from Sales to ImplementationEssential Jedi SkillsGrowth mindset – A MUSTStartup mentality: bright, focused, ethical, friendly, cross-functional, hardworking, and always proactiveGenuinely excited to help customers and solve problemsBeing able to get your hands dirty when neededBody in Israel, mind/soul, and inner operating system with no borders (and boundaries) – excellent English, no lessEffective presentation, customer service, financial/business acumen, and soft skills at all levels of customer engagementThis is a field role that requires travel to customer locations from time to time, based on the needs of the business (under COVID-19 restrictions)What have you done lately?Hands-on experience in Data Science/AI/ML (data ingestion, model development, training, inferencing and move to production)Experience with popular open-source buzzzzz like Jupyter Notebook, Grafana, KubeFlow, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, XGBoostContainers head (Kubernetes)5+ years of Pre-Sale/ Solution Architect/System Architect/Product Specialist/ account management experienceExperience working with large multinational accounts

Title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: TriEye is the pioneer of SWIR sensing technology. Based on nanophotonics research, TriEye’s technology is disrupting the world of vision sensors for the automotive market along with other exciting applications.We are looking for some exceptional talent to join our Electro-Optical Systems Engineering team as a Senior Mechanical Engineer.You will be part of a growing team designing and developing SWIR perception systems to meet worldwide customer requirements.Requirements:B.Sc or M.Sc in Mechanical Engineering with at least 5 years of experience.In-depth knowledge of mechanical design principles for products, jigs, and tools.Experienced with multidisciplinary systems design.Significant understanding of opto-mechanical engineering principles including mechanical precision mechanisms, manufacturing methods, testing, and assembly. Proven experience in electronics packaging, wiring and thermal management.Proven work with suppliers on various manufacturing methods, including technologies for high-volume manufacturing .Proficiency in using CAD software for both systems design and analysis, SolidWorks preferred. Former working experience with ePDM.Former background in thermal design, analysis and simulations of systems using FEA softwares such as Ansys, or similar - advantage.Experience in mechanical design for the Automotive industry, considering environmental conditions and vibrations - advantage.Self-driven, versatile, and challenges-solving oriented.Great interpersonal skills, a team player.Your Day to Day:Responsibility for an end-to-end mechanical and opto-mechanical design, development and manufacturing of an electro-optical sensing system, incorporating laser sources, sensors, optics, electrical hardware, and thermal modules.Full ownership of the mechanical solution including design, drawings, manufacturing, assembly support, tests and experiments.Develop electro-optical-mechanical packaging concepts.Initiate and implement thermal solutions to different heat dissipation challenges.Design jigs and develop tools to support different R&D teams efforts.Work in collaboration with different R&D disciplines (Electro-Optics, Photonics, Electronics, and System Architecture) to develop a product meeting system requirements.Why should you be a TriEyoneer?:Timing is everything! You want to be a part of a fast-growing deep-tech company backed by industry leaders, as it enters a significant stage of global growth.Inspiring skill development by providing growth opportunitiesInterest in supporting TriEye’s mission to improve and save lives by making Short-Wave Infrared (SWIR) technology accessible to everyone. Harnessing the power of SWIR sensing to provide superior vision, enables access to mission-critical image data even in the most challenging visibility conditions. This is a unique opportunity to take an active part in building a world’s first technology. Benefits:Free Gym MembershipParkingHolidays and Birthday giftsCibusGenerous vacation allowanceHappy hours and team eventsGeneral statement:TriEye is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Territory Manager Dental Israel (Jerusalem)
Location: Rosh HaAyin, Center District, Israel
Text: Welcome to ZimVie, a new, publicly traded global company focused on improving quality of life for our patients. Our company is founded on a legacy of established brands, medical experts and over $1B in annual revenue. We design, manufacture, and distribute a comprehensive portfolio of innovative solutions for implant dentistry, spinal surgery and bone growth stimulation. Our seasoned leadership and dedicated global team of more than 2,500 is focused on shaping an exciting future for ZimVie — we hope you’ll consider being a part of it!Job MissionSell ZimVie products through effective sales presentations to dental clinicians and technicians in accordance with company sales, compliance, pricing and profitability requirements in order to maximize sales and distribution of ZimVie products and services in the designated territory, so that the company can perform its functions and achieve its objectives.Main Tasks And Responsibilities Develop business through addition of new customers and penetrating existing accounts;  Maintain and grow accounts by utilizing positive relationship management techniques;  Meet annual sales targets as assigned;  Perform product trainings with customers in order to ensure best use of our products;  Attend exhibitions, local evening meetings and company events;  Perform administrative tasks needed to timely and accurately support sales efforts and management requirements. Additonal Tasks and Responsibilities will be transparent upon request.Main Profile Requirments Of Suitable Candidate Minimum of 2 years outside/field sales experience;  Preferably experienced within the medical device industry;  Team player;  Excellent presentation skills;  Confident MS Office user.  Hebrew mother tongue  Position located in JERUSALEM Our OfferZimVie offers you a challenging position with good career prospects in a fast growing international business. We offer a competitive remuneration package.ZimVie is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants for employment and employment decisions, including hiring, promotion, transfer, etc. are considered without regard to racial or ethnic origin, gender, religion or belief, disability, age or sexual identity.

Title: Director of Software Engineering
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: We are looking for an experienced manager of managers (group manager) to lead the Israeli site of our software team, about 25 people at this time, and growing. We are looking for someone who can plan for the future and also optimize for the present. Be aware of the details and also think big. Someone we can count on toProspera uses AI based image analysis and other data sensors to help farmers save time and optimize their yields. We do this by providing insights about plant growth, irrigation, diseases and nutrients. We design and build field-hardy weatherproof cameras, communications and control IoT devices, base stations that apply edge computing, integrate with satellite imagery, build beautiful state of the art mobile and web consumer applications as well as tooling applications, data analysis pipelines and complex workflows that enable agronomists, operations specialists, remote sensing scientists and ML researchers to work effectively together to deliver timely insights to farmers. We are really just getting started!Requirements:Led significant software projects involving several teams - MUSTStrong management background- managing at least 20 engineers and team leadsStrong computer science backgroundBackground from leading teams in startupStrong communication skillsStrong analytical skillsExcellent team playerResponsibilities:Lead a group of 25 talented engineers & managers with diverse backgrounds and experience levelsGrow leaders. Mentor and coach managers and engineersDeliver high quality software solutionsCollaborate effectively with stakeholders and peersDeeply understand the business and our products

Title: Senior Product Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Imagine there was a platform that allows operating multiple autonomous vehicles, from a single location. How awesome would that be?!What if you were the one who built it? Based in TLV, bluewhite is a world leader in autonomous technologies and unmanned systems.We are seeking a talented, experienced, and creative Senior Product Manager, you’ll be responsible for the full lifecycle of your products. You’ll lead product requirements and specifications, work with development teams through delivery, and push for adoption of new tools by our customers, in coordination and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. In this position, you will report to the VP Product and you will play a key role in a fast-growing team with significant impact and potential for professional and personal growth.Responsibilities - what you will be doing:Take responsibility for product planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle - market research, user research, gathering and prioritizing user stories, defining the product vision, writing requirements, working with Product Designer and developers, and defining the core product needsDefine the priorities of the product through understanding customers’ needs and company visionPresenting selected functionalities for internal and external stakeholders as part of product overall ownershipDeliver a great experience to our product’s usersHelp create the product's vision and build a plan to achieve it through concrete milestones and versionsCreate promotion strategies through advertisements to highlight core features of the productWork closely with engineering, data scientists, design, business development teams Stay updated about the latest SaaS products available in marketRequirements:Requirements - Title: Operations Project Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Medix is a tech-driven healthcare management company with offices in over 12 different countries, providing a variety of services to over 7 million customers spread in over 90 different countries. Through our best -in-class health management services, combining digital health solutions and human touch services, we are disrupting the industry by providing a variety of virtual medical solutions, including prevention, personal medical navigation / case management, rehabilitation, and mental health. We are bold yet disciplined in our approach, ready to invest behind our ideas and strongly support creativity and intellectual freedom to push the boundaries to which technology and data can take us. As a result of our unique approach and capabilities, we have become a global market leader and one of the fastest growing healthcare management groups in the world. We are currently expanding our team and looking for bright individuals who want to have an essential role and join the team of a disruptive company with a meaningful purpose. Check us out: www.medix-global.comMain Responsibilities:• Plan and review policies and procedures• Contribute operations information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; prepare  and complete action plans; implement production, productivity, quality, and customer-service  standards; resolve problems; complete audits; • Prepare an annual budget; schedule expenditures; initiating corrective actions• Analyze and improve organizational process and workflow• Monitor employees performance• Maintain safe and healthy work environment by establishing, following, and enforcing standards  and procedures; complying with legal regulations• Manage relationships with key operations vendors• Track vendor pricing, rebates, and service levels• Review and approve all operational invoices and ensure they are submitted for payment• Communicate customer issues with operations team and devise ways of improving the customer  experience, including resolving problems and complaints• Communicate all operating policies and/or issues at department meetings• Communicate with legal counsel to ensure all processes remain compliant with regulations  Requirements and qualifications:• 3 years minimum experience as a PMO• B.Sc. in industrial Engineering or equivalent• Methodical approach with attention to details and ability to understand abstract ideas fully and logically and keep track of multiple tasks and projects• Strong verbal and written communication skills in English • Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and/or other project management tools• Experience of working with Salesforce – advantage• Excellent interpersonal skills, self - motivated, details oriented, self - managed, team player

Title: Director of Engineering
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: With over 30 Million users on our platform, we’re here to change the future of business. Our all-in-one platform makes starting a business affordable and accessible to everyone - we welcome more than 800k new business owners every month. From our products to our careers, there are endless opportunities for growth.Our team | Our core | Our dream fulfillersWhen we started Tailor Brands, we wanted to help people to accelerate their growth and fulfill their dreams. This also defines us internally; we put our focus on maximizing individual impact and creating an environment of absolute transparency.About The RoleWe are in the process of growing our Engineering team, and we are looking for an experienced, creative and passionate leader to join our growing engineering team and take part in our amazing journey!As a Director of Engineering, you will have a huge part in growing and scaling our engineering team from a technical and human perspective.You will manage multiple cross-functional teams (Pods) and play a key role in the development, providing technical guidance, coaching, and mentoring to the development team in order to maximize the teams’ potential.You will be a significant part of the growth of the department, making sure we move in the right direction and have the right strategies to do so while working hand in hand with our CTO.ResponsibilitiesGrowing and mentoring direct reports, focusing on team growth challengesBuilding new teams - Title: Delivery Manager
Location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: The Cymbio team is a group of innovators who are changing the way commerce and business relationships are initiated and conducted. We are on a mission to enable every company to connect and work with any business in a seamless and efficient manner. We connect, scale, and automate the full cycle of digital commerce from commercials through technology to daily operations. We believe in building a transparent and dynamic world, and we highly invest in our people, customers, and product. We have a flexible work model, connecting people from multiple locations, including the US and Israel. We’re rapidly growing and are looking for culture first in mind, talented people to be part of the Cymbio team to help shape our business and culture. Join us on this journey in building the future of connected commerce!We are growing and looking for a Delivery Manager to join our Delivery Team and work closely with the Success/Support/Data teams to ensure swift onboarding of our brands to new sales channels. You will specialize in multiple eCommerce platforms and be an expert in our platform.Requirements:1-2 years experience in a SaaS B2B company in a data or customer operations roleExtremely organized with strong attention to detailExpert in project management with a technical backgroundFamiliarity with project management tools like Jira, Monday, Airtable, and alike. Passion for gaming – An Advantage

Title: Junior Controller
Location: Holon, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Text: Job Location: HolonCompany DescriptionFerrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella®, Tic Tac®, Ferrero Rocher®, Raffaello®, Kinder Bueno® and Kinder Surprise®. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in 55 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? Nearly 35,000 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them.Diversity StatementFerrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding.About the Role:If you have a great eye for details and are a perfect organiser this role can interest you. As a Controlling Specialist your main focus will be to support accounting quality, compliance with tax and accounting law by correctly applying internal controlling rules. As your Manager will supervise all the "Procure to Pay" and "Order to Cash" processes, you will support the proper management of administration issues as receivables, payables.Main Responsibilities:Responsible for ensuring the proper planning process (Strategic Planning, Budget, Forecast).Ensures the reliability of Market data management.Interacts with all the local departments and the Central Reporting and controllers of central functions to explain deviations and budgetary assumptions.Who we are looking for:1-2 years of experience as Finance Business AnalystAdvanced Excel (VBA is a plus)Fluent in Hebrew and EnglishKnowledge SAP R3 and Hyperion (Essbase is a plus)Precision and commitmentAbility to work effectively in multitasking and project mode, as well as under pressure and time constraintsExperience in confectionary or FMCG is a plusHow to be successful in the role and at Ferrero:Consumers, quality and care are at the heart of everything we do. So, to be successful at Ferrero, you’ll need to be just as consumer and product centric as we are - dedicated to crafting brilliant results for consumers around the world.Strong analytical mind, attention to details on one hand and great organisational skills on the other, are the key to success. Employee contribution and engagement at Ferrero is based on the individual, team and organisation dimension, so you should have the ability to work independently, as a team member and build good relations with stakeholders on all levels. Being flexible and dealing with a dynamic working environment and embedding new knowledge and skills in existing competencies will definitely help you to become a high performer here.

By continuously optimizing cloud infrastructure to always be highly available and for the lowest possible cost, we revolutionize the way businesses manage their cloud.
